original: de'i phyir drug dang bdun dang bcu gcig gi bar dag gis kyang mchongs pa dang rkyal byed pa rnams la dro ba dang grang ba la sogs pa cig car nyams su myong ba dang / kha cig la bkres pa dang skom pa'i reg bya dag kyang ste lus kyi rnam par shes pa reg bya bcu gcig gi yul can bye brag tu ma bcad pa skye ba yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir drug dang bdun dang bcu gcig gi bar dag gis kyang mchongs pa dang rkyal byed pa rnams la dro ba dang grang ba la sogs pa cig car nyams su myong ba dang / kha cig la bkres pa dang skom pa'i reg bya dag kyang ste lus kyi rnam par shes pa reg bya bcu gcig gi yul can bye brag tu ma bcad pa skye ba yin no //
translated: Thus, unconfined tactile objects are the objects of the eleven types of body consciousness.

original: de ltar na spyi la dmigs pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: de ltar na spyi la dmigs pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: In this way, the five collections of consciousness focus on general objects.

original: chos mngon pa las rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga rang gi mtshan nyid kyi yul can du 'don te /
analyzed: chos mngon pa las rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga rang gi mtshan nyid kyi yul can du 'don te /
translated: The Abhidharma states that the five collections of consciousness have specific objects.

original: de'i phyir sngon po la sogs pa'i rnam ba bye brag tu ma bcad pa rnam par shes pa'i gzung ba ni spyi la dmigs nas 'dzin ba'i phyir spyi'i yul can nyid dang spyi la dmigs pa'i phyir sngon po la sogs pa'i spyi gang yin pa de'i rnam par
analyzed: de'i phyir sngon po la sogs pa'i rnam ba bye brag tu ma bcad pa rnam par shes pa'i gzung ba ni spyi la dmigs nas 'dzin ba'i phyir spyi'i yul can nyid dang spyi la dmigs pa'i phyir sngon po la sogs pa'i spyi gang yin pa de'i rnam par
translated: Therefore, since consciousness that observes and apprehends a generality, such as the blue color of a blue utpala flower, without distinguishing its aspects such as blue, it has a generality as its object.🔽

original: 'dzin pa'i phyir spyi'i yul can nyid du 'gyur ro zhes gzhan dag rtsod par byed do //
analyzed: 'dzin pa'i phyir spyi'i yul can nyid du 'gyur ro zhes gzhan dag rtsod par byed do //
translated: Therefore, others argue that since consciousness that is the apprehended object of blue and so on that is not specifically differentiated is a subject that focuses on a universal, it is a subject that possesses a universal and since it focuses on a universal, it is a subject that possesses a universal because it apprehends the universal of blue and so on.

original: gzhan dag ni 'di la rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga ni spyi'i yul can yin te rang gi yul mtha' dag la dmigs pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gzhan dag ni 'di la rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga ni spyi'i yul can yin te rang gi yul mtha' dag la dmigs pa'i phyir /
translated: Others say that the five collections of consciousness are subjects that possess a universal because they focus on their entire object field.

original: chos thams cad bdag med pa bzhin no zhes pa'i rab tu sbyor ba nyid do //
analyzed: chos thams cad bdag med pa bzhin no zhes pa'i rab tu sbyor ba nyid do //
translated: They are like the application that all phenomena are selfless.

original: de'i phyir 'di dag ni skye mched kyi rang gi mtshan nyid kyi zhes rgyas bar 'byung ngo //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di dag ni skye mched kyi rang gi mtshan nyid kyi zhes rgyas bar 'byung ngo //
translated: Therefore they are called subjects that possess the universal of the specific characteristics of the sense bases.

original: bstan bcos las ni skye mched kyi mtshan nyid kyi dbang du mdzad nas rang gi mtshan nyid kyi yul can du bshad la skye mched kyi rang gi mtshan nyid de yang sngon po dang ring po la sogs pa rnams kyi spyi yin pas spyi'i yul can nyid du
analyzed: bstan bcos las ni skye mched kyi mtshan nyid kyi dbang du mdzad nas rang gi mtshan nyid kyi yul can du bshad la skye mched kyi rang gi mtshan nyid de yang sngon po dang ring po la sogs pa rnams kyi spyi yin pas spyi'i yul can nyid du
translated: And since the specific object of the sense bases is the universal of blue, long and so on, it would be accepted that it has a universal object.

original: khas blangs par 'gyur te de'i phyir grub pa bsgrub pa'o //
analyzed: khas blangs par 'gyur te de'i phyir grub pa bsgrub pa'o //
translated: Therefore this is a proof of what is already established.

original: 'ga' zhig rang gi skye mched kyi rdzas du mas bskyed par bya ba yin pa'i phyir spyi yin par khyad par med la bye brag tu ma bcad par de dag yul du yod pas spyi'i yul can yin gyi spyi nyid ni ma yin te /
analyzed: 'ga' zhig rang gi skye mched kyi rdzas du mas bskyed par bya ba yin pa'i phyir spyi yin par khyad par med la bye brag tu ma bcad par de dag yul du yod pas spyi'i yul can yin gyi spyi nyid ni ma yin te /
translated: Some say: It is a universal because it is generated by many substances of its own sense base. It is not different, but since it exists as an object without being specified, it has a universal object but is not a universal.

original: de ni btags par yod pa'i phyir dang rnam par shes pa yang 'dis bdag med par bshad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni btags par yod pa'i phyir dang rnam par shes pa yang 'dis bdag med par bshad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it exists as a designation and because it is explained that consciousness is selfless.

original: gzhan du na sngon bo la sogs pa'i rang gi mtshan nyid kyi shes pa yang spyi'i yul can du 'gyur te rdul phra rab kyi rdzas du mas bskyed par bya ba yin @50b pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan du na sngon bo la sogs pa'i rang gi mtshan nyid kyi shes pa yang spyi'i yul can du 'gyur te rdul phra rab kyi rdzas du mas bskyed par bya ba yin @50b pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Otherwise, the consciousness of the intrinsic identity of blue, etc., would have a universal for its object, because it is produced by many substances of atoms.

original: 'dir gtan tshigs ma grub pa dang dpe dang bsgrub bya'i chos ma tshang ba yang bsam par bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir gtan tshigs ma grub pa dang dpe dang bsgrub bya'i chos ma tshang ba yang bsam par bya'o //
translated: Here, the reason is not established, and the example and the property to be established are incomplete.

original: yang skye mched kyi mtshan nyid ci rdzas kyi mtshan nyid ci zhe na /
analyzed: yang skye mched kyi mtshan nyid ci rdzas kyi mtshan nyid ci zhe na /
translated: What is the definition of the sense-spheres? What is the definition of substance?

original: mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa mtshungs par ldan pa dang bcas pa'i rten dang dmigs par rung pa ni ji ltar srid pa bzhin du mig la sogs pa'i skye mched rnams dang / gzugs la sogs pa dmigs pa rnams kyi mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa mtshungs par ldan pa dang bcas pa'i rten dang dmigs par rung pa ni ji ltar srid pa bzhin du mig la sogs pa'i skye mched rnams dang / gzugs la sogs pa dmigs pa rnams kyi mtshan nyid do //
translated: The eye, etc., are defined as the sense-spheres of the eye, etc., and form, etc., are defined as the objects, in accordance with the possibilities, as the fit support and object of the consciousness of the eye, etc., together with what is associated with it.

original: de la mig gi dbang po'i yul kho na la mig gi rnam par shes pa skye'i gzhan las ni ma yin pas 'di dag ni skye mched kyi mtshan nyid la brten nas rang gi mtshan nyid kyi yul can yin gyi tha dad pa dag la tha mi dad
analyzed: de la mig gi dbang po'i yul kho na la mig gi rnam par shes pa skye'i gzhan las ni ma yin pas 'di dag ni skye mched kyi mtshan nyid la brten nas rang gi mtshan nyid kyi yul can yin gyi tha dad pa dag la tha mi dad
translated: Since eye consciousness arises from the object of the eye sense faculty alone and not from others, they are said to be objects of their own characteristics in dependence on the definition of a sense base, but they are not different from different things.

original: par brtags pa las ni ma yin te /
analyzed: par brtags pa las ni ma yin te /
translated: Eye consciousness arises from the object of the eye faculty alone, but not from another. Therefore, they are objects of their own characteristics based on the characteristics of the sense bases, but not from the investigation of the nondistinct in distinct objects.

original: de dag ni rnam par rtog pa med pa yin pa'i phyir ro //🔽rdzas kyi rang gi mtshan nyid ni sngon po la sogs pa rnams kyi rang gi ngo bo brjod du med pa rnam par rtog pa med pa ye shes kyi yul te de ltar yang bstan bcos las mig gi rnam par shes pas sngon po rnam par shes kyi
analyzed: de dag ni rnam par rtog pa med pa yin pa'i phyir ro // rdzas kyi rang gi mtshan nyid ni sngon po la sogs pa rnams kyi rang gi ngo bo brjod du med pa rnam par rtog pa med pa ye shes kyi yul te de ltar yang bstan bcos las mig gi rnam par shes pas sngon po rnam par shes kyi
translated: Because they are nonconceptual.🔽The intrinsic character of substance is the inexpressible, nonconceptual object of wisdom, the intrinsic entity of blue and so on. Thus the treatise Attainment of Knowledge states:

original: sngon po'o snyam du ni ma yin no zhes so //
analyzed: sngon po'o snyam du ni ma yin no zhes so //
translated: Eye consciousness cognizes blue, but it does not cognize I see blue.

original: 'di dpyad par bya ste zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste lus dang lce'i dbang po gnyis ni rten gcig yin pa'i phyir dang / phrad nas 'dzin pa'i phyir dang / ro dang reg bya dag kyang phan tshun tha dad med pa'i phyir yul dang phrad pa'i go rims las rnam par shes pa skye ba'i go rims mi srid pas de'i phyir dpyad pa'o //
analyzed: 'di dpyad par bya ste zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste lus dang lce'i dbang po gnyis ni rten gcig yin pa'i phyir dang / phrad nas 'dzin pa'i phyir dang / ro dang reg bya dag kyang phan tshun tha dad med pa'i phyir yul dang phrad pa'i go rims las rnam par shes pa skye ba'i go rims mi srid pas de'i phyir dpyad pa'o //
translated: The body and tongue faculties are the same basis, they apprehend objects by contact, and both taste and tactility are not mutually distinct. Therefore, since it is impossible for consciousness to arise in a sequence corresponding to the sequence of contact with the object, this should be investigated.

original: za bar 'dod pas rgyud gtad pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: za bar 'dod pas rgyud gtad pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la /
translated: Because the mindstream is directed by desire to eat.

original: za bar 'dod pa ni 'dun pa yin zhing /
analyzed: za bar 'dod pa ni 'dun pa yin zhing /
translated: Desire is craving.

original: de yang yid la byed pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa yin la /
analyzed: de yang yid la byed pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa yin la /
translated: It is concomitant with attention.

original: yid la byed pa'i dbang gis kyang sems kyi rgyud dmigs pa gzhan rnams la 'jug pas de'i phyir lce'i rnam par shes pa sngar skye'o //
analyzed: yid la byed pa'i dbang gis kyang sems kyi rgyud dmigs pa gzhan rnams la 'jug pas de'i phyir lce'i rnam par shes pa sngar skye'o //
translated: And the mindstream is directed to other focal objects by the power of attention. Therefore, tongue consciousness arises first.

original: gang gi tshe yul mnyam pa dang phrad la za bar 'dod pa med pa de'i tshe ni gang gi yul yin pa de sngar skye'o //
analyzed: gang gi tshe yul mnyam pa dang phrad la za bar 'dod pa med pa de'i tshe ni gang gi yul yin pa de sngar skye'o //
translated: When the object is the same and there is no desire to eat, then that which is the object arises first.

original: dbang po lnga'i don dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: dbang po lnga'i don dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: As for the meaning of the five sense faculties, etc.,

original: de dag ji ltar 'dzin pa ni res 'ga' ni rdzas gcig gis mig gi rnam par shes pa skyed do zhes rgyas par ro //
analyzed: de dag ji ltar 'dzin pa ni res 'ga' ni rdzas gcig gis mig gi rnam par shes pa skyed do zhes rgyas par ro //
translated: how they apprehend is sometimes one substance generates an eye consciousness, etc.

original: da ni de dag gi mjug thogs su bstan pa'i phyir de dag bshad pa'i mjug thogs su de ni rnam par rig byed ma yin pa brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: da ni de dag gi mjug thogs su bstan pa'i phyir de dag bshad pa'i mjug thogs su de ni rnam par rig byed ma yin pa brjod par bya'o //
translated: Now, in order to explain them immediately after that, immediately after the explanation of those, nonindicative form should be explained.

original: @51a * // g-yengs dang sems med pa yi yang //
analyzed: @51a * // g-yengs dang sems med pa yi yang //
translated: It is also of those in a distracted mind and in the mindless states.

original: zhes bya ba ni ngag gi rnam par rig byed las khyad par byed pa ste ngag gi rnam par rig byed ni sems g-yengs pa dang sems med pa dag la mi 'byung ste rgyun chad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni ngag gi rnam par rig byed las khyad par byed pa ste ngag gi rnam par rig byed ni sems g-yengs pa dang sems med pa dag la mi 'byung ste rgyun chad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This distinguishes it from verbal indicative form because verbal indicative form does not occur in those with a distracted mind or in the mindless states because the continuum is severed.

original: rjes 'brel gang zhes bya ba ni lus kyi rnam par rig byed las khyad par du byed pa'o //
analyzed: rjes 'brel gang zhes bya ba ni lus kyi rnam par rig byed las khyad par du byed pa'o //
translated: The term “concomitant” is meant to distinguish it from bodily intimation.

original: gal te rnam par rig byed kyang rjes su 'brel ba ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: gal te rnam par rig byed kyang rjes su 'brel ba ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: But isn’t intimation also concomitant?

original: rnam par rig byed log kyang rnam par rig byed ma yin pa mi ldog pa'i phyir 'dir mchog tu gyur par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: rnam par rig byed log kyang rnam par rig byed ma yin pa mi ldog pa'i phyir 'dir mchog tu gyur par shes par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood that in this context, non-intimation is the most important, because even when intimation ceases, non-intimation does not cease.

original: yang na rjes 'brel nyid nges par bzung ba'i phyir rnam par rig byed du thal ba med de /
analyzed: yang na rjes 'brel nyid nges par bzung ba'i phyir rnam par rig byed du thal ba med de /
translated: Or else, the word “concomitant” is used to exclude the possibility that non-intimation is intimation,

original: rnam par rig byed ni de'i skad cig la yang yod do //
analyzed: rnam par rig byed ni de'i skad cig la yang yod do //
translated: because intimation exists in the moment immediately following the moment of non-intimation.

original: dge dang mi dge zhes bya ba ni mig la sogs pa'i rgyun las khyad par du byed pa'o //
analyzed: dge dang mi dge zhes bya ba ni mig la sogs pa'i rgyun las khyad par du byed pa'o //
translated: The term “virtuous” and “non-virtuous” is meant to distinguish it from the continuum of the eye, etc.

original: 'byung ba che rnams rgyur byas pa //
analyzed: 'byung ba che rnams rgyur byas pa //
translated: It is derived from the great elements.

original: zhes bya ba ni thob pa'i rgyun las khyad par du bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni thob pa'i rgyun las khyad par du bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The term “derived” is meant to distinguish it from the continuum of acquisition.

original: bstan bcos las sems g-yengs pa nyon mongs pa can gyi sems su bshad pas de'i phyir de las gzhan ba'i sems kyi yang yin pa'o zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: bstan bcos las sems g-yengs pa nyon mongs pa can gyi sems su bshad pas de'i phyir de las gzhan ba'i sems kyi yang yin pa'o zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: It is also of a different mind.

original: 'dir de'i sgra yis ni kun nas slong pa'i sems shig brjod par 'dod la /
analyzed: 'dir de'i sgra yis ni kun nas slong pa'i sems shig brjod par 'dod la /
translated: Here the word also indicates an instigating mind.

original: de las gzhan pa ni de slong par byed pa'i sems dang mi 'dra ba'i phyir dge ba dang mi dge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa yang rung ste /
analyzed: de las gzhan pa ni de slong par byed pa'i sems dang mi 'dra ba'i phyir dge ba dang mi dge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa yang rung ste /
translated: A different mind is any virtuous, nonvirtuous, or neutral mind that is not similar to the instigating mind.

original: rjes su 'jug par byed pa g-yengs pa thams cad la brjod kyi nyon mongs pa can kho na ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rjes su 'jug par byed pa g-yengs pa thams cad la brjod kyi nyon mongs pa can kho na ni ma yin no //
translated: It is called a subsequent instigator because it is all distracted minds, but it is not only afflicted minds.

original: gnyid dang brgyal ba sems med par khas ma blangs pa'i phyir dang / 'du shes med pa la rnam par rig byed ma yin pa med pa'i phyir 'du shes med pa dang 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa la snyoms par zhugs pa'i yang yin pa'o zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: gnyid dang brgyal ba sems med par khas ma blangs pa'i phyir dang / 'du shes med pa la rnam par rig byed ma yin pa med pa'i phyir 'du shes med pa dang 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa la snyoms par zhugs pa'i yang yin pa'o zhes gsungs te /
translated: It is also of one who is absorbed in the meditative attainment of nondiscernment or cessation because it is said that they do not accept sleep and fainting to be mindless states and because nondiscernment does not possess nonindicative form.

original: sems med pa ni snyoms par 'jug pa gnyis kho na yin no zhes ston par byed do //
analyzed: sems med pa ni snyoms par 'jug pa gnyis kho na yin no zhes ston par byed do //
translated: The two mindless meditative attainments are taught.🔽The word “also” in the verse means that the two meditative attainments are also called “undistracted” and “with mind.”

original: yang zhes bya ba'i sgras ni zhes bya ba ni yang gi sgra gang zhig tshig le'ur byas pa las /
analyzed: yang zhes bya ba'i sgras ni zhes bya ba ni yang gi sgra gang zhig tshig le'ur byas pa las /
translated: The Autocommentary states:

original: g-yengs dang sems med pa yi yang //🔽zhes bya ba ste ma g-yengs pa sems dang bcas pa'i yang yin no zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: g-yengs dang sems med pa yi yang // zhes bya ba ste ma g-yengs pa sems dang bcas pa'i yang yin no zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Also distracted and mindless.🔽Undistracted and with mind.

original: 'dir yang sems dang bcas pa smos pa ni 'di'i sems g-yengs pa med pas mi g-yengs pa zhes bya ba yin na sems med @51b pa la yang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir de dgag pa'i don du gnyi ga'o //
analyzed: 'dir yang sems dang bcas pa smos pa ni 'di'i sems g-yengs pa med pas mi g-yengs pa zhes bya ba yin na sems med @51b pa la yang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir de dgag pa'i don du gnyi ga'o //
translated: The term “with mind” is stated here because the mind is not distracted in this state, and it is called “undistracted.” But if it were stated that “undistracted” means “not mindless,” then it would follow that the two meditative attainments would be undistracted.

original: ji ltar yang sems mi g-yeng ba ni sems g-yeng ba dgag pa'i phyir dang mi g-yeng ba mngon du gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ji ltar yang sems mi g-yeng ba ni sems g-yeng ba dgag pa'i phyir dang mi g-yeng ba mngon du gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Undistracted states are so called because the mind is not distracted in them, and because the undistracted mind manifests in them.

original: yang na sems dang bcas pa'i gnas skabs rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: yang na sems dang bcas pa'i gnas skabs rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Or, states with mind are of two types:

original: g-yengs pa'i sems dang bcas pa'i gnas skabs dang / ma g-yengs pa'i sems dang bcas pa'i gnas skabs so //
analyzed: g-yengs pa'i sems dang bcas pa'i gnas skabs dang / ma g-yengs pa'i sems dang bcas pa'i gnas skabs so //
translated: The state of having a distracted mind and the state of having an undistracted mind.

original: de la g-yengs pa sems dang bcas pa'i gnas skabs ni dngos su bstan la /
analyzed: de la g-yengs pa sems dang bcas pa'i gnas skabs ni dngos su bstan la /
translated: The state of having a distracted mind is directly stated.

original: ma g-yengs pa sems dang bcas pa'i gnas skabs ni yang gi sgras so //
analyzed: ma g-yengs pa sems dang bcas pa'i gnas skabs ni yang gi sgras so //
translated: The state of having an undistracted mind is stated by the word “also.”

original: de ltar na /
analyzed: de ltar na /
translated: Thus,

original: g-yengs dang sems med pa ya yang //
analyzed: g-yengs dang sems med pa ya yang //
translated: the distracted, the mindless, and also the distracted-mindless.

original: zhes pa 'dis gnas skabs gsum bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zhes pa 'dis gnas skabs gsum bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: This teaches three states.

original: yang na 'dir mi g-yeng ba ni rnam par rig byed kyis kun nas slong pa pa'i sems dang bcas pa dang mnyam par gzhag pa'i sems dang mnyam par gzhag pa dang mnyam par ma bzhag pa'i rnam par rig byed ma yin pa'i kun slong gi sems bstan pa
analyzed: yang na 'dir mi g-yeng ba ni rnam par rig byed kyis kun nas slong pa pa'i sems dang bcas pa dang mnyam par gzhag pa'i sems dang mnyam par gzhag pa dang mnyam par ma bzhag pa'i rnam par rig byed ma yin pa'i kun slong gi sems bstan pa
translated: Or, here, the undistracted is taught as the state of having a mind that is motivated by indicative form, and the state of having a mind that is motivated by nonindicative form that is either in equipoise or not in equipoise.

original: yin no // ji skad du /
analyzed: yin no // ji skad du /
translated: As it says,

original: rnam par rig byed dang ting nge 'dzin las byung ba'i zhes rgya cher 'byung ngo //
analyzed: rnam par rig byed dang ting nge 'dzin las byung ba'i zhes rgya cher 'byung ngo //
translated: “arisen from indicative form and concentration.”

original: rjes su 'brel pa gsungs pa'i phyir kun slong gi char gyur pa'i sems kyi gnas skabs mi g-yeng ba zhes bya bar gzung bar bya'o zhes slob dpon 'phags pa'i 'bangs zer ro //
analyzed: rjes su 'brel pa gsungs pa'i phyir kun slong gi char gyur pa'i sems kyi gnas skabs mi g-yeng ba zhes bya bar gzung bar bya'o zhes slob dpon 'phags pa'i 'bangs zer ro //
translated: The master Arya-Sthiramati says that it should be understood as the state of mind that is the causal impetus for the subsequent continuity, and is called “non-distraction.”

original: skad cig ma las gzhan pa'i rjes su 'brel pa'i rgyun med do //
analyzed: skad cig ma las gzhan pa'i rjes su 'brel pa'i rgyun med do //
translated: There is no continuity of the action apart from the moment.

original: gal te skad cig ma dang po la rgyun med pa de yang rnam par rig byed kyi skad cig med pa'i phyir /🔽n++y'u noo rnam par rig byed ma yin pa'i skad cig na nu tso kta m'a dya ae ba na bha g'i ti /
analyzed: gal te skad cig ma dang po la rgyun med pa de yang rnam par rig byed kyi skad cig med pa'i phyir / n++y'u noo rnam par rig byed ma yin pa'i skad cig na nu tso kta m'a dya ae ba na bha g'i ti /
translated: If there is no continuity of the action in the first moment, then in the second moment and so on, there would be no non-informative action because there is no moment of informative action.

original: de ltar 'o na gnyis pa la sogs pa yang so sor rgyun gyis rjes su 'brel ba med pa'i phyir rnam par rig byed me yin pa med do zhe na /
analyzed: de ltar 'o na gnyis pa la sogs pa yang so sor rgyun gyis rjes su 'brel ba med pa'i phyir rnam par rig byed me yin pa med do zhe na /
translated: If you say that there is no error because the second moment and so on are the continuity of the first moment, then in the second moment and so on, there would be no informative action because there is no continuity of the first moment.

original: dang po yang skad cig phyi ma la bltos nas rjes su 'brel pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dang po yang skad cig phyi ma la bltos nas rjes su 'brel pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The first moment is the continuity of the second moment and so on.

original: de 'ba' zhig ma yin gyi de'i kun slong yang brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de 'ba' zhig ma yin gyi de'i kun slong yang brjod par bya'o //
translated: Not only that, but the causal impetus for the first moment should also be stated.

original: de dang 'dra ba nyid na de'i phyir rjes 'brel ba zhes brjod ce na /
analyzed: de dang 'dra ba nyid na de'i phyir rjes 'brel ba zhes brjod ce na /
translated: Because it is similar to that, it is called subsequent.

original: rnam par rig byed kyi gnas su gyur pa 'gags kyang ma btang gi bar du rjes su 'jug par shes par bya bo'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par rig byed kyi gnas su gyur pa 'gags kyang ma btang gi bar du rjes su 'jug par shes par bya bo'i phyir ro //
translated: Even though the state of being a basis of informative form has ceased, it is to be understood that it continues to exist as long as it has not been relinquished.

original: thob pa'i rgyun yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: thob pa'i rgyun yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: The continuum of attainment, etc.

original: thob pa rnams ni mi ldan pa yin pa'i phyir 'byung ba chen po rnams rgyur byas pa ma yin no //
analyzed: thob pa rnams ni mi ldan pa yin pa'i phyir 'byung ba chen po rnams rgyur byas pa ma yin no //
translated: Attainments are not derived from the great elements because they are not possessed.

original: rgyur byas pa'i don ni rgyu'i @52a * //
analyzed: rgyur byas pa'i don ni rgyu'i @52a * //
translated: The meaning of derived is the meaning of cause.

original: don te zhes bya ba la phrad nas rnam par shes pa skyed pa la sogs pa'i rgyu'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir zhes brjod de /
analyzed: don te zhes bya ba la phrad nas rnam par shes pa skyed pa la sogs pa'i rgyu'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir zhes brjod de /
translated: This is because they are the nature of a cause that generates consciousness, etc., after coming into contact with it.

original: skyed pa dang rten pa dang gnas pa dang rton pa dang 'phel bar byed pas so //
analyzed: skyed pa dang rten pa dang gnas pa dang rton pa dang 'phel bar byed pas so //
translated: They are causes because they generate, support, maintain, assist, and increase.

original: de la skyed pa ni rang gi gnas 'byung ba chen po rnams rgyur byas nas de bskyed pa'o //
analyzed: de la skyed pa ni rang gi gnas 'byung ba chen po rnams rgyur byas nas de bskyed pa'o //
translated: Among them, generation is the generation of that consciousness after the great elements that are its basis have been derived.

original: rten pa ni de rjes su sgrub pa ste /
analyzed: rten pa ni de rjes su sgrub pa ste /
translated: Support is the establishment of that consciousness.

original: gnas kyi bdag nyid kyi lus 'byung ba chen po rgyu byas pa dang mthun par 'jug pa /🔽shtsakra sye ba sam ba ri brta m'a na bya bho moo sa'i phyogs su lus kyi 'byung ba chen po rnams rnam par rig byed ma yin pa dang mthun par 'jug pa'i rgyur 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: gnas kyi bdag nyid kyi lus 'byung ba chen po rgyu byas pa dang mthun par 'jug pa / shtsakra sye ba sam ba ri brta m'a na bya bho moo sa'i phyogs su lus kyi 'byung ba chen po rnams rnam par rig byed ma yin pa dang mthun par 'jug pa'i rgyur 'gyur ba'o //
translated: The body as the abode is the cause for the engagement of the great elements in accordance with the engagement of the cause.🔽The great elements of the body in the direction of the east are the cause for the engagement of the non-revealing form in accordance with the engagement of the cause.

original: gnas pa ni lus kyi 'byung ba chen po rnams rten pa'i gnas skabs so //
analyzed: gnas pa ni lus kyi 'byung ba chen po rnams rten pa'i gnas skabs so //
translated: Abiding is the state of support for the great elements of the body.

original: rton pa ni rnam par gnon pas nye bar 'tshe ba'o //
analyzed: rton pa ni rnam par gnon pas nye bar 'tshe ba'o //
translated: Relying is the harm by subjugation.

original: gnyi ga gsal bar skyes pa la rten gyi rnam 'gyur ni ta dvi ni bri tto ta: 'phel ba ni lus kyi 'byung ba chen po rnams gzhan 'dod pa'i rgyu med par rgyun rab tu 'brel bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnyi ga gsal bar skyes pa la rten gyi rnam 'gyur ni ta dvi ni bri tto ta: 'phel ba ni lus kyi 'byung ba chen po rnams gzhan 'dod pa'i rgyu med par rgyun rab tu 'brel bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The transformation of the support for the one who has been born and has both clearly arisen is the increase of the great elements of the body because they are the cause for the uninterrupted continuum of the other desires.

original: gzugs dang byed pa'i rang bzhin yin yang zhes bya ba la gzugs smos pa ni sems pa las khyad par du bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzugs dang byed pa'i rang bzhin yin yang zhes bya ba la gzugs smos pa ni sems pa las khyad par du bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Although it is the nature of form and action, the word form is mentioned in order to distinguish it from intention.

original: byed pa smos pa ni mig la sogs pa las khyad par du bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: byed pa smos pa ni mig la sogs pa las khyad par du bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The word “agent” is mentioned in order to distinguish it from the eye, etc.

original: de'i phyir de lta na na'i sgra la 'di shes rab byas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir de lta na na'i sgra la 'di shes rab byas par 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, the word “also” is to be supplied to the word “wisdom” in the root text.

original: rnam par rig byed ma yin pa ni rnam par rig byed bkag pa tsam ma yin la /
analyzed: rnam par rig byed ma yin pa ni rnam par rig byed bkag pa tsam ma yin la /
translated: Non-informative form is not merely the negation of informative form.

original: gzugs zang gcig rnam par rig byed las gzhan pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: gzugs zang gcig rnam par rig byed las gzhan pa yang ma yin no //
translated: It is not a second type of form that is other than informative form.

original: 'o na ci zhe na gzugs dang byed pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir rnam par rig byed dang 'dra ba'i gzugs gzhan zhig kun nas slong bar byed pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba rnams lhag par rig par mi byed pa'i phyir rnam par rig byed ma yin
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na gzugs dang byed pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir rnam par rig byed dang 'dra ba'i gzugs gzhan zhig kun nas slong bar byed pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba rnams lhag par rig par mi byed pa'i phyir rnam par rig byed ma yin
translated: What is it, then? It is a form that is similar to informative form because it is the nature of form and action. It is called “non-informative” because it does not cause others to understand the mind and mental factors that motivate it.

original: pa zhes brjod de 'dra ba'i dbang du byas nas gzhan la yang ngag gi tshig rigs so //
analyzed: pa zhes brjod de 'dra ba'i dbang du byas nas gzhan la yang ngag gi tshig rigs so //
translated: The same expression is used for other things as well, as in the expression “the meaning of the word ‘also.’”

original: de bzhin du gang gi phyir gyi don zhes pa yongs su dri ba nyid do //
analyzed: de bzhin du gang gi phyir gyi don zhes pa yongs su dri ba nyid do //
translated: Similarly, the word “why” in the root text is a question.

original: yang na'i sgras 'di ba gzhan nyid la aa yam b'a ra zhes gsal bar bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang na'i sgras 'di ba gzhan nyid la aa yam b'a ra zhes gsal bar bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Or else, the particle ni is for the purpose of clarifying that this is another master.

original: na'i sgra ni de'i ming gi rgyu shes par byed pa'i don to //
analyzed: na'i sgra ni de'i ming gi rgyu shes par byed pa'i don to //
translated: The particle ni has the sense of indicating the cause of that name.

original: brjod ces bya ba slob dpon gyi tshig yin par ston pa'o zhes bya ba ni ston pa'i gsung ma yin no snyam du dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: brjod ces bya ba slob dpon gyi tshig yin par ston pa'o zhes bya ba ni ston pa'i gsung ma yin no snyam du dgongs pa'o //
translated: The word “declares” shows that this is the statement of a master, not the statement of a teacher.

original: yang na de slob dpon nyid 'ba' zhig gi brjod kyi mngon sum mam rjes su dpag pa'i sgo nas ma @52b yin pa'o //
analyzed: yang na de slob dpon nyid 'ba' zhig gi brjod kyi mngon sum mam rjes su dpag pa'i sgo nas ma @52b yin pa'o //
translated: Or else, that is the declaration of the master himself, not by way of direct perception or inference.

original: mdor na rnam par rig byed dang ting nge 'dzin las byung ba zhes rgyas par 'byung ste /
analyzed: mdor na rnam par rig byed dang ting nge 'dzin las byung ba zhes rgyas par 'byung ste /
translated: In brief, the statement “arisen from informative form and concentration” is elaborated.

original: de la dge ba dang mi dge ba zhes ma brjod na ni rnam par rig byed dang ting nge 'dzin las byung ba'i rnam par smin pa las skyes pa dang rgyas pa las byung ba dag la yang thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de la dge ba dang mi dge ba zhes ma brjod na ni rnam par rig byed dang ting nge 'dzin las byung ba'i rnam par smin pa las skyes pa dang rgyas pa las byung ba dag la yang thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If “virtuous” and “nonvirtuous” are not mentioned, then it would follow that the karmic maturation of informative form and concentration would be arisen from karmic maturation and arisen from enhancement.

original: rnam par rig byed dang ting nge 'dzin las byung ba ma brjod na ni rig byed kyi gzugs la yang thal bar 'gyur te de'i phyir gnyi ga smos so //
analyzed: rnam par rig byed dang ting nge 'dzin las byung ba ma brjod na ni rig byed kyi gzugs la yang thal bar 'gyur te de'i phyir gnyi ga smos so //
translated: If the form derived from concentration were not mentioned, then the form of the indication would be included, and therefore both are mentioned.

original: de la rnam par rig byed las skyes pa ni sdom pa dang sdom pa ma yin pa'i bdag nyid can dge ba dang mi dge ba'o //
analyzed: de la rnam par rig byed las skyes pa ni sdom pa dang sdom pa ma yin pa'i bdag nyid can dge ba dang mi dge ba'o //
translated: That derived from the indication is either virtue or nonvirtue, having the nature of restraint or nonrestraint.

original: cig shos kyang 'dod pa dang mi 'dod pa'i 'bras bu nyid kyis bde ba dang mi bde ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: cig shos kyang 'dod pa dang mi 'dod pa'i 'bras bu nyid kyis bde ba dang mi bde ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The other is also either pleasant or unpleasant, because it is the result of what is desired or not desired.

original: ting nge 'dzin las byung ba ni dge ba kho na ste bsam gtan dang zag med kyi sdom pa dag go //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin las byung ba ni dge ba kho na ste bsam gtan dang zag med kyi sdom pa dag go //
translated: That derived from concentration is only virtue, being the restraints of absorption and uncontaminated states.

original: ting nge 'dzin ni gcig tu 'dod pa'i 'bras bu nyid kyi phyir zhes so //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin ni gcig tu 'dod pa'i 'bras bu nyid kyi phyir zhes so //
translated: Concentration is only the result of what is desired, because it is the result of the desire realm.

original: 'di ni rnam par rig byed ma yin pa mtha' dag gi mtshan nyid w'a sy'a ta bya sta b'a /
analyzed: 'di ni rnam par rig byed ma yin pa mtha' dag gi mtshan nyid w'a sy'a ta bya sta b'a /
translated: This is the definition of all nonindicative form.

original: do la re zhig mtha' dag la rung ba ma yin te rnam par rig byed kyi rdzas gcig 'dis mtha' dag mtshon ba ma yin na ni mi bya ste mtshan gzhi la 'khrul ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: do la re zhig mtha' dag la rung ba ma yin te rnam par rig byed kyi rdzas gcig 'dis mtha' dag mtshon ba ma yin na ni mi bya ste mtshan gzhi la 'khrul ba'i phyir ro //
translated: But this is not so, because the substance of one informative form does not indicate all.

original: mi g-yengs pa sems dang bcas pa gang yin pa rgyur byas pa'i gzugs kyi bdag nyid rnam bar rig byed ma yin pa'i rdzas dge ba de nyid g-yengs dang sems med pa yang rung de nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: mi g-yengs pa sems dang bcas pa gang yin pa rgyur byas pa'i gzugs kyi bdag nyid rnam bar rig byed ma yin pa'i rdzas dge ba de nyid g-yengs dang sems med pa yang rung de nyid ma yin no //
translated: That very substance of noninformative form that is virtuous and has form as its intrinsic nature, whether distracted or not, whether with or without mind, is not that very substance.

original: dge ba zhes bya ba yod kyang rnam par rig byed ma yin pa'i gzugs kyi mtshan nyid gzhi ma yin zhing 'di mtshan nyid du mi rung ngo //
analyzed: dge ba zhes bya ba yod kyang rnam par rig byed ma yin pa'i gzugs kyi mtshan nyid gzhi ma yin zhing 'di mtshan nyid du mi rung ngo //
translated: Even though there is a substance called virtuous, it is not the basis of the characteristics of noninformative form, and it is not suitable as a characteristic.

original: dbye ba'i mtshan nyid du ni 'gal ba med do //
analyzed: dbye ba'i mtshan nyid du ni 'gal ba med do //
translated: But there is no contradiction in its being a characteristic of a classification.

original: de ni de las gzhan du yang 'jug ste /
analyzed: de ni de las gzhan du yang 'jug ste /
translated: It also occurs in a way that is different from that.

original: nirdzny'a ta mig gi rnam par shes pa'i rten gzugs dang ba dang mig gi mtshan nyid dang rnam par smin pa las skyes pa dang / rgyas pa las 'byung ba dang skal ba mnyam pa dang 'dra ba la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid bzhin no //
analyzed: nirdzny'a ta mig gi rnam par shes pa'i rten gzugs dang ba dang mig gi mtshan nyid dang rnam par smin pa las skyes pa dang / rgyas pa las 'byung ba dang skal ba mnyam pa dang 'dra ba la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid bzhin no //
translated: The eye sense-faculty is the basis of the visual consciousness, and is clear form. It is the eye sense-faculty itself, which is the effect of retribution, which is the cause of the visual consciousness.

original: slob dpon 'dus bzang na re /
analyzed: slob dpon 'dus bzang na re /
translated: The master Saṃghabhadra says:

original: 'di ni rnam par rig byed ma yin pa'i mtshan nyid skyon med pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni rnam par rig byed ma yin pa'i mtshan nyid skyon med pa ma yin te /
translated: This is not a faultless definition of non-informative action.

original: skad cig ma dang po ni rgyun ces bya ba mi rung ngo //
analyzed: skad cig ma dang po ni rgyun ces bya ba mi rung ngo //
translated: The first moment cannot be called a “series.”

original: de lta bas na mtshan nyid 'dir bsdus pa med pas ma tshang ba yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na mtshan nyid 'dir bsdus pa med pas ma tshang ba yin no //
translated: Thus, this definition is incomplete, since it does not include the first moment.

original: rgyun yang rjes su med pa'i phyir rnam par rig byed ma yin ba rjes su med par 'gyur ro //🔽mnyam par gzhag @53a * //
analyzed: rgyun yang rjes su med pa'i phyir rnam par rig byed ma yin ba rjes su med par 'gyur ro // mnyam par gzhag @53a * //
translated: Moreover, since the series does not exist without the first moment, the non-informative action would not exist.

original: pa'i ni g-yengs pa dang sems med pa'i rjes su 'brel ba med pas de rnam par rig byed ma yin par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir nyams pa yin no //
analyzed: pa'i ni g-yengs pa dang sems med pa'i rjes su 'brel ba med pas de rnam par rig byed ma yin par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir nyams pa yin no //
translated: The non-informative action would be the effect of concentration, because it is not related to the distracted mind or to the mindless state.🔽This is a fault.

original: gal te ma g-yengs pa dang sems dang bcas pa'i rjes su 'brel ba'i phyir 'di ni nyes pa med do zhe na /
analyzed: gal te ma g-yengs pa dang sems dang bcas pa'i rjes su 'brel ba'i phyir 'di ni nyes pa med do zhe na /
translated: If you say that there is no fault because it is related to a nondistracted mind,

original: dge ba dang mi dge ba yang rnam par rig byed ma yin pa'i mtshan nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dge ba dang mi dge ba yang rnam par rig byed ma yin pa'i mtshan nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: then it follows that virtue and nonvirtue would also have the nature of nonindicative form.

original: gong ma kho nas mchog pa'i phyir sems med pa'i pang zhes bya ba'i sgra don med par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gong ma kho nas mchog pa'i phyir sems med pa'i pang zhes bya ba'i sgra don med par 'gyur te /
translated: And the term “without mind” would be meaningless, because it is already implied by the term “without thought.”

original: sems g-yengs pa'i yang zhes bya 'dis sems dang bcas pa'i gnas skabs thams cad bsdus zin na gang yang zhes bya ba'i sgra gnyis pas bsdu bar bya ba'i gnas skabs gzhan ci zhig yod /
analyzed: sems g-yengs pa'i yang zhes bya 'dis sems dang bcas pa'i gnas skabs thams cad bsdus zin na gang yang zhes bya ba'i sgra gnyis pas bsdu bar bya ba'i gnas skabs gzhan ci zhig yod /
translated: If this term “without thought” includes all states with a mind, then what other state is there to be included by the second term “without mind”?🔽It would be necessary to specify that virtue is related to nonindicative form in the context of mindless states, but this is not done.

original: sems med pa'i dbang du byas te dge ba'i rnam par rig byed ma yin pa'i rjes su 'brel pa khyad par du bya dgos pa las mtshang ba dang bstan bcos kyi lus nyams par thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sems med pa'i dbang du byas te dge ba'i rnam par rig byed ma yin pa'i rjes su 'brel pa khyad par du bya dgos pa las mtshang ba dang bstan bcos kyi lus nyams par thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: This is a fault and the body of the treatise would be undermined.

original: yang gi sgra lhag par brjod pas khyad par du bya ba khyad par du ma byas pa yang ngo //
analyzed: yang gi sgra lhag par brjod pas khyad par du bya ba khyad par du ma byas pa yang ngo //
translated: The word “also” is stated for the purpose of distinguishing that which is not distinguished, namely, that which is not a continuum and that which is not only the first moment of the nature of non-informative karma.

original: de la so sor ni thams cad la yang rnam par rig byed ma yin pa'i mtshan nyid las rgyun ma yin pa dang dang po 'ba' zhig ba ma yin pa nyid mtshan nyid de rgyun smos pa la yang de'i yan lag thams cad phan ston pa'i phyir te
analyzed: de la so sor ni thams cad la yang rnam par rig byed ma yin pa'i mtshan nyid las rgyun ma yin pa dang dang po 'ba' zhig ba ma yin pa nyid mtshan nyid de rgyun smos pa la yang de'i yan lag thams cad phan ston pa'i phyir te
translated: In this regard, the term “continuum” is used because all of its components are beneficial.

original: / dper na bum pa'i sgras gzugs la sogs pa smos pa bzhin no //
analyzed: / dper na bum pa'i sgras gzugs la sogs pa smos pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, the term “pot” is used to refer to form and so on.

original: de'i phyir ma tshang ba med pa nyid do //
analyzed: de'i phyir ma tshang ba med pa nyid do //
translated: Therefore, it is not incomplete.

original: rdzas su yod pa ma yin pa la yang rnam par rig byed ma yin pa med de /
analyzed: rdzas su yod pa ma yin pa la yang rnam par rig byed ma yin pa med de /
translated: Non-informative karma does not exist as a substantial entity.

original: rgyun smos pas de'i yan lag bzung bas rnam par rig byed la yang thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rgyun smos pas de'i yan lag bzung bas rnam par rig byed la yang thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Since the term “continuum” includes its components, it would also follow for informative karma.

original: gang gi phyir de'i skad cig nye bar gnas pa sems med pa la yang nges pa de'i phyir brjod par bya'o zhes pa ni sems med pa la yang dge ba dang mi dge ba nges par gzung ba'i phyir thal ba med do //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de'i skad cig nye bar gnas pa sems med pa la yang nges pa de'i phyir brjod par bya'o zhes pa ni sems med pa la yang dge ba dang mi dge ba nges par gzung ba'i phyir thal ba med do //
translated: Because its moment abides near, even in the mindless states, it is ascertained. Therefore, it should be stated. This is not a consequence, because virtue and nonvirtue are ascertained even in the mindless states.

original: yang gi sgra lhag par brjod pa yang med pa nyid do //
analyzed: yang gi sgra lhag par brjod pa yang med pa nyid do //
translated: The word also is not stated in excess.

original: ji skad bshad pa sngar khyad par du bya dgos pa yang 'dir khyad par du byas pa nyid de /
analyzed: ji skad bshad pa sngar khyad par du bya dgos pa yang 'dir khyad par du byas pa nyid de /
translated: Also, that which must be specified previously, as it was explained, is specified here.

original: dge ba dang mi dge ba dag gi rnam par rig byed ma yin pa'i gzugs dag gi ji ltar srid ba'i ngag yongs su rdzogs pa la mtshan nyid 'di skyon dang bcas pa'o zhes zer ba ni ma yin pa nyid do //
analyzed: dge ba dang mi dge ba dag gi rnam par rig byed ma yin pa'i gzugs dag gi ji ltar srid ba'i ngag yongs su rdzogs pa la mtshan nyid 'di skyon dang bcas pa'o zhes zer ba ni ma yin pa nyid do //
translated: It is not that this definition is faulty with regard to the complete verbal statement of the virtue and nonvirtue of nonindicative form as is possible.

original: gzhan du de'i mtshan nyid bshad pa byas pa dang mi 'dra ba'i sems la'ang sems med pa la @53b gang ;
analyzed: gzhan du de'i mtshan nyid bshad pa byas pa dang mi 'dra ba'i sems la'ang sems med pa la @53b gang ;
translated: Otherwise, the definition of that is stated as if it were different, but it is not different in the mind that is not mindless.

original: / lung bstan thogs pa med pa'i gzugs //
analyzed: / lung bstan thogs pa med pa'i gzugs //
translated: Nonindicative form is unobscured neutral.

original: de ni rnam par rig byed min 'dod //
analyzed: de ni rnam par rig byed min 'dod //
translated: It is called nonindicative form.

original: byas pa dang yang zhes pa ni byed pa dang bya ba gzhan yang ngo //
analyzed: byas pa dang yang zhes pa ni byed pa dang bya ba gzhan yang ngo //
translated: The words “and so on” refer to other agents and actions.

original: mi 'dra ba'i sems la'ang zhes pa ni kun slong du gyur ba'i 'dra ba'i sems la yang ngo //
analyzed: mi 'dra ba'i sems la'ang zhes pa ni kun slong du gyur ba'i 'dra ba'i sems la yang ngo //
translated: The words “and also with regard to a dissimilar mind” refer to a similar mind that is the instigator.

original: lhag ma go sla ba nyid do //
analyzed: lhag ma go sla ba nyid do //
translated: The rest is easily understood.

original: 'di mtha' dag gi bya stam p'a /
analyzed: 'di mtha' dag gi bya stam p'a /
translated: The summary of all this is:

original: mtshan nyid du yongs su rtog na yang de la re zhig mtha' dag gi ma yin te /
analyzed: mtshan nyid du yongs su rtog na yang de la re zhig mtha' dag gi ma yin te /
translated: If one imagines that the characteristic of non-revealing form is like that of revealing form, then, first, it is not like that of all revealing form,

original: thams cad kyi re re rnam par rig byed ma yin pa'i rdzas kyi mtshan nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: thams cad kyi re re rnam par rig byed ma yin pa'i rdzas kyi mtshan nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: because each of the latter is the characteristic of a substance of non-revealing form.

original: n'a pi bya stam thams cad la mtshon du med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: n'a pi bya stam thams cad la mtshon du med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Nor is it like that of all revealing form, because it is not indicated in all of them.

original: de'i phyir lung bstan thogs pa med pa'i gzugs zhes pa de kho na 'di'i mtshan nyid yin gyi lhag ma ni don med pa nyid do //
analyzed: de'i phyir lung bstan thogs pa med pa'i gzugs zhes pa de kho na 'di'i mtshan nyid yin gyi lhag ma ni don med pa nyid do //
translated: Therefore, the characteristic of non-revealing form is just that which is taught in the scriptures as “unobstructed form,” and the rest is meaningless.

original: yang na thogs pa med pa'i gzugs zhes aa sdu lung bstan bstan pa smos pa yang don med pa can no //
analyzed: yang na thogs pa med pa'i gzugs zhes aa sdu lung bstan bstan pa smos pa yang don med pa can no //
translated: Or, the statement in the scriptures that “unobstructed form” is taught is also meaningless.

original: 'dir yang rgyun nyid de'i mtshan nyid yin gyi rdzas ni ma yin no //🔽aa ta sminb'a ta ta pra yo ga ai tang hu bra ka ra bi shr'i n'i ta sh'a ka the ti /
analyzed: 'dir yang rgyun nyid de'i mtshan nyid yin gyi rdzas ni ma yin no // aa ta sminb'a ta ta pra yo ga ai tang hu bra ka ra bi shr'i n'i ta sh'a ka the ti /
translated: Here also, the continuum itself is the characteristic, not the substance.

original: spros pas chog go //
analyzed: spros pas chog go //
translated: Enough of this elaboration!

original: skabs su gsal nyid brtsam par bya ste /
analyzed: skabs su gsal nyid brtsam par bya ste /

original: 'byung ba dag ni sa khams dang // zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /

analyzed: dang po dang mthar khams smos pa ni bar du yang shes par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The mention of the elements at the beginning and end is for the purpose of understanding in the middle.

original: khams smos pa ni kha dog dang dbyibs kyi bdag nyid kyis la sogs pa bsal ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: khams smos pa ni kha dog dang dbyibs kyi bdag nyid kyis la sogs pa bsal ba'i phyir te /

original: gzhan du bshad na ni de dag la yang thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan du bshad na ni de dag la yang thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If explained otherwise, it would follow that they are also elements.

original: sa nyid khams yin pa ni sa'i khams te lhag ma la yang de skad du brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: sa nyid khams yin pa ni sa'i khams te lhag ma la yang de skad du brjod par bya'o //
translated: Earth itself is the element, the earth element. The same should be said for the rest.

original: gzhan dag ni sa'i khams ni sa'i khams so zhes 'chad do //
analyzed: gzhan dag ni sa'i khams ni sa'i khams so zhes 'chad do //

original: de lta na ni thams cad rgyur byas pa'i gzugs 'dzin pa'i phyir khams nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta na ni thams cad rgyur byas pa'i gzugs 'dzin pa'i phyir khams nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: If that were so, then all would be elements, because they all hold derivative form.

analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid dang rgyur byas pa'i gzugs 'dzin ba'i phyir khams dag go zhes bya ba ni nges pa'i tshig gi tshul gyis te /
translated: The elements are so called because they hold their own characteristics and derivative form. This is according to the method of verbal derivation.

analyzed: 'byung ba rnams kyang 'byung ba rnams kyi gnas yin te skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: de ltar de dag phan tshun tha dad pa nyid bshad par 'gyur ro //

translated: Water is seen to support a boat, to ripen fruit, to be hot and to move.🔽Therefore, earth, wind and fire are seen to be associated with the water element. analyzed: las dang rang bzhin khyad par ci yod ce na byed pa la bltos pa dang de bzhin du las kyi kun spyod rdzas 'dzin pa la bltos pa na /
translated: When action depends on an agent and the performance of action depends on the substance that is the agent,

original: de ltar las kyi kun spyod rdzas 'dzin pa la bltos pas sa'i khams la 'dzin ba'i las su brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar las kyi kun spyod rdzas 'dzin pa la bltos pas sa'i khams la 'dzin ba'i las su brjod par bya'o //
translated: in that case, the action of holding should be ascribed to the earth element, since the performance of action depends on the substance that is the agent.

original: kun sdud pa la bltos te gzhan kun sdud pa'i las brjod pa la bltos nas ma dang ldan pa'i las brjod pa bya'o //
analyzed: kun sdud pa la bltos te gzhan kun sdud pa'i las brjod pa la bltos nas ma dang ldan pa'i las brjod pa bya'o //
translated: The action of the mother is to be described in dependence on the action of the general progenitor.🔽The action of the nurse is to be described in dependence on the action of the mother.🔽The action of the grower is to be described in dependence on the action of the nurse.🔽The action of the nourisher is to be described in dependence on the action of the grower.

original: mer mer bo ni myu gu la sogs pa ya ba ltos te gso 'phel ba'i las su brjod par bya'o //🔽gzhan dag na re 'byung ba'i mtshan nyid las rnams ni gsum pa dang du gcig ba nyid yin no zhes zer ro //🔽rang bzhin ni rang gi ngo bo nyid de de yang thams cad du dngos po gzhan la bltos pa'o zhes pa ni khyad par ro //
analyzed: mer mer bo ni myu gu la sogs pa ya ba ltos te gso 'phel ba'i las su brjod par bya'o // gzhan dag na re 'byung ba'i mtshan nyid las rnams ni gsum pa dang du gcig ba nyid yin no zhes zer ro // rang bzhin ni rang gi ngo bo nyid de de yang thams cad du dngos po gzhan la bltos pa'o zhes pa ni khyad par ro //
translated: The action of the producer is to be described in dependence on the action of the nourisher.🔽The action of the developer is to be described in dependence on the action of the producer.

original: rgyas bar byed bzhi 'phel bar byed pa dang rgyas bar byed pa yin no //🔽'phel ba ni myu gu la sogs pa rnams steng dang 'og dang ngos su ba ni la sogs pa dag las ches lhag par skye ba yin la /
analyzed: rgyas bar byed bzhi 'phel bar byed pa dang rgyas bar byed pa yin no // 'phel ba ni myu gu la sogs pa rnams steng dang 'og dang ngos su ba ni la sogs pa dag las ches lhag par skye ba yin la /
translated: The action of the one who causes to increase is to be described in dependence on the action of the developer.🔽The action of the one who causes to grow is to be described in dependence on the action of the one who causes to increase.🔽The action of the one who causes to expand is to be described in dependence on the action of the one who causes to grow.🔽The action of the one who causes to flourish is to be described in dependence on the action of the one who causes to expand.

original: rgyas par byed pa ni shing ljon pa la sogs pa rnams bar chad med par yul gzhan dag tu skye ba'o //
analyzed: rgyas par byed pa ni shing ljon pa la sogs pa rnams bar chad med par yul gzhan dag tu skye ba'o //
translated: The action of the one who causes to mature is to be described in dependence on the action of the one who causes to flourish.🔽The action of the one who causes to attain is to be described in dependence on the action of the one who causes to mature.🔽The action of the one who causes to emerge is to be described in dependence on the action of the one who causes to attain.🔽The action of the one who causes to manifest is to be described in dependence on the action of the one who causes to emerge.🔽The action of the one who causes to realize is to be described in dependence on the action of the one who causes to manifest.🔽The action of the one who causes to understand is to be described in dependence on the action of the one who causes to realize.🔽The action of the one who causes to penetrate is to be described in dependence on the action of the one who causes to understand.🔽The action of the one who causes to enter is to be described in dependence on the action of the one who causes to penetrate.🔽The action of the one who causes to accomplish is to be described in dependence on the action of the one who causes to enter.🔽The action of the one who causes to attain is to be described in dependence on the action of the one who causes to accomplish.🔽The action of the one who causes to realize is to be described in dependence on the action of the one

original: sra ga sher de nyi g-yo ba rnams //🔽zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: sra ga sher de nyi g-yo ba rnams // zhes bya ba la /
translated: solidity, fluidity, heat, and motion.

original: dngos po'i rkyen bshad pa ni rdzas las dngos po don gzhan ma yin pa nyid du shes bar bya ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: dngos po'i rkyen bshad pa ni rdzas las dngos po don gzhan ma yin pa nyid du shes bar bya ba'i phyir te /
translated: The condition of entities is explained in order to understand that the substance is not different from the entity.

original: de nyid kyi phyir dro ba @55b nyid ni me khams so zhes bshad do //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir dro ba @55b nyid ni me khams so zhes bshad do //
translated: Therefore, heat is the fire element.

original: dngos po rnams kyi mtshan nyid ni rang bzhin kho na yin te mi 'khrul ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos po rnams kyi mtshan nyid ni rang bzhin kho na yin te mi 'khrul ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The characteristic of entities is just their nature, because it is non-erroneous.

original: mkhrang ba dang 'thas ba zhes bya ba'i bar du bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mkhrang ba dang 'thas ba zhes bya ba'i bar du bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: up to solidity and viscosity will be explained.

original: gsher ba ni chu'i khams so zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gsher ba ni chu'i khams so zhes bya ba la /
translated: Fluidity is the water element.

original: brlan pa'i bdag nyid can yin pa'i phyir gsher ba'o //
analyzed: brlan pa'i bdag nyid can yin pa'i phyir gsher ba'o //
translated: Fluidity is the nature of moistening.

original: gzhan dag phrag nyid do zhes zer ro //
analyzed: gzhan dag phrag nyid do zhes zer ro //
translated: Others say it is the nature of cohesion.

original: dro ba ni sreg par byed ba zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: dro ba ni sreg par byed ba zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Heat is that which burns.

original: 'byung ba smos pa ni gzugs can ma yin pa ni yul na mi gnas ba'i phyir ram yul gzhan du skyed pa mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'byung ba smos pa ni gzugs can ma yin pa ni yul na mi gnas ba'i phyir ram yul gzhan du skyed pa mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The mention of the elements is because the formless does not abide in a place, or because it is impossible to produce in another place.

original: rgyun smos pa ni skad cig ma gcig la yul gzhan du skye ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyun smos pa ni skad cig ma gcig la yul gzhan du skye ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The word “continuum” is mentioned because there is no arising in another place in a single moment.

original: sgron me g-yo ba bzhin du zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: sgron me g-yo ba bzhin du zhes bya ba la /
translated: Like a moving lamp.

original: ji ltar sgron me skad cig ma yin pas 'gro ba bzhin du yul gzhan du skyed pa rlung gis g-yo bar brjod pa de bzhin du gzhan 'byung ba'i rgyun la yang yin no //
analyzed: ji ltar sgron me skad cig ma yin pas 'gro ba bzhin du yul gzhan du skyed pa rlung gis g-yo bar brjod pa de bzhin du gzhan 'byung ba'i rgyun la yang yin no //
translated: Just as a lamp is said to be moved by the wind, since it moves from one place to another because it is momentary, so too is the continuum of arising from another.

original: mdo sde dang bstan bcos 'gal ba spang ba'i phyir ro //🔽rab tu byed ba dag ces bya ba rgyas bar 'byung ba la /🔽rab tu byed pa dag las rlung gi khams gang zhan /🔽yang zhing g-yo ba nyid do zhes bstan la /
analyzed: mdo sde dang bstan bcos 'gal ba spang ba'i phyir ro // rab tu byed ba dag ces bya ba rgyas bar 'byung ba la / rab tu byed pa dag las rlung gi khams gang zhan / yang zhing g-yo ba nyid do zhes bstan la /
translated: In order to avoid contradiction with the sutras and the treatises.🔽In the treatises,🔽it is taught that the wind element is lightness and movement.

original: mdo sde las ni rlung gi khams ni yang ba nyid do zhes bstan to //
analyzed: mdo sde las ni rlung gi khams ni yang ba nyid do zhes bstan to //
translated: But in the sutras, it is taught that the wind element is just lightness.

original: yang ba nyid de ni rlung gi khams nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: yang ba nyid de ni rlung gi khams nyid ma yin te /
translated: Lightness is not the wind element itself.

original: 'o na ci zhen rab tu byed pa dag las lci ba nyid dang yang ba nyid do zhes bshad pa rgyur byas pa'i gzugs gzhan yang yin no //
analyzed: 'o na ci zhen rab tu byed pa dag las lci ba nyid dang yang ba nyid do zhes bshad pa rgyur byas pa'i gzugs gzhan yang yin no //
translated: What then? The treatise mentions “heaviness and lightness” as fundamental material elements.

original: de'i phyir rlung ge khams gang zhe na /
analyzed: de'i phyir rlung ge khams gang zhe na /
translated: Therefore, the treatise states, “What is the wind constituent?🔽” If the treatise were to state that lightness is the wind constituent, then the consequence would be that lightness would be a fundamental material element.

original: yang ba nyid do zhes brjod pa ni rgyur byas pa'i gzugs la yang thal bar 'gyur na /🔽g-yo ba nyid do zhes brjod na las su 'gyur bas na /
analyzed: yang ba nyid do zhes brjod pa ni rgyur byas pa'i gzugs la yang thal bar 'gyur na / g-yo ba nyid do zhes brjod na las su 'gyur bas na /
translated: If the treatise were to state that movement is the wind constituent, then the consequence would be that movement would be a form that is derived.

original: g-yo ba'i rang bzhin yin pas rlung la yang ba dang g-yo ba gnyi ga brjod do //
analyzed: g-yo ba'i rang bzhin yin pas rlung la yang ba dang g-yo ba gnyi ga brjod do //
translated: Therefore, the treatise states that the wind constituent is both lightness and movement, because its nature is movement.

original: rang bzhin gyi sgra ni 'dir las la blta bar bya'i rang bzhin la ni ma yin te /
analyzed: rang bzhin gyi sgra ni 'dir las la blta bar bya'i rang bzhin la ni ma yin te /
translated: The term “nature” in this passage should be understood as referring to the action of the wind constituent, not to its essential nature.

original: de'i bya ba ni 'byung ba rnams yul gzhan du skyed pa'o //
analyzed: de'i bya ba ni 'byung ba rnams yul gzhan du skyed pa'o //
translated: The action of the wind constituent is to cause the primary elements to arise in another place.

original: de nyid kyi phyir 'di'i rang bzhin las kyis gsal ba yin no zhes rnam par bshad do //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir 'di'i rang bzhin las kyis gsal ba yin no zhes rnam par bshad do //
translated: This is why the commentary states that the nature of the wind constituent is revealed by its action.

original: 'di skad bshad par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di skad bshad par 'gyur te /
translated: The following explanation is provided.

original: g-yo ba'i las can gyi yang ba ni rlung gi khams yin gyi thams cad du gzhan yang ba ma yin pa ni rlung gi khams kyi rang bzhin ma yin no zhes slob dpon 'dus bzang zer ro //
analyzed: g-yo ba'i las can gyi yang ba ni rlung gi khams yin gyi thams cad du gzhan yang ba ma yin pa ni rlung gi khams kyi rang bzhin ma yin no zhes slob dpon 'dus bzang zer ro //
translated: But it is not the case that everything that is light is by nature the wind element.

original: /'on mdo sde dang rab tu byed par gsungs pa rlung gi khams ci ltar zhe na /🔽rgyu la 'bras bu btags @56a * //
analyzed: /'on mdo sde dang rab tu byed par gsungs pa rlung gi khams ci ltar zhe na / rgyu la 'bras bu btags @56a * //
translated: But what is the wind element that is mentioned in the sutras and the various treatises?

original: pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The cause of lightness is designated as lightness.

original: gal te me'i khams la yang yang ba nyid kyi rgyu yod kyang de ni rlung gi khams ltar thams cad du yang ba ma yin la /
analyzed: gal te me'i khams la yang yang ba nyid kyi rgyu yod kyang de ni rlung gi khams ltar thams cad du yang ba ma yin la /
translated: Even though the fire element is the cause of lightness, it is not the case that everything that is light is by nature the fire element.

original: k'a sha'i me tog la sogs pa'i yang ba nyid la yang gzhan du na me'i khams las byung ba'i dro ba der dmigs so //
analyzed: k'a sha'i me tog la sogs pa'i yang ba nyid la yang gzhan du na me'i khams las byung ba'i dro ba der dmigs so //
translated: And even though the lightness of a kasha flower, for example, is not due to the fire element, heat is observed in that flower.

original: de'i phyir yang ba thams cad kyi rgyu nyid kyi phyir rlung gi khams la 'di gdags par rigs so //
analyzed: de'i phyir yang ba thams cad kyi rgyu nyid kyi phyir rlung gi khams la 'di gdags par rigs so //
translated: Therefore it is logical to designate the cause of all lightness as the wind element.

original: sa la sogs pa rnams la ni de'i 'bras bu lci ba nyid la sogs pa rnams dang bu kha ta ra pra hya ta re nyid kyi phyir de'i rang bzhin gyis zhes pa yang ba'i khyad par rlung gi khams la ki b'arma te /🔽gang la rgyu la 'bras bu btags par rtag par byed /
analyzed: sa la sogs pa rnams la ni de'i 'bras bu lci ba nyid la sogs pa rnams dang bu kha ta ra pra hya ta re nyid kyi phyir de'i rang bzhin gyis zhes pa yang ba'i khyad par rlung gi khams la ki b'arma te / gang la rgyu la 'bras bu btags par rtag par byed /
translated: The cause is designated as the effect, as in “Go get the sesame oil.”

original: g-yo ba zhes pa yang las kyis 'di bstan gyi rang bzhin gyis ni ma yin te /
analyzed: g-yo ba zhes pa yang las kyis 'di bstan gyi rang bzhin gyis ni ma yin te /
translated: “Motility” is taught by the function, not by nature,

original: rang bzhin ni gzhan la ltos pa med pa'i phyir sra ba la sogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: rang bzhin ni gzhan la ltos pa med pa'i phyir sra ba la sogs pa bzhin no //
translated: because nature does not depend on another, like solidity and so on.

original: rab tu byed par yang zhing g-yo ba nyid ces gnyi ga bstan pa don med pa ma yin no ;
analyzed: rab tu byed par yang zhing g-yo ba nyid ces gnyi ga bstan pa don med pa ma yin no ;
translated: In the treatise it is taught that “lightness and motility” are both, and this is not meaningless.

original: / gzhan du yang nges par shes pa ngo bo'i rang bzhin gyis yang ba nyid bstan pa ni rgyu la 'bras bu btags pa zhes sgrub bar nus te gzhan du ma yin no //
analyzed: / gzhan du yang nges par shes pa ngo bo'i rang bzhin gyis yang ba nyid bstan pa ni rgyu la 'bras bu btags pa zhes sgrub bar nus te gzhan du ma yin no //
translated: It is also possible to prove that lightness is taught by nature, by the cognition of the nature of another, but not by another.

original: de ltar na 'dir mdo byed pa la rab tu sdang bas rnam par bshad pa la rnam par rtog pas rgyu gzhan tshol bar byed pa yang dmigs so //
analyzed: de ltar na 'dir mdo byed pa la rab tu sdang bas rnam par bshad pa la rnam par rtog pas rgyu gzhan tshol bar byed pa yang dmigs so //
translated: Thus, in this context, the author of the treatise is very angry at the Sutra master, and he is seen to seek another reason for his analysis of the explanation.

original: sa la sogs pa dag gis 'byung ba rnams ma bstan pa'i phyir sa la sogs pa dag 'byung ba rnams las gzhan yin no zhes don gyis smras bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sa la sogs pa dag gis 'byung ba rnams ma bstan pa'i phyir sa la sogs pa dag 'byung ba rnams las gzhan yin no zhes don gyis smras bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Since earth and so on are not taught to be the elements, it would be implied that earth and so on are other than the elements.

original: de'i phyir 'dri ba ni sa la sogs pa dang zhes rgya cher 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'dri ba ni sa la sogs pa dang zhes rgya cher 'byung ba'o //
translated: Therefore, the question is asked, beginning with the words, “If you say that earth and so on are other than the elements, why did the Lord say that the elements are four in number?”

original: sa ni kha dog dang dbyibs so zhes gal te sa'i sgras tshogs pa bzung la de la dri dang ro dang reg pa yod kyang kha dos dang dbyibs kho na las zhes bya ba'i rgyu brjod par bya'o zhe na /
analyzed: sa ni kha dog dang dbyibs so zhes gal te sa'i sgras tshogs pa bzung la de la dri dang ro dang reg pa yod kyang kha dos dang dbyibs kho na las zhes bya ba'i rgyu brjod par bya'o zhe na /
translated: If you maintain that the word earth refers to the collection of color, shape, smell, taste and tactility, and that earth is only color and shape, then you must state the reason for this.

original: 'jig rten gyi tha snyad du zhes brjod pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi tha snyad du zhes brjod pa ma yin nam /
translated: But is it not said that this is according to mundane convention?

original: 'jig rten las grags pa ni btags par yod pa yin la /
analyzed: 'jig rten las grags pa ni btags par yod pa yin la /
translated: What is renowned in the world exists as a designation.

original: 'jig rten na yang sa ston pa na kha dog dang dbyibs ston par byed do //
analyzed: 'jig rten na yang sa ston pa na kha dog dang dbyibs ston par byed do //
translated: In the world, when one indicates earth, one indicates color and shape.

original: 'jig rten na snam bu ston pa na yang de lta yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: 'jig rten na snam bu ston pa na yang de lta yin nam zhe na /
translated: But is it not the case that in the world, when one indicates cloth, one does not indicate color and shape?

original: yin te ring bo 'am dkar po'o zhes kha dog dang dbyibs kho na ston par byed do //
analyzed: yin te ring bo 'am dkar po'o zhes kha dog dang dbyibs kho na ston par byed do //
translated: One does indicate them, for one says, “The cloth is long,” or “The cloth is white.”🔽But, in the world, one also says, “The cloth smells,” “The cloth is felt,” “The cloth is tasted.”

original: yang snam bu ni skye mched bzhi'i bdag nyid du 'dod des bsnam par bya'o //🔽myang bar bya'o //
analyzed: yang snam bu ni skye mched bzhi'i bdag nyid du 'dod des bsnam par bya'o // myang bar bya'o //
translated: Thus, if one admits that the word cloth is applied to the four elementary substances, one will have to admit that the elementary substances are perceived by the five sense-faculties.

original: reg par bya'o zhes @56b dri la sogs pa rnams kyis kyang 'jig rten na sa la nye bar spyod do //🔽sa dang chu dang me'i khyad par las kha dog dang dbyibs dag dangs la dri la sogs pa yod kyang gzugs kyi skye mched nyid kyis nye bar spyod do //
analyzed: reg par bya'o zhes @56b dri la sogs pa rnams kyis kyang 'jig rten na sa la nye bar spyod do // sa dang chu dang me'i khyad par las kha dog dang dbyibs dag dangs la dri la sogs pa yod kyang gzugs kyi skye mched nyid kyis nye bar spyod do //
translated: But, in the world, one does not smell, etc., the elementary substances, but rather smell, etc., odors, etc., which reside in the elementary substances.

original: chu la dri med kyang bsnam par bya'o zhes dri yis nye bar spyod do //
analyzed: chu la dri med kyang bsnam par bya'o zhes dri yis nye bar spyod do //
translated: One does not smell the elementary substances, but one smells the odor which resides in the elementary substances.🔽One does not taste the elementary substances, but one tastes the taste which resides in the elementary substances.

original: me la dri dang ro dag med kyang khams gnyis dang sa la gzugs kyi skye mched khyad par med pa'i phyir zhes slob dpon 'dus bzang zer ro //
analyzed: me la dri dang ro dag med kyang khams gnyis dang sa la gzugs kyi skye mched khyad par med pa'i phyir zhes slob dpon 'dus bzang zer ro //
translated: Master Saṃghabhadra says that although smell and taste do not exist in fire, the two elements and the form base are not distinguished in earth.

original: de lta na 'o na thams cad du khyad par med par reg pa yis kyang nye bar spyod par thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta na 'o na thams cad du khyad par med par reg pa yis kyang nye bar spyod par thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If that is so, then it would follow that all objects would be experienced by contact, since there is no distinction.

original: 'jig rten na ni kha dog dang dbyibs la sa ste bsnam par bya'o myang bar bya'o reg par ba'o zhes ston par byed kyi dri la sogs pa rnams ni ma yin te gzugs kyi skye mched bzhin no //
analyzed: 'jig rten na ni kha dog dang dbyibs la sa ste bsnam par bya'o myang bar bya'o reg par ba'o zhes ston par byed kyi dri la sogs pa rnams ni ma yin te gzugs kyi skye mched bzhin no //
translated: In the world, color and shape are taught to be earth, and smell, taste, and tactility are taught to be earth, but smell and so on are not taught to be earth, as is the form base.

original: 'jig rten gyi tha snyad kyis sa nyid du khas blangs nas de ltar bshad de /
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi tha snyad kyis sa nyid du khas blangs nas de ltar bshad de /
translated: Earth is accepted as earth by worldly convention and explained as such.

original: 'jig rten gyi tha snyad la ltos nas zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi tha snyad la ltos nas zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is said that it is in dependence on worldly convention.

original: de bzhin du rnam par dpyad mi lang pa nyid kyis 'jig rten gyi gdags pa la nges pa yod pa ma yin zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du rnam par dpyad mi lang pa nyid kyis 'jig rten gyi gdags pa la nges pa yod pa ma yin zhes bya'o //
translated: In the same way, it is said that worldly imputation is not definite because it cannot withstand analysis.

original: chos mngon pa dag gis 'dir sa dang snam bu dag gis bstan pas de'i phyir dri la sogs pa rnams kyis kyang sa nye bar spyod pa skyon med do //
analyzed: chos mngon pa dag gis 'dir sa dang snam bu dag gis bstan pas de'i phyir dri la sogs pa rnams kyis kyang sa nye bar spyod pa skyon med do //
translated: The Ābhidharmikas say that since earth and cloth are indicated here, there is no fault in using smell, etc. to indicate earth.

original: gang kha dog dang dbyibs dag gis ston par byed pa de dag la slar 'di skad bshad do //
analyzed: gang kha dog dang dbyibs dag gis ston par byed pa de dag la slar 'di skad bshad do //
translated: Those who indicate by color and shape are responded to as follows.

original: 'jig rten pa thams cad la btags pa gcig tu mtshungs pa ni med do //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa thams cad la btags pa gcig tu mtshungs pa ni med do //
translated: There is no single universal that is imputed to all worldly things.🔽Since cloth is apprehended as having the nature of four bases, it is indicated as a composite in whatever way is appropriate.

original: snam bu ni skye mched bzhi'i bdag nyid du yongs su bzung bas thams cad tshogs pa la ji ltar rigs par bstan pa byas bar 'gyur ro zhes slob dpon 'dus bzang zer ro //
analyzed: snam bu ni skye mched bzhi'i bdag nyid du yongs su bzung bas thams cad tshogs pa la ji ltar rigs par bstan pa byas bar 'gyur ro zhes slob dpon 'dus bzang zer ro //
translated: This is what Master Saṃghabhadra says.

original: gang gi tshe kha dog dang dbyibs las zhes pa de bzhin du chu me yang ngo //
analyzed: gang gi tshe kha dog dang dbyibs las zhes pa de bzhin du chu me yang ngo //
translated: When it is said “from color and shape,” water and fire are also like that.

original: chu rnams la re zhig sngon po dang ring po dag gis chu ston par byed de rdzas nyid kyis kyang nye bar 'dogs pa 'di lta bu yod par smra'o //
analyzed: chu rnams la re zhig sngon po dang ring po dag gis chu ston par byed de rdzas nyid kyis kyang nye bar 'dogs pa 'di lta bu yod par smra'o //
translated: With regard to water, for example, blue and long indicate water. They also impute it by substance. This is what the Vaibhāṣikas say exists.

original: chu rnams dra bant'i ti na ti kha dog dang dbyibs phra ba nyid phan tshun gsher ba nyid yod pa de'i phyir kha dog dang dbyibs phra mo rnams tshogs pa'o //
analyzed: chu rnams dra bant'i ti na ti kha dog dang dbyibs phra ba nyid phan tshun gsher ba nyid yod pa de'i phyir kha dog dang dbyibs phra mo rnams tshogs pa'o //
translated: The water element is the cause of cohesion of the subtle form of color and shape, which are mutually wet.

original: rlung gis bskul ba'i dbang gis yul gzhan du skyed pa yang mthong bar 'gyur ro zhes brjod do //
analyzed: rlung gis bskul ba'i dbang gis yul gzhan du skyed pa yang mthong bar 'gyur ro zhes brjod do //
translated: It is also the cause of the production of the subtle form of color and shape in another place, because it is seen that water is moved by wind.

original: 'gro bar byed pas na chu'o //
analyzed: 'gro bar byed pas na chu'o //
translated: It is called water because it flows.🔽The fire element is the cause of the maturation of the subtle form of color and shape, which are mutually hot.🔽The wind element is the cause of the production of the subtle form of color and shape in another place, because it is seen that the subtle form of color and shape is produced in another place by the power of being moved by wind.🔽The wind element is the cause of the movement of the subtle form of color and shape, which are mutually light.

original: me la yang me stag dmar po 'bar ba dang ring po zhes 'jig rten gyis gdags bar byed do //🔽rlung tshogs @57a * //
analyzed: me la yang me stag dmar po 'bar ba dang ring po zhes 'jig rten gyis gdags bar byed do // rlung tshogs @57a * //
translated: The world designates the fire element as a flame, a spark, and a glow.

original: khams nyid yin zhes pa g-yo ba'i las can yang ba'o //
analyzed: khams nyid yin zhes pa g-yo ba'i las can yang ba'o //
translated: The wind element is the cause of the movement of the subtle form of color and shape, which are mutually light.🔽The world designates the wind element as a wind, a whirlwind, and a storm.

original: rdzas gcig pu nyid la 'jig rten na rlung zhes pas de'i phyir rlung dang rlung gi khams la khyad par med do //
analyzed: rdzas gcig pu nyid la 'jig rten na rlung zhes pas de'i phyir rlung dang rlung gi khams la khyad par med do //
translated: Therefore, there is no difference between the wind element and the wind.🔽The wind element is the cause of the production of the subtle form of color and shape in another place, because it is seen that the subtle form of color and shape is produced in another place by the power of being moved by wind.

original: rlung rnams kyi tshogs ni rlung yod pa ste 'jig rten na rlung sngon po rlung zlum po zhes smra bar byed de /
analyzed: rlung rnams kyi tshogs ni rlung yod pa ste 'jig rten na rlung sngon po rlung zlum po zhes smra bar byed de /
translated: The world designates the wind element as a wind, a whirlwind, and a storm.

original: de 'ga' zhig tu nye bar dmigs pas smra bar byed pa ni de dang 'dra ba'ang yin zhes ba ste /
analyzed: de 'ga' zhig tu nye bar dmigs pas smra bar byed pa ni de dang 'dra ba'ang yin zhes ba ste /
translated: Some say that it is called wind because it is sometimes perceived as near.

original: de la 'dis 'di 'thor sa 'thor bar nus te de'i phyir rlung gi khams nyid rlung ngo zhes snga rabs pa rnams zer ro //
analyzed: de la 'dis 'di 'thor sa 'thor bar nus te de'i phyir rlung gi khams nyid rlung ngo zhes snga rabs pa rnams zer ro //
translated: The former teachers say that it is called wind because it is able to scatter and disperse that which is to be scattered and dispersed.

original: sgra'i nges gzung gi phyir khams nyid yin zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sgra'i nges gzung gi phyir khams nyid yin zhes bya'o //
translated: It is called wind element because it is specified by the term element.

original: sa la sogs pa ni kha dog dang dbyibs kyi bdag nyid kho na de ltar rigs te /
analyzed: sa la sogs pa ni kha dog dang dbyibs kyi bdag nyid kho na de ltar rigs te /
translated: Earth and so on are just the nature of color and shape because it is logical that the bases of the elements are the four great elements.

original: zad par gyi skye mched rnams la mi sdug pa'i khyad par nyid las dang mi sdug pa las kyang gzugs med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zad par gyi skye mched rnams la mi sdug pa'i khyad par nyid las dang mi sdug pa las kyang gzugs med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The formless states are not form because they are superior to the repulsive states of form and because they are superior to the repulsive states of form.
