analyzed: de lta ma yin na zhes bya ba la gal te sems pa kho na 'dus byas kyi phung po yin gyi /
translated: If it were not so, if the aggregate of volition were only volition,

original: reg pa dang yid la byed pa la sogs pa rnams dang thob pa la sogs pa ma yin ba de lta na /
analyzed: reg pa dang yid la byed pa la sogs pa rnams dang thob pa la sogs pa ma yin ba de lta na /
translated: and not contact, mental attention, etc., and not possession, etc.,

original: de rnams gzugs dang tshor ba dang 'du byed dang rnam par shes pa'i phung po dag tu ma bsdus pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de rnams gzugs dang tshor ba dang 'du byed dang rnam par shes pa'i phung po dag tu ma bsdus pa'i phyir /
translated: then these would not be included in the aggregates of form, sensation, or consciousness.

original: sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung ba'i bden pa nyid du mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung ba'i bden pa nyid du mi 'gyur te /
translated: They would not be the truth of suffering or the truth of origination,

original: 'dus ma byas bzhin no //
analyzed: 'dus ma byas bzhin no //
translated: like the unconditioned.

original: gal te de las cir 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: gal te de las cir 'gyur zhe na /
translated: What would be the consequence of that?

original: yongs su shes pa dang spangs par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: yongs su shes pa dang spangs par mi 'gyur te /
translated: They would not be fully understood or abandoned.

original: sdug bsngal yongs su shes ba dang kun 'byung spong bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sdug bsngal yongs su shes ba dang kun 'byung spong bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: The truth of suffering would not be fully understood and the truth of origination would not be abandoned.

original: yongs su shes pa dang spangs pa med na nyes pa ci yod ce na /
analyzed: yongs su shes pa dang spangs pa med na nyes pa ci yod ce na /
translated: What is the consequence of not fully understanding and abandoning them?

original: de'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis ni zhes rgya cher gsungs so //
analyzed: de'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis ni zhes rgya cher gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, the Bhagavat has said, “One who does not know and see these two truths, the truth of suffering and the truth of the path, does not know and see the four noble truths, and does not leave the world.

original: mngon par ma shes zhes bya ba ni mthong ba'i lam gyis so //
analyzed: mngon par ma shes zhes bya ba ni mthong ba'i lam gyis so //
translated: “Not knowing” means not seeing by the path of seeing.

original: yongs su ma shes par zhes bya ba ni bsgom pa'i lam gyis so //
analyzed: yongs su ma shes par zhes bya ba ni bsgom pa'i lam gyis so //
translated: “Not fully understanding” means not fully understanding by the path of cultivation.

original: yang na mngon par ma shes shing zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten pa'i shes pas so //
analyzed: yang na mngon par ma shes shing zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten pa'i shes pas so //
translated: Alternatively, “not knowing” means not knowing by mundane knowledge.

original: yongs su ma shes par zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i shes pas yin te /
analyzed: yongs su ma shes par zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i shes pas yin te /
translated: “Not fully understanding” means not fully understanding by supramundane knowledge.

original: zag pa med pa'i shes pa ni yongs su shes pa'o zhes bshad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zag pa med pa'i shes pa ni yongs su shes pa'o zhes bshad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is explained that “uncontaminated knowledge is full understanding.”

original: yang na go rims ji lta ba bzhin chos dang rjes su shes pa dag gam bzod pa dang shes pa dag gis yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: yang na go rims ji lta ba bzhin chos dang rjes su shes pa dag gam bzod pa dang shes pa dag gis yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: Alternatively, it should be understood that they are by the knowledge of dharmas and subsequent knowledge, or by the acceptance of knowledge and knowledge, respectively.

original: de bzhin du ma spangs pa zhes gsungs te zhes bya ba ni chos gcig kyang mngon par ma shes shing ma spangs par sdug bsngal mthar byed par nga mi smra'o zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du ma spangs pa zhes gsungs te zhes bya ba ni chos gcig kyang mngon par ma shes shing ma spangs par sdug bsngal mthar byed par nga mi smra'o zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Similarly, it is said, “One who has not abandoned even one of these does not end suffering,” meaning one who has not known and abandoned even one dharma does not end suffering.

original: de la sdug bsngal shes pas yongs su ma shes shing /
analyzed: de la sdug bsngal shes pas yongs su ma shes shing /
translated: Regarding that, suffering is not fully understood through knowledge of suffering.🔽

original: kun 'byung shes pas ma spangs par te bshad pa ni thal ma thag tu bstan pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: kun 'byung shes pas ma spangs par te bshad pa ni thal ma thag tu bstan pa nyid yin no //
translated: The phrase “not fully understanding suffering and not abandoning origination” is explained immediately above.

original: de'i phyir gdon mi tha bar reg pa dang yid la byed pa @63b la sogs pa de rnams 'du byed kyi phung pos bsdus par khas blangs par bya ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir gdon mi tha bar reg pa dang yid la byed pa @63b la sogs pa de rnams 'du byed kyi phung pos bsdus par khas blangs par bya ste /
translated: Therefore, you must accept that contact, attention, etc., are included in the aggregate of formation.

original: de lta ma yin na sangs rgyas 'byung ba dang chos bstan pa don med par thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na sangs rgyas 'byung ba dang chos bstan pa don med par thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Otherwise, the appearance of a Buddha and the teaching of the Dharma would be pointless.

original: 'di ltar mngon par ma shes shing yongs su ma shes pa nyid kyis 'di nam mkha' dang so sor brtags pa'i 'gog pa bzhin du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar mngon par ma shes shing yongs su ma shes pa nyid kyis 'di nam mkha' dang so sor brtags pa'i 'gog pa bzhin du 'gyur ro //
translated: In this way, they would be like space and analytical cessation, because they would not be fully understood and would not be understood at all.

original: nam mkha' dang so sor brtags pa'i 'gog pa yang sdug bsngal mthar byed do snyam pa 'di ni nga rgyal gyi dngos po yin pa'i phyir dang / nga rgyal ni sdug bsngal zad pa'i gegs su gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nam mkha' dang so sor brtags pa'i 'gog pa yang sdug bsngal mthar byed do snyam pa 'di ni nga rgyal gyi dngos po yin pa'i phyir dang / nga rgyal ni sdug bsngal zad pa'i gegs su gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The thought “Space and analytical cessation end suffering” is a basis for pride, and pride is an obstacle to the exhaustion of suffering.

original: de ltar na sems pa kho na 'du byed kyi phung po dang yid la byed pa la sogs pa rnams ni de'i khyad par ro zhes slob dpon dpal len zer ro //
analyzed: de ltar na sems pa kho na 'du byed kyi phung po dang yid la byed pa la sogs pa rnams ni de'i khyad par ro zhes slob dpon dpal len zer ro //
translated: Thus, the master Haribhadra says, “The aggregate of formation is volition alone, and mental attention, etc., are its specific attributes.”

original: 'di ni ma yin te yid la byed pa la sogs pa rnams dang sems pa rang bzhin tha dad pa'i phyir rang bzhin gzhan ma yin par nges par gzung bar bya ste sems pa dang sems las byung ba ma spangs pa gzhan 'ga' zhig thob par byed do
analyzed: 'di ni ma yin te yid la byed pa la sogs pa rnams dang sems pa rang bzhin tha dad pa'i phyir rang bzhin gzhan ma yin par nges par gzung bar bya ste sems pa dang sems las byung ba ma spangs pa gzhan 'ga' zhig thob par byed do
translated: This is not so, because mental attention, etc., are different in substance from volition.

original: // des na 'du byed kyi phung po yang rdzas du ma ste sems pa smos pas kyang 'di khong du chud do //
analyzed: // des na 'du byed kyi phung po yang rdzas du ma ste sems pa smos pas kyang 'di khong du chud do //
translated: Therefore, the aggregate of formation is not a single substance, but many.

original: de ltar na sems pa dang tha dad pa'i sems pa zhes bya ba gnyi ga yang med bar thal ba ma yin te /
analyzed: de ltar na sems pa dang tha dad pa'i sems pa zhes bya ba gnyi ga yang med bar thal ba ma yin te /
translated: Thus, it is not the case that both volition and that which is called “different from volition” are nonexistent,

original: 'dun pa dang dad pa dang rmongs pa dang khro ba dang 'dod chags la sogs pa rnams ni phan tshun ngo bo tha dad pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dun pa dang dad pa dang rmongs pa dang khro ba dang 'dod chags la sogs pa rnams ni phan tshun ngo bo tha dad pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because aspiration, faith, delusion, anger, attachment, etc., are different from each other in substance.

original: tha mi dad pa'i tshul gyis 'jug pa sems pa'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: tha mi dad pa'i tshul gyis 'jug pa sems pa'i rang bzhin no //
translated: The nature of volition is to engage in the object in a manner that is not distinct from it.

original: de zhes bya ba ni rnam par shes pa'i phung po rnam par gcad par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de zhes bya ba ni rnam par shes pa'i phung po rnam par gcad par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The phrase “in this way” is for the purpose of distinguishing the aggregate of consciousness.

original: gsum zhes bya ba ni gzugs kyi phung po bsal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gsum zhes bya ba ni gzugs kyi phung po bsal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The phrase “threefold” is for the purpose of excluding the form aggregate.

original: skye mched bcu gcig dang khams bcu bdun gyis bsdus pa'i chos rnams thams cad chos kyi skye mched dang chos kyi khams kyis bsdus pas /🔽de'i phyir rnam rig byed min dang // 'dus ma byas dang bcas pa ni //
analyzed: skye mched bcu gcig dang khams bcu bdun gyis bsdus pa'i chos rnams thams cad chos kyi skye mched dang chos kyi khams kyis bsdus pas / de'i phyir rnam rig byed min dang // 'dus ma byas dang bcas pa ni //
translated: All entities that are included in the eleven sense fields and the seventeen elements are included in the entity sense field and the entity element.

original: zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, the root text declares, “The noninformative form, together with the unconditioned ,🔽are the entity sense field and the entity element.”

original: rnam par shes pa ni /🔽rnam shes so sor rnam rig pa //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa ni / rnam shes so sor rnam rig pa //
translated: Consciousness is🔽the awareness of each object.

original: zhes bya ste so sor rnam par rig pa'i sgras shes rab la sogs pa rnams las khyad par du byed do //
analyzed: zhes bya ste so sor rnam par rig pa'i sgras shes rab la sogs pa rnams las khyad par du byed do //
translated: The term “awareness of each object” distinguishes consciousness from such qualities as wisdom.

original: gzugs brnyan dang sgra brnyan ltar yul so sor snang ba'i phyir dngos po tsam la lta ba nyid ni rnam par shes pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs brnyan dang sgra brnyan ltar yul so sor snang ba'i phyir dngos po tsam la lta ba nyid ni rnam par shes pa'o //
translated: Consciousness is the mere perception of an entity, because it is the appearance of each object, like a reflection or an echo.

original: shes rab ni slar yang rang gi mtshan nyid yongs su gcod pa'o //
analyzed: shes rab ni slar yang rang gi mtshan nyid yongs su gcod pa'o //
translated: Wisdom is the determination of the intrinsic nature of an object.

original: 'du shes ni yul gyi khyad par la dmigs pa ste de ltar 'di ni @64a * //
analyzed: 'du shes ni yul gyi khyad par la dmigs pa ste de ltar 'di ni @64a * //
translated: Discrimination is the apprehension of the particular of an object.

original: khyad par yin no //
analyzed: khyad par yin no //
translated: This is the difference.

original: gzhan dag na re rnam par shes pa'i khams kyi rab tu dbye ba bstan pa'i don du so sor zhes pa ste brnan ba'i don to zhes zer ro //
analyzed: gzhan dag na re rnam par shes pa'i khams kyi rab tu dbye ba bstan pa'i don du so sor zhes pa ste brnan ba'i don to zhes zer ro //
translated: Others say that the word “each” has the sense of “individually” in order to indicate the classification of the elements of consciousness.

original: de nyid kyi phyir yul dang yul so sor rnam par rig byed ces gsungs te /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir yul dang yul so sor rnam par rig byed ces gsungs te /
translated: Therefore, it is said that the object and the consciousness of each object are individually cognized.

original: de yang gang zhig ce na dmigs pa zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: de yang gang zhig ce na dmigs pa zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: What is that? The object is said to be the appearance of the mere thing.

original: de yang dngos po tsam gyi snang brnyan nyid yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de yang dngos po tsam gyi snang brnyan nyid yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood that the appearance of the mere thing is the object of the five kinds of consciousness.

original: de la mig gi rnam par shes pa rnam par gzhag ba la gzugs nyid nye bar dmigs kyi sgra la sogs pa rnams ma yin no //
analyzed: de la mig gi rnam par shes pa rnam par gzhag ba la gzugs nyid nye bar dmigs kyi sgra la sogs pa rnams ma yin no //
translated: In this regard, form alone is apprehended as the object of visual consciousness, not sound, etc.

original: sngon po yang nye bar dmigs kyi sngon po'o snyam du ni ma yin no //
analyzed: sngon po yang nye bar dmigs kyi sngon po'o snyam du ni ma yin no //
translated: Blue is apprehended, but not the thought “This is blue.”

original: de bzhin du bud med dang skyes pa la sogs pa rnams yid du 'ong ba dang yid du mi 'ong ba'i ngo bos mi dmigs te gzugs tsam dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du bud med dang skyes pa la sogs pa rnams yid du 'ong ba dang yid du mi 'ong ba'i ngo bos mi dmigs te gzugs tsam dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Likewise, one does not apprehend a woman or a man as having the nature of being attractive or unattractive, because one only apprehends form.

original: de bzhin du rnam ba'i rnam par shes pa la sogs pa rnams la yang ji srid pa bzhin du brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du rnam ba'i rnam par shes pa la sogs pa rnams la yang ji srid pa bzhin du brjod par bya'o //
translated: The same should be said of consciousnesses of the eye and so on, as appropriate.

original: gang zhig mdo las /
analyzed: gang zhig mdo las /
translated: In a sutra it is said:

original: rnam par shes par byed pas na //
analyzed: rnam par shes par byed pas na //
translated: Because it causes consciousness.

original: zhes byed pa po bstan pa ni rang gi ngo bo tsam ste /
analyzed: zhes byed pa po bstan pa ni rang gi ngo bo tsam ste /
translated: This statement that the agent is consciousness is stated in terms of its mere nature.

original: de las tha dad pa'i rnam par shes pa por rtog pa dgag par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de las tha dad pa'i rnam par shes pa por rtog pa dgag par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because it is to be refuted that consciousness is the agent that causes consciousness to arise.

original: dper na grib ma 'gro'o zhes bya ba lta bu ste /
analyzed: dper na grib ma 'gro'o zhes bya ba lta bu ste /
translated: For example, it is like saying “the shadow goes.”

original: de ni bar mtshams med par yul gzhan dag tu skye ba na cung zad kyang mi byed pa'i byed pa por brtan pa 'thob pa de bzhin du rnam par shes pa yang yul gzhan dag tu rgyun chags su skye ba na cung zad kyang mi byed kyang yul
analyzed: de ni bar mtshams med par yul gzhan dag tu skye ba na cung zad kyang mi byed pa'i byed pa por brtan pa 'thob pa de bzhin du rnam par shes pa yang yul gzhan dag tu rgyun chags su skye ba na cung zad kyang mi byed kyang yul
translated: Just as it is established that the shadow is the agent that does not perform any action when it arises in another place without interruption, so too consciousness is the agent that does not perform any action when it arises in a continuum in another place.

original: de dang de shes par byed do zhes byed pa po'i brtan pa 'thob po //
analyzed: de dang de shes par byed do zhes byed pa po'i brtan pa 'thob po //
translated: One obtains the stability of the agent, saying, “I know this and that.”

original: gang las she na /
analyzed: gang las she na /
translated: From what?

original: gra skyes rnam par shes par byed do zhes ni nga mi smra'o zhes gzhan las byed pa po bkag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gra skyes rnam par shes par byed do zhes ni nga mi smra'o zhes gzhan las byed pa po bkag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the agent is denied in another passage: “I do not say that consciousness is produced by the eye.”

original: skad cig ma'i ngo bor bstan pa las tha dad pa'i rnam par shes par rtog pa dgag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skad cig ma'i ngo bor bstan pa las tha dad pa'i rnam par shes par rtog pa dgag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: In order to refute the idea that consciousness is different from what is taught to be momentary.

original: gzhan dag na re dper na grib ma 'gro'o zhes pa de yang yul gzhan du rgyud la byed pa po bstan to zhes zer ro //
analyzed: gzhan dag na re dper na grib ma 'gro'o zhes pa de yang yul gzhan du rgyud la byed pa po bstan to zhes zer ro //
translated: Others say that the statement “The shadow goes” shows that the agent is the continuum in a different place.

original: 'dis kyang dus mngon par 'phangs pa'i phyir rnam par shes pa'i tshogs drug ni rnam par shes pa'i phung po'o zhes brjod do //
analyzed: 'dis kyang dus mngon par 'phangs pa'i phyir rnam par shes pa'i tshogs drug ni rnam par shes pa'i phung po'o zhes brjod do //
translated: Since this also implies time, the six collections of consciousness are the aggregate of consciousness.

original: yid kyi skye mched kyang de yin /
analyzed: yid kyi skye mched kyang de yin /
translated: The mind base is also that.

original: khams bdun dag tu'ang 'dod pa ste //
analyzed: khams bdun dag tu'ang 'dod pa ste //
translated: It is also asserted to be seven elements.

original: zhes bya ba la gnyi ga la 'ang gi sgra ni rnam par shes pa'i rdzas re re zhing yid kyi skye mched yin gyi 'di btags pa tshogs pa pa ni ma yin pa'o zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la gnyi ga la 'ang gi sgra ni rnam par shes pa'i rdzas re re zhing yid kyi skye mched yin gyi 'di btags pa tshogs pa pa ni ma yin pa'o zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The term “both” in the verse is stated to indicate that each substance of consciousness is the mental base, but that the mental base is not a collection of these imputed entities.

original: @64b 'dir zhes bya ba ni 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas zhes 'chad par ro //
analyzed: @64b 'dir zhes bya ba ni 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas zhes 'chad par ro //
translated: Here means in the explanation of the conditioned and the unconditioned.

original: gzhan dag na re zag bcas dang zag pa med par ro zhes zer ro //
analyzed: gzhan dag na re zag bcas dang zag pa med par ro zhes zer ro //
translated: Others say: It is in terms of contaminated and uncontaminated states.

original: rnam par shes pa'i phung po ni rnam par shes pa drug gi bdag nyid yin la de dag kyang khams rnam par gzhag pa ni mig gi rnam par shes pa'i khams nas yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i khams kyi bar ro zhes bstan pa nyid de /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i phung po ni rnam par shes pa drug gi bdag nyid yin la de dag kyang khams rnam par gzhag pa ni mig gi rnam par shes pa'i khams nas yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i khams kyi bar ro zhes bstan pa nyid de /
translated: The aggregate of consciousness is the nature of the six consciousnesses and they are presented as the elements in the Abhidharma, from the eye-consciousness element to the mind-consciousness element.

original: de'i phyir yid kyi khams rnam par shes pa'i phung pos ma bsdus pa ni yod pa ma yin no zhes de ltar thugs la bzhag nas yang de dag las gzhan pa yid kyi khams de dag gang yin zhes 'dri ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir yid kyi khams rnam par shes pa'i phung pos ma bsdus pa ni yod pa ma yin no zhes de ltar thugs la bzhag nas yang de dag las gzhan pa yid kyi khams de dag gang yin zhes 'dri ste /
translated: Having understood this, one should ask, “What is that other mental element?”

original: drug po 'das ma thag pa yi //
analyzed: drug po 'das ma thag pa yi //
translated: The immediately preceding of the six

original: zhes rgya cher 'byung ba la de ma thag pa smos pa ni bar dang bcas pa rnam par gcad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes rgya cher 'byung ba la de ma thag pa smos pa ni bar dang bcas pa rnam par gcad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The phrase “immediately preceding” is stated in order to exclude that which is separated by other states.

original: 'das pa smos pa ni ma 'ongs pa rnam par gcad par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'das pa smos pa ni ma 'ongs pa rnam par gcad par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The phrase “past” is stated in order to exclude the future.

original: rnam par shes pa smos ba ni 'das ma thag pa'i tshor ba la sogs pa rnam bar gcad par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa smos ba ni 'das ma thag pa'i tshor ba la sogs pa rnam bar gcad par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The phrase “consciousness” is stated in order to exclude the immediately past feeling and so on.

original: ni'i sgra ni rnam par shes pa drug las de ma thag tu 'das pa kho na yin gyi yin gyi de las tha dad pa ni yod pa ma yin no zhes nges par gzung ba'i don to //
analyzed: ni'i sgra ni rnam par shes pa drug las de ma thag tu 'das pa kho na yin gyi yin gyi de las tha dad pa ni yod pa ma yin no zhes nges par gzung ba'i don to //
translated: The word “only” is stated in order to ascertain that the mental element is only the immediately past of the six consciousnesses and that it is not something separate from that.

original: 'dir 'das ma thag pa ni rigs mthun pa'i skad cig mas chod pa 'das pa yin gyi rigs mi mthun pa'i skad cig ma'i de ma thag pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: 'dir 'das ma thag pa ni rigs mthun pa'i skad cig mas chod pa 'das pa yin gyi rigs mi mthun pa'i skad cig ma'i de ma thag pa ni ma yin te /
translated: Here, the immediately past is past only when it is separated by a moment of the same type, but not when it is separated by a moment of a different type.

original: de ltar na 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa las ldang ba'i sems la yang yod pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar na 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa las ldang ba'i sems la yang yod pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: In that case, the mind that arises from the meditative attainment of cessation would also exist.

original: dper na bu de nyid dus dang gnas skabs kyis chod pa na gzhan gyi bar 'gyur ba dang / 'bras bu de nyid dus dang gnas skabs kyis chod pa na gzhan gyi sa bon yin pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na bu de nyid dus dang gnas skabs kyis chod pa na gzhan gyi bar 'gyur ba dang / 'bras bu de nyid dus dang gnas skabs kyis chod pa na gzhan gyi sa bon yin pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, the very same son is another’s son when separated by time and circumstance, and the very same effect is another’s seed when separated by time and circumstance.

original: de bzhin du mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa gzhan la brten pa de nyid dus dang gnas skabs kyis chod pa na gzhan gyi rten du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa gzhan la brten pa de nyid dus dang gnas skabs kyis chod pa na gzhan gyi rten du 'gyur ro //
translated: In the same way, the very same consciousness that is supported by another eye consciousness, etc., is another’s support when separated by time and circumstance.

original: de ltar na de nyid brten pa yin pa'i phyir rnam par shes pa yin la rten yin pa'i phyir yid yin no zhes bya bar 'grub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar na de nyid brten pa yin pa'i phyir rnam par shes pa yin la rten yin pa'i phyir yid yin no zhes bya bar 'grub par 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, because it is the supported, it is consciousness, and because it is the support, it is mind.

original: slob dpon 'phags pa'i 'bangs na re mig gi rnam par shes pa ni yid kyi rnam par shes pa la yid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: slob dpon 'phags pa'i 'bangs na re mig gi rnam par shes pa ni yid kyi rnam par shes pa la yid du 'gyur ro //
translated: Master Āryabhadra says that the eye consciousness is the mental faculty in relation to the eye consciousness.

original: mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa rnams de ma thag tu de mi skye ba ma yin pas lus kyi rnam par shes pa'i bar nyid yid du 'gyur la /🔽de las gzhan pa'i rnam par shes @65a * //
analyzed: mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa rnams de ma thag tu de mi skye ba ma yin pas lus kyi rnam par shes pa'i bar nyid yid du 'gyur la / de las gzhan pa'i rnam par shes @65a * //
translated: Since eye consciousness and so on are not necessarily immediately followed by eye consciousness and so on, body consciousness is the mental faculty.

original: pa ni yid kyi rnam par shes pa ste drug po rnams kyang yid du 'gyur ro zhes zer ro //
analyzed: pa ni yid kyi rnam par shes pa ste drug po rnams kyang yid du 'gyur ro zhes zer ro //
translated: Mental consciousness is the mental faculty that is different from those six.

original: 'di yang nges pa'i rgyu med pa'i phyir sems ji lta bar thams cad kyi phyi ma mi srid do //
analyzed: 'di yang nges pa'i rgyu med pa'i phyir sems ji lta bar thams cad kyi phyi ma mi srid do //
translated: Since there is no definitive reason for this, it is not possible that all minds are followed by all minds.

original: de'i phyir ma la yang so sor bsten par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir ma la yang so sor bsten par bya'o //
translated: Therefore it should be applied to each mind.

original: gcig gi nang du gcig 'dus pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la grangs bsgrub pa ni don gyi dbang gis 'gyur gyi rim pa'i dbang gis ma yin no //
analyzed: gcig gi nang du gcig 'dus pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la grangs bsgrub pa ni don gyi dbang gis 'gyur gyi rim pa'i dbang gis ma yin no //
translated: Because one is included in the other means that the number is established by the power of the object, not by the power of sequence.

original: de la gal te yid kyi khams drug gi nang du 'dus so zhes bya ba yin na ni de lta ni yid kyi khams ma gtogs pa gzhan khams bcu bdun rdzas su yod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de la gal te yid kyi khams drug gi nang du 'dus so zhes bya ba yin na ni de lta ni yid kyi khams ma gtogs pa gzhan khams bcu bdun rdzas su yod par 'gyur ro //
translated: If the mental faculty is included among the six sense faculties, then the seventeen elements would exist substantially, excluding the mental faculty.

original: ci ste rnam par shes pa'i khams drug yid kyi nang du 'du na ni de lta na gzugs can bcu dang yid kyi khams dang chos kyi khams zhes bya ba bcu gnyis su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ci ste rnam par shes pa'i khams drug yid kyi nang du 'du na ni de lta na gzugs can bcu dang yid kyi khams dang chos kyi khams zhes bya ba bcu gnyis su 'gyur ro //
translated: If the six consciousness elements are included in the mental faculty, then there would be twelve elements: the ten physical elements, the mental faculty, and the phenomena element.

original: de lta'ang yin mod kyi zhes bya ba la dngos su na de ltar bcu bdun nam bcu gnyis yin mod kyi 'on kyang rten dang brten pa'i dbye bas phye na /🔽drug pa'i rten ni rab bsgrub phyir //
analyzed: de lta'ang yin mod kyi zhes bya ba la dngos su na de ltar bcu bdun nam bcu gnyis yin mod kyi 'on kyang rten dang brten pa'i dbye bas phye na / drug pa'i rten ni rab bsgrub phyir //
translated: Although that is so, in reality there are seventeen or twelve elements, but if they are classified by the distinction between the basis and the dependent,🔽the eighteen elements are asserted

original: khams ni bco brgyad dag tu 'dod //
analyzed: khams ni bco brgyad dag tu 'dod //
translated: because the six sense faculties are established as the basis.

original: ces bya ste gang gi phyir ji ltar rnam par shes pa rnams dmigs pa med pa na skye bar mi 'gyur ba de bzhin du rten med na yang yin la /
analyzed: ces bya ste gang gi phyir ji ltar rnam par shes pa rnams dmigs pa med pa na skye bar mi 'gyur ba de bzhin du rten med na yang yin la /
translated: Just as consciousness does not arise without an object, it also does not arise without a basis.

original: drug pa yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i khams la ni ji ltar mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa rnams la mig la sogs pa lta bur rten gzhan yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: drug pa yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i khams la ni ji ltar mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa rnams la mig la sogs pa lta bur rten gzhan yod pa ma yin no //
translated: The mental faculty is not like the eye, etc., in that it has another basis.

original: de'i phyir yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i khams kyi rten rab tu bsgrub par bya ba'i phyir yid kyi khams bstan to //
analyzed: de'i phyir yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i khams kyi rten rab tu bsgrub par bya ba'i phyir yid kyi khams bstan to //
translated: Therefore, the mental faculty is taught in order to establish the basis of the mental consciousness.

original: yang ji ltar 'gags zin pa da ltar ba'i rten du brjod ce na /
analyzed: yang ji ltar 'gags zin pa da ltar ba'i rten du brjod ce na /
translated: How can it be said that the present basis is already ceased?

original: de skye ba la nye ba'i rgyur gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de skye ba la nye ba'i rgyur gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is the cause that is proximate to the arising of the mental consciousness.

original: ji ltar gzugs yod kyang mig med par de'i rnam par shes pa phyi ma mi skye ba de bzhin du yul rnams yod kyang rnam par shes pa snga ma 'gags pa med par rnam par shes pa phyi ma mi 'byung ngo //
analyzed: ji ltar gzugs yod kyang mig med par de'i rnam par shes pa phyi ma mi skye ba de bzhin du yul rnams yod kyang rnam par shes pa snga ma 'gags pa med par rnam par shes pa phyi ma mi 'byung ngo //
translated: Just as the eye is the basis of the visual consciousness, even though form exists, the visual consciousness does not arise without the eye. In the same way, even though the objects exist, the subsequent consciousness does not arise without the prior consciousness having ceased.

original: de nyid kyi phyir 'gags ma thag pa zhes brjod kyi ches snga bar 'gags pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir 'gags ma thag pa zhes brjod kyi ches snga bar 'gags pa ni ma yin no //
translated: For this very reason, it is called “immediately past,” not “very prior.”

original: des go skabs phyir yang ma skye ba'i phyir de'i phyir 'di ni 'dir rten gyi dngos po'o //
analyzed: des go skabs phyir yang ma skye ba'i phyir de'i phyir 'di ni 'dir rten gyi dngos po'o //
translated: Because it does not arise again, therefore it is the basis here.

original: da ltar ba kho nas de'i rten gyi bya ba byed de /
analyzed: da ltar ba kho nas de'i rten gyi bya ba byed de /
translated: The present alone performs the action of basis,

original: de mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen gyi 'bras bu nyid du yongs su gzung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen gyi 'bras bu nyid du yongs su gzung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is included as the effect of the condition as equivalent and immediate antecedent.

original: 'das pas ni bya ba byas zin pa kho na'o //
analyzed: 'das pas ni bya ba byas zin pa kho na'o //
translated: The past performs the action that has already been performed.

original: gal te rten sems yin pa'i phyir @65b sems las byung ba nyid du thal lo zhe na de'i rjes su mi 'jug pa'i phyir thal ba med do //
analyzed: gal te rten sems yin pa'i phyir @65b sems las byung ba nyid du thal lo zhe na de'i rjes su mi 'jug pa'i phyir thal ba med do //
translated: If it is asked, “Since the mind is the basis, it follows that it is a mental factor,” there is no entailment, because it is not concomitant with it.

original: 'on te ci'i phyir rnam par shes pa nyid du rnam par gzhag ce na /
analyzed: 'on te ci'i phyir rnam par shes pa nyid du rnam par gzhag ce na /
translated: If it is asked, “Why is it established as consciousness?”

original: yid kyi khams sems las byung ba ma yin yang mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen nges pa las sems su nges pa de sems byung du nges pa las yid kyi khams ma yin no //
analyzed: yid kyi khams sems las byung ba ma yin yang mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen nges pa las sems su nges pa de sems byung du nges pa las yid kyi khams ma yin no //
translated: Although the mind element is not a mental factor, it is ascertained as mind from the certainty of the condition as equivalent and immediate antecedent. It is not the mind element from being ascertained as a mental factor.

original: 'o na de ltar 'byung ba chen po rnams la yid kyi khams nyid yod par 'gyur te nges pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'o na de ltar 'byung ba chen po rnams la yid kyi khams nyid yod par 'gyur te nges pa'i phyir ro //
translated: But then the mental faculty would exist in the great elements, because it is determined that way.

original: skye ba gcig bu la yid kyi khams med cing yod kyi khams zhes kyang mi rung ngo //
analyzed: skye ba gcig bu la yid kyi khams med cing yod kyi khams zhes kyang mi rung ngo //
translated: And it would be impossible to say that the mental faculty is absent in the one-pointed mind of the meditative state of composure without thought, or that it is absent in the meditative state of composure of cessation.

original: rnam par shes pa rgyu nyid kyi phyir sems las byung ba rnams rnam par shes pa'i rten du mi rung ngo //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa rgyu nyid kyi phyir sems las byung ba rnams rnam par shes pa'i rten du mi rung ngo //
translated: The mental factors are not suitable as the basis of consciousness because they are the effect of consciousness.

original: de la rten drug tshan ni mig la sogs pa yid kyi mthar thug pa'o //
analyzed: de la rten drug tshan ni mig la sogs pa yid kyi mthar thug pa'o //
translated: The six collections of bases are the eye and so on up to the mental faculty.

original: brten pa drug tshan ni mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa yid kyi rnam par shes pa la thug pa'o //
analyzed: brten pa drug tshan ni mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa yid kyi rnam par shes pa la thug pa'o //
translated: The six collections of that which is based on them are the eye consciousness and so on up to the mental consciousness.

original: dmigs pa drug tshan ni gzugs la sogs pa chos kyi khams kyi mthar thug pa'o //
analyzed: dmigs pa drug tshan ni gzugs la sogs pa chos kyi khams kyi mthar thug pa'o //
translated: The six collections of objects are form and so on up to the phenomena element.

original: 'o na ni dgra bcom pa zhes bya ba la tha ma ni gang nas mtshams mi sbyor ba yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa'i dus kyi tshe thams cad kyi tha ma gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: 'o na ni dgra bcom pa zhes bya ba la tha ma ni gang nas mtshams mi sbyor ba yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa'i dus kyi tshe thams cad kyi tha ma gang yin pa'o //
translated: But then the last moment of an arhat would not be the mental faculty, because it is not the basis of the mental consciousness.

original: de nyid la rgyu smras ba ni /
analyzed: de nyid la rgyu smras ba ni /
translated: The cause of that is stated:

original: de gang gi zhes rgyas par 'byung ba ste /
analyzed: de gang gi zhes rgyas par 'byung ba ste /
translated: What is the cause of that?

original: rnam par shes pa 'das ma thag pa la yid ces bya ba la /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa 'das ma thag pa la yid ces bya ba la /
translated: The immediately past consciousness is called the mental faculty.

original: de gang gi 'das ma thag par 'gyur pa dgra bcom pa'i sems tha ma las sems gzhan skye ba yang ma yin no //
analyzed: de gang gi 'das ma thag par 'gyur pa dgra bcom pa'i sems tha ma las sems gzhan skye ba yang ma yin no //
translated: What is the immediately past object of that? It is not that another mind arises from the final mind of an arhat.

original: de yang yid kyi ngo bor zhes bya ba la phyi ma'i rten gyi ngo bor gnas pa'i phyir na /
analyzed: de yang yid kyi ngo bor zhes bya ba la phyi ma'i rten gyi ngo bor gnas pa'i phyir na /
translated: Also, it is said to be the nature of the mental faculty because it exists as the nature of the support of the latter.

original: der yid nyid ma nyams so snyam du dgongs so //
analyzed: der yid nyid ma nyams so snyam du dgongs so //
translated: Therefore it is thought that the mental faculty itself does not degenerate.

original: gal te de rten gyi ngo bor rnam par ma bzhag na ci'i phyir phyi ma mi skye zhe na /
analyzed: gal te de rten gyi ngo bor rnam par ma bzhag na ci'i phyir phyi ma mi skye zhe na /
translated: If it is not posited as the nature of the support, why does the latter not arise?

original: de'i phyir rgyu gzhan ma tshang ba'i phyir rnam par shes pa phyi ma mi skye bar zad do zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: de'i phyir rgyu gzhan ma tshang ba'i phyir rnam par shes pa phyi ma mi skye bar zad do zhes gsungs te /
translated: Therefore it is said that the latter consciousness does not arise because other causes are incomplete.

original: de la yid las mjug thogs su rnam par shes pa skye ba'i rgyu gzhan ni mthong ba'i chos kyi rnam par smin pa lhag ma dang 'gro bar nying mtshams sbyor ba'i nyon mongs pa'i thob pa yin no //
analyzed: de la yid las mjug thogs su rnam par shes pa skye ba'i rgyu gzhan ni mthong ba'i chos kyi rnam par smin pa lhag ma dang 'gro bar nying mtshams sbyor ba'i nyon mongs pa'i thob pa yin no //
translated: The cause of consciousness arising immediately after mental consciousness is the remaining karmic maturation of the present life and the obtainment of affliction that connects to the next rebirth.

original: dgra bcom pa'i rnam par shes pa tha ma la ni yid kyi ngo bor gnas kyang gnyi ga med pas rnam par shes pa phyi ma mi skye'o //🔽gal te drug po 'das ma thag pa'i rnam par shes pa yid nyid yin na mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa rnams kyang yid la brten nas skye bas te yid la brten nas chos @66a * //
analyzed: dgra bcom pa'i rnam par shes pa tha ma la ni yid kyi ngo bor gnas kyang gnyi ga med pas rnam par shes pa phyi ma mi skye'o // gal te drug po 'das ma thag pa'i rnam par shes pa yid nyid yin na mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa rnams kyang yid la brten nas skye bas te yid la brten nas chos @66a * //
translated: The final consciousness of an arhat exists as mental consciousness, but since neither exist, subsequent consciousness does not arise.

original: rnams kyang skye bar brjod par bya'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa las ma yin te /
analyzed: rnams kyang skye bar brjod par bya'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa las ma yin te /
translated: If the immediately past six consciousnesses are mental consciousness, then since eye consciousness and so on arise in dependence on the mental faculty, it is said that they arise in dependence on the mental faculty and not in dependence on mental consciousness.

original: yid kyi rkyen nyid ma bkag par mig la brten nas zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: yid kyi rkyen nyid ma bkag par mig la brten nas zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Since the mental faculty is not negated as a condition, it is said that they arise in dependence on the eye faculty and so on.

original: 'o na 'di rkyen gyi gtso bor bstan pa ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na 'di rkyen gyi gtso bor bstan pa ci zhe na /
translated: But why is it taught to be the principal condition?

original: glan ka'i skabs med do //
analyzed: glan ka'i skabs med do //
translated: There is no occasion for dispute.

original: de la phung po dag gis ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: de la phung po dag gis ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: With regard to that, the phrase “by the aggregates” and so on is stated.

original: 'dus byas chos rnams de dag kyang //
analyzed: 'dus byas chos rnams de dag kyang //
translated: Those conditioned phenomena are also

original: zhes bya ba der zag pa dang bcas pa dang zag pa med pa thams cad bsdus pa'i phyir phung po dag gis ni 'dus byas thams cad bsdus so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba der zag pa dang bcas pa dang zag pa med pa thams cad bsdus pa'i phyir phung po dag gis ni 'dus byas thams cad bsdus so //
translated: Because all contaminated and uncontaminated phenomena are included there, all conditioned phenomena are included by the aggregates.

original: gang dag zag bcas nyer len pa'i //
analyzed: gang dag zag bcas nyer len pa'i //
translated: Those that are contaminated and appropriated

original: phung po'ang zhes bya ba der zag pa dang bcas pa rnams kho na nye bar len pa'i rgyur gyur pa'i phyir ram nye bar len pa las byung ba'i phyir ram nye bar len pa la rag lus pa'i phyir nye bar len pa'i phung po dag gis ni zag🔽pa dang bcas pa thams cad bsdus so //
analyzed: phung po'ang zhes bya ba der zag pa dang bcas pa rnams kho na nye bar len pa'i rgyur gyur pa'i phyir ram nye bar len pa las byung ba'i phyir ram nye bar len pa la rag lus pa'i phyir nye bar len pa'i phung po dag gis ni zag pa dang bcas pa thams cad bsdus so //
translated: Because all contaminated phenomena are included there, all contaminated phenomena are included by the appropriated aggregates, since they are the cause of appropriation, they arise from appropriation, or they depend on appropriation.

original: skye mched dang khams dag gis ni chos thams cad bsdus so ;
analyzed: skye mched dang khams dag gis ni chos thams cad bsdus so ;
translated: All phenomena are included by the bases and elements.

original: / chos thams cad kyang phung po lnga dang 'dus ma byas kyis so //
analyzed: / chos thams cad kyang phung po lnga dang 'dus ma byas kyis so //
translated: All phenomena are the five aggregates and unconditioned phenomena.

original: 'di ni re zhig rgyas pa'i sgo nas chos thams cad bsdus pa yin la /
analyzed: 'di ni re zhig rgyas pa'i sgo nas chos thams cad bsdus pa yin la /
translated: This is a brief summary of all things by way of the extensive explanation.

original: bsdus pa ni phung po dang ni zhes rgya cher 'byung ste /
analyzed: bsdus pa ni phung po dang ni zhes rgya cher 'byung ste /
translated: The summary is stated in the line “the aggregates, the bases, and the elements.”

original: dang gi sgra ni kun sdud pa'i don to //
analyzed: dang gi sgra ni kun sdud pa'i don to //
translated: The word “and” has the sense of “all.”

original: 'di ci ltar shes par bya zhe na /
analyzed: 'di ci ltar shes par bya zhe na /
translated: How is this known?

original: gzugs kyi phung po dang / yid kyi skye mched dang chos kyi khams bsdoms pa nyid kyis de ltar shes par bya'i re res ni ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs kyi phung po dang / yid kyi skye mched dang chos kyi khams bsdoms pa nyid kyis de ltar shes par bya'i re res ni ma yin pa'o //
translated: It is known because the form aggregate, the mind base, and the phenomena element are combined.

original: de la gzugs kyi phung pos ni gzugs can gyi khams bcu dang rnam par rig byed ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: de la gzugs kyi phung pos ni gzugs can gyi khams bcu dang rnam par rig byed ma yin pa'o //
translated: The form aggregate includes the ten physical constituents and nonindicative form.

original: yid kyi skye mched kyis ni sems kyi khams bdun no //
analyzed: yid kyi skye mched kyis ni sems kyi khams bdun no //
translated: The mind base includes the seven mental constituents.

original: chos kyi khams kyis ni tshor ba la sogs pa gsum dang 'dus ma byas dang rnam par rig byed ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: chos kyi khams kyis ni tshor ba la sogs pa gsum dang 'dus ma byas dang rnam par rig byed ma yin pa'o //
translated: The phenomena element includes the three constituents of feeling and so on, unconditioned phenomena and nonindicative form.

original: yang ci'i phyir gsum po 'di dag kho nas yin gyi gzhan dag gis sam gnyis sam gcig gis ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: yang ci'i phyir gsum po 'di dag kho nas yin gyi gzhan dag gis sam gnyis sam gcig gis ma yin zhe na /
translated: Why are they included by just these three and not by others, or by two or one?

original: de'i phyir bsdu ba de ni zhes rgya cher gsungs te /
analyzed: de'i phyir bsdu ba de ni zhes rgya cher gsungs te /
translated: Therefore, it is said, “that compilation is…”

original: gang dang gang nas byung yang rung zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gang dang gang nas byung yang rung zhes bya ba la /
translated: Whatever it is that arises is…

original: phung po dang skye mched dang khams dag gis yin pa 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi /
analyzed: phung po dang skye mched dang khams dag gis yin pa 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi /
translated: It is not only the aggregates, bases, and constituents that are included.

original: 'o na ci zhe na gzhan yang bden pa dang 'gro ba dang khams dang rten cing 'brel par 'byung bas bsdu ba yang rig par bya'o //
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na gzhan yang bden pa dang 'gro ba dang khams dang rten cing 'brel par 'byung bas bsdu ba yang rig par bya'o //
translated: What else? Also, the truths, realms, and dependent origination are included.

original: rang gi ngo bo nyid kyis te gzhan gyi dngos pos bsdus pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo nyid kyis te gzhan gyi dngos pos bsdus pa ni ma yin no //
translated: They are included by their own nature, not by the nature of something else.

original: 'on phung po @66b gsum gyis 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad ci ltar bsdus te /
analyzed: 'on phung po @66b gsum gyis 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad ci ltar bsdus te /
translated: But how are the eightfold noble path and the three aggregates included?

original: yang dag pa'i rtog pa dang rtsol ba dag gis shes rab kyi phung po bsdus par mi 'gyur zhing yang dag pa'i dran pas ting nge 'dzin gyi phung po bsdus pa ma yin te de'i rang bzhin ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i rtog pa dang rtsol ba dag gis shes rab kyi phung po bsdus par mi 'gyur zhing yang dag pa'i dran pas ting nge 'dzin gyi phung po bsdus pa ma yin te de'i rang bzhin ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Right thought and right effort are not included in the aggregate of wisdom, and right mindfulness is not included in the aggregate of concentration, because they are not by nature those things.

original: de yang lta'o zhes pa gzhan gyi dngos pos bsdus kyang chos rnams la 'dod par bya'o zhes pas rigs mthun pa gzhan dag gzhan gyi dngos po nyid kyi khyad par las nges pa 'di ni ci las yin zhe na /
analyzed: de yang lta'o zhes pa gzhan gyi dngos pos bsdus kyang chos rnams la 'dod par bya'o zhes pas rigs mthun pa gzhan dag gzhan gyi dngos po nyid kyi khyad par las nges pa 'di ni ci las yin zhe na /
translated: Though the phrase “it sees” is included in the phrase “it is,” it is to be applied to phenomena.

original: yang dag pa'i rtog pa dang rtsol ba dag nyid kyis shes rab kyi phung po bsdus kyi lam gyi yan lag lhag ma rnams ni ma yin no //🔽ci ste gsal ba'i phyir yang dag pa'i rtog pa dang rtsol ba dag shes rab kyi mtshan nyid bstan la ting nge 'dzin la sogs pa ma yin zhing /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i rtog pa dang rtsol ba dag nyid kyis shes rab kyi phung po bsdus kyi lam gyi yan lag lhag ma rnams ni ma yin no // ci ste gsal ba'i phyir yang dag pa'i rtog pa dang rtsol ba dag shes rab kyi mtshan nyid bstan la ting nge 'dzin la sogs pa ma yin zhing /
translated: Since the aggregates of wisdom are included in right investigation and right effort, the remaining branches of the path are not included in them.

original: dran pa dang ting nge 'dzin gyi mtshan nyid yang dag pa'i rtog pa la sogs pa ma yin pas yod par nges pa'i rgyu grub po ;
analyzed: dran pa dang ting nge 'dzin gyi mtshan nyid yang dag pa'i rtog pa la sogs pa ma yin pas yod par nges pa'i rgyu grub po ;
translated: If it is said that right investigation and right effort are taught to be the characteristics of wisdom because they are clear, and concentration and so on are not, and that right investigation and so on are not the characteristics of mindfulness and concentration, then the reason for the definite existence of the path is established.

original: /'on rang bzhin gyis bsdus pa'i mtshan nyid med par bsdus pa khas blangs pa'i phyir /
analyzed: /'on rang bzhin gyis bsdus pa'i mtshan nyid med par bsdus pa khas blangs pa'i phyir /
translated: But since you accept that the path is included without having the nature of being included,

original: ji ltar gzhan gyi dngos po dang mtshungs par ldan pas thams cad kyi thams cad du mtshungs par ldan pa nyid gzhan gyi chos bsdus pa la yang ci'i phyir 'dod par mi byed ce na /
analyzed: ji ltar gzhan gyi dngos po dang mtshungs par ldan pas thams cad kyi thams cad du mtshungs par ldan pa nyid gzhan gyi chos bsdus pa la yang ci'i phyir 'dod par mi byed ce na /
translated: Why not accept that all dharmas are included in the other-dependent nature, since they are associated with the other-dependent nature in every way?

original: mtshungs par ldan pa ni dmigs pa dang bcas pa rnams nyid de /
analyzed: mtshungs par ldan pa ni dmigs pa dang bcas pa rnams nyid de /
translated: Association is only of those dharmas that have an object.

original: de yang rten dang dmigs pa dang rnam pa dang dus dang rdzas kyi rnam pa smos pa'i rgyu mtshan gyis thams cad kyi thams cad du mi rung ngo //
analyzed: de yang rten dang dmigs pa dang rnam pa dang dus dang rdzas kyi rnam pa smos pa'i rgyu mtshan gyis thams cad kyi thams cad du mi rung ngo //
translated: And that is not possible in every way, because of the difference in basis, objective support, aspect, time, and substance.

original: bsdu ba'i dngos po ni chos rnams thams cad kyi gzhan gyi dngos po'i khyad par la ste /
analyzed: bsdu ba'i dngos po ni chos rnams thams cad kyi gzhan gyi dngos po'i khyad par la ste /
translated: The other-dependent nature is the other-nature of all dharmas,

original: nges pa'i rgyu med pa'i phyir thams cad kyi thams cad du ma yin no //
analyzed: nges pa'i rgyu med pa'i phyir thams cad kyi thams cad du ma yin no //
translated: but not in every way, because there is no fixed cause.

original: 'o na gal te de ltar phung po gsum gyis lam bsdus so zhes brjod pa ming tsam zhig gam ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na gal te de ltar phung po gsum gyis lam bsdus so zhes brjod pa ming tsam zhig gam ci zhe na /
translated: Well, if the path is included in the three heaps in this way, is it just a matter of mere words?

original: 'di ni bsdu ba'i sgra dang rjes su mthun pas brjod pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni bsdu ba'i sgra dang rjes su mthun pas brjod pa'o //
translated: This is said in accordance with the word “include.”

original: rang bzhin gyis bsdu ba 'di ni 'di ltar dngos po rnams kyi rang bzhin nyid do //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis bsdu ba 'di ni 'di ltar dngos po rnams kyi rang bzhin nyid do //
translated: This natural inclusion is the very nature of things.

original: de nyid kyi phyir rang bzhin gyis bsdus pa thams cad ni dngos po la ma ltos pa'i phyir dang rgyu med pa'i phyir 'di ji ltar khong du chud par bya zhe na /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir rang bzhin gyis bsdus pa thams cad ni dngos po la ma ltos pa'i phyir dang rgyu med pa'i phyir 'di ji ltar khong du chud par bya zhe na /
translated: Therefore, since natural inclusion does not depend on anything else and has no cause, how can it be understood?

original: gzhan gyi dngos po dang mi ldan pa ni mig ste 'dir rna ba'i dngos po dang mi ldan pa'o //🔽mi ldan gang dang gang yin pa de dang de @67a * //
analyzed: gzhan gyi dngos po dang mi ldan pa ni mig ste 'dir rna ba'i dngos po dang mi ldan pa'o // mi ldan gang dang gang yin pa de dang de @67a * //
translated: The eye is not endowed with the nature of the ear, because it does not possess the nature of the ear.

original: nyid kyis bsdus so zhes bya ba rigs ma yin pa'i smra bar khong du chud par bya'o //
analyzed: nyid kyis bsdus so zhes bya ba rigs ma yin pa'i smra bar khong du chud par bya'o //
translated: It is not reasonable to say that whatever is not endowed with something is included in that.

original: dngos po rnams kyis bsdus pa'i rang bzhin ni 'dir rang bzhin gyi rang gi ngo bo ni ma yin no zhes gzhan dag zer ro //
analyzed: dngos po rnams kyis bsdus pa'i rang bzhin ni 'dir rang bzhin gyi rang gi ngo bo ni ma yin no zhes gzhan dag zer ro //
translated: Others say that natural inclusion is not the intrinsic nature of things.

original: rang bzhin ni rang gi mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: rang bzhin ni rang gi mtshan nyid do //
translated: Intrinsic nature is the intrinsic identity of things.

original: rang gi mtshan nyid kyang dngos po rnams phan tshun 'byed par byed pa yin la gang la phye ba de nyid du bsdu ba la mi rig pa med do //
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid kyang dngos po rnams phan tshun 'byed par byed pa yin la gang la phye ba de nyid du bsdu ba la mi rig pa med do //
translated: And the specific characteristic of things is that they are mutually exclusive, and that which is differentiated is not undifferentiated.

original: de lta ma yin na dbye ba med pas bsdu ba nyid du mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: de lta ma yin na dbye ba med pas bsdu ba nyid du mi 'gyur te /
translated: Otherwise, since there would be no differentiation, there would be no differentiation.

original: bsdu ba ni rdzas gzhan pa rnams gcig tu byed pa nyid yin pa de'i phyir 'dir don du rung ngo //
analyzed: bsdu ba ni rdzas gzhan pa rnams gcig tu byed pa nyid yin pa de'i phyir 'dir don du rung ngo //
translated: Since differentiation is the unification of different substances, it is appropriate here.

original: gcer bu rnams kyang rang bzhin mngon par 'dod pa 'di'i ming gi don yang ci zhe na /
analyzed: gcer bu rnams kyang rang bzhin mngon par 'dod pa 'di'i ming gi don yang ci zhe na /
translated: What is the meaning of the name of the Nirgranthas, who also assert a nature?

original: gang gi phyir rnam par rtog pa med pa'i ye shes kyi spyod yul gyi dngos po gzhan rnam par bcad pas ston par byed do //
analyzed: gang gi phyir rnam par rtog pa med pa'i ye shes kyi spyod yul gyi dngos po gzhan rnam par bcad pas ston par byed do //
translated: Because it is taught by the exclusion of other things that are not the domain of nonconceptual wisdom.

original: de nyid kyi phyir bstan bcos las kyang mig gi rnam par shes pas sngon po rnam par shes kyi sngon po'o snyam du ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir bstan bcos las kyang mig gi rnam par shes pas sngon po rnam par shes kyi sngon po'o snyam du ni ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, the treatise also says: “The eye consciousness cognizes blue, but not ‘This is blue.’”

original: yid kyi rnam par shes pas ni sngon po rnam par shes shing sngon po'o snyam du yang ngo zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: yid kyi rnam par shes pas ni sngon po rnam par shes shing sngon po'o snyam du yang ngo zhes gsungs so //
translated: The mental consciousness cognizes blue and thinks “blue.”

original: slob dpon 'dus bzang na re /
analyzed: slob dpon 'dus bzang na re /
translated: Master Saṃghabhadra says:

original: gzhan gyi dngos pos bsdus na ni chos gcig skyes ba dang 'jig pas chos thams cad skye ba dang 'jig pa mi 'dod pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: gzhan gyi dngos pos bsdus na ni chos gcig skyes ba dang 'jig pas chos thams cad skye ba dang 'jig pa mi 'dod pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur la /
translated: If they were included in the nature of others, it would follow that the arising and disintegration of all phenomena would not be asserted due to the arising and disintegration of a single phenomenon.

original: rigs gcig spangs pa las thams cad spangs par 'gyur bas gong ma'i gnyen po don med pa nyid do //
analyzed: rigs gcig spangs pa las thams cad spangs par 'gyur bas gong ma'i gnyen po don med pa nyid do //
translated: And since all would be abandoned by abandoning a single type, the higher antidote would be pointless.

original: rang gi ngo bos bsdus par bstan pa'i phyir 'di ltar gzhan gyi ngo bos bsdus par yang mi 'gyur te 'di la skyon med do //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bos bsdus par bstan pa'i phyir 'di ltar gzhan gyi ngo bos bsdus par yang mi 'gyur te 'di la skyon med do //
translated: But since they are taught to be included in their own nature, they are not included in the nature of others, and there is no fault.

original: dper na mig gi dbang po ni gzugs kyi phung po dang zhes rgya cher 'byung ste /
analyzed: dper na mig gi dbang po ni gzugs kyi phung po dang zhes rgya cher 'byung ste /
translated: For example, the eye faculty is included in the form aggregate, and so on at length.

original: gzugs kyi mtshan nyid dang rjes su 'brel ba'i phyir gzugs kyi phung pos so //
analyzed: gzugs kyi mtshan nyid dang rjes su 'brel ba'i phyir gzugs kyi phung pos so //
translated: Because it is related to the characteristics of form, it is included in the form aggregate.

original: mig gi skye mched dang khams dag ni mi rtag pa nyid kyi phyir sdug bsngal gyi bden pa dang / de'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir kun 'byung gi bden pas bsdus so //
analyzed: mig gi skye mched dang khams dag ni mi rtag pa nyid kyi phyir sdug bsngal gyi bden pa dang / de'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir kun 'byung gi bden pas bsdus so //
translated: The eye sense-sphere and the eye element are included in the truth of suffering because they are impermanent, and they are included in the truth of origination because they are the cause of that.

original: gzhan dang gzhan bsdus pa yang de ltar rgya cher sbyar ro //
analyzed: gzhan dang gzhan bsdus pa yang de ltar rgya cher sbyar ro //
translated: The same should be extensively applied to the other sense-spheres and elements.

original: bsdu ba'i dngos po ni sbyin pa dang snyan par smra ba dang don spyod pa dang don mthun pa rnams so //
analyzed: bsdu ba'i dngos po ni sbyin pa dang snyan par smra ba dang don spyod pa dang don mthun pa rnams so //
translated: The means of gathering are generosity, pleasant speech, meaningful activity, and consistency of behavior.

original: 'khor rnams ni dge slong dang dge slong ma dang dge bsnyen dang dge bsnyen ma rnams so //
analyzed: 'khor rnams ni dge slong dang dge slong ma dang dge bsnyen dang dge bsnyen ma rnams so //
translated: The retinue is the monks, nuns, male and female lay followers.

original: bsdu ba'i dngos pos 'khor bsdus pa yang rang bzhin gyis ni ma yin te /
analyzed: bsdu ba'i dngos pos 'khor bsdus pa yang rang bzhin gyis ni ma yin te /
translated: The retinue is not gathered by the means of gathering through their intrinsic nature,

original: 'di res 'ga' @67b ba yin pa'i phyir dang brdar btags pa'i yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: 'di res 'ga' @67b ba yin pa'i phyir dang brdar btags pa'i yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: but it should be understood that they are gathered through conventional designation.

original: bsdu ba'i dngos po rnams kyis ni 'khor rnams bdag gir byed pa tsam la 'dir bsdu bar gsungs so //
analyzed: bsdu ba'i dngos po rnams kyis ni 'khor rnams bdag gir byed pa tsam la 'dir bsdu bar gsungs so //
translated: Here, the means of gathering are said to gather the retinue by merely making them one's own.

original: de ni rtag tu med pa dang phyis kyang res 'ga' ba yin no //
analyzed: de ni rtag tu med pa dang phyis kyang res 'ga' ba yin no //
translated: It is never present and is sometimes absent later.

original: rang bzhin gyis bsdus pa ni rtag pa dang don dam pa pa yin no zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis bsdus pa ni rtag pa dang don dam pa pa yin no zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: The included in nature is permanent and is the ultimate.

original: rten gyi dbye bas khams kyi dbye ba'i dbang du byas nas 'dri ba ni /
analyzed: rten gyi dbye bas khams kyi dbye ba'i dbang du byas nas 'dri ba ni /
translated: The question is asked from the perspective of the classification of elements by way of their basis.

original: mig dang rna ba dag ces bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: mig dang rna ba dag ces bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba'o //
translated: The question is asked in detail: “Are the eye and ear elements different?

original: rigs dang spyod yul dang rnam par shes pa'i dbye bas khams dbye bar bya'i rten gyi dbye bas ni ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rigs dang spyod yul dang rnam par shes pa'i dbye bas khams dbye bar bya'i rten gyi dbye bas ni ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: The elements are classified by way of their type, object-field, and consciousness, but not by way of their basis.

original: mi 'gyur te 'di ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /🔽de la mig la sogs pa lnga po rnams ni phan tshun rigs dang spyod yul dang rnam par shes pa tha dad pa las khams tha dad do //
analyzed: mi 'gyur te 'di ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te / de la mig la sogs pa lnga po rnams ni phan tshun rigs dang spyod yul dang rnam par shes pa tha dad pa las khams tha dad do //
translated: In order to demonstrate this, he says, “No, because...”.🔽Among them, the five beginning with the eye are different elements because of the difference in their type, object-field, and consciousness.

original: gzugs la sogs pa yul gyi khams rnams ni rigs dang rnam par shes pa tha dad pa las so //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa yul gyi khams rnams ni rigs dang rnam par shes pa tha dad pa las so //
translated: The elements of the object-fields beginning with form are different because of the difference in their type and consciousness.

original: rnam par shes pa'i khams drug ni rigs dang spyod yul tha dad pa las so //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i khams drug ni rigs dang spyod yul tha dad pa las so //
translated: The six elements of consciousness are distinguished by their different types and objects.

original: yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i thun mong ma yin pa'i yul ni chos kyi khams so //
analyzed: yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i thun mong ma yin pa'i yul ni chos kyi khams so //
translated: The object of the mental consciousness is the element of mental objects.

original: yid kyi khams spyod yul ni rnam par shes pa'i dbye ba las chos kyi khams spyod yul yin pa'i phyir dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i rten yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yid kyi khams spyod yul ni rnam par shes pa'i dbye ba las chos kyi khams spyod yul yin pa'i phyir dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i rten yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The mental element is the object of the mental consciousness because it is the object of the class of mental consciousness, and because it is the support of the mental consciousness.

original: de la rigs kyi dbye ba yod de rnam par shes pa'i khams drug gis bsdus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la rigs kyi dbye ba yod de rnam par shes pa'i khams drug gis bsdus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is distinguished by its type, because it is included in the six elements of consciousness.

original: mig dang rna ba dang sna rnams las rigs tha dad par yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: mig dang rna ba dang sna rnams las rigs tha dad par yod pa ma yin no //
translated: The eye, ear, and nose elements are not distinguished by their types.

original: rigs kyi don ni khams kyi don to zhes so //
analyzed: rigs kyi don ni khams kyi don to zhes so //
translated: The meaning of type is the meaning of element.

original: 'bras bu'i dbye bas rten rnam par bcad de khams kyi dbye ba rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: 'bras bu'i dbye bas rten rnam par bcad de khams kyi dbye ba rnam par gzhag go //
translated: The distinction of the elements is established by the distinction of results, and the distinction of supports is eliminated.

original: de'i phyir mig la sogs pa rnam pa gnyis yin mod na'ang khams gcig nyid de /
analyzed: de'i phyir mig la sogs pa rnam pa gnyis yin mod na'ang khams gcig nyid de /
translated: Therefore, although the eye and so on are twofold, they are only one element.

original: 'dir yang dpe ni skad cig ma'i rgyun gzhan gyi mig la sogs pa rnams so //
analyzed: 'dir yang dpe ni skad cig ma'i rgyun gzhan gyi mig la sogs pa rnams so //
translated: The example here is the eye, etc., which are a series of moments.

original: de lta ma yin na khams nyi shu rtsa gcig tu 'gyur ba ma yin nam zhes brjod par mi bya'i /
analyzed: de lta ma yin na khams nyi shu rtsa gcig tu 'gyur ba ma yin nam zhes brjod par mi bya'i /
translated: If it were otherwise, would it not follow that there would be twenty-one elements?

original: 'o na ci zhe na 'di skad du khams tshad med pa dag tu 'gyur ba ma yin zhes brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na 'di skad du khams tshad med pa dag tu 'gyur ba ma yin zhes brjod par bya'o //
translated: No, it should be said that there would be an infinite number of elements.🔽The same should be applied to the ear and nose.

original: de bzhin du rna ba dang sna dag la yang sbyar bar bya'o zhes bya ba la rigs 'dra ba ni so sor gnyis ka yang rna ba dang sna'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du rna ba dang sna dag la yang sbyar bar bya'o zhes bya ba la rigs 'dra ba ni so sor gnyis ka yang rna ba dang sna'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The similarity of type is that each is of the nature of the ear and nose.

original: spyod yul 'dra ba ni sgra dang dri'i yul can yin pa'i phyir ro //🔽rnam par @68a * //
analyzed: spyod yul 'dra ba ni sgra dang dri'i yul can yin pa'i phyir ro // rnam par @68a * //
translated: The similarity of object is that they have sound and odor as their objects.

original: shes pa 'dra ba ni so sor gnyis ga rna ba dang sna'i rnam par shes pa'i rten yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shes pa 'dra ba ni so sor gnyis ga rna ba dang sna'i rnam par shes pa'i rten yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The similarity of consciousness is that each is the basis of the ear and nose consciousnesses.

original: spyod yul 'dra ba dang rnam par shes pa 'dra bar 'khrul ba ni yid kyi khams dang yul la yang yod pa'i phyir rigs gcig tu yod pa nyid do zhes pa'i khyad par 'di la skyon med de /
analyzed: spyod yul 'dra ba dang rnam par shes pa 'dra bar 'khrul ba ni yid kyi khams dang yul la yang yod pa'i phyir rigs gcig tu yod pa nyid do zhes pa'i khyad par 'di la skyon med de /
translated: The error of similarity of object field and similarity of consciousness is also present in the mental faculty and its object field. Therefore, the distinction that the two are the same type is not faulty.

original: de ltar na 'o na spyod yul dang rnam par shes pa 'dra ba ni don med pa can te snga ma nyid kyis grub pa'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ltar na 'o na spyod yul dang rnam par shes pa 'dra ba ni don med pa can te snga ma nyid kyis grub pa'i phyir zhe na /
translated: If that is so, then similarity of object field and consciousness is meaningless, because it is already established by the former.

original: mig gi khams dang yid kyi khams yul mtshungs pa ni med do //
analyzed: mig gi khams dang yid kyi khams yul mtshungs pa ni med do //
translated: The eye element and the mental faculty do not have the same object field.

original: rnam par shes pa 'dra ba ni gnyi ga mig gi rnam par shes pa'i rten nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa 'dra ba ni gnyi ga mig gi rnam par shes pa'i rten nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: They are similar consciousnesses because both are the basis of eye consciousness.

original: yul ni yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i lhag par dmigs pa'o zhes bya bar thal ba med do //
analyzed: yul ni yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i lhag par dmigs pa'o zhes bya bar thal ba med do //
translated: It is not the case that the object field of mental consciousness is not also the object field of eye consciousness.

original: kha cig rigs gzhan du sems so //
analyzed: kha cig rigs gzhan du sems so //
translated: Some say: They are different types.

original: lus kyi dbang pos tha dad pa med par bsdus pa'i phyir lus kyi khams ma yin pa'i pho'i dbang po dang mo'i dbang po med pa nyid do //
analyzed: lus kyi dbang pos tha dad pa med par bsdus pa'i phyir lus kyi khams ma yin pa'i pho'i dbang po dang mo'i dbang po med pa nyid do //
translated: The male faculty and female faculty are not included in the body element because they are distinct from the body faculty.

original: de thams cad lus su rigs gcig pas rigs mtshungs pa dang / thams cad kyi yul reg bya yin pas spyod yul mtshungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de thams cad lus su rigs gcig pas rigs mtshungs pa dang / thams cad kyi yul reg bya yin pas spyod yul mtshungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: All of them are of the same type as body, and they are similar in that they all have the tactile object as their domain.

original: reg bya'i khyad par las dbang po gzhan ni ma yin te /
analyzed: reg bya'i khyad par las dbang po gzhan ni ma yin te /
translated: The other sense faculties are not distinguished by a special tactile object.

original: mig dang brang la sogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: mig dang brang la sogs pa bzhin no //
translated: They are like the chest, etc.

original: mig dang brang dang mgrin pa dag kyang thun mong ma yin pa'i reg bya du ba la sogs pa dang phrad pa na de dag dbang po gzhan ma yin te thams cad lus kyi rnam par shes pa'i rten yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mig dang brang dang mgrin pa dag kyang thun mong ma yin pa'i reg bya du ba la sogs pa dang phrad pa na de dag dbang po gzhan ma yin te thams cad lus kyi rnam par shes pa'i rten yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The chest, throat, and so on are not other sense faculties when they come in contact with a special tactile object such as smoke, because they are all the basis of body consciousness.

original: spyod yul mtshungs kyang rnam par shes pa 'dra ba dang rnam par shes pa mi 'dra bar gsal bar 'byung ngo //
analyzed: spyod yul mtshungs kyang rnam par shes pa 'dra ba dang rnam par shes pa mi 'dra bar gsal bar 'byung ngo //
translated: Even though they are similar in having the same domain, they are clearly distinguished as being the same or different kinds of consciousness.

original: dbang po rnams ni lhag par dbang byed pa nyid kyi phyir te /
analyzed: dbang po rnams ni lhag par dbang byed pa nyid kyi phyir te /
translated: The sense faculties are dominant in the sense that they are superior.

original: kha cig tu de dag nyid kyang dbang byed pas skye mched dang khams gcig nyid dang yul reg bya yin par rigs mthun pa la yang dbang po so sor bstan pa dbang po bcu gcig rnams chos kyi skye mched dang khams gcig nyid la yang dbang po so🔽sor bstan pa bzhin no zhes so //
analyzed: kha cig tu de dag nyid kyang dbang byed pas skye mched dang khams gcig nyid dang yul reg bya yin par rigs mthun pa la yang dbang po so sor bstan pa dbang po bcu gcig rnams chos kyi skye mched dang khams gcig nyid la yang dbang po so sor bstan pa bzhin no zhes so //
translated: In some cases, the same sense base and element are the dominant condition, such as the eleven faculties, which are the same as the sense base and element of phenomena.

original: gal te mig la sogs pa rnams khams gcig nyid yin na /
analyzed: gal te mig la sogs pa rnams khams gcig nyid yin na /
translated: If the eyes and so on are the same sense base and element,

original: ci'i phyir de rnams kyi rten gcig nyid du mi 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir de rnams kyi rten gcig nyid du mi 'gyur zhe na /
translated: why are their supports not the same?

original: de'i phyir mdzes bya'i phyir na gnyis byung ngo zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de'i phyir mdzes bya'i phyir na gnyis byung ngo zhes gsungs so //
translated: Therefore it is said that two eyes arise for the sake of beauty.

original: gal te dngos po rnams 'byung ba rgyu'i dbang gis yin gyi dgongs pa'i dbang gis ma yin pa ma yin nam zhe na /🔽'di ni de @68b ltar yin no //🔽ci'i phyir / mdzes pa'i phyir na gnyis byung ngo //
analyzed: gal te dngos po rnams 'byung ba rgyu'i dbang gis yin gyi dgongs pa'i dbang gis ma yin pa ma yin nam zhe na / 'di ni de @68b ltar yin no // ci'i phyir / mdzes pa'i phyir na gnyis byung ngo //
translated: If things arise due to the power of causes and not due to the power of intention,

original: zhes bya ba smras she na /
analyzed: zhes bya ba smras she na /
translated: why is it said that two eyes arise for the sake of beauty?

original: ji ltar da lta'i sems can so sor rigs mthun pa rnams mig dag gis rten tha dad pas yan lag rnam par 'byed pa'i rten la mdzes par rlom pa de bzhin du 'das pa'i dus na yang yin par gdon mi za ste /
analyzed: ji ltar da lta'i sems can so sor rigs mthun pa rnams mig dag gis rten tha dad pas yan lag rnam par 'byed pa'i rten la mdzes par rlom pa de bzhin du 'das pa'i dus na yang yin par gdon mi za ste /
translated: Just as it is now, there is no doubt that it was also in the past, since sentient beings of the same type have eyes that are similar in appearance and function.

original: de'i phyir srid pa sngon du 'gro ba can gyi las kyis mngon par bsgrub pa'i lus la dgongs nas /
analyzed: de'i phyir srid pa sngon du 'gro ba can gyi las kyis mngon par bsgrub pa'i lus la dgongs nas /
translated: Therefore, the Bhagavān, intending to speak of a body that is established by karma that precedes existence,

original: mdzes bya'i phyir na gnyis 'byung ngo zhes bshad do /
analyzed: mdzes bya'i phyir na gnyis 'byung ngo zhes bshad do /
translated: said, “Two arise for the sake of beauty.”

original: de skyes pa'i las kyi gzhi bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de skyes pa'i las kyi gzhi bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because he taught the basis of karma that is produced.

original: dper na rgyan mdzes pa la dmigs pa'i 'dun pa'i 'dod chags kyi rgyu can gyi 'bras bu yin pas mdzes par bya ba'i don du brjod pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na rgyan mdzes pa la dmigs pa'i 'dun pa'i 'dod chags kyi rgyu can gyi 'bras bu yin pas mdzes par bya ba'i don du brjod pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, it is like saying that the result of the desire realm that is caused by the desire realm that is the focus of the desire to be beautiful is for the sake of beauty.

original: slob dpon 'dus bzang na re /
analyzed: slob dpon 'dus bzang na re /
translated: Master Saṃghabhadra says:

original: dbang po'i rnam pa 'di rnams nyid kyi rnam pa mngon par 'grub pa de ni /
analyzed: dbang po'i rnam pa 'di rnams nyid kyi rnam pa mngon par 'grub pa de ni /
translated: The establishment of the aspects of the sense faculties

original: rgyu'i mi mthun phyogs med pa gnyis kyis mngon par 'grub ste /
analyzed: rgyu'i mi mthun phyogs med pa gnyis kyis mngon par 'grub ste /
translated: is established by two factors: the absence of opposing causes🔽and the presence of concordant causes.

original: lus kyi dbang po'i lag pa dang rkang pa'i gnas kyi dbye ba bzhin no //
analyzed: lus kyi dbang po'i lag pa dang rkang pa'i gnas kyi dbye ba bzhin no //
translated: like the hand and foot which are the bases of the body faculty.

original: gang zhig 'dod chags la sogs pa lus kyi dbang po'i rten rnam par rtog pa dag tu mthong ba de'i rgyu ni de dag nyid kyi mthun pa'i phyogs 'dzin pas de rten med pa dang bcas pa gnyis bzhin du ci'i phyir rgyu la bltos pas dbang po mngon🔽par 'grub ces so //
analyzed: gang zhig 'dod chags la sogs pa lus kyi dbang po'i rten rnam par rtog pa dag tu mthong ba de'i rgyu ni de dag nyid kyi mthun pa'i phyogs 'dzin pas de rten med pa dang bcas pa gnyis bzhin du ci'i phyir rgyu la bltos pas dbang po mngon par 'grub ces so //
translated: If one sees attachment, etc. as the conceptualizations of the body faculty, then the cause of those is the acquisition of their favorable side. Why, then, do they not arise in the two with body faculty?

original: gal te rgyu la bltos pas dbang po mngon par 'grub pa de nyid brjod par bya ba dbang po 'di rnams kyi rgyu nyid rnam pa gang gis gnyis nyid kyis 'jug par byed /
analyzed: gal te rgyu la bltos pas dbang po mngon par 'grub pa de nyid brjod par bya ba dbang po 'di rnams kyi rgyu nyid rnam pa gang gis gnyis nyid kyis 'jug par byed /
translated: If the faculties are established in dependence on a cause, then the cause of these faculties must be stated. By what aspect does it cause the two to engage?

original: de la rigs kho na rnam pa zhe na /
analyzed: de la rigs kho na rnam pa zhe na /
translated: If you say that it is the lineage itself,

original: las kyi rnam par thal ba las /
analyzed: las kyi rnam par thal ba las /
translated: then the Sūtra statement that the faculties are established in dependence on a cause would be contradicted.

original: de nyid lhag par dbang byed pa thob pa'i sgra yis brjod par bshad do ;
analyzed: de nyid lhag par dbang byed pa thob pa'i sgra yis brjod par bshad do ;
translated: It is said that the word “alone” is used to indicate that the cause of the faculties is the acquisition of superior controlling power.

original: / gal te mig la sogs pa rten re rer gyur na lhag par dbang byed pa nyams te /
analyzed: / gal te mig la sogs pa rten re rer gyur na lhag par dbang byed pa nyams te /
translated: If the eye, etc. were the individual supports, then superior controlling power would be impaired.

original: ji ltar gnyis dag gis yongs su gsal bar mthong ba de ltar re rer ma yin no //
analyzed: ji ltar gnyis dag gis yongs su gsal bar mthong ba de ltar re rer ma yin no //
translated: Just as they are seen to be illuminated by two, so they are not seen to be illuminated by one.

original: de ltar dbang po rnams kyis lhag par dbang byed pa 'grib pa dang nyams par 'gyur ba na /🔽mdzes bya'i phyir zhes pa lhag par dbang byed pa'o zhes bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: de ltar dbang po rnams kyis lhag par dbang byed pa 'grib pa dang nyams par 'gyur ba na / mdzes bya'i phyir zhes pa lhag par dbang byed pa'o zhes bshad par bya ste /
translated: Thus, when the predominance of the faculties is diminished and weakened,🔽it should be explained that the predominance is for the sake of beauty.

original: mdzes bya'i phyir zhes pa'i sgra yis lhag par dbang byed pa brjod par bya'o zhes zer ro //
analyzed: mdzes bya'i phyir zhes pa'i sgra yis lhag par dbang byed pa brjod par bya'o zhes zer ro //
translated: The term “for the sake of” should be explained as “for the sake of predominance.”

original: 'di ni rtog pa tsam ste ji ltar lce la sogs pa rnams rten gcig dang rten du ma la yang de dang 'dra bas dbang byed pa nyams pas 'di dag gi gcig la'ang mig la @69a * //
analyzed: 'di ni rtog pa tsam ste ji ltar lce la sogs pa rnams rten gcig dang rten du ma la yang de dang 'dra bas dbang byed pa nyams pas 'di dag gi gcig la'ang mig la @69a * //
translated: This is mere speculation. Just as the tongue and so on are not predominant in one or many supports, so the eye and so on are not predominant in one or many supports.

original: sogs par 'gyur ro zhes pa dang / las kyis lce ni rten nyid du gsal bar dmigs pa'i rten du gyur pa rgya chen po zhig skye bar 'dod do zhes brjod par mi nus so //
analyzed: sogs par 'gyur ro zhes pa dang / las kyis lce ni rten nyid du gsal bar dmigs pa'i rten du gyur pa rgya chen po zhig skye bar 'dod do zhes brjod par mi nus so //
translated: One cannot say that the tongue is the support of the faculty of taste because it is clearly observed as the support of the faculty of touch, and it is asserted that a large part of the tongue is generated as the support of the faculty of touch.

original: rigs mthun pas 'dra ba rnams la yang gzugs mdzes par rlom pa nges pa ste /
analyzed: rigs mthun pas 'dra ba rnams la yang gzugs mdzes par rlom pa nges pa ste /
translated: and the eye, etc. are beautiful in relation to those that are similar.

original: dper na 'ug pa la sogs pa rnams la yang rang gi lus mdzes pa'i srid pa las skyes pa nyid kyi mig la sogs pa'i rten gyi dbye ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na 'ug pa la sogs pa rnams la yang rang gi lus mdzes pa'i srid pa las skyes pa nyid kyi mig la sogs pa'i rten gyi dbye ba lta bu'o //
translated: For example, owls, etc. also have eyes, etc. that are the bases of the life that is the beauty of their own bodies.🔽If it were not so,

original: de lta ma yin te zhes bya ba la gal te mig la sogs pa rten gnyis par ma gyur na shin tu mi mdzes par 'gyur te /
