analyzed: de lta ma yin te zhes bya ba la gal te mig la sogs pa rten gnyis par ma gyur na shin tu mi mdzes par 'gyur te /
translated: if the eye, etc. were not the bases of two, they would be very ugly,

original: rten gnyis pa'i mig la sogs pa dag la mdzes par mngon par rlom pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rten gnyis pa'i mig la sogs pa dag la mdzes par mngon par rlom pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because one would not conceive the eye, etc. that are the bases of two to be beautiful.

original: phung po dang khams dang skye mched kyi don zhes bya ba rgya cher 'byung ba la /
analyzed: phung po dang khams dang skye mched kyi don zhes bya ba rgya cher 'byung ba la /
translated: The meaning of the aggregates, bases, and elements

original: phung po dang skye mched dang khams rnams la dngos po'i sgo nas dbye ba yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: phung po dang skye mched dang khams rnams la dngos po'i sgo nas dbye ba yod pa ma yin te /
translated: There is no difference in the aggregates, bases, and elements from the point of view of substance.

original: ji ltar gang phung po rnams 'dus ma byas khyad par du shes par bya bar gsungs la /
analyzed: ji ltar gang phung po rnams 'dus ma byas khyad par du shes par bya bar gsungs la /
translated: For example, the aggregates are said to be known as unconditioned,🔽and the elements and bases are also said to be known as unconditioned.

original: skye mched dang khams rnams la yang de nyid de de'i phyir 'dir phung po la sogs pa'i don gyi khyad par las byed pa yin gyi /
analyzed: skye mched dang khams rnams la yang de nyid de de'i phyir 'dir phung po la sogs pa'i don gyi khyad par las byed pa yin gyi /
translated: The same is true of the bases and elements. Therefore, the meaning of the aggregates, etc., is distinguished in this treatise by their function.

original: de yang dngos po'i khyad par shes par bya ba ma yin no //
analyzed: de yang dngos po'i khyad par shes par bya ba ma yin no //
translated: Moreover, that is not to be understood as a distinction of substance.

original: 'du byed la sogs pa'i sgra rnams so sor don du ma yin pa'i phyir phung po dang skye mched dang khams kyi don rnam grangs gzhan gyis te /
analyzed: 'du byed la sogs pa'i sgra rnams so sor don du ma yin pa'i phyir phung po dang skye mched dang khams kyi don rnam grangs gzhan gyis te /
translated: The terms “aggregate,” etc., are not synonyms because each has a different meaning.🔽Therefore, in order to demonstrate the meaning of the aggregates, etc.,

original: de'i phyir de ltar phung po la sogs pa'i don bstan pa'i phyir /🔽spungs dang skye sgo rigs kyi don //
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar phung po la sogs pa'i don bstan pa'i phyir / spungs dang skye sgo rigs kyi don //
translated: the root text states:

original: phung po skye mched khams rnams yin //🔽zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: phung po skye mched khams rnams yin // zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: The meaning of “aggregate” is a heap; the meaning of “base” is a gateway for the production of consciousness; the meaning of “element” is a type.🔽The meaning of “aggregate” is a heap, the meaning of “base” is a gateway for the production of consciousness, and the meaning of “element” is a type.

original: 'di rnams la spungs pa dang skye ba'i sgo dang rigs dag yod pas na zhes bya bar tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
analyzed: 'di rnams la spungs pa dang skye ba'i sgo dang rigs dag yod pas na zhes bya bar tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
translated: The term “aggregate” is applied to these because they are heaps. The term “base” is applied to them because they are gateways for the production of consciousness. The term “element” is applied to them because they are types.

original: de rnams kyang gang zhe na /
analyzed: de rnams kyang gang zhe na /
translated: What are they?

original: phung po skye mched khams rnams yin //
analyzed: phung po skye mched khams rnams yin //
translated: The aggregates, bases, and elements.

original: zhes bya ba ste sgra rnams yin no zhes bya ba ni tshig gi lhag ma'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ste sgra rnams yin no zhes bya ba ni tshig gi lhag ma'o //
translated: The words “and so on” indicate that the other aggregates are also to be understood in the same way.

original: phung po'i don ni spungs pa'i don yin no zhes bya bar ji ltar rtogs she na /
analyzed: phung po'i don ni spungs pa'i don yin no zhes bya bar ji ltar rtogs she na /
translated: How is it understood that the meaning of “aggregate” is the meaning of “heap”?

original: mdo las de thams cad gcig tu bsdus te gzugs kyi phung po zhes bya ba'i grangs su 'gro'o zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mdo las de thams cad gcig tu bsdus te gzugs kyi phung po zhes bya ba'i grangs su 'gro'o zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because a sutra declares: “All of that is collected into one and is called the form aggregate.”

original: mi rtag pa nyid kyis 'gag pa'o zhes bya ba ni 'gog pa ni rnam pa lngar 'gyur ba las mi rtag pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid kyi 'gog pa'i khyad bar ro //
analyzed: mi rtag pa nyid kyis 'gag pa'o zhes bya ba ni 'gog pa ni rnam pa lngar 'gyur ba las mi rtag pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid kyi 'gog pa'i khyad bar ro //
translated: Cessation is a specific form of cessation that has the characteristic of impermanence, from among the five aspects of impermanence.

original: gzhan dag ni snyoms par 'jug pa'i 'gog pa dang / skye ba'i 'gog pa dang so sor brtags pa'i 'gog pa dang / @69b so sor brtags pa ma yin pa'i 'gog pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan dag ni snyoms par 'jug pa'i 'gog pa dang / skye ba'i 'gog pa dang so sor brtags pa'i 'gog pa dang / @69b so sor brtags pa ma yin pa'i 'gog pa'o //
translated: The others are: the cessation of meditative attainment, the cessation of birth, the cessation that is a specific analytical cessation, and the cessation that is a specific non-analytical cessation.

original: 'dir mi rtag pa nyid kyis 'gags pa ni so sor brtags pa'i 'gags pa rnam par gcad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dir mi rtag pa nyid kyis 'gags pa ni so sor brtags pa'i 'gags pa rnam par gcad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Here, cessation by means of impermanence is distinguished from the cessation that is a specific analytical cessation.

original: gzugs kyi skabs las skye ba dang snyoms par 'jug pa'i 'gog pa dag ni sems dang sems las byung ba rnams nyid gzugs ma yin no zhes kha cig go //
analyzed: gzugs kyi skabs las skye ba dang snyoms par 'jug pa'i 'gog pa dag ni sems dang sems las byung ba rnams nyid gzugs ma yin no zhes kha cig go //
translated: Some say: The cessation of birth and the cessation of meditative attainment are not mind and mental factors, because they are not form.

original: de bzhin du tshor ba la sogs pa la yang rig par bya zhing /
analyzed: de bzhin du tshor ba la sogs pa la yang rig par bya zhing /
translated: The same should be understood for feeling and so on.

original: shin tu bstan pas rang gi mtshan nyid kyi 'gog pa shes par bya'o //
analyzed: shin tu bstan pas rang gi mtshan nyid kyi 'gog pa shes par bya'o //
translated: The cessation of specific characteristics should be understood through extensive explanation.

original: 'gog pa rnam par gcad pa'i don du mi rtag pa nyid smos par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: 'gog pa rnam par gcad pa'i don du mi rtag pa nyid smos par shes par bya'o //
translated: Impermanence should be understood as stated for the purpose of eliminating the meaning of cessation.

original: snyoms par 'jug pa dang skye ba dang so sor brtags pas 'gog pa rnams ma 'ongs pa nyid do //
analyzed: snyoms par 'jug pa dang skye ba dang so sor brtags pas 'gog pa rnams ma 'ongs pa nyid do //
translated: The cessation of meditative attainment, birth and analytical cessation are only future.

original: so sor brtags pas 'gog pa dus gsum pa can no //
analyzed: so sor brtags pas 'gog pa dus gsum pa can no //
translated: Analytical cessation is in the three times.

original: zag pa dang bcas pa rnams kyi rang gi mtshan nyid kyi 'gog pa ni da ltar byung ba nyid do //
analyzed: zag pa dang bcas pa rnams kyi rang gi mtshan nyid kyi 'gog pa ni da ltar byung ba nyid do //
translated: The cessation of specific characteristics of contaminated states is only present.

original: da ltar byung ba ni byung la ma 'gag sa pa'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: da ltar byung ba ni byung la ma 'gag sa pa'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: The present is that which has arisen and not yet ceased.

original: byung ba zhes bya ba de tsam zhig yin na ni 'das pa la yang thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: byung ba zhes bya ba de tsam zhig yin na ni 'das pa la yang thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If it were merely that which has occurred, then the past would also be present.

original: ma 'gags pa zhes bya ba de tsam zhig yin na ni ma 'ongs pa la yang thal bar 'gyur bas dgag pa'i phyir gnyis ka smos so //
analyzed: ma 'gags pa zhes bya ba de tsam zhig yin na ni ma 'ongs pa la yang thal bar 'gyur bas dgag pa'i phyir gnyis ka smos so //
translated: If it were merely that which has not ceased, then the future would also be present. Therefore, both are mentioned in order to exclude those.

original: nang ni rang gi rgyud la yod pa'o zhes bya ba ni mig la sogs pa dang gzugs la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: nang ni rang gi rgyud la yod pa'o zhes bya ba ni mig la sogs pa dang gzugs la sogs pa'o //
translated: Internal means that which exists in one’s own continuum, such as the eyes, etc., and forms, etc.

original: gzhan ni phyi'i 'o zhes bya ba ni gang zhig gzhan gyi rgyud kyi dang rgyud ma gtogs pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan ni phyi'i 'o zhes bya ba ni gang zhig gzhan gyi rgyud kyi dang rgyud ma gtogs pa'o //
translated: External means that which is other than that, that is, that which is in another’s continuum and that which is not included in a continuum.

original: yang na skye mched kyi sgo nas zhes bya ba ni mig la sogs pa nang gi skye mched drug dang gzugs la sogs pa phyi'i skye mched drug go //
analyzed: yang na skye mched kyi sgo nas zhes bya ba ni mig la sogs pa nang gi skye mched drug dang gzugs la sogs pa phyi'i skye mched drug go //
translated: Or, from the perspective of the sense bases, the six internal sense bases are the eyes, etc., and the six external sense bases are forms, etc.

original: de'i phyir gzhan gyi rgyud du gtogs pa'i gzugs la sogs pa rnams phyi'i 'o zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir gzhan gyi rgyud du gtogs pa'i gzugs la sogs pa rnams phyi'i 'o zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, forms, etc., that belong to another’s continuum are said to be external.

original: rigs pa ni thogs pa dang bcas pa ste skye mched bcu'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: rigs pa ni thogs pa dang bcas pa ste skye mched bcu'i rang bzhin no //
translated: Reason is that which is impeded, that is, it has the nature of the ten sense bases.

original: phra ba ni thogs pa med pa ste rnam par rig byed ma yin pa'i gzugs so //
analyzed: phra ba ni thogs pa med pa ste rnam par rig byed ma yin pa'i gzugs so //
translated: Subtle form is unimpeded, namely, non-revealing form.

original: yang na bltos pa pa yin te bil ba'i gzugs ni rags pa dang yin la skyu ru ra'i gzugs ni phra ba'o //
analyzed: yang na bltos pa pa yin te bil ba'i gzugs ni rags pa dang yin la skyu ru ra'i gzugs ni phra ba'o //
translated: Alternatively, it is relative, for the form of a bilva fruit is coarse and the form of a myrobalan fruit is subtle.

original: gal te bltos pa pa ma yin pa'i phyir ma grub pa ste rnam par gnas pa med do zhe na /
analyzed: gal te bltos pa pa ma yin pa'i phyir ma grub pa ste rnam par gnas pa med do zhe na /
translated: If you say that it is unestablished because it is not relative, since it is not established, it does not exist as a specific state.

original: ji ltar skyu ru ra'i gzugs de nyid bil ba dang rgya shug la bltos nas phra ba dang rags pa yang yin pas cung zad phra ba dang rags par gnas par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: ji ltar skyu ru ra'i gzugs de nyid bil ba dang rgya shug la bltos nas phra ba dang rags pa yang yin pas cung zad phra ba dang rags par gnas par mi 'gyur te /
translated: Just as the form of a myrobalan fruit is both subtle and coarse in relation to a bilva fruit and jujube fruit, it would not exist as slightly subtle or coarse,🔽like the near and far shores.

original: pha rol dang tshu rol bzhin no zhe na ma yin te bltos pas tha dad pa'i phyir ro @70a * //
analyzed: pha rol dang tshu rol bzhin no zhe na ma yin te bltos pas tha dad pa'i phyir ro @70a * //
translated: That is not so, because it is different due to relativity.

original: zhes bya ba la gang la bltos nas mngon par brjod pa de la bltos pa gnas skabs te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la gang la bltos nas mngon par brjod pa de la bltos pa gnas skabs te /
translated: That which is designated as subtle or coarse in relation to something else exists in a specific state in relation to that,

original: dper na pha dang bu bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na pha dang bu bzhin no //
translated: like a father and son.

original: ngan pa ni nyon mongs pa can te bsgribs pa dang mi dge ba rgya nom pa ni nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa ste dge ba dang ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa'o //
analyzed: ngan pa ni nyon mongs pa can te bsgribs pa dang mi dge ba rgya nom pa ni nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa ste dge ba dang ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa'o //
translated: The bad is defiled, that is, obscured and non-virtuous. The excellent is non-defiled, that is, virtuous and unobscured neutral.

original: ring ba ni 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa ste phan tshun da ltar byung ba'i dngos pos chod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ring ba ni 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa ste phan tshun da ltar byung ba'i dngos pos chod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The distant is the past and future, because they are obstructed by the present.

original: nye ba ni da ltar byung ba ste 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dag gis mchod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nye ba ni da ltar byung ba ste 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dag gis mchod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The near is the present, because it is not obstructed by the past and future.

original: yang na byed pa po 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa ni ring pa'o //
analyzed: yang na byed pa po 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa ni ring pa'o //
translated: Or, the past and future are distant because they are agents.

original: da ltar byung ba ni nye ba'o //
analyzed: da ltar byung ba ni nye ba'o //
translated: The present is near.

original: rnam par shes pa'i bar du yang de dang 'dra'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i bar du yang de dang 'dra'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: The same is true up to consciousness.

original: tshor ba dang 'du shes dang 'du byed gang ci yang rung /
analyzed: tshor ba dang 'du shes dang 'du byed gang ci yang rung /
translated: Whatever feeling, whatever perception, whatever volitional formations,

original: rnam par shes pa gang ci yang rung /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa gang ci yang rung /
translated: whatever consciousness there is,

original: 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar byung ba'am /
analyzed: 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar byung ba'am /
translated: whether past, future, or present,

original: nang gi'am / phyi'i 'am /
analyzed: nang gi'am / phyi'i 'am /
translated: internal or external,

original: rags pa'am / phra ba'am /
analyzed: rags pa'am / phra ba'am /
translated: coarse or subtle,🔽inferior or excellent,🔽far or near.

original: ngan pa'am / gya nom ba'am /
analyzed: ngan pa'am / gya nom ba'am /
translated: whether bad or good,

original: thag ring ba na yod pa gang yin pa'am /
analyzed: thag ring ba na yod pa gang yin pa'am /
translated: whether far or near,

original: nye ba na yod pa gang yin pa de thams cad gcig tu bsdus te rnam par shes pa'i phung po zhes bya ba'i grangs su 'gro'o zhes bya bar ro //
analyzed: nye ba na yod pa gang yin pa de thams cad gcig tu bsdus te rnam par shes pa'i phung po zhes bya ba'i grangs su 'gro'o zhes bya bar ro //
translated: all of that is included in the aggregate of consciousness.

original: de la rags pa dang phra ba ma gtogs pa 'das pa la sogs pa rnams ni de kho na ltar bstan to //
analyzed: de la rags pa dang phra ba ma gtogs pa 'das pa la sogs pa rnams ni de kho na ltar bstan to //
translated: Among those, the past, etc., are taught just as they are, except for the gross and subtle.

original: de nyid kyi phyir 'di ni khyad par yin te /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir 'di ni khyad par yin te /
translated: Therefore, this is the distinction:

original: zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: Thus it is said.

original: rags pa ni dbang po lnga la brten pa'o zhes bya ba ni rten gyi rjes su byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rags pa ni dbang po lnga la brten pa'o zhes bya ba ni rten gyi rjes su byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The gross is based on the five sense faculties, because it follows the support.

original: phra ba ni yid las byung ba'o zhes bya ba ni ma bsags pa dang thogs pa med pa'i rten can yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phra ba ni yid las byung ba'o zhes bya ba ni ma bsags pa dang thogs pa med pa'i rten can yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The subtle is mental, because it has an unaccumulated and unobstructed support.

original: yang na sa las kyang zhes bya ba la bltos pa nyid kyi phyir 'dod par gtogs pa ni rags pa nyid dang srid pa'i rtse mo pa ni phra ba nyid do //🔽'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa ni rang gi sgras brjod pa yin bzhin du ring por sgro btags pa dang ngan pa dang gya nom pa'i don yongs su rgyas par ma rangs pas bye brag tu smra ba rnams na re zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: yang na sa las kyang zhes bya ba la bltos pa nyid kyi phyir 'dod par gtogs pa ni rags pa nyid dang srid pa'i rtse mo pa ni phra ba nyid do // 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa ni rang gi sgras brjod pa yin bzhin du ring por sgro btags pa dang ngan pa dang gya nom pa'i don yongs su rgyas par ma rangs pas bye brag tu smra ba rnams na re zhes gsungs so //
translated: Or else, since it is said that “it is also from the earth,” the desire realm is coarse and the peak of existence is subtle.🔽The past and future are distant because they are not directly perceived, even though they are expressed by their own terms.

original: btsun pa zhes bya ba ni dpe ston sde pa'i gnas brtan chos skyob bo //
analyzed: btsun pa zhes bya ba ni dpe ston sde pa'i gnas brtan chos skyob bo //
translated: Bhadanta Dharmatrāta says that the past and future are subtle because they are not objects of the five sense faculties.

original: dbang po lngas gzung bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni phyi'i skye mched lnga'o //
analyzed: dbang po lngas gzung bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni phyi'i skye mched lnga'o //
translated: The five sense faculties apprehend the five external bases.

original: gzhan ni phra ba'o zhes bya ba ni yid kyi dbang po'i gzung par bya ba ste de yang mig la sogs pa skye mched gzugs can rnams dang rnam par rig byed ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan ni phra ba'o zhes bya ba ni yid kyi dbang po'i gzung par bya ba ste de yang mig la sogs pa skye mched gzugs can rnams dang rnam par rig byed ma yin pa'o //
translated: The other is subtle, that is, the object of the mental faculty. That is also the form bases such as the eyes and unmanifest form.

original: yid @70b du mi 'ong ba'o zhes bya ba ni yid dang mi mthun pa ste //
analyzed: yid @70b du mi 'ong ba'o zhes bya ba ni yid dang mi mthun pa ste //
translated: Unpleasant means disagreeable.

original: de ni yid du 'ong bar byed pa ma yin zhing dga' bar byed pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //🔽yid du 'ong ba ni yid dang mthun pa ste /
analyzed: de ni yid du 'ong bar byed pa ma yin zhing dga' bar byed pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro // yid du 'ong ba ni yid dang mthun pa ste /
translated: It is not pleasant, not delightful.🔽Pleasant means agreeable.

original: de ni yid du 'thad pa'i phyir yid du 'ong bar byed pa'o //🔽de lta na rdor ba'i don gyis ni ngan pa yin la /
analyzed: de ni yid du 'thad pa'i phyir yid du 'ong bar byed pa'o // de lta na rdor ba'i don gyis ni ngan pa yin la /
translated: It is pleasant because it is agreeable to the mind.

original: tshim par byed pa'i don gyis na gya nom pa'o //🔽ring ba ni yul mi snang ba can no zhes bya ba'i rten gyi yul gyi dbang du byas nas yin te /
analyzed: tshim par byed pa'i don gyis na gya nom pa'o // ring ba ni yul mi snang ba can no zhes bya ba'i rten gyi yul gyi dbang du byas nas yin te /
translated: Thus, the meaning of “bad” is “low” and the meaning of “excellent” is “satisfying.”🔽Far means having an invisible object.

original: 'ga' zhig nye yang phra ba'i phyir mi snang bas yul smos so //
analyzed: 'ga' zhig nye yang phra ba'i phyir mi snang bas yul smos so //
translated: This is from the perspective of the object that is the basis, because some objects are invisible due to being subtle, even though they are near.

original: cung zad cig nye ba yin yang chad pa'i phyir yul mi snang ba can du 'gyur mod kyi /
analyzed: cung zad cig nye ba yin yang chad pa'i phyir yul mi snang ba can du 'gyur mod kyi /
translated: Even though some are near, they become invisible due to being obstructed.

original: de'i rten ni gnas dang nyid kyis lta bar nus pas krita kyi rkyen ni nus pa'i don la rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i rten ni gnas dang nyid kyis lta bar nus pas krita kyi rkyen ni nus pa'i don la rig par bya'o //
translated: However, the basis is capable of seeing by nature, so the suffix krit should be known to have the meaning of capability.

original: nye ba ni yul snang ba can no zhes bya ba la skar ma la sogs pa ni cung zad cig ni ring yang snang ba de'i phyir yul snang ba can zhes smos so //
analyzed: nye ba ni yul snang ba can no zhes bya ba la skar ma la sogs pa ni cung zad cig ni ring yang snang ba de'i phyir yul snang ba can zhes smos so //
translated: Since stars and so on are distant, they are said to have an object that appears.

original: yang rgyu ci'i phyir btsun pas bye brag tu smra bas bshad pa'i ring ba dang nye ba la rnam pa gzhan du ring ba dang nye ba bstan ce na /
analyzed: yang rgyu ci'i phyir btsun pas bye brag tu smra bas bshad pa'i ring ba dang nye ba la rnam pa gzhan du ring ba dang nye ba bstan ce na /
translated: Why did the Venerable explain distant and nearby in a different way than the Vaibhasikas?

original: de'i phyir 'das pa la sogs pa rang gi ming gi bstan pa'i phyir te zhes bya ba la gsungs te /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'das pa la sogs pa rang gi ming gi bstan pa'i phyir te zhes bya ba la gsungs te /
translated: Therefore he said, “Because the past and so on are taught by their own names.”

original: 'di ltar cung zad cig rang gi sgras rab tu dbye bar smras pa ni rab tu dbye ba gzhan gyi mtshan nyid la 'jug pa ma yin te tha mi dad par 'gyur ro zhes dgongs so //🔽de dag gi nye ba dang ring ba dag ni zhes bya ba la tshor ba la sogs pa yul mi snang ba la brten pa ni ring ba yin la /
analyzed: 'di ltar cung zad cig rang gi sgras rab tu dbye bar smras pa ni rab tu dbye ba gzhan gyi mtshan nyid la 'jug pa ma yin te tha mi dad par 'gyur ro zhes dgongs so // de dag gi nye ba dang ring ba dag ni zhes bya ba la tshor ba la sogs pa yul mi snang ba la brten pa ni ring ba yin la /
translated: He thinks that if one says that something is distinguished by its own term, it is not engaged in the definition of another category because it would be undifferentiated.🔽Those that are nearby and distant to them🔽are distant and nearby.

original: yul snang ba la brten pa zhi nye ba'o //
analyzed: yul snang ba la brten pa zhi nye ba'o //
translated: Those that are based on objects that do not appear, such as feeling, are distant.🔽Those that are based on objects that appear are nearby.

original: snga ma bzhin no zhes bya ba ni dbang po la brten pa ni rags pa'o //
analyzed: snga ma bzhin no zhes bya ba ni dbang po la brten pa ni rags pa'o //
translated: As before means that that which is based on a faculty is gross.

original: yid las byung ba ni phra ba'o //
analyzed: yid las byung ba ni phra ba'o //
translated: That which arises from mind is subtle.

original: yang na sa las kyang ngo zhes bshad pa ltar ro //
analyzed: yang na sa las kyang ngo zhes bshad pa ltar ro //
translated: Or, it is as explained in the Abhidharma.

original: sems dang sems las byung ba rnams skye ba'i sgo'i don ni skye mched kyi don te zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: sems dang sems las byung ba rnams skye ba'i sgo'i don ni skye mched kyi don te zhes bya ba la /
translated: The meaning of sense base is the meaning of the door for the arising of mind and mental factors.🔽From what is this understood? From the etymological definition, which states:

original: gang las rtogs she na nges pa'i tshig tu na sems dang sems las byung ba rnams zhes rgya cher 'byung ngo //
analyzed: gang las rtogs she na nges pa'i tshig tu na sems dang sems las byung ba rnams zhes rgya cher 'byung ngo //
translated: “The sense bases are so called because they are the doors for the arising of mind and mental factors.”

original: skye ba ni 'ong ba la brjod do //
analyzed: skye ba ni 'ong ba la brjod do //
translated: Arising is said to be coming.

original: sems dang sems las byung ba rnams skye zhing bdag gi dngos por red pa'o //
analyzed: sems dang sems las byung ba rnams skye zhing bdag gi dngos por red pa'o //
translated: Mind and mental factors arise and are born as their own entities.

original: de'i phyir de dag ni sems dang sems las byung ba rnams skye ba mched par byed pas na skye mched de /🔽mched par byed /
analyzed: de'i phyir de dag ni sems dang sems las byung ba rnams skye ba mched par byed pas na skye mched de / mched par byed /
translated: Therefore, since they are the doors for the arising of mind and mental factors, they are sense bases.🔽They are bases because they are doors.

original: rgyas par byed /
analyzed: rgyas par byed /
translated: They are bases because they are expanded.

original: bdag gi dngos por red pa rgyun du gnas par byed ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: bdag gi dngos por red pa rgyun du gnas par byed ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: They are bases because they are born as their own entities and remain in a continuum.

original: ji skad du bram ze mig gi sgo nas ji srid gzugs @71a * //
analyzed: ji skad du bram ze mig gi sgo nas ji srid gzugs @71a * //
translated: As the Abhidharmakosa states,🔽The eye sense faculty sees visible form,

original: rnams la blta ba'i phyir zhes bya ba de la /
analyzed: rnams la blta ba'i phyir zhes bya ba de la /
translated: but the eye sense faculty does not see the eye sense faculty itself.

original: drug po rnams nyid sgo'i don du 'thad de /
analyzed: drug po rnams nyid sgo'i don du 'thad de /
translated: The meaning of door is suitable for the six sense faculties alone.

original: sems dang sems las byung ba'i sgo'i don ni bcu gnyis po rnams te /
analyzed: sems dang sems las byung ba'i sgo'i don ni bcu gnyis po rnams te /
translated: The meaning of door of mind and mental factors is the twelve.

original: mig la brten nas gzugs rnams la mig gi rnam par shes pa skye zhing gsum 'dus pa las reg pa dang lhan cig tshor ba dang 'du shes skye'o zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mig la brten nas gzugs rnams la mig gi rnam par shes pa skye zhing gsum 'dus pa las reg pa dang lhan cig tshor ba dang 'du shes skye'o zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is said that eye consciousness arises in dependence on the eye and visible form and contact arises from the union of the three and feeling and discernment arise simultaneously with that.

original: rigs kyi don ni khams kyi don te zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: rigs kyi don ni khams kyi don te zhes bya ba la /
translated: The meaning of lineage is the meaning of element.🔽From what is it understood that it is a lineage?

original: gang las khong du chud ce na rigs su 'dra ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang las khong du chud ce na rigs su 'dra ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is similar to a lineage.

original: de nyid kyi phyir dper na ri 'ga' zhig la zhes rgya cher gsungs te /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir dper na ri 'ga' zhig la zhes rgya cher gsungs te /
translated: Therefore it is said, for example, just as a mountain has many different types of minerals.

original: dper na gser dang sa bon gyi rigs la khams zhes brjod pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na gser dang sa bon gyi rigs la khams zhes brjod pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, gold and seed lineages are called elements.

original: rten tam rgyud ces rgyas par 'byung ba la /
analyzed: rten tam rgyud ces rgyas par 'byung ba la /
translated: The meaning of support and continuum is the meaning of sense base.

original: lus sam sems dang sems las byung ba'i rgyud gcig la'o //
analyzed: lus sam sems dang sems las byung ba'i rgyud gcig la'o //
translated: in a single stream of aggregates of form, mind, and mental factors.

original: gzhan dag na re skad cig ma'i rgyun gcig la'o zhes zer ro //
analyzed: gzhan dag na re skad cig ma'i rgyun gcig la'o zhes zer ro //
translated: Others say: in a single stream of moments.

original: rigs bco brgyad rnams ni sa bon bco brgyad la khams bco brgyad du brjod pa'o ;
analyzed: rigs bco brgyad rnams ni sa bon bco brgyad la khams bco brgyad du brjod pa'o ;
translated: The eighteen elements are called the eighteen seeds, because they are homogeneous causes.

original: / skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la mig gi dbang po ni mig gi dbang po phyis skyes pa dang ma skyes pa'i skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu yin te /
analyzed: / skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la mig gi dbang po ni mig gi dbang po phyis skyes pa dang ma skyes pa'i skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu yin te /
translated: Because they are homogeneous causes. The eye faculty is the homogeneous cause of a later eye faculty and of the form that is its object.

original: de bzhin du gzhan la yang brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du gzhan la yang brjod par bya'o //
translated: The same goes for the others.

original: 'dus ma byas khams ma yin par 'gyur ro zhe na zhes bya ba la snga ma dang phyi ma nyid med pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: 'dus ma byas khams ma yin par 'gyur ro zhe na zhes bya ba la snga ma dang phyi ma nyid med pa'i phyir te /
translated: If unconditioned states are not elements, they would not be included in the aggregates.

original: de ni 'ga'i yang skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni 'ga'i yang skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are not homogeneous causes for any.

original: de ni sems dang sems las byung ba rnams kyi dmigs pa dang bdag po'i rkyen du gyur pa'i phyir 'dus ma byas kyang 'byung gnas nyid du grub po //
analyzed: de ni sems dang sems las byung ba rnams kyi dmigs pa dang bdag po'i rkyen du gyur pa'i phyir 'dus ma byas kyang 'byung gnas nyid du grub po //
translated: Since it is the object and dominant condition of mind and mental factors, the unconditioned is also established as an element.

original: de lta na yang der skye mched dang khams kyi don dag dbyer med par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de lta na yang der skye mched dang khams kyi don dag dbyer med par 'gyur te /
translated: However, in that case, the meanings of sense base and element would be undifferentiated,

original: gnyi ga yang sems dang sems las byung ba'i 'byung gnas su gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnyi ga yang sems dang sems las byung ba'i 'byung gnas su gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because both are the source of mind and mental factors.

original: de'i phyir gzhan dag na re khams zhes bya ba'i sgra 'di ni rigs kyi tshig yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir gzhan dag na re khams zhes bya ba'i sgra 'di ni rigs kyi tshig yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: Therefore, others say that the term element dhātu is a word for type.

original: dper na gser la sogs pa'i rigs rnams phan tshun rigs tha dad pa de bzhin du mig la sogs pa dag kyang yin no //
analyzed: dper na gser la sogs pa'i rigs rnams phan tshun rigs tha dad pa de bzhin du mig la sogs pa dag kyang yin no //
translated: For example, the types of gold and so on are different types from each other and the eye and so on are also different types.

original: de ltar na rigs su 'ong bas khams kyi sgra 'di ni rigs kyi tshig yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na rigs su 'ong bas khams kyi sgra 'di ni rigs kyi tshig yin no //
translated: Thus, since it is a type, the term element is a word for type.

original: rang bzhin zhes bya ba la rang bzhin ni rigs gzhan rnam par bcad pa'i sgo nas rang gi ngo bo ste /
analyzed: rang bzhin zhes bya ba la rang bzhin ni rigs gzhan rnam par bcad pa'i sgo nas rang gi ngo bo ste /
translated: Nature means that which is differentiated from other types and is one’s own nature.

original: mtshan nyid mtshungs pa la bshad kyi rdzas kyi rang bzhin nyid ni ma yin no //🔽khams so sor mtshungs @71b par yang mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mtshan nyid mtshungs pa la bshad kyi rdzas kyi rang bzhin nyid ni ma yin no // khams so sor mtshungs @71b par yang mi 'gyur ro //

original: yid sngon du 'gro bas rnam par shes pa'i khams drug tu 'gyur ro //🔽ma 'ongs pa'i dus la ji ltar de dag de'i sngon du 'gro ba 'thad ce na /
analyzed: yid sngon du 'gro bas rnam par shes pa'i khams drug tu 'gyur ro // ma 'ongs pa'i dus la ji ltar de dag de'i sngon du 'gro ba 'thad ce na /
translated: The six consciousnesses are the basis of the mental faculty, but not of the six sense-faculties.🔽The six consciousnesses are the basis of the mental faculty, but not of the six sense-faculties.🔽The six consciousnesses are the basis of the mental faculty, but not of the six sense-faculties.

original: yid ji lta bar khams kyang de bzhin pas rnam par shes pa'i khams drug ces bya'o //
analyzed: yid ji lta bar khams kyang de bzhin pas rnam par shes pa'i khams drug ces bya'o //
translated: The six consciousnesses are the

original: bye brag tu smra ba rnams kyi skye mched dang khams ltar phung po yang rdzas su 'dod la /
analyzed: bye brag tu smra ba rnams kyi skye mched dang khams ltar phung po yang rdzas su 'dod la /
translated: Vaibhasikas assert that aggregates are substantial entities, like the bases and constituents.🔽Since a collection is the nature of the aggregation of many substantial entities, they think that it is impossible for a substantial entity to be a collection.

original: spungs pa yang rdzas du ma 'dus pa'i bdag nyid can yin pas rdzas su yod pa la spungs pa nyid mi srid do snyam ste 'dri ba ni /
analyzed: spungs pa yang rdzas du ma 'dus pa'i bdag nyid can yin pas rdzas su yod pa la spungs pa nyid mi srid do snyam ste 'dri ba ni /
translated: The question is asked:

original: gal te spungs pa'i don phung po zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gal te spungs pa'i don phung po zhes bya'o //
translated: If a collection is the meaning of aggregate,

original: spungs pa dang gang zag bzhin no zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: spungs pa dang gang zag bzhin no zhes bya ba la /
translated: like a collection and a person.

original: ji ltar 'bru la sogs pa rdzas du ma 'dus pa'i phyir btags pa'i phung po yin gyi rdzas kyi ma yin te /
analyzed: ji ltar 'bru la sogs pa rdzas du ma 'dus pa'i phyir btags pa'i phung po yin gyi rdzas kyi ma yin te /
translated: Just as a collection of many substantial entities such as grain is a nominal aggregate, not a substantial one,

original: 'bru la sogs pa gsal na de 'dzin pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'bru la sogs pa gsal na de 'dzin pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because when grain and so on are separated, it is not apprehended.

original: de bzhin du gang zag gi gzugs kyi phung po stong phrag nyid kyang rdzas su med pa yin te /🔽ji ltar yan lag tshogs las ni //
analyzed: de bzhin du gang zag gi gzugs kyi phung po stong phrag nyid kyang rdzas su med pa yin te / ji ltar yan lag tshogs las ni //
translated: So too, the five thousand aggregates of the person are not substantial.🔽Just as a chariot is not imputed

original: shing rta zhes ni mi btags pa //
analyzed: shing rta zhes ni mi btags pa //
translated: to the collection of its parts,

original: de bzhin phung po la brten nas //
analyzed: de bzhin phung po la brten nas //
translated: so too, in dependence on the aggregates,

original: kun rdzob tu ni sems can brjod //
analyzed: kun rdzob tu ni sems can brjod //
translated: the conventional sentient being is expressed.

original: ces bya ba'i lung las so //
analyzed: ces bya ba'i lung las so //
translated: This is stated in the scriptures.

original: de bzhin du 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa la sogs pa'i rdzas tshogs pa'i bdag nyid can yin pa'i phyir phung po rnams kyang btags pa'i yod par 'gyur na /
analyzed: de bzhin du 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa la sogs pa'i rdzas tshogs pa'i bdag nyid can yin pa'i phyir phung po rnams kyang btags pa'i yod par 'gyur na /
translated: Likewise, since the aggregates are the nature of a collection of past, future, and present substances, they would be imputedly existent.

original: de yang 'dod pa ma yin pas phung po'i don gzhan zhig brjod par bya dgos so zhe na ma yin te /
analyzed: de yang 'dod pa ma yin pas phung po'i don gzhan zhig brjod par bya dgos so zhe na ma yin te /
translated: But since this is unacceptable, you must state another meaning of aggregate.

original: rdul phra rab gcig kyang phung po yin pa'i phyir rdul phra rab gcig pu yang phung por brjod de /
analyzed: rdul phra rab gcig kyang phung po yin pa'i phyir rdul phra rab gcig pu yang phung por brjod de /
translated: This is not so, because a single subtle particle is an aggregate.

original: gzhan du na phung po rnams rang bzhin med pa'i phyir phung po rnams skye mched dang khams ltar chos rnams kyi rang bzhin bsdus par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan du na phung po rnams rang bzhin med pa'i phyir phung po rnams skye mched dang khams ltar chos rnams kyi rang bzhin bsdus par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If it were otherwise, since the aggregates would lack intrinsic reality, they would not subsume the intrinsic reality of all phenomena, like the sense bases and elements.

original: phung po rnams btags pa'i yod pa rang bzhin nyid ma yin na /
analyzed: phung po rnams btags pa'i yod pa rang bzhin nyid ma yin na /
translated: If the aggregates are not intrinsically real, but imputedly existent,

original: de lta 'o na 'di gzhan dang 'gal lo //
analyzed: de lta 'o na 'di gzhan dang 'gal lo //
translated: then this contradicts other statements.

original: 'o na spungs pa'i don ni phung po'i don to zhes bya ba ma yin te /
analyzed: 'o na spungs pa'i don ni phung po'i don to zhes bya ba ma yin te /
translated: The meaning of aggregate is not the meaning of a heap.

original: dang por spungs pa nye bar len pa dag 'dir don @72a * //
analyzed: dang por spungs pa nye bar len pa dag 'dir don @72a * //
translated: The first is the appropriation of the collection of aggregates.

original: gyi spungs pa nyid don ma yin te rdzas dang rnam grangs yin pa'i phyir ro zhes slob dpon 'dus bzang zer ro //
analyzed: gyi spungs pa nyid don ma yin te rdzas dang rnam grangs yin pa'i phyir ro zhes slob dpon 'dus bzang zer ro //
translated: Here, the collection of aggregates is not the meaning of the term because it is a substance and a category.🔽This is the assertion of Master Saṅghabhadra.

original: rdul phra rab gcig pu yang dus gsum gyis bsdus pa'i phyir blos mngon par bsdus pa'i sgo nas spungs pa nyid 'thad pas phung po rnams btags pa'i yod pa ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: rdul phra rab gcig pu yang dus gsum gyis bsdus pa'i phyir blos mngon par bsdus pa'i sgo nas spungs pa nyid 'thad pas phung po rnams btags pa'i yod pa ma yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that a single subtle particle is subsumed by the three times and it is tenable that it is a collection from the perspective of the mind that subsumes it, the aggregates do not exist as imputed entities.

original: de nyid la smras pa /
analyzed: de nyid la smras pa /
translated: To that we say:

original: de lta na yang mdo dang 'gal te /
analyzed: de lta na yang mdo dang 'gal te /
translated: Even so, this contradicts the sūtras,

original: de dag thams cad gcig tu bsdus te gzugs kyi phung po zhes bya ba'i grangs su 'gro'o zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag thams cad gcig tu bsdus te gzugs kyi phung po zhes bya ba'i grangs su 'gro'o zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it says, “All of those are subsumed in one and are counted as the form aggregate.”

original: slob dpon 'phags pa'i 'bangs na re /🔽phan tshun bltos pas rdzas ni rdzas ma dra /
analyzed: slob dpon 'phags pa'i 'bangs na re / phan tshun bltos pas rdzas ni rdzas ma dra /
translated: Āryāsanga says:🔽A substance is not a substance due to mutual dependence.

original: phung po gang la gcig ni med de phung po de la bltos pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phung po gang la gcig ni med de phung po de la bltos pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: No single aggregate exists because it is not dependent on the other aggregates.

original: ji ltar gzhan du na mi rtag pa dang sdug bsngal ba dang stong pa zhes bya ba las spungs par bya ba dang yongs su shes par bya ba gang zag btags pa nye bar len pa'i phung por gyur ba rdzas su yod pa nyid nyams kyi chos kyi🔽khams 'di rnams yin no zhe na ma yin te /
analyzed: ji ltar gzhan du na mi rtag pa dang sdug bsngal ba dang stong pa zhes bya ba las spungs par bya ba dang yongs su shes par bya ba gang zag btags pa nye bar len pa'i phung por gyur ba rdzas su yod pa nyid nyams kyi chos kyi khams 'di rnams yin no zhe na ma yin te /
translated: Just as impermanence, suffering and emptiness are imputed to the appropriated aggregates, the person is also imputed to the appropriated aggregates.

original: gang zag ni btags par yod pa nyid de ming tsam nyid kyi byir ro //🔽de lta na bon bum pa dang snam bu la sogs pa yang rdzas su yod par thal bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: gang zag ni btags par yod pa nyid de ming tsam nyid kyi byir ro // de lta na bon bum pa dang snam bu la sogs pa yang rdzas su yod par thal bar 'gyur te /
translated: But that is not so, because the person is imputedly existent, it is a mere name.🔽If it were substantially existent, it would follow that such things as pots and cloth would also be substantially existent.

original: de dag la yang rdzas dang rdzas phan tshun ltos ba bum pa dang snam bu'i don de ltar brjod nus pas gzugs ji snyed pa'i rdzas de snyed phung por 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag la yang rdzas dang rdzas phan tshun ltos ba bum pa dang snam bu'i don de ltar brjod nus pas gzugs ji snyed pa'i rdzas de snyed phung por 'gyur ro //
translated: For, in dependence on their parts, one can say that they are substantially existent.

original: de ltar yin na de dag thams cad gcig tu bsdus te gzugs kyi phung po zhes bya ba'i grangs su 'gro'o zhes bya ba de dang 'gal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar yin na de dag thams cad gcig tu bsdus te gzugs kyi phung po zhes bya ba'i grangs su 'gro'o zhes bya ba de dang 'gal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If that were so, it would contradict the statement, “All of those are included in one and are counted as the form heap.”

original: de la smras pa /
analyzed: de la smras pa /
translated: To that, we reply:🔽No, because they are mutually dependent, the name “many” is applied to the many that are called “heaps.” The name “many” is applied to those, not to a single object.

original: mi 'gyur te phan tshun bltos pas phung po zhes bya ba mang po rnams kyi ming 'di lta ste mang po rnams so zhes bya ba gzhan ma yin pa de rnams la zhes bgrang bar bya ste yul gcig la ni ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di dpe'i🔽zhes zer ro //
analyzed: mi 'gyur te phan tshun bltos pas phung po zhes bya ba mang po rnams kyi ming 'di lta ste mang po rnams so zhes bya ba gzhan ma yin pa de rnams la zhes bgrang bar bya ste yul gcig la ni ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di dpe'i zhes zer ro //
translated: This is the example.

original: 'di ni mi mthun pa nye bar bkod pa ste /
analyzed: 'di ni mi mthun pa nye bar bkod pa ste /
translated: This is an inappropriate analogy.

original: de la yang mang po rnams nyid re re la ni ma yin te 'das pa'i rdzas rnams la phung po zhes bya ba med par mtshungs so //
analyzed: de la yang mang po rnams nyid re re la ni ma yin te 'das pa'i rdzas rnams la phung po zhes bya ba med par mtshungs so //
translated: Moreover, the many are not applied to each individual, just as the term “heap” is not applied to individual grains of sand.

original: ci ste de rnams mtha' dag nyid la phung por btags pa nyid na sran ma m'a sha'i phung po bzhin du sems can gyi phung po zhes bya ba btags par grub po //
analyzed: ci ste de rnams mtha' dag nyid la phung por btags pa nyid na sran ma m'a sha'i phung po bzhin du sems can gyi phung po zhes bya ba btags par grub po //
translated: If the term “heap” is applied to the totality of those, then just as there is a “heap of beans,” it is established that the term “sentient being” is a designation.

original: lus kyang mi rtag pa dang sdug bsngal pa dang stong pa las gzhan ma yin te so sor 'gro bar brjod pas de btags pa ma yin pa med do //
analyzed: lus kyang mi rtag pa dang sdug bsngal pa dang stong pa las gzhan ma yin te so sor 'gro bar brjod pas de btags pa ma yin pa med do //
translated: The body is also not other than impermanent, painful, and empty. Since it is said to go separately, it is not a designation.

original: de ltar sems can rnams kyang @72b mi rtag par gsungs te /
analyzed: de ltar sems can rnams kyang @72b mi rtag par gsungs te /
translated: Thus, sentient beings are also said to be impermanent.

original: gang gi nub mo kho na nas //
analyzed: gang gi nub mo kho na nas //
translated: On the very night🔽that a person first enters

original: mngal du dang po 'jug pa'i mi //
analyzed: mngal du dang po 'jug pa'i mi //
translated: the womb,

original: sdod pa med par 'gro 'gyur te //
analyzed: sdod pa med par 'gro 'gyur te //
translated: he goes without stopping.

original: song ba las kyang ldog pa med //
analyzed: song ba las kyang ldog pa med //
translated: He does not return from where he went.

original: ces so // sems can ni rdzas su yod pa yin pa la nye bar gnas pa las gdul bya'i khyad par lam ltos nas sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyis chos bstan te /
analyzed: ces so // sems can ni rdzas su yod pa yin pa la nye bar gnas pa las gdul bya'i khyad par lam ltos nas sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyis chos bstan te /
translated: Sentient beings exist substantially. The Bhagavān Buddhas teach the Dharma in dependence on the particular disciples who are present and who are to be guided.

original: de ltar phung po zhes bya ba yang mi rtag par bstan pa dang 'gal ba med do //
analyzed: de ltar phung po zhes bya ba yang mi rtag par bstan pa dang 'gal ba med do //
translated: Thus, there is no contradiction in teaching that the so-called aggregates are impermanent.

original: btags par mthong ba dang btags pa nye bar bzung nas nags tshal gyi ljon shing dang dmag dpung dang dmag dpung gi yan lag rnams ji snyed pa de rnams ni skrag pa 'phel ba nyid kyis ma bris shing de ltar rnam par mi spyod do //
analyzed: btags par mthong ba dang btags pa nye bar bzung nas nags tshal gyi ljon shing dang dmag dpung dang dmag dpung gi yan lag rnams ji snyed pa de rnams ni skrag pa 'phel ba nyid kyis ma bris shing de ltar rnam par mi spyod do //
translated: and the trees in a forest and the parts of an army are not written about and are not so analyzed because they increase fear.

original: gzhan dag na re khur khyer ba'i don nam zhes bya ba la bya ba nyid khur yin pa na bya ba'i khur ro //
analyzed: gzhan dag na re khur khyer ba'i don nam zhes bya ba la bya ba nyid khur yin pa na bya ba'i khur ro //
translated: Others say: The meaning of “that which is carried” is “that which is the burden of activity.”

original: khyer ba ni de la rag las pa nyid do //
analyzed: khyer ba ni de la rag las pa nyid do //
translated: “That which is carried” is the dependence on that.

original: de la rag lus shing bdag nyid rnyed ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de la rag lus shing bdag nyid rnyed ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it is dependent on that and it is obtained by itself.

original: 'di ltar lus kyi phyogs gang zhig khur khyer bar nus pa ni phrag pa yin la ;
analyzed: 'di ltar lus kyi phyogs gang zhig khur khyer bar nus pa ni phrag pa yin la ;
translated: Thus, the part of the body that is able to carry a burden is the shoulder.

original: 'di yang bya ba'i khur khyer ba'i don phung po'i don yin no //
analyzed: 'di yang bya ba'i khur khyer ba'i don phung po'i don yin no //
translated: And the meaning of “aggregate” is the meaning of “burden of activity that is carried.”

original: gang zhig gang gi bya ba'i khur yin zhe na /
analyzed: gang zhig gang gi bya ba'i khur yin zhe na /
translated: What is the burden of activity of what?

original: re zhig thun mong du ni phung po lnga rnams kyi skye mched drug yin te /
analyzed: re zhig thun mong du ni phung po lnga rnams kyi skye mched drug yin te /
translated: In general, the six sense spheres are the burden of activity of the five aggregates.

original: ji skad du ming dang gzugs kyi rkyen gyis skye mched drug ces bshad pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: ji skad du ming dang gzugs kyi rkyen gyis skye mched drug ces bshad pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, it is like the explanation: “The condition of name-and-form is the six sense bases.”

original: gzugs dang rnam par shes pa gnyis kyi bya ba'i khur ni reg pa ste skye mched drug gi rkyen gyis reg pa zhes 'byung ba'i phyir dang / tshor ba'i ni sred pa ste tshor ba'i rkyen gyis sred pa zhes dang / 'du byed rnams kyi rnam par shes pa dang rnam par shes pa'i ming dang gzugs te /
analyzed: gzugs dang rnam par shes pa gnyis kyi bya ba'i khur ni reg pa ste skye mched drug gi rkyen gyis reg pa zhes 'byung ba'i phyir dang / tshor ba'i ni sred pa ste tshor ba'i rkyen gyis sred pa zhes dang / 'du byed rnams kyi rnam par shes pa dang rnam par shes pa'i ming dang gzugs te /
translated: The function of form and consciousness is contact, because it says, “The condition of the six sense bases is contact,” and the function of feeling is craving, because it says, “The condition of feeling is craving,” and the function of formation is consciousness and name-and-form,

original: 'du byed kyi rkyen gyis rnam par shes pa dang / rnam par shes pa'i rkyen gyis ming dang gzugs zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'du byed kyi rkyen gyis rnam par shes pa dang / rnam par shes pa'i rkyen gyis ming dang gzugs zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it says, “The condition of formation is consciousness” and “The condition of consciousness is name-and-form.”

original: de bzhin du gzhan la yang sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du gzhan la yang sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: This should be applied in the same way to the others.

original: de nyid rdzas gcig kyang phung po nyid du grub la tshogs pa rnams kyi re res kyang bya ba'i khur khyer bar nus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de nyid rdzas gcig kyang phung po nyid du grub la tshogs pa rnams kyi re res kyang bya ba'i khur khyer bar nus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Although they are one substance, they are established as aggregates because each of the collections is able to bear the burden of function.

original: yongs su chad pa'i don zhes rgya cher 'byung ba la /
analyzed: yongs su chad pa'i don zhes rgya cher 'byung ba la /
translated: The meaning of “limited” is explained at length.

original: lhan cig skye ba'i 'byung ba dang 'byung ba las gyur pa rnams dang / sems dang sems las byung ba rnams gcig kyang blos dpyad par bya ba nus pas yongs su chad pa'o //
analyzed: lhan cig skye ba'i 'byung ba dang 'byung ba las gyur pa rnams dang / sems dang sems las byung ba rnams gcig kyang blos dpyad par bya ba nus pas yongs su chad pa'o //
translated: The primary elements and the derivative form that are co-arisen, and the mind and mental factors, are limited because they can be analyzed by the mind.

original: bya bar 'dod pa ni 'dus byas so //
analyzed: bya bar 'dod pa ni 'dus byas so //
translated: That which is desired to be done is conditioned.

original: de la yongs su chad pa gang yin pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar byung ba rnams te /🔽de ltar phung @73a * //
analyzed: de la yongs su chad pa gang yin pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar byung ba rnams te / de ltar phung @73a * //
translated: That which is limited and that which is past and present are conditioned.

original: po rnams rdzas su yod pa yin gyi btags par ni ma yin no //
analyzed: po rnams rdzas su yod pa yin gyi btags par ni ma yin no //
translated: Thus the aggregates exist substantially and not nominally.

original: de ni mdo dang 'gal lo zhes rgyas par 'byung ba la /
analyzed: de ni mdo dang 'gal lo zhes rgyas par 'byung ba la /
translated: This contradicts the sutra, which states in detail:

original: slob dpon 'dus bzang na re /🔽skye mched dang khams kyi don gyi mdo gzung bar bya'i /
analyzed: slob dpon 'dus bzang na re / skye mched dang khams kyi don gyi mdo gzung bar bya'i /
translated: Master Samghabhadra says:🔽The sutra should be interpreted in terms of the meaning of the bases and elements.

original: phung po'i don gyi mdo ni mi 'dod do zhes zer ro //
analyzed: phung po'i don gyi mdo ni mi 'dod do zhes zer ro //
translated: The meaning of the aggregates should not be accepted.

original: rigs pa 'di ni ci de la rigs na skye mched dang phung po'i don gyi mdo las ma gsungs pa la de ltar mdo dang 'gal ba yod pa ma yin la /
analyzed: rigs pa 'di ni ci de la rigs na skye mched dang phung po'i don gyi mdo las ma gsungs pa la de ltar mdo dang 'gal ba yod pa ma yin la /
translated: If this reasoning is correct, then the meaning of the term “aggregate” is not stated in the sutra that explains the meaning of the term “source” and “aggregate,” and it is not contradictory that the meaning of the term “aggregate” is not stated in that sutra.

original: phung po'i don gyi mdo las bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pas de dang mi 'gal ba gzhan ma yin no //
analyzed: phung po'i don gyi mdo las bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pas de dang mi 'gal ba gzhan ma yin no //
translated: And it is not contradictory that the meaning of the term “aggregate” is not stated in the sutra that explains the meaning of the term “source” and “aggregate” because the Bhagavān stated the meaning of the term “aggregate” in the sutra that explains the meaning of the term “source.”

original: bsgrub bar nus pa'i mdor yang phung po'i don nyid gsungs te de thams cad gcig tu bsdus shing zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bsgrub bar nus pa'i mdor yang phung po'i don nyid gsungs te de thams cad gcig tu bsdus shing zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The sutra that can be interpreted literally also states the meaning of the term “aggregate” because it says, “All of them are included in one.”

original: re res ni mi nus pa nyid do //
analyzed: re res ni mi nus pa nyid do //
translated: But each cannot bear the burden of the meaning of the term “aggregate.”

original: bya ba'i khur khyer ba'i don nam yongs su chad pa'i don ni phung po'i zhes shes par bya'o //
analyzed: bya ba'i khur khyer ba'i don nam yongs su chad pa'i don ni phung po'i zhes shes par bya'o //
translated: The meaning of the term “aggregate” should be understood as the meaning of “that which bears the burden of action” or the meaning of “that which is completely cut.”

original: thal bar 'gyur ba'i sgo nas phung po rnams btags pa'i yod pa nyid bzlog par 'dod bas na ;
analyzed: thal bar 'gyur ba'i sgo nas phung po rnams btags pa'i yod pa nyid bzlog par 'dod bas na ;
translated: Since the existence of the aggregates as imputed is refuted through the consequence that they would be permanent,

original: de ltar na skye mche da gzugs can rnams kyang zhes bya ba rgyas par smos te /
analyzed: de ltar na skye mche da gzugs can rnams kyang zhes bya ba rgyas par smos te /
translated: he says, “In that case, the physical sources would also be permanent.”

original: thogs pa med pa'i skye mched bkag ste bcu char yang gzung ngo //
analyzed: thogs pa med pa'i skye mched bkag ste bcu char yang gzung ngo //
translated: The ten are also apprehended by blocking the unimpeded sense bases.🔽Because many atoms of the eye, etc. serve as the door for the arising of consciousness.

original: mig la sogs pa'i rdul phra rab mang po rnams skye ba'i sgor gyur ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni btags pa'i yod pa nyid la rgyur smras pa ste /
analyzed: mig la sogs pa'i rdul phra rab mang po rnams skye ba'i sgor gyur ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni btags pa'i yod pa nyid la rgyur smras pa ste /
translated: This is said to be the cause of imputed existence.

original: rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga ni bsags pa la brten pa dang dmigs pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga ni bsags pa la brten pa dang dmigs pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the five collections of consciousness are supported on and focus on the accumulation.

original: mig gi dbang po'i rdul phra rab dang kha dog gi rdul phra rab mang po bsags pa kho na rten dang dmigs pa'i ngo bos mig gi rnam par shes pa mtshungs par ldan pa dang bcas pa skye ba'i sgor 'gyur te /
analyzed: mig gi dbang po'i rdul phra rab dang kha dog gi rdul phra rab mang po bsags pa kho na rten dang dmigs pa'i ngo bos mig gi rnam par shes pa mtshungs par ldan pa dang bcas pa skye ba'i sgor 'gyur te /
translated: The accumulation of many atoms of the eye faculty and many atoms of form serve as the door for the arising of eye consciousness together with its concomitant mental factors, in the aspect of support and focal object.

original: lus kyi skye mched dang reg bya'i skye mched kyi bar du yang de dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: lus kyi skye mched dang reg bya'i skye mched kyi bar du yang de dang 'dra'o //
translated: The same applies up to the sense base of body and the sense base of tactility.

original: de'i phyir rdzas du ma 'dus pa'i phyir mig gi skye mched la sogs pa btags par yod pa nyid do //
analyzed: de'i phyir rdzas du ma 'dus pa'i phyir mig gi skye mched la sogs pa btags par yod pa nyid do //
translated: Therefore, the sense bases of eye, etc. are imputedly existent because many substances are accumulated.

original: ma yin te tshogs pa rnams re re nas rgyu'i ngo bor gyur ba'i phyir zhes bya ba la /🔽gang mang po rnams skye ba'i sgor gyur pa'i phyir /
analyzed: ma yin te tshogs pa rnams re re nas rgyu'i ngo bor gyur ba'i phyir zhes bya ba la / gang mang po rnams skye ba'i sgor gyur pa'i phyir /
translated: No, because each of the collections is the entity of the cause.

original: zhes bshad pa de ltar khas mi len te /
analyzed: zhes bshad pa de ltar khas mi len te /
translated: We do not accept that because many are the door for generating consciousness,

original: gang gi phyir tshogs thams cad kyang re re nas rgyur 'gyur te mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa rnams rdul phra rab re re la brten pa'i phyir rdul phra rab re re la dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang gi phyir tshogs thams cad kyang re re nas rgyur 'gyur te mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa rnams rdul phra rab re re la brten pa'i phyir rdul phra rab re re la dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because each of the collections is the cause, since the consciousnesses such as eye consciousness are supported on each of the subtle particles, they focus on each subtle particle.

original: ci ste ci'i phyir bsags pa kho na rten yin zhing bsags pa kho na dmigs @73b pa yin snyam du sems na /
analyzed: ci ste ci'i phyir bsags pa kho na rten yin zhing bsags pa kho na dmigs @73b pa yin snyam du sems na /
translated: But if you think, why is only the collection the support and why is only the collection the focal object?

original: de nyid kyi phyir rdzas du ma 'dus pa nyid mi 'da' ste bltos pa dang bcas pa rnams rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir rdzas du ma 'dus pa nyid mi 'da' ste bltos pa dang bcas pa rnams rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of that, many substances do not assemble, because those that are related are the cause.

original: 'di ltar gal te re re zhing skye mched du 'gyur na ni gzugs can ma yin pa'i skye mched ltar gnyis pa la mi bltos par 'gyur ba zhig go snyam na /
analyzed: 'di ltar gal te re re zhing skye mched du 'gyur na ni gzugs can ma yin pa'i skye mched ltar gnyis pa la mi bltos par 'gyur ba zhig go snyam na /
translated: If each were a sense base, then like the nonphysical sense bases, they would not rely on a second.

original: 'di'i len du yul lhan cig byed pa yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba rgyas par gsungs te /
analyzed: 'di'i len du yul lhan cig byed pa yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba rgyas par gsungs te /
translated: In response to this, Vasubandhu states, because the object is a coemergent cause.

original: gal te lhan cig byed pa la bltos pa dang bcas pa rnams rgyur gyur pa'i phyir dbang po'i rdul phra rab rnams re re nas skye mched nyid du mi 'dod na /
analyzed: gal te lhan cig byed pa la bltos pa dang bcas pa rnams rgyur gyur pa'i phyir dbang po'i rdul phra rab rnams re re nas skye mched nyid du mi 'dod na /
translated: If you do not assert that the subtle particles of the sense faculties are sense bases individually because they are causes that rely on coemergent causes,

original: de ltar mig la sogs pa dbang po'i gzugs la sogs pa dag las logs shig tu skye mched du mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar mig la sogs pa dbang po'i gzugs la sogs pa dag las logs shig tu skye mched du mi 'gyur ro //
translated: then form such as the eye faculty would not be a separate sense base from the sense faculty.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na yul lhan cig byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na yul lhan cig byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Why? Because the object is a coemergent cause.

original: yul la bltos pa med par dbang po rnams 'ba' zhig sems dang sems las byung ba rnams kyi skye ba'i sgor mi 'gyur la /
analyzed: yul la bltos pa med par dbang po rnams 'ba' zhig sems dang sems las byung ba rnams kyi skye ba'i sgor mi 'gyur la /
translated: The sense faculties alone are not the door of arising for minds and mental factors without relying on objects.

original: khyod kyi ltar na mig gi dbang po gzugs la sogs pa dag las logs shig tu skye mched du mi 'gyur ba yang ma yin te /
analyzed: khyod kyi ltar na mig gi dbang po gzugs la sogs pa dag las logs shig tu skye mched du mi 'gyur ba yang ma yin te /
translated: But according to you, the eye sense-faculty would not be a sense-sphere separate from visible form, etc.

original: mdo las skye mched bcu gnyis so zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mdo las skye mched bcu gnyis so zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: But the Sūtra says that there are twelve sense-spheres.

original: de ltar na mig la sogs pa'i rdul phra rab rnams kyang so sor skye mched yin no zhes bya bar shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar na mig la sogs pa'i rdul phra rab rnams kyang so sor skye mched yin no zhes bya bar shes par bya'o //
translated: Thus you should understand that the atoms of the eye sense-faculty, etc. are also separate sense-spheres.

original: yang ci'i phyir mig la sogs pa rdul phra rab rnams yul gyi rdul phra rab rnams kyi lhan cig byed pa yin yang tha dad du byas she na /
analyzed: yang ci'i phyir mig la sogs pa rdul phra rab rnams yul gyi rdul phra rab rnams kyi lhan cig byed pa yin yang tha dad du byas she na /
translated: Why do you make a separate sense-sphere of the atoms of the eye sense-faculty, etc. , even though they are the co-operating cause of the object-field?

original: de dag lhan cig byed pa yin pa'i phyir gcig tu byas pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: de dag lhan cig byed pa yin pa'i phyir gcig tu byas pa ma yin gyi /
translated: They are not made into one sense-sphere because they are the co-operating cause of the object-field.

original: 'o na ci zhen rigs dang spyod yul dang rnam par shes pa 'dra ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'o na ci zhen rigs dang spyod yul dang rnam par shes pa 'dra ba'i phyir ro //
translated: But rather because they are of the same type, have the same object-field and the same consciousness.

original: yul gyi rdul phra rab rnams ni rigs tha dad pas 'di dag gi spyod yul du yod pa ma yin te ;
analyzed: yul gyi rdul phra rab rnams ni rigs tha dad pas 'di dag gi spyod yul du yod pa ma yin te ;
translated: The atoms of the object-field are not of the same type as the atoms of the eye sense-faculty, etc. , for they are not the basis of the visual consciousness, etc.

original: sngon po la sogs pa thams cad kyis rnam par shes pa skyed pa la mig gi dbang po'i rdul phra rab rnams kyang thun mong ba'i phyir sngon po la sogs pa'i rdul phra rab rnams kho na ni ma yin pas gcig tu ma byas te /
analyzed: sngon po la sogs pa thams cad kyis rnam par shes pa skyed pa la mig gi dbang po'i rdul phra rab rnams kyang thun mong ba'i phyir sngon po la sogs pa'i rdul phra rab rnams kho na ni ma yin pas gcig tu ma byas te /
translated: The atoms of the eye faculty are also common to the generation of consciousness by all blue, etc. , and are not just the atoms of blue, etc. , so they are not counted as one.

original: de bzhin du gzhan la yang rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du gzhan la yang rig par bya'o //
translated: The same should be understood for the others.

original: bye brag tu bshad pa las ni zhes bya ba 'dis phung po rnams btags par yod pa yin no zhes ston par byed do //
analyzed: bye brag tu bshad pa las ni zhes bya ba 'dis phung po rnams btags par yod pa yin no zhes ston par byed do //
translated: The Abhidharmakośa declares, “The aggregates are only nominally real.”

original: yang ci phung po 'di btags pa'i yod par lta bar byed na 'das ba'i ming la sogs pa gcig tu bsdoms pa la bltos te ma bltos pa'i mtha' 'jug par byed pa de yis de la bltos nas phung po zhes brjod de /🔽ma bltos @74a * //
analyzed: yang ci phung po 'di btags pa'i yod par lta bar byed na 'das ba'i ming la sogs pa gcig tu bsdoms pa la bltos te ma bltos pa'i mtha' 'jug par byed pa de yis de la bltos nas phung po zhes brjod de / ma bltos @74a * //
translated: If the aggregates are only nominally real, then the past, etc., are only nominally real, since they are included in the aggregates.🔽The aggregates are not real in the ultimate sense, but are like a heap.

original: par spungs pa bzhin du gcig gi ngo bor mi rigs so //
analyzed: par spungs pa bzhin du gcig gi ngo bor mi rigs so //
translated: It is not logical that they are one entity without depending on the collection.

original: rang gi tshogs pa can ni tshogs par bshad pas rdul phra rab gcig kyang phung po'i phyogs zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rang gi tshogs pa can ni tshogs par bshad pas rdul phra rab gcig kyang phung po'i phyogs zhes bya'o //
translated: Since a collection is explained as a collection of parts, even a single subtle particle is called a part of an aggregate.

original: yang na phung po btags pa la bltos pa zhes pa ste phung por gyur pas btags pa la bltos pa'o //
analyzed: yang na phung po btags pa la bltos pa zhes pa ste phung por gyur pas btags pa la bltos pa'o //
translated: Alternatively, it is called dependent on imputed aggregates.

original: gzhan dag na re btags par yod pa'i phung po ni gzhan la bltos pa'o zhes zer ro //
analyzed: gzhan dag na re btags par yod pa'i phung po ni gzhan la bltos pa'o zhes zer ro //
translated: Others say: Imputed aggregates are dependent on others.

original: rdul phra rab khams gcig ces bya ba ni gzugs can bcu las gang yang rung ba'o //
analyzed: rdul phra rab khams gcig ces bya ba ni gzugs can bcu las gang yang rung ba'o //
translated: One element of a subtle particle means any one of the ten physical elements.

original: skye mched gcig ces bya ba ni gzugs can rnams las gang yang rung ba'o //
analyzed: skye mched gcig ces bya ba ni gzugs can rnams las gang yang rung ba'o //
translated: One sense base means any one of the physical sense bases.

original: phung po gcig gi zhes bya ba ni phung po lnga las gzugs kyi phung po'o //
analyzed: phung po gcig gi zhes bya ba ni phung po lnga las gzugs kyi phung po'o //
translated: One aggregate means the form aggregate from among the five aggregates.

original: phyogs cha ni cha shas te rdzas kyi rdul phra rab kyi dbang du byas pa'o //
analyzed: phyogs cha ni cha shas te rdzas kyi rdul phra rab kyi dbang du byas pa'o //
translated: A part is a portion and is from the perspective of substantial subtle particles.

original: btags pa la bltos pa med bar phyogs la mi 'jug pa'i sgra phyogs su brjod de /
analyzed: btags pa la bltos pa med bar phyogs la mi 'jug pa'i sgra phyogs su brjod de /
translated: Without depending on an imputation, the term part is expressed in terms of a part.

original: yang na bltos pas phung po btags par bshad pa zhes rgyas bar te /
analyzed: yang na bltos pas phung po btags par bshad pa zhes rgyas bar te /
translated: Or else, it is explained that the aggregates are imputed in dependence.

original: ji ltar 'di 'dod pa spyod bar dmigs zhes bshad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ji ltar 'di 'dod pa spyod bar dmigs zhes bshad par 'gyur ro //
translated: How could it be observed to exist as it is imagined?

original: phyogs la yang phyogs can bzhin du nye bar 'dogs pa'i tha dad yod de /🔽de la phyogs ni rdul phra rab po //🔽phyogs can ni gzugs can gang yang rung ba khams dang skye mched dang phung po rnams so //
analyzed: phyogs la yang phyogs can bzhin du nye bar 'dogs pa'i tha dad yod de / de la phyogs ni rdul phra rab po // phyogs can ni gzugs can gang yang rung ba khams dang skye mched dang phung po rnams so //
translated: Just as the possessor of the parts is imputed in dependence on the parts, the whole is imputed in dependence on the parts.🔽Just as the possessor of the parts is imputed in dependence on the parts, the whole is imputed in dependence on the parts.🔽Just as the possessor of the parts is imputed in dependence on the parts, the whole is imputed in dependence on the parts.🔽Just as the possessor of the parts is imputed in dependence on the parts, the whole is imputed in dependence on the parts.🔽Just as the possessor of the parts is imputed in dependence on the parts, the whole is imputed in dependence on the parts.🔽Just as the possessor of the parts is imputed in dependence on the parts, the whole is imputed in dependence on the parts.🔽Just as the possessor of the parts is imputed in dependence on the parts, the whole is imputed in dependence on the parts.🔽Just as the possessor of the parts is imputed in dependence on the parts, the whole is imputed in dependence on the parts.🔽Just as the possessor of the parts is imputed in dependence on the parts, the whole is imputed in dependence on the parts.🔽Just as the possessor of the parts is imputed in dependence on the parts, the whole is imputed in dependence on the parts.🔽Just as the possessor of the parts is imputed in dependence on the parts, the whole is imputed in dependence on the parts.🔽Just as the possessor of the parts is imputed in dependence on the parts, the whole is imputed in dependence on the parts.🔽Just as the possessor of the parts is imputed in dependence on the parts, the whole is imputed in dependence on the parts.🔽Just as the possessor of the parts is imputed in dependence on the parts, the whole is imputed in dependence on the parts.🔽Just as the possessor of the parts is imputed in dependence on the parts, the whole is imputed in dependence on the parts.🔽Just as the possessor of the parts is imputed in dependence on the parts, the whole is imputed in dependence on the parts.

original: de nyid la 'jig rten la grags pa'i dpe smos pa ni dper na ras yug gi phyogs zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung pa'o ;
analyzed: de nyid la 'jig rten la grags pa'i dpe smos pa ni dper na ras yug gi phyogs zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung pa'o ;
translated: Just as the possessor of the parts is imputed in dependence on the parts, the whole is imputed in dependence on the parts.

original: / la ba la sogs pa tshig pa dgag pa brjod par 'dod pa dang ma tshig pa dgag pa brjod par 'dod pa'i tshe ras yug gi phyogs gcig tshig pa la ras yug tshig go zhes brjod kyi /
analyzed: / la ba la sogs pa tshig pa dgag pa brjod par 'dod pa dang ma tshig pa dgag pa brjod par 'dod pa'i tshe ras yug gi phyogs gcig tshig pa la ras yug tshig go zhes brjod kyi /
translated: Just as the possessor of the parts is imputed in dependence on the parts, the whole is imputed in dependence on the parts

original: ril dang phyogs gcig tshig pa brjod par 'dod pa'i tshe ni ma yin pa de bzhin du 'dir yang phung po gzhan dgag pa brjod pa dang ; phung po ma yin pa dgag pa brjod par 'dod pa'i tshe phung po'i phyogs gcig la phung por 'dogs te /
analyzed: ril dang phyogs gcig tshig pa brjod par 'dod pa'i tshe ni ma yin pa de bzhin du 'dir yang phung po gzhan dgag pa brjod pa dang ; phung po ma yin pa dgag pa brjod par 'dod pa'i tshe phung po'i phyogs gcig la phung por 'dogs te /
translated: But when one wishes to speak of the burning of the whole or of a part, then one designates a part of the aggregate as an aggregate.

original: phyogs dang phyogs can dag gtso bo ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phyogs dang phyogs can dag gtso bo ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the part and the whole are not the principal matter.

original: phung po dang skye mched dang khams rnams kyi chos tha dad pa la tha dad par bstan pa'i dgos pa 'dri ba ni /
analyzed: phung po dang skye mched dang khams rnams kyi chos tha dad pa la tha dad par bstan pa'i dgos pa 'dri ba ni /
translated: The purpose of teaching the distinct dharmas of the aggregates, bases, and elements as distinct is questioned:

original: yang ci'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis zhes rgya cher 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: yang ci'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis zhes rgya cher 'byung ba'o //
translated: Why did the Lord teach the aggregates, bases, and elements in different ways?

original: bde bar gshegs pa'i dgongs pa ni shes par dka' mod kyi /
analyzed: bde bar gshegs pa'i dgongs pa ni shes par dka' mod kyi /
translated: The intention of the Sugata is indeed difficult to understand.

original: rtog ge ba rnams la ni 'di ltar snang ste gdul bya rnams kyi /
analyzed: rtog ge ba rnams la ni 'di ltar snang ste gdul bya rnams kyi /
translated: But this is how it appears to the logicians:

original: rmongs dbang 'dod rnam gsum gyi phyir //🔽zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: rmongs dbang 'dod rnam gsum gyi phyir //🔽zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba'o //
translated: because of the three kinds of confusion of the disciples,🔽because of the three kinds of desire, and because of the three kinds of mental activity.

original: rnam gsum gyi sgra ni re re dang sbyar bar bya ste /
analyzed: rnam gsum gyi sgra ni re re dang sbyar bar bya ste /
translated: The term “threefold” should be applied to each of the three.

original: @74b rmongs pa rnam pa gsum gyi phyir //
analyzed: @74b rmongs pa rnam pa gsum gyi phyir //
translated: Because of three kinds of delusion,

original: zhes bya ba ni sa 'dod pa rnam pa gsum gyi phyir gyi bar ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni sa 'dod pa rnam pa gsum gyi phyir gyi bar ro //
translated: up to because of three kinds of desire for the stages.

original: grag go zhes bya ba grag go'i sgra ni 'di mdo'i don ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: grag go zhes bya ba grag go'i sgra ni 'di mdo'i don ma yin pa'o //
translated: The term “it is said” means that this is not the meaning of the sutra.

original: gang las phung po lnga la sogs pa rnams su phung po la sogs pa bstan pa la dgos pa gzhan gsungs te /
analyzed: gang las phung po lnga la sogs pa rnams su phung po la sogs pa bstan pa la dgos pa gzhan gsungs te /
translated: The purpose of teaching the aggregates, etc., in the Five Aggregates Sūtra, etc., is stated as follows:

original: go rims ji lta ba bzhin du gcig pa nyid dang byed pa po nyid dang za ba po nyid du 'dzin pa bsal ba'i sgo nas phung po la sogs pa gsum bstan te /
analyzed: go rims ji lta ba bzhin du gcig pa nyid dang byed pa po nyid dang za ba po nyid du 'dzin pa bsal ba'i sgo nas phung po la sogs pa gsum bstan te /
translated: The three, the aggregates, etc., are taught in order to eliminate the grasping of identity, the grasping of the agent, and the grasping of the experiencer, respectively.

original: de dag la bdag tu 'dzin pa ni gcig pa nyid du 'dzin pa la sogs pa sngon du 'gro ba can yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag la bdag tu 'dzin pa ni gcig pa nyid du 'dzin pa la sogs pa sngon du 'gro ba can yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because grasping an identity in those three is preceded by the grasping of identity, etc.

original: yang na spyod pa stong phrag brgyad cu'i dbye ba la kun tu rmongs pa'i gnyen por phung po la sogs pa bstan to zhes grag go //
analyzed: yang na spyod pa stong phrag brgyad cu'i dbye ba la kun tu rmongs pa'i gnyen por phung po la sogs pa bstan to zhes grag go //
translated: Or, it is said that the aggregates, etc., are taught as the antidote to the confusion that arises from the eighty thousand types of activity.

original: kha cig ni sems las byung ba rnams la kun tu rmongs te ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: kha cig ni sems las byung ba rnams la kun tu rmongs te ji ltar zhe na /
translated: Some are confused about the mental factors. How?

original: ril po'i bdag tu 'dzin pas zhes bya ste rgyu la rmongs pas ril po'i ril po la bdag snyam du 'dzin bas so //
analyzed: ril po'i bdag tu 'dzin pas zhes bya ste rgyu la rmongs pas ril po'i ril po la bdag snyam du 'dzin bas so //
translated: They grasp the self as a whole, because they are confused about the cause. They grasp the self as a whole because they think the self is a whole.

original: yang na sems las byung ba rnams la ril por bzung ste ;
analyzed: yang na sems las byung ba rnams la ril por bzung ste ;
translated: Or else, they grasp the mental factors as a whole.

original: phyis bdag tu 'dzin pas tshor ba dang 'du shes dang 'du byed phan tshun pa dang bdag kyang mtshan nyid gcig pa nyid du bzung nas bdag tu mngon par zhen te /
analyzed: phyis bdag tu 'dzin pas tshor ba dang 'du shes dang 'du byed phan tshun pa dang bdag kyang mtshan nyid gcig pa nyid du bzung nas bdag tu mngon par zhen te /
translated: Later, they grasp feeling, perception, and the formations as having the same characteristics as the self, and they cling to the self.

original: de'i phyir de dag la bdag tu 'dzin pa sngon du 'gro ba can ril por 'dzin pa ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir de dag la bdag tu 'dzin pa sngon du 'gro ba can ril por 'dzin pa ste /
translated: Therefore, grasping the self as a whole is preceded by grasping the self.

original: ril por 'dzin pa'i gnyen por phung po bstan pa brtsams so //
analyzed: ril por 'dzin pa'i gnyen por phung po bstan pa brtsams so //
translated: The teaching on the aggregates is undertaken as the antidote to grasping the self as a whole.

original: de ltar na tshor ba la sogs pa'i dbye ba bstan pas phung po la ril por 'dzin pa log pa dang bdag tu 'dzin pa yang ldog par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ltar na tshor ba la sogs pa'i dbye ba bstan pas phung po la ril por 'dzin pa log pa dang bdag tu 'dzin pa yang ldog par 'gyur te /
translated: Thus, by teaching the divisions of feeling and so on, the grasping of the self as a whole with regard to the aggregates is eliminated, and the grasping of the self is also eliminated.

original: de sngon du 'gro ba can yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de sngon du 'gro ba can yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is preceded by that.🔽Some are confused about form alone.

original: kha cig ni gzugs kho na la'o zhes bya ba la ril po'i bdag tu 'dzin pas kun tu rmongs so zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: kha cig ni gzugs kho na la'o zhes bya ba la ril po'i bdag tu 'dzin pas kun tu rmongs so zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: The confusion is due to the apprehension of a self that is a whole.

original: kun tu rmongs pa de'i gnyen por gzugs nyid rnam pa bcur phye ba dang sems dang sems las byung ba rnams skye mched gcig nyid de /
analyzed: kun tu rmongs pa de'i gnyen por gzugs nyid rnam pa bcur phye ba dang sems dang sems las byung ba rnams skye mched gcig nyid de /
