translated: The antidote to that confusion is the analysis of form into ten types and the analysis of mind and mental factors into one sense-sphere.

original: de ltar ril por phye ba la ril por 'dzin pa sngon du 'gro ba can gyi bdag tu 'dzin ba ldog par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar ril por phye ba la ril por 'dzin pa sngon du 'gro ba can gyi bdag tu 'dzin ba ldog par 'gyur ro //
translated: In this way, the apprehension of a self that is preceded by the apprehension of a whole is eliminated.

original: kha cig ni gzugs dang sems la ste rmongs so zhes bya bar snyegs so //
analyzed: kha cig ni gzugs dang sems la ste rmongs so zhes bya bar snyegs so //
translated: Some are confused about form and mind.

original: de dag gi rmongs pa bzlog par bya ba'i phyir khams bstan pa las gzugs rnam pa bcu dang sems rnam pa bdun du phye nas bstan to //
analyzed: de dag gi rmongs pa bzlog par bya ba'i phyir khams bstan pa las gzugs rnam pa bcu dang sems rnam pa bdun du phye nas bstan to //
translated: In order to eliminate their confusion, the elements are taught. Form is analyzed into ten types and mind is analyzed into seven types.

original: de la sems dang sems las byung ba dag la rmongs pa gang yin pa de ni rmongs pa'i rnam pa chung ba yin te /
analyzed: de la sems dang sems las byung ba dag la rmongs pa gang yin pa de ni rmongs pa'i rnam pa chung ba yin te /
translated: Among them, the confusion about mind and mental factors is a lesser type of confusion.

original: dngos po phra ba dang rigs mthun pa la rmongs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos po phra ba dang rigs mthun pa la rmongs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is confused about subtle things and those of the same type.

original: @75a * // gang zhig gzugs la rmongs pa de ni rmongs pa'i rnam pa 'bring po yin te /
analyzed: @75a * // gang zhig gzugs la rmongs pa de ni rmongs pa'i rnam pa 'bring po yin te /
translated: That which is confused about form is a middling type of confusion,

original: dngos po rags shing rigs mthun pa la rmongs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos po rags shing rigs mthun pa la rmongs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is confused about gross things and those of the same type.

original: gang zhig gzugs dang sems dag la rmongs pa de ni rmongs pa'i rnam pa chen po yin te /
analyzed: gang zhig gzugs dang sems dag la rmongs pa de ni rmongs pa'i rnam pa chen po yin te /
translated: That which is confused about form and mind is a great type of confusion,

original: dngos po phra ba dang rags pa dang rigs mthun pa dang mi mthun pa rnams la rmongs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos po phra ba dang rags pa dang rigs mthun pa dang mi mthun pa rnams la rmongs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is confused about subtle and gross things, those of the same type and those of different types.

original: de ltar na phung po bstan pa 'dis ji skad bshad pa'i kun tu rmongs pa dang 'jig tshogs la lta ba ril por 'dzin pa sngon du 'gro ba can bzlog ste /
analyzed: de ltar na phung po bstan pa 'dis ji skad bshad pa'i kun tu rmongs pa dang 'jig tshogs la lta ba ril por 'dzin pa sngon du 'gro ba can bzlog ste /
translated: Thus, through this teaching on the aggregates, the confusion explained above and the belief in the transitory collection that precedes it are eliminated.

original: de sngon du 'gro ba can gyi nyon mongs ba rnams kyang spong ba yin no //
analyzed: de sngon du 'gro ba can gyi nyon mongs ba rnams kyang spong ba yin no //
translated: And through their elimination, the afflictions that precede them are also eliminated.

original: dbang po dag kyang rnam pa gsum ste zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: dbang po dag kyang rnam pa gsum ste zhes bya ba la /
translated: The faculties are also threefold.

original: 'dir dbang po rnams ni dad pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'dir dbang po rnams ni dad pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: Here, the faculties are faith, etc.

original: dbang po rtul po dang 'bring po dag gis ni khams dang skye mched rab tu dbye ba rtogs kyi phung po bstan pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: dbang po rtul po dang 'bring po dag gis ni khams dang skye mched rab tu dbye ba rtogs kyi phung po bstan pa ni ma yin no //
translated: Those of dull and middling faculties understand the classification of the elements and sense bases through the teaching of the aggregates, but not through the teaching of the elements and sense bases.

original: dbang po rtul po la ni khams kyi rab tu dbye ba las phan btags par 'gyur gyi skye mched kyis ma yin no //
analyzed: dbang po rtul po la ni khams kyi rab tu dbye ba las phan btags par 'gyur gyi skye mched kyis ma yin no //
translated: Those of dull faculties are helped by the classification of the elements, not by the classification of the sense bases.

original: dbang po rnon po dang 'bring po dag la ni phung po bstan pa dang skye mched bstan pas skye mched dang khams kyi dbye ba rtogs par nus te /
analyzed: dbang po rnon po dang 'bring po dag la ni phung po bstan pa dang skye mched bstan pas skye mched dang khams kyi dbye ba rtogs par nus te /
translated: Those of sharp and middling faculties are able to understand the classification of the sense bases and elements through the teaching of the aggregates and the teaching of the sense bases.

original: de'i phyir skye mched bstan pa dang khams bstan pa don med par 'gyur ba'am gzhan du na de bzhin gshegs pa la yid mi ches par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir skye mched bstan pa dang khams bstan pa don med par 'gyur ba'am gzhan du na de bzhin gshegs pa la yid mi ches par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, the teaching of the sense bases and the teaching of the elements would be pointless, or else one would not believe in the Tathāgata.

original: de'i phyir gang zag dbang po rnon po'i dbang du byas nas phung po bstan pa dang dbang po 'bring po la skye mched bstan pa dang dbang po rtul po la khams bstan pa ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir gang zag dbang po rnon po'i dbang du byas nas phung po bstan pa dang dbang po 'bring po la skye mched bstan pa dang dbang po rtul po la khams bstan pa ste /
translated: Therefore, the aggregates are taught for those of sharp faculties, the bases are taught for those of medium faculties, and the elements are taught for those of dull faculties.

original: de ltar na thams cad la phan gdags pa byas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar na thams cad la phan gdags pa byas par 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, all are benefited.

original: 'dod pa yang rnam pa gsum ste zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'dod pa yang rnam pa gsum ste zhes bya ba la /
translated: There are three kinds of interest.

original: 'dod pa ni mos pa ste /
analyzed: 'dod pa ni mos pa ste /
translated: Interest is aspiration.

original: gzhan du na mos pa rnams la gzhan du chos bstan pa ni yid mi ches pa'i rgyur 'gyur ba kho na 'ba' zhig tu zad pas /
analyzed: gzhan du na mos pa rnams la gzhan du chos bstan pa ni yid mi ches pa'i rgyur 'gyur ba kho na 'ba' zhig tu zad pas /
translated: Otherwise, teaching the Dharma in a different way than the interest would be a cause for lack of confidence alone.

original: gdul bya'i mos pa'i khyad par las phung po la sogs pa'i sgo nas rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: gdul bya'i mos pa'i khyad par las phung po la sogs pa'i sgo nas rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: Therefore, there are three kinds of teachings, in terms of the aggregates and so on, due to the special interest of those to be trained.

original: 'di dag thams cad kyang chos rab tu rnam par 'byed pa'i don te /
analyzed: 'di dag thams cad kyang chos rab tu rnam par 'byed pa'i don te /
translated: All of these are for the purpose of discerning the Dharma,

original: chos rab tu rnam par 'byed pa med par nyon mongs pa spong ba med pas na /
analyzed: chos rab tu rnam par 'byed pa med par nyon mongs pa spong ba med pas na /
translated: because without discerning the Dharma, the afflictions cannot be eliminated.

original: phung po bstan pa'i dgos pa ni sngar nyid du shes par byas zin to //
analyzed: phung po bstan pa'i dgos pa ni sngar nyid du shes par byas zin to //
translated: The purpose of teaching the aggregates has already been understood.

original: de las gzhan pa'i sems las byung ba phung po tha dad par byas pa mi 'gal ba gang yin pa 'dir brjod par bya ba ni yang ci'i phyir zhes rgyas par 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa'i sems las byung ba phung po tha dad par byas pa mi 'gal ba gang yin pa 'dir brjod par bya ba ni yang ci'i phyir zhes rgyas par 'byung ba'o //
translated: The question is asked: “Why are desire and lust for the five aggregates called attachment to pleasure?”

original: 'dod par bya bas na 'dod pa @75b ste gzugs la sogs pa'i yul rnams so //
analyzed: 'dod par bya bas na 'dod pa @75b ste gzugs la sogs pa'i yul rnams so //
translated: Pleasure is the object, form, etc.

original: de dag la lhag par chags pa ni 'dun pa'i 'dod chags so //
analyzed: de dag la lhag par chags pa ni 'dun pa'i 'dod chags so //
translated: Desire and lust for them is the desire for pleasure.

original: lta ba dag ni 'jig tshogs la lta ba la sogs pa rnams so //
analyzed: lta ba dag ni 'jig tshogs la lta ba la sogs pa rnams so //
translated: The views are the afflicted view of the self, etc.

original: de dag la lhag par chags pa ni 'dun pa'i 'dod chags kho na'o //
analyzed: de dag la lhag par chags pa ni 'dun pa'i 'dod chags kho na'o //
translated: Desire and lust for them is the desire for pleasure.

original: snga ma ni phal cher khyim pa'i phyogs dang / phyi ma ni phal cher rab tu 'byung ba'i phyogs kyi'o //
analyzed: snga ma ni phal cher khyim pa'i phyogs dang / phyi ma ni phal cher rab tu 'byung ba'i phyogs kyi'o //
translated: The former is for the most part on the side of the householder, and the latter is for the most part on the side of the renunciate.

original: de ltar yang mdo las 'dod pa'i 'dod chags la lhag par zhen pa dang 'chums pa dang yongs su zhen pa dang lhan cig tu gyur bas khyim pa rnams ni khyim pa rnams dang lhan cig tu rtsod par byed 'gyed bar byed do zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: de ltar yang mdo las 'dod pa'i 'dod chags la lhag par zhen pa dang 'chums pa dang yongs su zhen pa dang lhan cig tu gyur bas khyim pa rnams ni khyim pa rnams dang lhan cig tu rtsod par byed 'gyed bar byed do zhes gsungs te /
translated: Householders quarrel and fight with other householders due to their attachment to, fondness for, and great desire for sensual objects.

original: de gnyis kyis zhen pa ni tshor ba dang 'du shes so //
analyzed: de gnyis kyis zhen pa ni tshor ba dang 'du shes so //
translated: The two attachments are feeling and discrimination.

original: gtso bo smos pa ni ma rig pa la sogs pa rnams kyang de gnyis kyi rgyur 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gtso bo smos pa ni ma rig pa la sogs pa rnams kyang de gnyis kyi rgyur 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The principal ones are mentioned because ignorance and so on are also causes of those two.

original: tshor ba ro myang ba'i dbang gis ni zhes ba la ro myang dam pa ni tshor ba nyid ro myang ba yin pas na tshor ba myang ba'o //
analyzed: tshor ba ro myang ba'i dbang gis ni zhes ba la ro myang dam pa ni tshor ba nyid ro myang ba yin pas na tshor ba myang ba'o //
translated: Due to the power of relishing feeling: since feeling itself is relishing, it is relishing feeling.

original: de ni ro mngar ba dang 'dra bas na ro myang ba ste de'i dbang gis 'dun pa'i 'dod chags kyi sgo nas 'dod pa la mngon par zhen pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni ro mngar ba dang 'dra bas na ro myang ba ste de'i dbang gis 'dun pa'i 'dod chags kyi sgo nas 'dod pa la mngon par zhen pa yin no //
translated: Since it is like a sweet taste, it is relishing. Due to the power of that, one is attached to desire through desirous attachment.

original: yang na tshor ba la ro myang ba'i phyir tshor ba ro myang ba ste de la sred pa'i dbang gis tshor ba la phan 'dogs shing 'dod pa la mngon par zhen pa dang lhag par chags pa yin no //
analyzed: yang na tshor ba la ro myang ba'i phyir tshor ba ro myang ba ste de la sred pa'i dbang gis tshor ba la phan 'dogs shing 'dod pa la mngon par zhen pa dang lhag par chags pa yin no //
translated: Or else, it is relishing of feeling because of relishing the taste of feeling. Due to craving for that, one benefits feeling and one adheres to and is attached to desire.

original: 'du shes phyin ci log gi dbang gis zhes bya ba ni chos ma yin pas chos su 'du shes pa dang ba dag med pa la sogs pa rnams la bdag la sogs par 'du shes pa ste /
analyzed: 'du shes phyin ci log gi dbang gis zhes bya ba ni chos ma yin pas chos su 'du shes pa dang ba dag med pa la sogs pa rnams la bdag la sogs par 'du shes pa ste /
translated: Due to the power of distorted discernment means that due to non-Dharma being taken as Dharma, discernment of self and so on arises in regard to the non-existent and so on.

original: de dag ni tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin ba dang 'jig tshogs dang mthar 'dzin bar lta ba la sogs pa ste lta ba de dag la mngon par zhen no //
analyzed: de dag ni tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin ba dang 'jig tshogs dang mthar 'dzin bar lta ba la sogs pa ste lta ba de dag la mngon par zhen no //
translated: Those are the overesteeming of inferior ethical discipline and austerities, the afflicted view of the self, the view grasping an extreme and so on.

original: gang gi tshe bden pa mthong ba rnams la 'du shes yod kyang phyin ci log med pas lta ba la mngon par zhen pa yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gang gi tshe bden pa mthong ba rnams la 'du shes yod kyang phyin ci log med pas lta ba la mngon par zhen pa yod pa ma yin te /
translated: When those who see the four truths have discernment, it is not distorted and so they do not adhere to views.

original: de'i phyir gang gis 'du shes phyin ci log tu byas pa de nyid lta ba la mngon par zhen pa'i rgyu yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir gang gis 'du shes phyin ci log tu byas pa de nyid lta ba la mngon par zhen pa'i rgyu yin te /
translated: Therefore, the cause of adherence to views is that very distorted discernment.

original: de yod pa dang med pa dag gis yod pa dang med pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: de yod pa dang med pa dag gis yod pa dang med pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: Because of the existence and nonexistence of existence and nonexistence.

original: de ni de lta ma yin te mi gsal ba'i bdag nyid kyis mun pa dang 'dra ba'i phyir na phyin ci log tu rtog pa'i rgyu ma rig pa ni lta ba la mngon par zhen pa'i rgyur shes par bya ba ma yin gyi /
analyzed: de ni de lta ma yin te mi gsal ba'i bdag nyid kyis mun pa dang 'dra ba'i phyir na phyin ci log tu rtog pa'i rgyu ma rig pa ni lta ba la mngon par zhen pa'i rgyur shes par bya ba ma yin gyi /
translated: That is not so, because the cause of distorted conception is ignorance, which is like darkness in that it is unclear. It is not understood to be the cause of adherence to views.

original: gang zhig de dang 'dres shing mtshan mar 'dzin pa'i rnam pa can gyi 'du shes de ni rgyu yin no //🔽smras pa / 'dam bying nya ni yang yang 'phar ba @76a * //
analyzed: gang zhig de dang 'dres shing mtshan mar 'dzin pa'i rnam pa can gyi 'du shes de ni rgyu yin no // smras pa / 'dam bying nya ni yang yang 'phar ba @76a * //
translated: But that discernment which is mixed with that and has the aspect of apprehending signs is the cause.🔽Objection: Just as a fish in muddy water

original: yis ; / chu dag rnyog par byed pa ji bzhin du //🔽ma rig pa dang rjes 'brel 'du shes kyis //
analyzed: yis ; / chu dag rnyog par byed pa ji bzhin du // ma rig pa dang rjes 'brel 'du shes kyis //
translated: Repeatedly stirs up the water,🔽So too, discernment associated with ignorance

original: rig pa sun 'byin byed pa'ang de dang 'dra //
analyzed: rig pa sun 'byin byed pa'ang de dang 'dra //
translated: Pollutes the water of knowledge.

original: de'i phyir 'du shes phyin ci log gi dbang gis ni lta ba dag la mngon par zhen to zhes bya ba'i rigs so //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'du shes phyin ci log gi dbang gis ni lta ba dag la mngon par zhen to zhes bya ba'i rigs so //
translated: Therefore, it is reasonable to say that one adheres to views through the power of distorted discernment.

original: tshor ba la zhen pa ni tshor ba la tshogs pa'o ;
analyzed: tshor ba la zhen pa ni tshor ba la tshogs pa'o ;
translated: Craving that is based on feeling is craving that is associated with feeling.

original: /'du shes phyin ci log tu gyur pa ni phyin ci log tu mtshan mar 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: /'du shes phyin ci log tu gyur pa ni phyin ci log tu mtshan mar 'dzin pa'o //
translated: Distorted discernment is the distorted apprehension of signs.

original: de la tshor ba la zhen cing sred pa la spyod pa ni 'khor bar 'khor ro //
analyzed: de la tshor ba la zhen cing sred pa la spyod pa ni 'khor bar 'khor ro //
translated: One who is attached to feeling and who engages in craving cycles in samsara.

original: 'du shes phyin ci log tu gyur pas ni lta bar spyod do //
analyzed: 'du shes phyin ci log tu gyur pas ni lta bar spyod do //
translated: One who has distorted discernment engages in views.

original: tshor ba la zhen pa ni phyin ci log pa zhis 'du shes phyin ci log tu gyur pa kho nas nying mtshams sbyor ba'i tshe 'khor te /
analyzed: tshor ba la zhen pa ni phyin ci log pa zhis 'du shes phyin ci log tu gyur pa kho nas nying mtshams sbyor ba'i tshe 'khor te /
translated: One who is attached to feeling is reborn through distorted discernment alone.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: blo ni phyin ci log gyur las //
analyzed: blo ni phyin ci log gyur las //
translated: From the mind that is distorted,

original: rtse dags 'gro ba'i yul du 'gro //🔽zhes bshad pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: rtse dags 'gro ba'i yul du 'gro //🔽zhes bshad pa lta bu'o //
translated: Desire leads to the object of the journey.

original: 'dir 'khor ba'i rgyu'i ngo bo dag de ltar gsungs te dngos su ni phyin ci log tu zhen pa kho na rgyu nyid de sangs rgyas rnams la dgongs pa sngon du ma btang ba'i chos ston pa mi mnga' zhing /
analyzed: 'dir 'khor ba'i rgyu'i ngo bo dag de ltar gsungs te dngos su ni phyin ci log tu zhen pa kho na rgyu nyid de sangs rgyas rnams la dgongs pa sngon du ma btang ba'i chos ston pa mi mnga' zhing /
translated: Here, the nature of the cause of samsara is taught in this way. In fact, only the erroneous conception is the cause, because the Buddhas do not teach the Dharma without first having a thought.

original: dgongs pa yang 'dir gsal bar byas pa'i phyir zhes so //
analyzed: dgongs pa yang 'dir gsal bar byas pa'i phyir zhes so //
translated: And here, the thought is made clear.

original: 'o na ci'i phyir skye mched dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni dri ba'o //
analyzed: 'o na ci'i phyir skye mched dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni dri ba'o //
translated: Now, why is it that the sense bases, etc. are not taught? This is the question.

original: phung po ngag tu 'dus ma byas //
analyzed: phung po ngag tu 'dus ma byas //
translated: The unconditioned is not included in the aggregates.

original: don du rung phyir ma bshad do //
analyzed: don du rung phyir ma bshad do //
translated: It is not taught as a separate one, because it is not suitable as an object.

original: phung po dag 'chad pa na 'dus ma byas ni de dag kho na'i khongs su bsdus par ram de dag las tha dad par gzhan zhig tu rnam par 'jog //
analyzed: phung po dag 'chad pa na 'dus ma byas ni de dag kho na'i khongs su bsdus par ram de dag las tha dad par gzhan zhig tu rnam par 'jog //
translated: When the aggregates are explained, the unconditioned is either included within them or it is established as something separate from them.

original: de yang nye bar len pa'i phung po dag gam phung po dag gi khongs su sdud grang na rnam pa thams cad du yang mi rung ngo //
analyzed: de yang nye bar len pa'i phung po dag gam phung po dag gi khongs su sdud grang na rnam pa thams cad du yang mi rung ngo //
translated: And if it is included within the appropriated aggregates or the aggregates, it is not suitable in any way.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na don du mi rung pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na don du mi rung pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Why is that? Because it is not suitable as an object.

original: re zhig phung po dag gi khongs su bsdu bar ni mi nus te /
analyzed: re zhig phung po dag gi khongs su bsdu bar ni mi nus te /
translated: It cannot be included among the aggregates,

original: de dag gi nye bar len pa'i don mi rig pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag gi nye bar len pa'i don mi rig pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not included in the meaning of upadana.

original: de dag gi nye bar len pa ni gzugs dang tshor ba dang 'du shes dang 'du byed dang rnam par shes pa dag yod na 'dus ma byas ni gzugs la sogs pa'i bdag nyid kyang ma yin te /
analyzed: de dag gi nye bar len pa ni gzugs dang tshor ba dang 'du shes dang 'du byed dang rnam par shes pa dag yod na 'dus ma byas ni gzugs la sogs pa'i bdag nyid kyang ma yin te /
translated: If form, feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness exist, then the unconditioned is not the nature of form, etc.

original: ji ltar de'i bdag nyid ma yin pa de gzugs la sogs pa'i phung po dag gis bsdus par rigs so //
analyzed: ji ltar de'i bdag nyid ma yin pa de gzugs la sogs pa'i phung po dag gis bsdus par rigs so //
translated: How is it not their nature? It is reasonable that it is not included among the aggregates of form, etc.

original: de nyid kyi phyir de ni gzugs ma yin zhing rnam par shes pa'i bar du yang ma yin pas zhes bshad do //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir de ni gzugs ma yin zhing rnam par shes pa'i bar du yang ma yin pas zhes bshad do //
translated: For this very reason, it is said that it is not form, nor is it up to consciousness.

original: 'di skad bshad par 'gyur te de ni gzugs su rung ba ma yin pa nas rnam par rig pa ma yin pa'i bar du ste /
analyzed: 'di skad bshad par 'gyur te de ni gzugs su rung ba ma yin pa nas rnam par rig pa ma yin pa'i bar du ste /
translated: This is explained as follows: It is not suitable as form, up to it is not suitable as consciousness.

original: phung po drug par brjod par yang mi rung ste @76b spungs pa'i don mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phung po drug par brjod par yang mi rung ste @76b spungs pa'i don mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is also not suitable to be called a sixth aggregate, because the meaning of a heap is not suitable.

original: gal te phung po'i don ni spungs pa yin pas 'dus ma byas kyang tshor ba bzhin du phung po drug pa zhig tu cis mi 'dod de /🔽ji ltar gzugs la sogs pa 'das pa la sogs pa'i bye brag gis tha dad pa rnams phan tshun 'dus te reg pa la ma ltos par blos bsdoms nas phung por brjod par 'gyur ba de bzhin du 'dus ma byas kyang blos bsdoms pa la bltos nas phung
analyzed: gal te phung po'i don ni spungs pa yin pas 'dus ma byas kyang tshor ba bzhin du phung po drug pa zhig tu cis mi 'dod de / ji ltar gzugs la sogs pa 'das pa la sogs pa'i bye brag gis tha dad pa rnams phan tshun 'dus te reg pa la ma ltos par blos bsdoms nas phung por brjod par 'gyur ba de bzhin du 'dus ma byas kyang blos bsdoms pa la bltos nas phung
translated: If the meaning of aggregate is a heap, why is unconditioned form not asserted to be a sixth aggregate like feeling, etc.?

original: por byas pa la 'gal ba ci zhig yod ce na /
analyzed: por byas pa la 'gal ba ci zhig yod ce na /
translated: Just as form, etc., which are different by way of the specific categories of past, etc., are mutually combined and called an aggregate by the mind without depending on contact, why would it be contradictory to call unconditioned form an aggregate in dependence on the mind combining it?

original: 'di la 'gal ba yod de phung por byed pa ni phyogs nas 'gugs bar ram dus las 'gugs ba zhig yin grang na /
analyzed: 'di la 'gal ba yod de phung por byed pa ni phyogs nas 'gugs bar ram dus las 'gugs ba zhig yin grang na /
translated: There is a contradiction here, because if it is made into an aggregate by being drawn from a direction or drawn from time,

original: gnyi ga yang 'dus ma byas phyogs dang dus su ma gtogs pa la srid pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gnyi ga yang 'dus ma byas phyogs dang dus su ma gtogs pa la srid pa ma yin no //
translated: both are impossible for unconditioned form, which is not included in a direction or time.

original: de nyid kyi phyir 'dus ma byas ni 'das pa la sogs pa'i bye brag gis tha dad pa ma yin no zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir 'dus ma byas ni 'das pa la sogs pa'i bye brag gis tha dad pa ma yin no zhes gsungs so //
translated: For that reason it is said that unconditioned form is not different by way of the specific categories of past and so on.

original: 'das pa la sogs pa'i bye brag gis tha dad pa phung por rnam par 'jog na de lta bu'i mtshan nyid 'dus ma byas phung por brjod pa la mi rung ngo //
analyzed: 'das pa la sogs pa'i bye brag gis tha dad pa phung por rnam par 'jog na de lta bu'i mtshan nyid 'dus ma byas phung por brjod pa la mi rung ngo //
translated: If the aggregates are posited as different due to the distinctions of past, etc., then it is not suitable to call the unconditioned, which has such characteristics, an aggregate.

original: gnyi ga ltar yang phung por bstan pa la dgos pa med pa'i phyir gnyi ga ltar yang 'dus ma byas phung por ma bshad do //
analyzed: gnyi ga ltar yang phung por bstan pa la dgos pa med pa'i phyir gnyi ga ltar yang 'dus ma byas phung por ma bshad do //
translated: Since there would be no purpose in teaching the aggregates in either way, the unconditioned is not explained as an aggregate in either way.

original: yang kun nas nyon mongs pa'i gzhi shes par bya ba'i phyir zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: yang kun nas nyon mongs pa'i gzhi shes par bya ba'i phyir zhes bya ba la /
translated: Again, in order to know the basis of defilement,

original: gzhi'i sgra ni 'dir rgyu'i rnam grangs te /
analyzed: gzhi'i sgra ni 'dir rgyu'i rnam grangs te /
translated: the term basis here is a synonym for cause.

original: zag pa dang bcas pa rnams ni kun nas nyon mongs pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zag pa dang bcas pa rnams ni kun nas nyon mongs pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because those with outflows are the cause of defilement.

original: bya ba'i phyir gyi sgra ni 'dir dgos pa'i tshig go //
analyzed: bya ba'i phyir gyi sgra ni 'dir dgos pa'i tshig go //
translated: The word for the sake of here is a word for purpose.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba'i gzhi shes par bya ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni zag pa dang bcas pa rnams kun nas nyon mongs pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir la zag pa med pa rnams rnam par byang ba'i rgyu'i phyir yin na 'dus ma🔽byas ni gnyi ga yang ma yin no //🔽kun nas nyon mongs pa rgyas par mi 'gyur ba'i phyir kun nas nyon mongs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba'i gzhi shes par bya ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni zag pa dang bcas pa rnams kun nas nyon mongs pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir la zag pa med pa rnams rnam par byang ba'i rgyu'i phyir yin na 'dus ma byas ni gnyi ga yang ma yin no // kun nas nyon mongs pa rgyas par mi 'gyur ba'i phyir kun nas nyon mongs pa ma yin no //
translated: The unconditioned is not a basis of defilement because it does not increase defilement.

original: lam ma yin pa'i phyir rnam par byang ba'i dngos po ma yin no //
analyzed: lam ma yin pa'i phyir rnam par byang ba'i dngos po ma yin no //
translated: It is not a basis of purification because it is not the path.

original: gzhan dag na re 'dus ma byas yin pa'i phyir dngos po gnyi ga yang ma yin pa nyid do zhes zer ro //
analyzed: gzhan dag na re 'dus ma byas yin pa'i phyir dngos po gnyi ga yang ma yin pa nyid do zhes zer ro //
translated: Others say that it is neither because it is unconditioned.

original: gzhan dag na re rnam par byang ba'i rgyu nyid kyi phyir 'dus byas kyi dngos po ma yin zhing kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba'i dngos po ma yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: gzhan dag na re rnam par byang ba'i rgyu nyid kyi phyir 'dus byas kyi dngos po ma yin zhing kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba'i dngos po ma yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: Others say that it is not a basis of defilement or purification because it is the cause of purification, but not a conditioned basis.

original: de la 'dis rnam par byang ba byas pas na rnam par byang ba ste lam la mngon par 'dod do //
analyzed: de la 'dis rnam par byang ba byas pas na rnam par byang ba ste lam la mngon par 'dod do //
translated: Purification is the path, since it is that by which one is purified.

original: @77a * // de ltar so sor brtags pa'i 'gog pa nyid ni gnyi ga'i dngos por bshad de /
analyzed: @77a * // de ltar so sor brtags pa'i 'gog pa nyid ni gnyi ga'i dngos por bshad de /
translated: Thus, the very analytical cessation is explained as the reality of both.

original: 'dis 'dus ma byas thams cad kyi'o zhes bya ba 'di bsam par bya'o //🔽ji ltar bum pa chag pa zhes bya ba ni bum pa 'gags pa ste /
analyzed: 'dis 'dus ma byas thams cad kyi'o zhes bya ba 'di bsam par bya'o // ji ltar bum pa chag pa zhes bya ba ni bum pa 'gags pa ste /
translated: This is to be considered: the reality of all unconditioned things is just that.🔽Just as one says “the destruction of a pot,” where the pot is destroyed and is not a pot,

original: bum pa ma yin pa de bzhin du phung po zhig pa ste phung po 'gags pa yang 'dus ma byas yin pas phung po ma yin zhing /
analyzed: bum pa ma yin pa de bzhin du phung po zhig pa ste phung po 'gags pa yang 'dus ma byas yin pas phung po ma yin zhing /
translated: so also the cessation of the aggregates, where the aggregates are destroyed and are not aggregates.

original: nam mkha' ni gcig kho na yin pas phung po ma yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: nam mkha' ni gcig kho na yin pas phung po ma yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: Space is not an aggregate because it is a single entity.

original: de dag ji lta ba na khams dang skye mched zhig pa yang khams dang skye mched ma yin par thal bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de dag ji lta ba na khams dang skye mched zhig pa yang khams dang skye mched ma yin par thal bar 'gyur te /
translated: Just as these are so, the destruction of the elements and sense bases would also entail that the elements and sense bases are not elements and sense bases.

original: khams dang skye mched kyi bdag nyid kho na khams dang skye mched zhig par rung ba ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: khams dang skye mched kyi bdag nyid kho na khams dang skye mched zhig par rung ba ma yin pa'o //
translated: It is not tenable that the elements and sense bases themselves are the destruction of the elements and sense bases.

original: de ni de ltar ma yin te zag pa dang bcas pa'i phung po bzhin no //
analyzed: de ni de ltar ma yin te zag pa dang bcas pa'i phung po bzhin no //
translated: It is not so, like the four aggregates that are not form.

original: zag pa dang bcas pa'i skye mched rnams la yang 'gog par 'gyur ro zhes pa'i gnas skabs su thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zag pa dang bcas pa'i skye mched rnams la yang 'gog par 'gyur ro zhes pa'i gnas skabs su thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: And it would follow that the cessation of the aggregates would be a sense base, as in the passage: “Cessation is a sense base.”

original: gzhan dag na re 'dir phung po spungs pa zhig par 'dod pa ma yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: gzhan dag na re 'dir phung po spungs pa zhig par 'dod pa ma yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: Others say: Here, the aggregates are not asserted to be a heap.

original: nam mkha' dang so sor brtags pa ma yin pa'i 'gog pa dag ma spangs pa'i bdag nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: nam mkha' dang so sor brtags pa ma yin pa'i 'gog pa dag ma spangs pa'i bdag nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Because space and non-analytical cessation are not abandoned by nature.

original: 'o na ci zhe na gang la mtshan nyid med pa de phung po rnams las au bar ta me ba b'a /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na gang la mtshan nyid med pa de phung po rnams las au bar ta me ba b'a /
translated: But if something lacks the characteristics of the aggregates, how can it be a part of the aggregates?

original: 'dus ma byas gsum yang phung po zhig par mi rung zhes pa ni dga' ba tshigs su bcad pa'i don to //🔽phung po rnams kyi rnam pa gzhan bshad zin to zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'dus ma byas gsum yang phung po zhig par mi rung zhes pa ni dga' ba tshigs su bcad pa'i don to // phung po rnams kyi rnam pa gzhan bshad zin to zhes bya ba la /
translated: The meaning of the verse is that the three unconditioned things are not suitable to be a part of the aggregates.🔽The other aspects of the aggregates have been explained.

original: skye mched dang khams dag gi rnam pa gzhan mngon par brjod pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: skye mched dang khams dag gi rnam pa gzhan mngon par brjod pa'i phyir te /
translated: The other aspects of the sense bases and elements have been explained.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa la sogs pa'i dngos po rim pa gzhan gyi ngo bo skye mched dang khams su rnam par gzhag pa la sogs pa go rims lhag ma lus pa de brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa la sogs pa'i dngos po rim pa gzhan gyi ngo bo skye mched dang khams su rnam par gzhag pa la sogs pa go rims lhag ma lus pa de brjod par bya'o //
translated: The remaining order should be stated, such as the order of the arising of the entities of defilement, etc., and the order of the presentation of the sense spheres and elements.

original: sangs rgyas rnams kyi gsung ni dgongs pa sngon du btang nas 'jug pa de'i phyir /
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams kyi gsung ni dgongs pa sngon du btang nas 'jug pa de'i phyir /
translated: The speech of the Buddhas is engaged in after having previously reflected.

original: 'dir rim ni rags dang kun nyon mongs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: 'dir rim ni rags dang kun nyon mongs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Therefore, here the order is stated as follows: “The gross, the defiled, etc.”

original: rags pa ji lta ba dang kun nas nyon mongs pa ji lta ba dang snod la sogs pa'i don gyi khams rnams kyang ngo //
analyzed: rags pa ji lta ba dang kun nas nyon mongs pa ji lta ba dang snod la sogs pa'i don gyi khams rnams kyang ngo //
translated: The elements of the meaning of the vessel, etc. are also the gross, the defiled, etc.

original: gzugs ni thogs pa dang rnam pa'i phyir thams cad la rags zhes bya ba ni gtogs che ba'o //
analyzed: gzugs ni thogs pa dang rnam pa'i phyir thams cad la rags zhes bya ba ni gtogs che ba'o //
translated: Form is called gross in all cases because of obstruction and because of aspect.

original: gzhan dag na re rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga'i rten yin pa'i phyir rags so zhes zer ro //
analyzed: gzhan dag na re rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga'i rten yin pa'i phyir rags so zhes zer ro //
translated: Others say that it is gross because it is the support of the five collections of consciousness.

original: rgyu ba rags pa ni gsum mo zhes tshig rnam @77b par sbyar te lus kyang rgyu ba'i sa bcas pas rtogs par ches sla ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu ba rags pa ni gsum mo zhes tshig rnam @77b par sbyar te lus kyang rgyu ba'i sa bcas pas rtogs par ches sla ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The gross movement is threefold. The word “also” is to be supplied. The body is the place of movement, and so it is the easiest to understand.

original: de nyid kyi phyir 'di ltar bstan pa rgya cher sbyar te /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir 'di ltar bstan pa rgya cher sbyar te /
translated: Therefore, the following is taught in detail:

original: 'du shes ni 'du byed dang rnam par shes pa gnyis las ches rags te de'i bya ba rtogs par ches sla ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'du shes ni 'du byed dang rnam par shes pa gnyis las ches rags te de'i bya ba rtogs par ches sla ba'i phyir ro //
translated: feeling is grosser than the two, i.e., than the formative forces and consciousness, because its activity is the easiest to understand.

original: 'du shes ni skyes pa dang bud med la sogs pa'i mtshan mar 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: 'du shes ni skyes pa dang bud med la sogs pa'i mtshan mar 'dzin pa'o //
translated: Feeling is the apprehension of the signs of a woman, a man, etc.

original: rnam par shes pa bas ni 'du byed rags te /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa bas ni 'du byed rags te /
translated: The formative forces are grosser than consciousness,

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa'i kun tu spyad pa shin tu gsal bar rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa'i kun tu spyad pa shin tu gsal bar rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the activity of passion, etc. is very clearly understood.

original: gzhan dag na re mngon par 'du byed pa'i mtshan nyid kyi bde ba dang sdug bsngal la sogs pa'i 'jug pa nye bar mtshon pa'i phyir ro zhes zer ro //
analyzed: gzhan dag na re mngon par 'du byed pa'i mtshan nyid kyi bde ba dang sdug bsngal la sogs pa'i 'jug pa nye bar mtshon pa'i phyir ro zhes zer ro //
translated: Others say that this is because the engagement of pleasure, pain, etc. which is characterized by the formative forces is clearly indicated.

original: thams cad pas phra ba'i phyir rnam par shes pa ni mthar te /
analyzed: thams cad pas phra ba'i phyir rnam par shes pa ni mthar te /
translated: Consciousness is the end because it is the most subtle of all.

original: gdul bya rnams gzud pa dang rjes su mthun pa'i phyir na 'di ni rags pa'i rim pa ste /
analyzed: gdul bya rnams gzud pa dang rjes su mthun pa'i phyir na 'di ni rags pa'i rim pa ste /
translated: This is the gross stage, in accordance with the entry of those to be trained.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa ji lta ba'o //
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa ji lta ba'o //
translated: This is the way of defilement.

original: phan tshun gzugs la mngon par dga' ste zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: phan tshun gzugs la mngon par dga' ste zhes bya ba la /
translated: They delight in each other's form.

original: phan tshun kha dog dang dbyibs dang sgra dang dri dang ro dang reg bya la mngon par zhen par byed do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: phan tshun kha dog dang dbyibs dang sgra dang dri dang ro dang reg bya la mngon par zhen par byed do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: They are attached to each other's color, shape, sound, smell, taste, and touch.

original: de bzhin du gzugs gcig ni chags par bya ba ma yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin du gzugs gcig ni chags par bya ba ma yin te /
translated: Similarly, one form is not to be desired,

original: ji ltar mdo las skyes pa dang bud med phan tshun gzugs la reg par byed do zhes rgya cher 'byung ngo //
analyzed: ji ltar mdo las skyes pa dang bud med phan tshun gzugs la reg par byed do zhes rgya cher 'byung ngo //
translated: as it is said in the sutra: Men and women touch each other's forms.

original: de dag kyang tshor ba'i ro myang ba la chags pa'i phyir phan tshun gzugs kyis mngon par dga' zhing tshor ba'i ro myang ba nas phrad pa dang bral ba'i sred pas zhen cing tshor ba'i ro myang ba dang tshor ba la chags pa'i bar du'o //
analyzed: de dag kyang tshor ba'i ro myang ba la chags pa'i phyir phan tshun gzugs kyis mngon par dga' zhing tshor ba'i ro myang ba nas phrad pa dang bral ba'i sred pas zhen cing tshor ba'i ro myang ba dang tshor ba la chags pa'i bar du'o //
translated: And they delight in each other's form because they are attached to the taste of feeling, and they are attached to the taste of feeling up to the craving for contact and separation, and they are attached to the taste of feeling and to feeling.

original: gzhan dag na re gal te tshor ba thob pa nyid kyi phyir chags pa dang mngon par chags pa las so zhes so //
analyzed: gzhan dag na re gal te tshor ba thob pa nyid kyi phyir chags pa dang mngon par chags pa las so zhes so //
translated: Others say: because of the attainment of feeling, there is attachment and full attachment.

original: 'du shes phyin ci log pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'du shes phyin ci log pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la /
translated: Because of the perversion of ideation.

original: sdug bsngal la bde'o snyam pa ni 'du shes phyin ci log pa ste /
analyzed: sdug bsngal la bde'o snyam pa ni 'du shes phyin ci log pa ste /
translated: The idea that what is suffering is happiness is the perversion of ideation.

original: tshor ba bde ba nyid kyang 'du byed 'gyur ba'i sdug bsngal dag gis sdug bsngal ba nyid do //
analyzed: tshor ba bde ba nyid kyang 'du byed 'gyur ba'i sdug bsngal dag gis sdug bsngal ba nyid do //
translated: Even pleasant feeling is suffering because of the suffering of the transformation of the formative forces.

original: phyin ci log de yang kun nas nyon mongs pa dag gis so zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: phyin ci log de yang kun nas nyon mongs pa dag gis so zhes bya ba la /
translated: And that perversion is due to the defilements.

original: mi rtag pa dang ; sdug bsngal ba dang mi gtsang ba dang bdag med pa rnams la nyon mongs pas rnam par 'phrul te 'du shes phyin ci log tu 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mi rtag pa dang ; sdug bsngal ba dang mi gtsang ba dang bdag med pa rnams la nyon mongs pas rnam par 'phrul te 'du shes phyin ci log tu 'gyur ro //
translated: The defilements cause the perversion of the idea of the impermanent, the suffering, the impure and the insubstantial as being the opposite of these.

original: sems kyang de dag gis kun nas nyon mongs pa can du byas pa zhes bya ba kun nas nyon mongs pas yang srid kyi rnam par shes pa mtshams sbyor ba'i nyon mongs @78a * //
analyzed: sems kyang de dag gis kun nas nyon mongs pa can du byas pa zhes bya ba kun nas nyon mongs pas yang srid kyi rnam par shes pa mtshams sbyor ba'i nyon mongs @78a * //
translated: And the mind is defiled by them. The mind is defiled by the defilements that cause the rebirth of consciousness in a new existence.

original: pa la 'jug pas rnam par shes pa mthar gsungs so zhes gzhan dag zer ro //
analyzed: pa la 'jug pas rnam par shes pa mthar gsungs so zhes gzhan dag zer ro //
translated: Thus consciousness is said to be the final element.

original: gang nas kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / gang gi don dang ji ltar dang gang zhig dang gang dag gis kun nas nyon mongs pa de bstan par bya ba'i phyir nyon mongs pa ji lta ba bzhin go rims brjod do //
analyzed: gang nas kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / gang gi don dang ji ltar dang gang zhig dang gang dag gis kun nas nyon mongs pa de bstan par bya ba'i phyir nyon mongs pa ji lta ba bzhin go rims brjod do //
translated: The order of the defilements is explained according to the order of the defilements themselves, in order to indicate the meaning of defilement, the object of defilement, the manner of defilement, the defiled thing, and that by which there is defilement.

original: yang na snod la sogs pa'i don gyis te zhes rgya cher 'byung ba la /
analyzed: yang na snod la sogs pa'i don gyis te zhes rgya cher 'byung ba la /
translated: Or else, in the sense of a receptacle, etc.

original: gzugs ni snod lta bu ste tshor ba zas dang 'dra ba'i rten yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzugs ni snod lta bu ste tshor ba zas dang 'dra ba'i rten yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Form is like a receptacle, because it is the support of feeling, which is like food.

original: tshor ba ni zas lta bu ste ro myang bar bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshor ba ni zas lta bu ste ro myang bar bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Feeling is like food, because it is the experience of the object.

original: gzhan dag na re sems can rnams la zas ni phan pa dang gnod par 'jug pa'i phyir ro zhes zer ro //
analyzed: gzhan dag na re sems can rnams la zas ni phan pa dang gnod par 'jug pa'i phyir ro zhes zer ro //
translated: Others say that food is beneficial or harmful to sentient beings.

original: 'dis gsal bar byed pas na 'du shes ni tshod ma lta bu ste /
analyzed: 'dis gsal bar byed pas na 'du shes ni tshod ma lta bu ste /
translated: Perception is like condiments, because it flavors the object.

original: des yid du 'ong ba dang yid du mi 'ong ba'i mtshan ma bzung nas tshor ba gsal bar byed do //
analyzed: des yid du 'ong ba dang yid du mi 'ong ba'i mtshan ma bzung nas tshor ba gsal bar byed do //
translated: Having grasped the sign of the agreeable or disagreeable, it produces a clear sensation.

original: yang na 'du shes ni phyin ci log gi dbang gis tshor ba'i ro mngon par 'dod pa'i phyir na 'du shes ni tshod ma lta bu'o //
analyzed: yang na 'du shes ni phyin ci log gi dbang gis tshor ba'i ro mngon par 'dod pa'i phyir na 'du shes ni tshod ma lta bu'o //
translated: Or else, it is like a cook, because, by error, it flavors the sensation in such a way that one desires it.

original: gzhan dag na re kun nas nyon mongs pas dgra dang mdza' bo dang bran dang bde ba la sogs par mtshan mar 'dzin pas so zhes zer ro //
analyzed: gzhan dag na re kun nas nyon mongs pas dgra dang mdza' bo dang bran dang bde ba la sogs par mtshan mar 'dzin pas so zhes zer ro //
translated: According to others, it is like a cook, because it seizes the sign of friend, enemy, and stranger, etc., through the defilements.

original: 'du byed rnams ni byan po lta bu ste de'i dbang gis rnam par smin pa yid du 'ong ba dang mi 'ong ba mngon par 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'du byed rnams ni byan po lta bu ste de'i dbang gis rnam par smin pa yid du 'ong ba dang mi 'ong ba mngon par 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Formation is like a field, because the agreeable and disagreeable results ripen through its power.

original: dmigs pa'i phyir na rnam par shes pa ni zab po lta bu ste /
analyzed: dmigs pa'i phyir na rnam par shes pa ni zab po lta bu ste /
translated: Consciousness is like a hunter, because it is consciousness that grasps the object and becomes attached to it.

original: gzhan dag na re de la bdag tu 'dzin pa'i phyir ro zhes zer ro //
analyzed: gzhan dag na re de la bdag tu 'dzin pa'i phyir ro zhes zer ro //
translated: According to others, it is consciousness that is the self, and it is because of it that one becomes attached to the object.

original: gzhan dag na re sems can gyi rdzas gtso bo yin pa'i phyir te tbu do dza ba tv'at tshor ba la sogs pa rnams so zhes zer ro //
analyzed: gzhan dag na re sems can gyi rdzas gtso bo yin pa'i phyir te tbu do dza ba tv'at tshor ba la sogs pa rnams so zhes zer ro //
translated: Others say: The substance of sentient beings is primary, because feeling and so on are subordinate to it.

original: sems can gyi dbang po'i gzugs gang yul gzugs su yod pa'i phyir 'dod pa'i yon tan gzugs kyis rab tu phye ba ni 'dod pa'i khams so //
analyzed: sems can gyi dbang po'i gzugs gang yul gzugs su yod pa'i phyir 'dod pa'i yon tan gzugs kyis rab tu phye ba ni 'dod pa'i khams so //
translated: The desire realm is distinguished by the form of the sense faculties of sentient beings, since it is the domain of form.

original: tshor bas rab tu phye ba ni bsam gtan rnams te tshor ba tha dad pas de tha dad pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: tshor bas rab tu phye ba ni bsam gtan rnams te tshor ba tha dad pas de tha dad pa'i phyir te /
translated: The absorptions are distinguished by feeling, because they are distinguished by different feelings.

original: 'di ltar snyoms par 'jug pa'i bsam gtan dang po gnyis na ni yid bde ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar snyoms par 'jug pa'i bsam gtan dang po gnyis na ni yid bde ba'o //
translated: Thus the first two absorptions of meditative attainment have mental satisfaction.

original: gong ma gnyis na ni btang snyoms ngag go //
analyzed: gong ma gnyis na ni btang snyoms ngag go //
translated: The two higher absorptions have equanimity.

original: skye ba'i bsam gtan dag na ni //
analyzed: skye ba'i bsam gtan dag na ni //
translated: The absorptions of birth🔽have mental satisfaction, pleasure,🔽equanimity, mental satisfaction and pleasure,

original: yid bde bde de btang snyoms dang // btang snyoms yid bde bde ba dang // btang snyoms btang snyoms tshor ba yod //
analyzed: yid bde bde de btang snyoms dang // btang snyoms yid bde bde ba dang // btang snyoms btang snyoms tshor ba yod //
translated: and equanimity and equanimity.

original: ces pa'o // gzhan dag na re skye ba'i bsam gtan rnams su 'du byed thams cad kyi khyad par so sor rig cing dmigs pas @78b gzugs kyi khams tshor bas rab tu phye ba'o zhes zer ro //
analyzed: ces pa'o // gzhan dag na re skye ba'i bsam gtan rnams su 'du byed thams cad kyi khyad par so sor rig cing dmigs pas @78b gzugs kyi khams tshor bas rab tu phye ba'o zhes zer ro //
translated: Others say: The realm of form is distinguished by feeling, because in the absorptions of birth there, one experiences and observes the distinctive characteristics of all the formative forces.

original: 'du shes kyis rab tu phye ba ni gzugs med pa gsum mo zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'du shes kyis rab tu phye ba ni gzugs med pa gsum mo zhes bya ba la /
translated: The formless realm is distinguished by ideation.

original: de dag ni de'i mtshan ma gsal ba'i phyir 'du shes gtso bo yin no //
analyzed: de dag ni de'i mtshan ma gsal ba'i phyir 'du shes gtso bo yin no //
translated: Ideation is predominant there, because the signs of those realms are clear.

original: btang snyoms thun mong ba rnam par bcad pa med pa'i phyir de ni gtso bo ma yin no //
analyzed: btang snyoms thun mong ba rnam par bcad pa med pa'i phyir de ni gtso bo ma yin no //
translated: Equanimity is not predominant there, because it is not distinguished by a specific state.

original: gzhan dag na re lus med pas nam mkha' la sogs pa'i 'du shes kyis rnam par 'byed pa'i phyir 'du shes kyis rab tu phye ba'o zhes zer ro //
analyzed: gzhan dag na re lus med pas nam mkha' la sogs pa'i 'du shes kyis rnam par 'byed pa'i phyir 'du shes kyis rab tu phye ba'o zhes zer ro //
translated: Others say: The formless realm is distinguished by ideation, because it is differentiated by the ideation of space etc.🔽The summit of existence is distinguished by mere formation.

original: 'du byed tsam gyis rab tu phye ba ni srid pa'i rtse mo ste zhes bya ba ni 'di thams cad bas de'i sems la 'bras bu che ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'du byed tsam gyis rab tu phye ba ni srid pa'i rtse mo ste zhes bya ba ni 'di thams cad bas de'i sems la 'bras bu che ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is the most excellent of all because the result of the mind is greater there.

original: phye ba ni gsal bar byas pa zhes bya pa'i tha tshig ste gang na gang zhig gtso bo de nyid kyis de nye bar mtshon par byas pa yin no //
analyzed: phye ba ni gsal bar byas pa zhes bya pa'i tha tshig ste gang na gang zhig gtso bo de nyid kyis de nye bar mtshon par byas pa yin no //
translated: The term “distinction” means “clarification.” Whatever is primary in a given context is indicated by that term.

original: 'di dag ni rnam par shes pa gnas pa yin la zhes bya ba ni gzugs su nye bar 'gro ba 'dod pa'i khams dang tshor bar nye bar 'gro ba gzugs kyi khams dang 'du shes su nye bar 'gro ba gzugs med pa gsum dang / 'du byed du nye bar 'gro ba srid pa'i rtse mo'o //
analyzed: 'di dag ni rnam par shes pa gnas pa yin la zhes bya ba ni gzugs su nye bar 'gro ba 'dod pa'i khams dang tshor bar nye bar 'gro ba gzugs kyi khams dang 'du shes su nye bar 'gro ba gzugs med pa gsum dang / 'du byed du nye bar 'gro ba srid pa'i rtse mo'o //
translated: These are the stations of consciousness means that the desire realm is the station of consciousness that is directed toward form, the three realms of form are the stations of consciousness that are directed toward feeling, the three formless realms are the stations of consciousness that are directed toward conception, and the peak of existence is the station of consciousness that is directed toward the formations.

original: de dag la rnam par shes pa gnas so zhes bya ba ni de dag gi sred pa'i rlan gyi mthus so //
analyzed: de dag la rnam par shes pa gnas so zhes bya ba ni de dag gi sred pa'i rlan gyi mthus so //
translated: Consciousness is present in them means that consciousness is present in them by the power of the moisture of craving.

original: zhing dang sa bon gyi go rims lta bur bstan pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhing dang sa bon gyi go rims lta bur bstan pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la /
translated: The order of the field and the seed is indicated.

original: zhing ni sngar yin la /
analyzed: zhing ni sngar yin la /
translated: The field is prior.

original: sa bon ni phyi nas te /
analyzed: sa bon ni phyi nas te /
translated: The seed is subsequent.

original: sngar ji ltar bshad pa'i phung po rnams zhing go rims pas bstan pa'i don de nyid kyi phyir rags pa la sogs pa'i rgyu rnams ji lta bar phung po rnams lnga las mi nyung mi mang ngo //
analyzed: sngar ji ltar bshad pa'i phung po rnams zhing go rims pas bstan pa'i don de nyid kyi phyir rags pa la sogs pa'i rgyu rnams ji lta bar phung po rnams lnga las mi nyung mi mang ngo //
translated: The five aggregates are not less than or more than five in number, just as the causes of coarseness, etc. are not less than or more than five in number.🔽The reason for the order is stated in the verse: “The order is according to grossness, etc. ”

original: rim rgyu'i phyir zhes gang smras pa de sbyar bar bya ba'i phyir go rims kyi rgyu de nyid kyi phyir zhes rgya cher 'byung ngo //🔽de'i dbang nyid kyis ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /🔽ji ltar zhe na yul can gyi rten gyi gtso bo yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: rim rgyu'i phyir zhes gang smras pa de sbyar bar bya ba'i phyir go rims kyi rgyu de nyid kyi phyir zhes rgya cher 'byung ngo // de'i dbang nyid kyis ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa la / ji ltar zhe na yul can gyi rten gyi gtso bo yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: The order of the faculties is in accordance with their relative grossness, with the faculties of form being the grossest and the mental faculty the most subtle.🔽The order of the elements is in accordance with the order of the faculties, since the elements are the faculties and the objects of the faculties.🔽The order of the faculties is in accordance with their relative predominance.🔽The order of the faculties is in accordance with their relative predominance.

original: yul rnam par gzhag pa ni yul can gyi dbang yin pa'i phyir ro //🔽dbang ni rag las pa'o //
analyzed: yul rnam par gzhag pa ni yul can gyi dbang yin pa'i phyir ro // dbang ni rag las pa'o //
translated: The order of the faculties is in accordance with their relative predominance.🔽The order of the faculties is in accordance with their relative predominance.🔽The order of the faculties is in accordance with their relative predominance.🔽The order of the faculties is in accordance with their relative predominance.🔽The order of the faculties is in accordance with their relative predominance.🔽The order of the faculties is in accordance with their relative predominance.🔽The order of the faculties is in accordance with their relative predominance.🔽The order of the faculties is in accordance with their relative predominance.🔽The order of the faculties is in accordance with their relative predominance.🔽The order of the faculties is in accordance with their relative predominance.🔽The order of the faculties is in accordance with their relative predominance.🔽The order of the faculties is in accordance with their relative predominance.🔽The order of the faculties is in accordance with their relative predominance.🔽The order of the faculties is in accordance with their relative predominance.🔽The order of the faculties is in accordance with their relative predominance.🔽The order of the faculties is in accordance with their relative predominance.🔽The order of the faculties is in accordance with their relative predominance.🔽The order of the faculties is in accordance with their relative predominance.🔽The order of the faculties is in accordance with their relative predominance.🔽The order of the faculties is in accordance with their relative predominance.🔽The order of the faculties is in accordance with their relative predominance.🔽The order of the faculties is in accordance with their relative predominance.🔽The order of the faculties is in accordance with their relative predominance.🔽The order of the faculties is in accordance with their relative predominance.

original: brten par rnam par gzhag pa yang rten gyi dbang ngo //🔽dbang po drug las dang por lnga ste mig la sogs pa dag go //🔽ci'i phyir zhe na da lta'i don phyir zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: brten par rnam par gzhag pa yang rten gyi dbang ngo //🔽dbang po drug las dang por lnga ste mig la sogs pa dag go //🔽ci'i phyir zhe na da lta'i don phyir zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The order of the faculties is in accordance with their relative predominance.🔽The order of the faculties is in accordance with their relative predominance

original: 'di dag gi yul da ltar ba yin pas da ltar ba'i don gyi dngos po ni da ltar ba'i don nyid du lhag par bzung nas da ltar byung bar skyes pas na de'i yul rnams sngar smos so //
analyzed: 'di dag gi yul da ltar ba yin pas da ltar ba'i don gyi dngos po ni da ltar ba'i don nyid du lhag par bzung nas da ltar byung bar skyes pas na de'i yul rnams sngar smos so //
translated: Since these have present objects, the present object is grasped as a present object alone. Since they arise in the present, their objects are mentioned first.

original: yid ni kha @79a * //
analyzed: yid ni kha @79a * //
translated: The mental faculty

original: cig yul da ltar byung ba ste dper na gzhan gyi sems shes pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: cig yul da ltar byung ba ste dper na gzhan gyi sems shes pa lta bu'o //
translated: has some present objects, like the knowledge of another's mind.

original: kha cig gis dus gsum dang dus med pa'i yul can te /
analyzed: kha cig gis dus gsum dang dus med pa'i yul can te /
translated: Some have objects of the three times and some have nontemporal objects.

original: shes rgyud 'das pa'i yul can ni sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa'i shes pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: shes rgyud 'das pa'i yul can ni sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa'i shes pa lta bu'o //
translated: The mental faculty that has a past object is like the knowledge that recollects past lives.

original: ma 'ongs pa'i yul can ni mngon par 'dod pa'i shes pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa'i yul can ni mngon par 'dod pa'i shes pa lta bu'o //
translated: The mental faculty that has a future object is like the knowledge that directly perceives the future.

original: kha cig ni dus gsum pa'i yul can te /
analyzed: kha cig ni dus gsum pa'i yul can te /
translated: Some have objects of the three times.

original: dper na 'du byed mi rtag pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na 'du byed mi rtag pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, the knowledge that formative factors are impermanent.

original: kha cig ni dus med pa'i yul can te /
analyzed: kha cig ni dus med pa'i yul can te /
translated: Some have nontemporal objects.

original: dper na 'gog pa la dmigs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na 'gog pa la dmigs pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, like that which focuses on cessation.

original: kha cig ni dus gsum dang dus med pa'i yul can te /
analyzed: kha cig ni dus gsum dang dus med pa'i yul can te /
translated: Some have objects of the three times and nontemporal objects.

original: dper na chos thams cad bdag med do snyam pa lta bu ste /
analyzed: dper na chos thams cad bdag med do snyam pa lta bu ste /
translated: For example, the thought “All phenomena are devoid of self” is a mental consciousness.

original: de'i phyir yid ni ma nges pas phyis bshad do //
analyzed: de'i phyir yid ni ma nges pas phyis bshad do //
translated: Therefore, the mental faculty is not specified, because it is explained later.

original: 'byung ba las gyur don phyir gzhi //
analyzed: 'byung ba las gyur don phyir gzhi //
translated: The four elements are its object, because it is derived from the elements.

original: zhes bya ba la sngar bshad pa'i reg bya ma gtogs pa'i 'byung ba las gyur pa rnams 'di nyid kyi yul lo //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sngar bshad pa'i reg bya ma gtogs pa'i 'byung ba las gyur pa rnams 'di nyid kyi yul lo //
translated: The objects of this nose consciousness are the derived forms that are tactile objects, excluding the tactile objects that were previously explained.

original: 'byung ba gzhan rnams kyang de'i yul du ma nges pas na bzhi pa rnams so //🔽rjes su bshad pa zas lce dang ma phrad pa nyid kyis dri 'dzin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la /🔽gal te ma phrad pa'i zas kyi gong bu la brten pa'i dri kho na snas 'dzin na sna phrad nas 'dzin pa nyid la gnod par 'gyur ro zhes 'ga' zhig zer ro //
analyzed: 'byung ba gzhan rnams kyang de'i yul du ma nges pas na bzhi pa rnams so // rjes su bshad pa zas lce dang ma phrad pa nyid kyis dri 'dzin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la / gal te ma phrad pa'i zas kyi gong bu la brten pa'i dri kho na snas 'dzin na sna phrad nas 'dzin pa nyid la gnod par 'gyur ro zhes 'ga' zhig zer ro //
translated: The other elements are not specified as its objects, because it has four objects.🔽The nose consciousness is explained later, because it smells odors that are not in contact with the tongue.🔽If the nose consciousness only smells odors that are in a mass of food that is not in contact with the nose, then it would contradict the statement that the nose consciousness smells by coming in contact with its object.

original: zas dang 'dres pa'i rdzis myur du sna'i yul du phyin par byed pa yin te /
analyzed: zas dang 'dres pa'i rdzis myur du sna'i yul du phyin par byed pa yin te /
translated: Some say that the nose consciousness smells odors that are mixed with food, because it quickly goes to the object of the nose.

original: de dang rigs mthun pa'i phyir rdzi la brten pa'i dri la zas kyi dri zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de dang rigs mthun pa'i phyir rdzi la brten pa'i dri la zas kyi dri zhes bya'o //
translated: The odor of food is called odor of the wind, because it is of the same type.

original: rang gi 'byung ba bzhi tshan la brten pa nyid zas kyi dri ste 'byung ba chen po la brten pa'o //
analyzed: rang gi 'byung ba bzhi tshan la brten pa nyid zas kyi dri ste 'byung ba chen po la brten pa'o //
translated: The odor of food is the odor of the four fundamental material elements which constitute the food itself.

original: grib ma nyid shing ljon pa'i gral rim gyis 'jug pa de bzung zhes gzhan dag zer ro //
analyzed: grib ma nyid shing ljon pa'i gral rim gyis 'jug pa de bzung zhes gzhan dag zer ro //
translated: The shadow is the tree itself, because it is perceived when the tree is perceived.

original: yang ci'i phyir rdzas brgyad pa'i rdul phra rab gang la dri yin pa de la kha dog smos pa rjes su 'jug ste grib ma dang snang ba dag bzhin reg bya'i zhes pa phreng ba bzhin der gnas so //
analyzed: yang ci'i phyir rdzas brgyad pa'i rdul phra rab gang la dri yin pa de la kha dog smos pa rjes su 'jug ste grib ma dang snang ba dag bzhin reg bya'i zhes pa phreng ba bzhin der gnas so //
translated: Why is it that, in the particle which is a molecule of eight substances, odor is not followed by the declaration of color, as is the case for shadow and light?

original: gsum po rnams gnas kyi dbang gis te /
analyzed: gsum po rnams gnas kyi dbang gis te /
translated: The three, odor, taste, and tangible, are declared in the order in which they are grasped.

original: rna ba gnas dag ji ltar gnas pa'i rim pas 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rna ba gnas dag ji ltar gnas pa'i rim pas 'gyur ro //
translated: The order of the sense-faculties is determined by the order in which they appear in the Sūtra.

original: yid kyang de dag la brten pa dang zhes bya ba ni rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga'i mtshan nyid dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga'i mtshan nyid dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i tshogs kyi mtshan nyid de /
analyzed: yid kyang de dag la brten pa dang zhes bya ba ni rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga'i mtshan nyid dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga'i mtshan nyid dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i tshogs kyi mtshan nyid de /
translated: The five collections of consciousness have the nature of the five sense faculties, and the mental faculty has the nature of the sixth collection of consciousness.

original: 'di dag rnam pa drug car yang gzugs can ma yin pa'i phyir yul na mi gnas @79b so ;
analyzed: 'di dag rnam pa drug car yang gzugs can ma yin pa'i phyir yul na mi gnas @79b so ;
translated: Since all six of these are not physical, they do not exist in a place.

original: / gzhan dag na re dang po lnga ni de'i 'jug pa lnga rnams te /🔽gsum po gang dag las ches gsal bar ring du 'jug pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: / gzhan dag na re dang po lnga ni de'i 'jug pa lnga rnams te / gsum po gang dag las ches gsal bar ring du 'jug pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: Others say that the first five are the five that engage their objects.🔽They are the five that engage their objects more clearly than the sixth.

original: dper na gnas kyi rim pas mig la sogs pa rnams yul la sngon du 'jug la /
analyzed: dper na gnas kyi rim pas mig la sogs pa rnams yul la sngon du 'jug la /
translated: For example, the eye and so on engage their objects first in terms of their order of location.

original: yid ni de dag la phyir 'jug pa lta bu'o zhes zer ro //
analyzed: yid ni de dag la phyir 'jug pa lta bu'o zhes zer ro //
translated: The mental faculty engages them later.

original: de rnams la yang 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa'i rten gyi dngos por nye bar 'gro ba'i yul smos pa ni /
analyzed: de rnams la yang 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa'i rten gyi dngos por nye bar 'gro ba'i yul smos pa ni /
translated: The object is mentioned as the basis for engaging those sense faculties.

original: mig dang rna ba dag yul rgyang ring ba'i phyir gnyis pa de dag sngar smos so //
analyzed: mig dang rna ba dag yul rgyang ring ba'i phyir gnyis pa de dag sngar smos so //
translated: The eye and the ear are the first two because their objects are at a distance.

original: de las kyang mig ni ches rgyang ring ba la 'jug go //
analyzed: de las kyang mig ni ches rgyang ring ba la 'jug go //
translated: The eye is the first because it perceives at a greater distance than the ear.

original: sna dang lce dang lus gsum po rnams las kyang gang zhig ches gsal ba ste /
analyzed: sna dang lce dang lus gsum po rnams las kyang gang zhig ches gsal ba ste /
translated: Among the three, nose, tongue and body, the nose is the first because it perceives a subtle object.

original: ji ltar sna yis dri phra mo dmigs pa de ltar lces ro ma yin la /
analyzed: ji ltar sna yis dri phra mo dmigs pa de ltar lces ro ma yin la /
translated: The nose perceives a subtle object, for it perceives odor. The tongue does not perceive taste in the same way,

original: ji ltar lces ro ltar lus kyis grang ba dang dro ba dag ma yin no //🔽gal te mig la sogs pas nyams su myong ba'i gzugs la sogs pa kho na la yid kyi rnam par shes pa 'jug na /
analyzed: ji ltar lces ro ltar lus kyis grang ba dang dro ba dag ma yin no // gal te mig la sogs pas nyams su myong ba'i gzugs la sogs pa kho na la yid kyi rnam par shes pa 'jug na /
translated: and the body does not perceive the tangible in the same way.

original: ji ltar gnyid log pa rnams gzugs la sogs pa'i yul 'dzin ce na /
analyzed: ji ltar gnyid log pa rnams gzugs la sogs pa'i yul 'dzin ce na /
translated: If the mental consciousness is produced only by the eye, etc., when they are active, how is it that one perceives form, etc., when one is asleep?

original: kha cig na re sngon nyams su myong ba dran pa las de yin no //
analyzed: kha cig na re sngon nyams su myong ba dran pa las de yin no //
translated: Some say: It is due to the memory of what was previously experienced.

original: de lta ma yin na dmus long gis kyang gzugs dmigs te /
analyzed: de lta ma yin na dmus long gis kyang gzugs dmigs te /
translated: Otherwise, the blind would also perceive visible form.

original: de rmi lam rjes su dran pa kho nar gnyid sad pa bzhin 'di nga yis gzugs la sogs pa 'dzin pa ma yin pa'i phyir rmi lam mo zhes nyams su myong ba sngon gnyid ma log pas dran par byed de /
analyzed: de rmi lam rjes su dran pa kho nar gnyid sad pa bzhin 'di nga yis gzugs la sogs pa 'dzin pa ma yin pa'i phyir rmi lam mo zhes nyams su myong ba sngon gnyid ma log pas dran par byed de /
translated: It is a dream because it is not like the waking state, which apprehends form and so on.

original: 'di ni des yul yongs su gcod pa ma yin pas nyams su myong ba nyid rmi lam du dmigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni des yul yongs su gcod pa ma yin pas nyams su myong ba nyid rmi lam du dmigs pa ma yin no //
translated: This is not an experience that is the object of a dream because it does not comprehend its object.

original: gal te de yang skye ba gzhan du nyams su myong bas so zhe na /
analyzed: gal te de yang skye ba gzhan du nyams su myong bas so zhe na /
translated: If you say that it is because it is experienced in another life,

original: 'o na de lta na dmus long gis kyang rmi lam du gzugs dmigs par thal bar 'gyur te skye ba gzhan du nyams su myong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'o na de lta na dmus long gis kyang rmi lam du gzugs dmigs par thal bar 'gyur te skye ba gzhan du nyams su myong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: then it follows that even a congenitally blind person would perceive form in a dream because it is experienced in another life.

original: long bas kyang rmi lam du gzugs mi mthong ba 'di ma grub pa de'i phyir rmi lam yang sngon gyi dmigs pa gzhan ni srid pas bstan bcos so sor bshad la /
analyzed: long bas kyang rmi lam du gzugs mi mthong ba 'di ma grub pa de'i phyir rmi lam yang sngon gyi dmigs pa gzhan ni srid pas bstan bcos so sor bshad la /
translated: This is not established because even a blind person does not see form in a dream. Therefore, it is explained in the treatises that a dream is possible because of a previous object.

original: mig gi rnam par shes pas nyams su myong ba yid kyi rnam par shes pas shes par bya ba rnams ji snyed pa dang de snyed pa bshad do //
analyzed: mig gi rnam par shes pas nyams su myong ba yid kyi rnam par shes pas shes par bya ba rnams ji snyed pa dang de snyed pa bshad do //
translated: The objects of the eye consciousness are explained as being the objects of the mental consciousness.

original: nges pa kho nar lnga rnams phan tshun gzhan la yang ma yin no //🔽mngon du gyur pa'i phyir zhes bya ba gzugs la sogs pa'i yul gang yin pa rnams rmi lam du nye bar @80a * //
analyzed: nges pa kho nar lnga rnams phan tshun gzhan la yang ma yin no // mngon du gyur pa'i phyir zhes bya ba gzugs la sogs pa'i yul gang yin pa rnams rmi lam du nye bar @80a * //
translated: The five sense consciousnesses are not mutually related.

original: dmigs pa de dang mngon par 'brel pa nyid do //
analyzed: dmigs pa de dang mngon par 'brel pa nyid do //
translated: Because they are manifest, whatever objects such as form are apprehended in a dream, they are related to the manifest.🔽The Treatise declares:

original: da bstan bcos su brjod ces bya ba de yang gzugs bstan du yong ba dang zhing sgrib pa med par byed pa nam mkha'i khams lta bu'o //
analyzed: da bstan bcos su brjod ces bya ba de yang gzugs bstan du yong ba dang zhing sgrib pa med par byed pa nam mkha'i khams lta bu'o //
translated: “The form of the dream is like the element of space, because it is visible, it is form, and it is not obstructed.”

original: gal te de'i gzugs glang po che dang rta dang ri bo dang ljon shing la sogs pa pa'i rnam pa dang zhing sgrib pa med par byas nas de'i rnam pa de bzhin du mthong ba dang ci ste de'i rnam pa ma yin pa yang rmi lam gyi nang
analyzed: gal te de'i gzugs glang po che dang rta dang ri bo dang ljon shing la sogs pa pa'i rnam pa dang zhing sgrib pa med par byas nas de'i rnam pa de bzhin du mthong ba dang ci ste de'i rnam pa ma yin pa yang rmi lam gyi nang
translated: If the form of the dream is the form of elephants, horses, mountains, trees, and so on, and it is not obstructed in the field, then why is it not seen in that way?

original: du gzugs dmigs pa'i phyir yod pa ma yin pa dmigs pa de shes par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: du gzugs dmigs pa'i phyir yod pa ma yin pa dmigs pa de shes par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, since form is observed, the nonexistence of the object of observation is known.

original: de la ni rnam par dpyad pa gzhan te de nyid kyi phyir gtam 'phros pa zhar la byung bas chog go //
analyzed: de la ni rnam par dpyad pa gzhan te de nyid kyi phyir gtam 'phros pa zhar la byung bas chog go //
translated: This is a different kind of analysis, and therefore it is sufficient to have discussed this topic incidentally.

original: dkyus ma nyid brtsam par bya ste /🔽dbang don de dag kho na la //
analyzed: dkyus ma nyid brtsam par bya ste / dbang don de dag kho na la //
translated: Now we will begin the main topic.🔽The ten bases and ten elements

original: skye mched dang ni khams bcur 'dod //
analyzed: skye mched dang ni khams bcur 'dod //
translated: are asserted to be just the sense faculties and objects.

original: ces bya ba der gzugs can gyi skye mched bcu gzugs kyi phung po'i rang bzhin du bshad la /
analyzed: ces bya ba der gzugs can gyi skye mched bcu gzugs kyi phung po'i rang bzhin du bshad la /
translated: In that passage, the ten physical bases are explained to be the nature of the form aggregate.

original: chos rnams rab tu rnam 'byed med par zhes bya ba der skye mched thams cad chos kyi rang bzhin du bshad pa de'i phyir 'dri ba ni /
analyzed: chos rnams rab tu rnam 'byed med par zhes bya ba der skye mched thams cad chos kyi rang bzhin du bshad pa de'i phyir 'dri ba ni /
translated: And in the passage that states, “Without the discernment of phenomena,” all the bases are explained to be the nature of the phenomena base.🔽Therefore the question is raised:

original: yang ci'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste gzugs kyi bdag nyid du khyad par med kyang gcig ni gzugs kyi skye mched ces bya bar brjod kyi gzhan dag ni ma yin /
analyzed: yang ci'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste gzugs kyi bdag nyid du khyad par med kyang gcig ni gzugs kyi skye mched ces bya bar brjod kyi gzhan dag ni ma yin /
translated: Why is one called the form base and the others not?

original: yang na sgra la sogs pa'i skye mched ltar yin pa yang ming gzhan ji ltar mi brjod /
analyzed: yang na sgra la sogs pa'i skye mched ltar yin pa yang ming gzhan ji ltar mi brjod /
translated: Or else, like the sense bases of sound and so on, why not call it by another name?

original: gzhan gzugs kyi skye mched nyid kyis brjod ces bya ba 'di la dgos pa ci zhig yod /
analyzed: gzhan gzugs kyi skye mched nyid kyis brjod ces bya ba 'di la dgos pa ci zhig yod /
translated: What is the purpose of calling it the form sense base?

original: de bzhin du chos kyi skye mched la yang brjod par bya'o zhe na /
analyzed: de bzhin du chos kyi skye mched la yang brjod par bya'o zhe na /
translated: The same should be said of the sense base of mental objects.

original: smras pa / bye brag don dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste gzugs kyi chos nyid du khyad par med pa rnams so sor skye mched yin par shes par byedo la'o //
analyzed: smras pa / bye brag don dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste gzugs kyi chos nyid du khyad par med pa rnams so sor skye mched yin par shes par byedo la'o //
translated: The root text states, “The distinctions are for the sake of meaning, etc.” The distinctions are for the sake of understanding that the various forms that are not distinguished as the intrinsic natures of form are sense bases.

original: bye brag kyang ci zhe na de ni khyad par gyi ming ngo //
analyzed: bye brag kyang ci zhe na de ni khyad par gyi ming ngo //
translated: What are the distinctions? They are the names of the distinctions.

original: gal te gzugs kyi rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir bcu char yang gzugs kyi skye mched ces brjod na ni /
analyzed: gal te gzugs kyi rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir bcu char yang gzugs kyi skye mched ces brjod na ni /
translated: If the ten sense bases that are the intrinsic natures of form are all called the form sense base,

original: mig la sogs pa dang gzugs la sogs pa rnams so sor yul dang yul can gyi dngos por rtogs par mi 'gyur la /
analyzed: mig la sogs pa dang gzugs la sogs pa rnams so sor yul dang yul can gyi dngos por rtogs par mi 'gyur la /
translated: then the eye and so on and form and so on would not be understood as distinct in terms of being objects and faculties.

original: de ma rtogs pas kyang de dag so sor skye mched nyid du shes par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ma rtogs pas kyang de dag so sor skye mched nyid du shes par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: and without understanding that, one would not understand that they are the sense bases.

original: de'i don du gzugs kyi bdag nyid can du khyad par med kyang gcig gzugs kyi skye mched du brjod nas sgra la sogs pa rnams ming gzhan dag gi skye mched du rnam @80b par gzhag pa mdzad do //
analyzed: de'i don du gzugs kyi bdag nyid can du khyad par med kyang gcig gzugs kyi skye mched du brjod nas sgra la sogs pa rnams ming gzhan dag gi skye mched du rnam @80b par gzhag pa mdzad do //
translated: For that reason, although there is no difference in their nature of form, one form is called the form sense base, and sound, etc. are posited as the other sense bases by means of their other names.

original: gzugs la yang skye mched gzhan rnam par gcad par bya ba'i phyir ming gzhan mi 'dogs te /
analyzed: gzugs la yang skye mched gzhan rnam par gcad par bya ba'i phyir ming gzhan mi 'dogs te /
translated: Also, form is not given another name in order to distinguish it from the other sense bases.

original: de ni byed rgyu ltar gzugs kyi ming thun mong ba kho nas gzhan dag las rnam par gcod pas khyad par gyi ming gdags pa don med do //
analyzed: de ni byed rgyu ltar gzugs kyi ming thun mong ba kho nas gzhan dag las rnam par gcod pas khyad par gyi ming gdags pa don med do //
translated: Since it is distinguished from the others by the common name form alone, like a cause, there is no point in giving it a special name.

original: de nyid kyi phyir mig la sogs pa bye brag tu byas pa dag gis zhes rgya cher gsungs so //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir mig la sogs pa bye brag tu byas pa dag gis zhes rgya cher gsungs so //
translated: For that reason, it says, “The eye, etc. are distinguished by their specific names,” and so on.

original: yang na gzugs kyi skye mched gtso bo yin pa'i phyir gzugs kyi ming thun mong bas ston par mdzad kyi /
analyzed: yang na gzugs kyi skye mched gtso bo yin pa'i phyir gzugs kyi ming thun mong bas ston par mdzad kyi /
translated: Or, because the form sense base is primary, it is taught by means of the common name form.

original: gzugs kyi bdag nyid yin yang gzhan dag gis ni ma yin te /
analyzed: gzugs kyi bdag nyid yin yang gzhan dag gis ni ma yin te /
translated: It is the nature of form, but not of the others,

original: gtso bo ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gtso bo ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not the most important.

original: lhag ma rnams la gtso bor bstan pa'i phyir //🔽de ni thogs pa dang bcas pa yin pa'i phyir te zhes bya ba rgya cher gsungs so //
analyzed: lhag ma rnams la gtso bor bstan pa'i phyir // de ni thogs pa dang bcas pa yin pa'i phyir te zhes bya ba rgya cher gsungs so //
translated: The rest are taught as being secondary.🔽It is impeded, because it is impeded by the hand and so on.

original: reg pa ma yin pa'i phyir gzugs kyi skye mched la lag pa la sogs pa'i 'dus te reg bdag gis ci ltar reg ce na /
analyzed: reg pa ma yin pa'i phyir gzugs kyi skye mched la lag pa la sogs pa'i 'dus te reg bdag gis ci ltar reg ce na /
translated: How can the base of form be touched by the hand and so on, since it is not touchable?

original: de nyid la ni reg par mi brjod de /
analyzed: de nyid la ni reg par mi brjod de /
translated: It is not said that it is touched in itself.

original: 'on kyang de'i rten 'byung ba rnams la lag pa la sogs pa'i 'dus te reg pa dag gis reg pa na ste /
analyzed: 'on kyang de'i rten 'byung ba rnams la lag pa la sogs pa'i 'dus te reg pa dag gis reg pa na ste /
