translated: But when the elements that are its support are touched by the contact of the hand and so on,

original: phrad na gzugs su rung zhing gzhom du rung ngo //
analyzed: phrad na gzugs su rung zhing gzhom du rung ngo //
translated: it is said that it is touched, because it is in contact with that which is touchable.🔽It is said that it is touched when it is in contact with that which is touchable, because it is suitable to be touched and destroyed.

original: 'di zhes bya ba ni gzugs kyi dngos po tsam brtag tu rung bas rten la gnas pa brtag tu rung ba'o //
analyzed: 'di zhes bya ba ni gzugs kyi dngos po tsam brtag tu rung bas rten la gnas pa brtag tu rung ba'o //
translated: It is suitable to be touched in the sense that it is suitable to be touched in its own place, since it is just the entity of form.

original: che ge mo zhes bya ba ni rten bskal ba na gnas pa brtag tu rung ba'o //
analyzed: che ge mo zhes bya ba ni rten bskal ba na gnas pa brtag tu rung ba'o //
translated: It is suitable to be touched in the sense that it is suitable to be touched in its own time, since it endures for a while.

original: yang na rnam pa gnyi ga brtag tu rung ba nyid de thogs pa brtag tu rung ba dang yul brtag tu rung ba'o //
analyzed: yang na rnam pa gnyi ga brtag tu rung ba nyid de thogs pa brtag tu rung ba dang yul brtag tu rung ba'o //
translated: Or else, both aspects are tenable: the obstruction of form is tenable, and the object of form is tenable.

original: 'di ni 'di na'o zhes bya ba ni yul nye ba brtag tu rung ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ni 'di na'o zhes bya ba ni yul nye ba brtag tu rung ba'o //
translated: The statement “here” indicates the tenability of the proximity of the object.

original: che ge mo zhig na'o zhes bya ba ni yul thag ring ba brtag tu rung ba'o //
analyzed: che ge mo zhig na'o zhes bya ba ni yul thag ring ba brtag tu rung ba'o //
translated: The statement “there” indicates the tenability of the distance of the object.

original: de'i phyir de ltar na gzugs su rung ba'i phyir dang brtag tu rung ba'i phyir gzugs kyi skye mched kho na gtso bo yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar na gzugs su rung ba'i phyir dang brtag tu rung ba'i phyir gzugs kyi skye mched kho na gtso bo yin no //
translated: Therefore, form is primary because it is suitable as form and because it is tenable.

original: gzhan dag la ni brtag tu rung ba med pa'i phyir gtso bo ma yin te /
analyzed: gzhan dag la ni brtag tu rung ba med pa'i phyir gtso bo ma yin te /
translated: The other sense bases are not primary because they are not tenable.

original: gang gi phyir mig la sogs pa rnams ni rjes su dpag bas gzung bar bya ba yin pa'i phyir 'di na'o che ge no zhes na'o zhes dngos su brtag tu mi rung la /
analyzed: gang gi phyir mig la sogs pa rnams ni rjes su dpag bas gzung bar bya ba yin pa'i phyir 'di na'o che ge no zhes na'o zhes dngos su brtag tu mi rung la /
translated: The eyes, etc., are not tenable as “here” or “there” because they are apprehended by inference.

original: dri dang ro dang reg bya'i skye mched dag ni phrad nas gzung bar bya ba yin pa'i phyir che ge mo zhig na'o zhes yongs su brtag par mi nus so //
analyzed: dri dang ro dang reg bya'i skye mched dag ni phrad nas gzung bar bya ba yin pa'i phyir che ge mo zhig na'o zhes yongs su brtag par mi nus so //
translated: The sense-fields of odor, taste, and touch cannot be specified as to place, because they are grasped only when they come into contact with the sense-faculties.

original: sgra'i skye mched la yang phyogs bstan pa brtag tu yod par zad kyi yul brtag tu rung ba ni med do //
analyzed: sgra'i skye mched la yang phyogs bstan pa brtag tu yod par zad kyi yul brtag tu rung ba ni med do //
translated: As for the sense-field of sound, it is possible to specify its direction, but not its location.

original: 'jig rten na yang gzugs so zhes grags kyi sgra ni ma yin @81a * //
analyzed: 'jig rten na yang gzugs so zhes grags kyi sgra ni ma yin @81a * //
translated: In the world, it is only form that is known as being in a certain place, not sound.

original: la bcom ldan 'das kyis bstan pa yang 'jig rten la bstan pa'i phyir yin te /
analyzed: la bcom ldan 'das kyis bstan pa yang 'jig rten la bstan pa'i phyir yin te /
translated: And the teaching of the Blessed One is in conformity with the world.

original: bstan bcos rig pa rnams kyis kyang sgra la sogs pa rnams gzugs nyid du ma rtogs so //
analyzed: bstan bcos rig pa rnams kyis kyang sgra la sogs pa rnams gzugs nyid du ma rtogs so //
translated: The treatises on logic also do not consider sound, etc. to be form.

original: chos mang ba dang mchog bsdus phyir //🔽zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: chos mang ba dang mchog bsdus phyir // zhes bya ba la /
translated: Because it includes many dharmas and the best.

original: 'dir chos kyi ming can gyi chos mang po rnams kho na bsdus te /
analyzed: 'dir chos kyi ming can gyi chos mang po rnams kho na bsdus te /
translated: Here, many dharmas that are named dharmas are included.

original: chos rab tu rnam par 'byed pa yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag dang / shes pa dang / rjes su dran pa dang / dad pa dang / dran pa nye bar gzhag pa dang / so so yang dag par rig pa dang / skyabs dang dkon mchog la sogs pa rnams so //
analyzed: chos rab tu rnam par 'byed pa yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag dang / shes pa dang / rjes su dran pa dang / dad pa dang / dran pa nye bar gzhag pa dang / so so yang dag par rig pa dang / skyabs dang dkon mchog la sogs pa rnams so //
translated: the correct understandings, the refuges, the jewels, and so on.

original: 'dir tshor ba la sogs pa chos mang po zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'dir tshor ba la sogs pa chos mang po zhes bya ba la /
translated: Here, many dharmas such as feeling are called “many dharmas.”

original: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / 'dus ma byas rnams dang / rnam par rig byed ma yin pa bsdus te /
analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / 'dus ma byas rnams dang / rnam par rig byed ma yin pa bsdus te /
translated: Feeling, discernment, compositional factors, unconditioned phenomena, and non-indicative form are included.

original: chos kyi sgra spyi ming med par de dag ji ltar 'dzin par 'gyur /
analyzed: chos kyi sgra spyi ming med par de dag ji ltar 'dzin par 'gyur /
translated: Without a general term such as “dharmas,” how would they be apprehended?

original: dge ba dang rtag pa'i phyir ram sdug bsngal rgyu dang bcas ba nye bar zhi ba'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir chos kyi mchog ni mya ngan las 'das pa ste /
analyzed: dge ba dang rtag pa'i phyir ram sdug bsngal rgyu dang bcas ba nye bar zhi ba'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir chos kyi mchog ni mya ngan las 'das pa ste /
translated: Because it is virtuous and permanent, or because it is the nature of the complete pacification of suffering and its causes, the supreme dharma is nirvana.

original: chos kyi mchog bsdus pa'i phyir na chos kyi skye mched gtso bo nyid du ston par byed do //
analyzed: chos kyi mchog bsdus pa'i phyir na chos kyi skye mched gtso bo nyid du ston par byed do //
translated: The sense base of mental objects is taught as the most important sense base because it includes the supreme among mental objects.

original: sha'i dang lha'i dang 'phags pa'i shes rab dang mig gsum gyi spyod yul yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: sha'i dang lha'i dang 'phags pa'i shes rab dang mig gsum gyi spyod yul yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Because it is the domain of the three kinds of eyes, the fleshly eye, the divine eye, and the eye of wisdom.

original: de la sha'i mig ni bdag cag rnams kyi lta bu'o //
analyzed: de la sha'i mig ni bdag cag rnams kyi lta bu'o //
translated: The fleshly eye is like ours.

original: lha'i ni lha rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: lha'i ni lha rnams kyi'o //
translated: The divine eye is that of the gods.

original: 'phags pa'i shes rab kyi mig ni 'phags pa rnams kyi ste /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i shes rab kyi mig ni 'phags pa rnams kyi ste /
translated: The eye of wisdom is that of the noble ones.

original: zag pa med pa'i shes pa ste chos thams cad la dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: zag pa med pa'i shes pa ste chos thams cad la dmigs pa'o //
translated: It is undefiled knowledge that has all dharmas as its object.

original: sha'i mig dang lha'i ni gzugs kyi yul can kho na ste /
analyzed: sha'i mig dang lha'i ni gzugs kyi yul can kho na ste /
translated: The fleshly eye and the divine eye have form as their object alone.

original: rnam pa nyi shus rags pa nyid kyis don rnam pa du mar brtag tu rung ba'i phyir dang / go rims bzhin du sha'i dang lha'i mig gis mdun du rags pa dang / thams cad phra bar brtag tu rung ba'i phyir dang / 'phags pa'i shes rab kyi mig gis mi rtag pa la sogs par brtag tu rung ba'i phyir gcig gzugs kyi skye mched du bstan to //
analyzed: rnam pa nyi shus rags pa nyid kyis don rnam pa du mar brtag tu rung ba'i phyir dang / go rims bzhin du sha'i dang lha'i mig gis mdun du rags pa dang / thams cad phra bar brtag tu rung ba'i phyir dang / 'phags pa'i shes rab kyi mig gis mi rtag pa la sogs par brtag tu rung ba'i phyir gcig gzugs kyi skye mched du bstan to //
translated: The one form base is taught because it is suitable to be investigated as many objects by way of its twenty aspects, because it is suitable to be investigated as coarse in front by way of the fleshly eye and divine eye, and because it is suitable to be investigated as subtle in all ways by way of the ārya’s eye of wisdom.🔽

original: phan tshun zhes bya ba rgya cher 'byung ba la /
analyzed: phan tshun zhes bya ba rgya cher 'byung ba la /
translated: The one form base is taught because it is suitable to be investigated as many objects by way of its twenty aspects, because it is suitable to be investigated as gross in front by way of the fleshly eye and as subtle in all ways by way of the divine eye, and because it is suitable to be investigated as impermanent and so on by way of the ārya’s eye of wisdom.

original: mdo gzhan las bstan pa'i phung po dang skye mched dang khams 'di dag kho nar 'du na ni de ltar yin dang gang zhig gang du 'du ba brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: mdo gzhan las bstan pa'i phung po dang skye mched dang khams 'di dag kho nar 'du na ni de ltar yin dang gang zhig gang du 'du ba brjod par bya'o //
translated: The other aggregates, bases, and constituents that are taught in other sūtras are included in these aggregates, bases, and constituents.

original: 'on te tha dad pa yin na ni de ltar na yang 'dus byas thams cad dang zag @81b pa dang bcas pa rnams dang / chos thams cad ni go rims bzhin du phung po dag dang nye bar lan pa'i phung po dag dang skye mched dang khams dag gis bsdus so zhes bya ba de dang 'gal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'on te tha dad pa yin na ni de ltar na yang 'dus byas thams cad dang zag @81b pa dang bcas pa rnams dang / chos thams cad ni go rims bzhin du phung po dag dang nye bar lan pa'i phung po dag dang skye mched dang khams dag gis bsdus so zhes bya ba de dang 'gal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: All conditioned phenomena, all contaminated phenomena, and all phenomena are included in the aggregates, in the contaminated aggregates, in the bases and elements, respectively.

original: mdo gzhan las gsungs pa de 'di dag gi nang du mi 'du na cir 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: mdo gzhan las gsungs pa de 'di dag gi nang du mi 'du na cir 'gyur zhe na /
translated: If what is stated in other sutras is not included in these, what is the problem?

original: gsung rab kyi tha snyad la kun tu rmongs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gsung rab kyi tha snyad la kun tu rmongs par 'gyur ro //
translated: One would be confused about the terminology of the scriptures.

original: de bzlog bar bya ba'i phyir 'di dag tu 'du bar brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: de bzlog bar bya ba'i phyir 'di dag tu 'du bar brjod par bya ste /
translated: To prevent that, it should be said that they are included in these.

original: sgra'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir gzugs kyi phung pos bsdus so //
analyzed: sgra'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir gzugs kyi phung pos bsdus so //
translated: Name is included in the form aggregate because it is by nature sound.

original: ming ni mi ldan pa'i 'du byed kyi rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir 'du byed kyi phung pos bsdus so ;
analyzed: ming ni mi ldan pa'i 'du byed kyi rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir 'du byed kyi phung pos bsdus so ;
translated: Name is included in the formation aggregate because it is by nature nonassociated compositional factors.

original: / gal te gsung ni tshig yin par grags pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: / gal te gsung ni tshig yin par grags pa ma yin nam /
translated: Isn’t it well known that speech is a word?

original: ji ltar ming sangs rgyas kyi gsung nyid du brjod ce na //
analyzed: ji ltar ming sangs rgyas kyi gsung nyid du brjod ce na //
translated: How can a name be called the Buddha’s word?

original: 'di tshig yod pas de'i phyir 'gal ba med do //
analyzed: 'di tshig yod pas de'i phyir 'gal ba med do //
translated: Since it is a verbal expression, there is no contradiction.

original: sangs rgyas kyi gsung ni don gyis rab tu dbye ba'i phyir la /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi gsung ni don gyis rab tu dbye ba'i phyir la /
translated: The Buddha’s word is distinguished by its meaning,

original: ming yang don brjod par byed pa'i phyir sangs rgyas kyi gsung ming gi bdag nyid yin no zhes rjod par byed do //
analyzed: ming yang don brjod par byed pa'i phyir sangs rgyas kyi gsung ming gi bdag nyid yin no zhes rjod par byed do //
translated: and since a name also expresses meaning, it is said that the Buddha’s word has the nature of a name.

original: nges pa de la ming ni dpe tsam du zad do //
analyzed: nges pa de la ming ni dpe tsam du zad do //
translated: In this regard, a name is merely an example,

original: sangs rgyas kyi gsung ming dang tshig dang yi ge'i tshogs kyi bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi gsung ming dang tshig dang yi ge'i tshogs kyi bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the Buddha’s word has the nature of a collection of names, phrases, and letters.

original: de la don dam pa dang kun rdzob tu yod pa'i rang gi ngo bo gsal bar byed pa ni ming ste /
analyzed: de la don dam pa dang kun rdzob tu yod pa'i rang gi ngo bo gsal bar byed pa ni ming ste /
translated: Among them, a name is that which illuminates the ultimate and conventional natures of things,

original: dper na gzugs so //
analyzed: dper na gzugs so //
translated: for example, “form,”

original: bum pa'o // rtag pa'o //
analyzed: bum pa'o // rtag pa'o //
translated: “pot,” “permanent,”

original: mi'o zhes pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: mi'o zhes pa lta bu'o //
translated: and “person.”

original: gang gis the tshom med par bya ba dang dus dang yon tan gyi khyad par dang 'brel ba rtogs par byed pa ni tshig ste /
analyzed: gang gis the tshom med par bya ba dang dus dang yon tan gyi khyad par dang 'brel ba rtogs par byed pa ni tshig ste /
translated: A phrase is that which causes one to understand without doubt, and it is connected with a particular time and quality.

original: dper na lhas byin g'a ma bh'a dza krishnam zhes pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na lhas byin g'a ma bh'a dza krishnam zhes pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, Devadatta is the son of Gautama.

original: yi ge ni yig 'bru aa yig la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: yi ge ni yig 'bru aa yig la sogs pa'o //
translated: Syllable is the letter a, etc.

original: phung po la sogs gtam re yin //
analyzed: phung po la sogs gtam re yin //
translated: Each topic is a heap, etc.

original: zhes bya ba la phung po las brtsams te bstan pa ni chos kyi phung po gcig go //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la phung po las brtsams te bstan pa ni chos kyi phung po gcig go //
translated: The teaching that begins with the aggregates is one aggregate of Dharma.

original: de bzhin du skye mched dang khams dang rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba la sogs pa rnams la yang brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du skye mched dang khams dang rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba la sogs pa rnams la yang brjod par bya'o //
translated: The same should be said for the bases, elements, dependent origination, etc.

original: la sogs kyi sgras dge ba dang mi dge ba'i las kyi lam dang bsdu ba'i dngos po la sogs pa rnams sdud par byed do //
analyzed: la sogs kyi sgras dge ba dang mi dge ba'i las kyi lam dang bsdu ba'i dngos po la sogs pa rnams sdud par byed do //
translated: The words “etc.” include the virtuous and nonvirtuous paths of action, the means of gathering students, and so on.

original: spyod pa rnams kyi gnyen por ni //
analyzed: spyod pa rnams kyi gnyen por ni //
translated: The antidote to the conduct of beings

original: zhes bya ba rgya cher 'byung ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba rgya cher 'byung ste /
translated: is taught to be the aggregate of Dharma.

original: 'di ni gnas pa yin te sems can rnams kyi spyod pa ni 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang gti mug dang / nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal dang / lta ba dang rtog pa la sogs pa'i bye brag gis brgyad @82a * //
analyzed: 'di ni gnas pa yin te sems can rnams kyi spyod pa ni 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang gti mug dang / nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal dang / lta ba dang rtog pa la sogs pa'i bye brag gis brgyad @82a * //
translated: This is the abiding nature, but the conduct of sentient beings is of eighty-four thousand types, differentiated by desire, anger, ignorance, pride thinking i, and views,🔽and so on.

original: khri ste / de rnams kyi gnyen por bcom ldan 'das kyis mi sdug pa dang byams pa dang rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba dang / mi rtag pa'i 'du shes dang / stong pa nyid dang / dbugs rngub pa dang 'byung ba dran pa la sogs pa bstan pa'i sgo nas chos kyi phung po brgyad khri gsungs par grag go //
analyzed: khri ste / de rnams kyi gnyen por bcom ldan 'das kyis mi sdug pa dang byams pa dang rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba dang / mi rtag pa'i 'du shes dang / stong pa nyid dang / dbugs rngub pa dang 'byung ba dran pa la sogs pa bstan pa'i sgo nas chos kyi phung po brgyad khri gsungs par grag go //
translated: It is said that the Bhagavan taught eighty-four thousand aggregates of Dharma as antidotes to those, through teaching repulsiveness, love, dependent origination, the ideation of impermanence, emptiness, mindfulness of inhalation and exhalation and so on.

original: gzhan dag na re /
analyzed: gzhan dag na re /
translated: Others say:

original: phung po la sogs gtam re yin //
analyzed: phung po la sogs gtam re yin //
translated: Each topic is a heap.

original: zhes bya ba 'di nyid /
analyzed: zhes bya ba 'di nyid /
translated: This is stated in the Abhidharma.🔽The aggregates and so on are taught

original: spyod pa rnams kyi gnyen por ni /
analyzed: spyod pa rnams kyi gnyen por ni /
translated: as antidotes to the conduct of sentient beings.

original: zhes rnam grangs gzhan gyis bstan te /
analyzed: zhes rnam grangs gzhan gyis bstan te /
translated: This is taught by another enumeration.

original: gang zhig nyon mongs pa'i gnyen por mi 'gyur ba'i phung po bstan pa de ni 'ga' yang med pa'i phyir ro zhes zer ro //
analyzed: gang zhig nyon mongs pa'i gnyen por mi 'gyur ba'i phung po bstan pa de ni 'ga' yang med pa'i phyir ro zhes zer ro //
translated: because there is no aggregate that is not an antidote to the defilements.

original: tshul khrims kyi phung po ni gzugs kyi phung pos zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: tshul khrims kyi phung po ni gzugs kyi phung pos zhes bya ba la /
translated: The aggregate of morality is included in the form aggregate.

original: tshul khrims ni lus dang ngag gi las kyi rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir gzugs kyi phung pos bsdus so //
analyzed: tshul khrims ni lus dang ngag gi las kyi rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir gzugs kyi phung pos bsdus so //
translated: Morality is included in the form aggregate because it is by nature the karma of body and speech.

original: ting nge 'dzin dang shes rab dang rnam par grol ba'i ye shes mthong ba'i phung po rnams ni tshor ba dang 'du shes las tha dad cing sems dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i 'du byed kyi phung po'i mtshan nyid can yin pa'i phyir 'du byed kyi phung pos bsdus
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin dang shes rab dang rnam par grol ba'i ye shes mthong ba'i phung po rnams ni tshor ba dang 'du shes las tha dad cing sems dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i 'du byed kyi phung po'i mtshan nyid can yin pa'i phyir 'du byed kyi phung pos bsdus
translated: The aggregates of concentration, wisdom, and the vision and cognition of liberation are included in the formation aggregate because they are by nature mental factors concomitant with the mind.

original: so // 'dir ni rnam par grol ba'i phung po mi slob pa'i mos pa yin gyi /
analyzed: so // 'dir ni rnam par grol ba'i phung po mi slob pa'i mos pa yin gyi /
translated: Here, the aggregate of liberation is the nonlearner's faith,

original: 'dus ma byas ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'dus ma byas ni ma yin no //
translated: but it is not unconditioned liberation.

original: brgyad ni ma chags pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la ;
analyzed: brgyad ni ma chags pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la ;
translated: Eight are by nature nonattachment.

original: zad par nam mkha' dang rnam par shes pa ma gtogs pa la sogs pa'i zad par rnams te /
analyzed: zad par nam mkha' dang rnam par shes pa ma gtogs pa la sogs pa'i zad par rnams te /
translated: The bases of totality are the ten totalities, such as the totality of earth, and so on, except for the totalities of space and consciousness.🔽The eight liberations, eight bases of subjugation,

original: zad par bcu'o brgyad ma chags //🔽zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zad par bcu'o brgyad ma chags // zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: and ten bases of totality are uncontaminated.

original: ma chags pa yang chos kyi skye mched kyis bsdus pa'i phyir zad par gyi skye mched brgyad ni chos kyi skye mched kyis bsdus so //
analyzed: ma chags pa yang chos kyi skye mched kyis bsdus pa'i phyir zad par gyi skye mched brgyad ni chos kyi skye mched kyis bsdus so //
translated: The eight bases of subjugation are the four of form observing form and so on, and the four of formless observing form and so on.🔽The ten bases of totality are the ten totalities, such as the totality of earth, and so on, except for the totalities of space and consciousness.

original: 'khor rnams dang bcas na ni zhes rgya cher 'byung ba la /
analyzed: 'khor rnams dang bcas na ni zhes rgya cher 'byung ba la /
translated: If they possess a retinue, they are included in the phenomena element.

original: de la rnam par rig byed ma yin pa'i gzugs ni gzugs kyi phung pos so //
analyzed: de la rnam par rig byed ma yin pa'i gzugs ni gzugs kyi phung pos so //
translated: Nonindicative form is included in the form aggregate.

original: rnam par shes pa'i phung po ni yid kyi skye mched kyis bsdus so //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i phung po ni yid kyi skye mched kyis bsdus so //
translated: The consciousness aggregate is included in the mental base.

original: lhag ma rnams ni chos kyi skye mched kyis so //
analyzed: lhag ma rnams ni chos kyi skye mched kyis so //
translated: The remaining aggregates and bases are included in the phenomena base.

original: zil gyis gnon pa'i skye mched rnams kyang de dang 'dra'o zhes bya ba'i sgras ni de la ma chags pa'i bdag nyid 'khor dang bcas pa rnams ni phung po lnga'i rang bzhin dang yid dang chos kyi skye mched dag gi nang du 'dus bar yongs su gzung bar
analyzed: zil gyis gnon pa'i skye mched rnams kyang de dang 'dra'o zhes bya ba'i sgras ni de la ma chags pa'i bdag nyid 'khor dang bcas pa rnams ni phung po lnga'i rang bzhin dang yid dang chos kyi skye mched dag gi nang du 'dus bar yongs su gzung bar
translated: The words “the same is true” indicate that the bases of subjugation, which are characterized by nonattachment, are included in the five aggregates and in the mind and mental objects bases.

original: bya'o // zad par nam mkha' dang rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched ces bya ba ni /
analyzed: bya'o // zad par nam mkha' dang rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched ces bya ba ni /
translated: The bases of totality are the four formless bases of infinite space and so on.

original: zad par skye @82b mched bcu las /
analyzed: zad par skye @82b mched bcu las /
translated: The bases of totality are ten in number.

original: khyad par du nam mkha' mtha' yas la sogs pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: khyad par du nam mkha' mtha' yas la sogs pa bzhi ste /
translated: The four formless bases of infinite space and so on are distinguished from the others.

original: nam mkha' dang rnam par shes pa dang ci yang med pa dang / 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched dag ni rjes su 'brang ba'i gzugs med pa'i phyir phung po bzhi'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: nam mkha' dang rnam par shes pa dang ci yang med pa dang / 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched dag ni rjes su 'brang ba'i gzugs med pa'i phyir phung po bzhi'i rang bzhin no //
translated: The bases of infinite space, infinite consciousness, nothingness, and neither existence nor nonexistence are, respectively, the four aggregates in the formless realm because they do not have form that is a concomitant.

original: rnam par grol ba'i skye mched lnga ni zhes rgya cher 'byung ba la /
analyzed: rnam par grol ba'i skye mched lnga ni zhes rgya cher 'byung ba la /
translated: The five bases of liberation are the four formless aggregates.

original: rnam par grol ba'i skye mched dang po gsum la ni gzhung 'dzin pas sgra'i skye mched do //
analyzed: rnam par grol ba'i skye mched dang po gsum la ni gzhung 'dzin pas sgra'i skye mched do //
translated: The first three doors of liberation are included in the sense base of sound because they are the domain of the mind that holds the scriptures.

original: bzhi pa yang gal te brjod cing sems par byed na ni skye mched gsum yod la /
analyzed: bzhi pa yang gal te brjod cing sems par byed na ni skye mched gsum yod la /
translated: The fourth is included in three sense bases if it is expressed and contemplated.

original: de lta ma yin na yid dang chos kyi skye mched kyis bsdus so //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na yid dang chos kyi skye mched kyis bsdus so //
translated: If it is not, it is included in the sense bases of the mental faculty and mental objects.

original: lnga pa yang yid dang chos kyi skye mched dag yod de /
analyzed: lnga pa yang yid dang chos kyi skye mched dag yod de /
translated: The fifth is included in the sense bases of the mental faculty and mental objects.

original: de'i phyir 'khor dang bcas pa rnams ni sgra dang yid dang chos kyi skye mched rnams kyis bsdus so //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'khor dang bcas pa rnams ni sgra dang yid dang chos kyi skye mched rnams kyis bsdus so //
translated: Therefore, when they are accompanied by retinue, they are included in the sense bases of sound, the mental faculty, and mental objects.

original: rnam par grol ba'i skye mched lnga gang zhe na /
analyzed: rnam par grol ba'i skye mched lnga gang zhe na /
translated: What are the five doors of liberation?🔽A sutra states:

original: mdo las 'di na dge slong la ston pa'am tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa bla ma'i gnas lta bu gang yang rung ba zhig gis chos ston par byed pa na /
analyzed: mdo las 'di na dge slong la ston pa'am tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa bla ma'i gnas lta bu gang yang rung ba zhig gis chos ston par byed pa na /
translated: Here a monk is taught Dharma by the Teacher or a fellow monk who is like a teacher.

original: 'di la ston pa'am tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa bla ma'i gnas lta bu gang yang rung ba zhig ji lta ji ltar chos ston pa de lta de ltar chos de dag la don so so yang dag par rig pa dang chos so so yang dag par rig🔽par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di la ston pa'am tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa bla ma'i gnas lta bu gang yang rung ba zhig ji lta ji ltar chos ston pa de lta de ltar chos de dag la don so so yang dag par rig pa dang chos so so yang dag par rig par 'gyur ro //
translated: In this regard, the teacher or a spiritual teacher who is like a holy person teaches the Dharma in whatever way is appropriate. In whatever way the Dharma is taught, in that same way, one will have discernment of the meaning of those teachings and discernment of the teachings.

original: don so so yang dag par rig pa dang chos so so yang dag par rig pa de dag las rab tu dga' ba skye'o //
analyzed: don so so yang dag par rig pa dang chos so so yang dag par rig pa de dag las rab tu dga' ba skye'o //
translated: From those two, discernment of the meaning and discernment of the teachings, there arises joy.

original: rab tu dga' bar gyur pa las yid dga' ba skye'o //
analyzed: rab tu dga' bar gyur pa las yid dga' ba skye'o //
translated: When one has joy, there arises mental satisfaction.

original: yid dga' bar gyur na lus shin tu sbyangs bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yid dga' bar gyur na lus shin tu sbyangs bar 'gyur ro //
translated: When the mind is satisfied, the body becomes tranquil.

original: lus shin tu sbyangs bas bde ba myong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lus shin tu sbyangs bas bde ba myong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: When the body is tranquil, one experiences pleasure.

original: bde bar gyur na sems mnyam par 'jog go //
analyzed: bde bar gyur na sems mnyam par 'jog go //
translated: When one is pleased, the mind becomes concentrated.

original: sems mnyam par bzhag na yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes te /
analyzed: sems mnyam par bzhag na yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes te /
translated: When the mind is concentrated, one knows and sees things as they really are.

original: 'di ni rnam par grol ba'i skye mched dang po'o //
analyzed: 'di ni rnam par grol ba'i skye mched dang po'o //
translated: This is the first foundation of mindfulness.

original: de ltar gnas pa'i dge slong ngam dge slong ma ting nge 'dzin la mnyam par 'jog pa ni zag pa yongs su ma zad pa yongs su zad par byed /
analyzed: de ltar gnas pa'i dge slong ngam dge slong ma ting nge 'dzin la mnyam par 'jog pa ni zag pa yongs su ma zad pa yongs su zad par byed /
translated: The monk or nun who is thus situated and who is concentrated in absorption exhausts the defilements which have not been exhausted.

original: ma thob pa bla na med pa'i grub pa dang bde ba'i mya ngan las 'das pa thob par byed do //
analyzed: ma thob pa bla na med pa'i grub pa dang bde ba'i mya ngan las 'das pa thob par byed do //
translated: He obtains the supreme attainment and the bliss of nirvana which have not been obtained.

original: gzhan yang lhan cig nyid du ston pa'am tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa mkhas pa bla ma'i gnas lta bu gang yang rung ba zhig gis chos ston pa na ji ltar thos pa dang bshad pa'i chos rnams @83a * //
analyzed: gzhan yang lhan cig nyid du ston pa'am tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa mkhas pa bla ma'i gnas lta bu gang yang rung ba zhig gis chos ston pa na ji ltar thos pa dang bshad pa'i chos rnams @83a * //
translated: Moreover, when the Master or a learned companion in the religious life, who is like a spiritual teacher, is teaching the Dharma, the bodhisattva listens to the Dharma and recites it in the same way that he has heard and studied it.

original: gzhan dag la rgya cher kha don byed du 'jug pa de lta de ltar de chos rnams la don so so yang dag par rig par 'gyur /
analyzed: gzhan dag la rgya cher kha don byed du 'jug pa de lta de ltar de chos rnams la don so so yang dag par rig par 'gyur /
translated: He makes others recite it extensively. In this way, he becomes skilled in the meaning of the Dharma and in the Dharma itself.

original: chos so so yang dag par rig par 'gyur zhing zhes bya ba snga ma bzhin te 'di ni rnam par grol ba'i skye mched gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: chos so so yang dag par rig par 'gyur zhing zhes bya ba snga ma bzhin te 'di ni rnam par grol ba'i skye mched gnyis pa'o //
translated: This is the second foundation of mindfulness.

original: gzhan yang lhan cig nyid du ston pa'am tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa mkhas pa bla ma'i gnas lta bu gang yang rung ba zhig gis chos ston par byed pa na /
analyzed: gzhan yang lhan cig nyid du ston pa'am tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa mkhas pa bla ma'i gnas lta bu gang yang rung ba zhig gis chos ston par byed pa na /
translated: Moreover, when a teacher or a spiritual friend who is learned and like a guru teaches the Dharma,

original: ji ltar thos pa dang / ji ltar bshad pa dang / ji ltar kun chub par byas pa'i chos rnams rgya cher dbyangs kyi kha ton du byed pa dang / yang ji ltar thos pa dang / ji ltar bshad pa dang / ji ltar kun chub par byas pa'i chos rnams gzhan dag la rgya cher yang dag par ston par byed de /
analyzed: ji ltar thos pa dang / ji ltar bshad pa dang / ji ltar kun chub par byas pa'i chos rnams rgya cher dbyangs kyi kha ton du byed pa dang / yang ji ltar thos pa dang / ji ltar bshad pa dang / ji ltar kun chub par byas pa'i chos rnams gzhan dag la rgya cher yang dag par ston par byed de /
translated: he or she recites aloud the teachings that he or she has heard, explained, and mastered, and he or she also teaches others in detail the teachings that he or she has heard, explained, and mastered.

original: ji lta ji ltar gzhan dag la rgya cher yang dag par ston pa de lta de ltar de don rnams la don so so yang dag par rig par 'gyur /
analyzed: ji lta ji ltar gzhan dag la rgya cher yang dag par ston pa de lta de ltar de don rnams la don so so yang dag par rig par 'gyur /
translated: To the extent that he or she teaches others in detail, he or she will attain the discernment of meaning with regard to those meanings and

original: chos so so yang dag par rig par 'gyur zhing zhes bya ba snga ma bzhin te /
analyzed: chos so so yang dag par rig par 'gyur zhing zhes bya ba snga ma bzhin te /
translated: the discernment of the teachings, as before.

original: 'di ni rnam par grol ba'i skye mched gsum pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni rnam par grol ba'i skye mched gsum pa'o //
translated: This is the third source of liberation.

original: gzhan yang sngar bshad pa mi byed mod kyi /
analyzed: gzhan yang sngar bshad pa mi byed mod kyi /
translated: Moreover, he does not do as was previously explained.

original: ji ltar thos pa dang / ji ltar bshad pa dang / ji ltar kun chub par byas pa rnams la sems par byed 'jal bar byed yongs su rtogs par byed de /
analyzed: ji ltar thos pa dang / ji ltar bshad pa dang / ji ltar kun chub par byas pa rnams la sems par byed 'jal bar byed yongs su rtogs par byed de /
translated: He reflects, evaluates, and fully investigates what he has heard, what he has explained, and what he has understood.

original: ji lta ji ltar de dag la sems par byed pa dang 'jal bar byed pa dang yongs su rtogs par byed pa de lta de ltar de chos rnams la don so so yang dag par rig par 'gyur /
analyzed: ji lta ji ltar de dag la sems par byed pa dang 'jal bar byed pa dang yongs su rtogs par byed pa de lta de ltar de chos rnams la don so so yang dag par rig par 'gyur /
translated: As he reflects, evaluates, and fully investigates, he gains the discernment of meaning with regard to those teachings.

original: chos so so yang dag par rig par 'gyur zhing zhes bya ba snga ma bzhin te /
analyzed: chos so so yang dag par rig par 'gyur zhing zhes bya ba snga ma bzhin te /
translated: He gains the discernment of the teachings, as before.

original: 'di ni rnam par grol ba'i skye mched bzhi pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni rnam par grol ba'i skye mched bzhi pa'o //
translated: This is the fourth stage of liberation.

original: gzhan yang sngar bshad pa mi byed mod kyi /
analyzed: gzhan yang sngar bshad pa mi byed mod kyi /
translated: Moreover, he does not do as was previously explained.

original: de ting nge 'dzin gyi mtshan ma bzang po legs par 'dzin par byed /🔽legs par ston par byed /
analyzed: de ting nge 'dzin gyi mtshan ma bzang po legs par 'dzin par byed / legs par ston par byed /
translated: He properly grasps the excellent signs of meditative concentration.🔽He properly demonstrates them.

original: legs par sbyor bar byed de /
analyzed: legs par sbyor bar byed de /
translated: He properly applies himself to them.

original: ji lta ji ltar ting nge 'dzin gyi mtshan mo bzang po legs par 'dzin par byed pa dang / legs par ston par byed pa dang / legs par sbyor bar byed pa de lta de ltar de chos rnams la don so so yang dag par rig par 'gyur /
analyzed: ji lta ji ltar ting nge 'dzin gyi mtshan mo bzang po legs par 'dzin par byed pa dang / legs par ston par byed pa dang / legs par sbyor bar byed pa de lta de ltar de chos rnams la don so so yang dag par rig par 'gyur /
translated: As he thus grasps the good night of concentration well, teaches it well, and practices it well, he will understand the individual meanings of the teachings.

original: chos so so yang dag par rig bar 'gyur zhing zhes bya ba snga ma bzhin te /
analyzed: chos so so yang dag par rig bar 'gyur zhing zhes bya ba snga ma bzhin te /
translated: He will understand the individual teachings, as before.

original: 'di ni rnam par grol ba'i skye mched lnga pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni rnam par grol ba'i skye mched lnga pa'o //
translated: This is the fifth door to liberation.

original: rnam par grol ba skye ba'i sgor gyur pas skye mched dag go //
analyzed: rnam par grol ba skye ba'i sgor gyur pas skye mched dag go //
translated: They are doors to liberation because they are doors to the arising of liberation.🔽From two bases, as the sutra states.

original: skye mched gnyis las zhes bya @83b ba ni mdo las ji ltar du rgya cher sems can gzugs can la 'du shes med cing so sor 'du shes med pa dag kyang yod de /
analyzed: skye mched gnyis las zhes bya @83b ba ni mdo las ji ltar du rgya cher sems can gzugs can la 'du shes med cing so sor 'du shes med pa dag kyang yod de /
translated: There are sentient beings who are formless, who have no perception, and who are without any perception.

original: 'di lta ste lha 'du shes med pa'i sems can lta bu ste 'di ni skye mched dang po yin no //
analyzed: 'di lta ste lha 'du shes med pa'i sems can lta bu ste 'di ni skye mched dang po yin no //
translated: They are like the gods who are sentient beings without perception. This is the first base.

original: sems can gzugs med pa la ci yang med pa'i skye mched las yang dag par 'das te ;🔽'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched rdzogs par byas te gnas pa dag kyang yod de /
analyzed: sems can gzugs med pa la ci yang med pa'i skye mched las yang dag par 'das te ; 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched rdzogs par byas te gnas pa dag kyang yod de /
translated: There are sentient beings who, having completely transcended the base of nothingness,

original: 'di lta ste 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched du nye bar 'gro ba rnams lta bu ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched du nye bar 'gro ba rnams lta bu ste /
translated: abide having attained and actualized the base of neither perception nor nonperception.

original: 'di ni skye mched gnyis pa'o zhes gsungs pa yin te /🔽skye mched 'di gnyis las 'du shes med pa'i sems can ni skye mched bcus bsdus te /
analyzed: 'di ni skye mched gnyis pa'o zhes gsungs pa yin te / skye mched 'di gnyis las 'du shes med pa'i sems can ni skye mched bcus bsdus te /
translated: This is the second base.

original: de dag la 'chi 'pho ba dang skye ba'i dus dag na sems dang sems las byung ba'i yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag la 'chi 'pho ba dang skye ba'i dus dag na sems dang sems las byung ba'i yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Sentient beings devoid of perception are subsumed by ten bases because they possess minds and mental factors at the times of death and birth.

original: khams mang po pa las khams drug cu rtsa gnyis bstan pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: khams mang po pa las khams drug cu rtsa gnyis bstan pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: The teaching on the sixty two elements in the Bahudhātuka Sūtra states:

original: mdo las btsun pa ji tsam gyis na mkhas pa khams la mkhas pa lags /
analyzed: mdo las btsun pa ji tsam gyis na mkhas pa khams la mkhas pa lags /
translated: Venerable One, how much knowledge is required to be knowledgeable about elements?

original: kun dga' bo mkhas pa ni khams bco brgyad yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin shes shing mthong ba yin te /
analyzed: kun dga' bo mkhas pa ni khams bco brgyad yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin shes shing mthong ba yin te /
translated: Ananda, the wise one knows and sees the eighteen elements as they are in reality.

original: mig gi khams dang gzugs kyi khams dang / mig gi rnam par shes pa'i khams dang zhes rgya cher 'byung ngo //
analyzed: mig gi khams dang gzugs kyi khams dang / mig gi rnam par shes pa'i khams dang zhes rgya cher 'byung ngo //
translated: The eye element, the form element, the eye consciousness element, and so on.

original: de la sa'i khams dang chu'i khams dang / me'i khams dang rlung gi khams zhes bya ba dang po bzhi ni reg bya'i khams kyis bsdus so //
analyzed: de la sa'i khams dang chu'i khams dang / me'i khams dang rlung gi khams zhes bya ba dang po bzhi ni reg bya'i khams kyis bsdus so //
translated: Among them, the four beginning with the earth element and the water element, the fire element, and the wind element are included in the tangible element.

original: nam mkha'i khams ni gzugs kyi khams kyis so //
analyzed: nam mkha'i khams ni gzugs kyi khams kyis so //
translated: The space element is included in the form element.

original: rnam par shes pa'i khams ni rnam par shes pa'i khams drug gis bsdus so //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i khams ni rnam par shes pa'i khams drug gis bsdus so //
translated: The consciousness element is included in the six consciousness elements.

original: yang khams drug nyid de 'dod pa'i khams dang / gnod sems kyi khams dang / nges par 'byung pa'i khams dang / gnod sems med pa'i khams dang / rnam par mi 'tshe ba'i khams te 'di dag ni chos kyi khams kyis bsdus so //
analyzed: yang khams drug nyid de 'dod pa'i khams dang / gnod sems kyi khams dang / nges par 'byung pa'i khams dang / gnod sems med pa'i khams dang / rnam par mi 'tshe ba'i khams te 'di dag ni chos kyi khams kyis bsdus so //
translated: Moreover, the six elements themselves: the desire element, the malice element, the renunciation element, the non-malice element, and the non-violence element are included in the phenomena element.

original: smras pa / 'on 'dod pa'i khams ni rnam pa lnga dang rnam pa nyi shu ste /
analyzed: smras pa / 'on 'dod pa'i khams ni rnam pa lnga dang rnam pa nyi shu ste /
translated: The desire realm is fivefold and twentyfold.🔽The desire realm is sixfold: hell beings, ghosts, animals, humans, and gods, and the desire realm that includes hell beings.

original: dmyal ba dang yi dags dang dud 'gro dang mi dang lha rnam pa drug dang / dmyal ba dang bcas pa gling gi dbye bas nyi shu ste de dag kyang dge ba dang nyon mongs pa can dang lung ma bstan pa yin pas khams de dag khams bco brgyad kyis bsdus pa ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: dmyal ba dang yi dags dang dud 'gro dang mi dang lha rnam pa drug dang / dmyal ba dang bcas pa gling gi dbye bas nyi shu ste de dag kyang dge ba dang nyon mongs pa can dang lung ma bstan pa yin pas khams de dag khams bco brgyad kyis bsdus pa ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: Since the desire realm is divided into twenty by the division of the continents, aren't those desire realms included in the eighteen elements?

original: de ni de lta yin mod kyi /🔽'dir ni 'dod pa'i khams zhes bya ba 'dod pa'i 'dod chags la dgongs pas thams cad kyis bsdus pa ma @84a * //
analyzed: de ni de lta yin mod kyi / 'dir ni 'dod pa'i khams zhes bya ba 'dod pa'i 'dod chags la dgongs pas thams cad kyis bsdus pa ma @84a * //
translated: That is so, but

original: yin te / gzhan du na de'i khongs su 'du ba'i phyir gnod sems kyi khams dang rnam par 'tshe ba'i khams logs shig tu mi brjod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yin te / gzhan du na de'i khongs su 'du ba'i phyir gnod sems kyi khams dang rnam par 'tshe ba'i khams logs shig tu mi brjod par 'gyur ro //
translated: here the desire realm is intended as attachment to desire realm objects. Therefore it is not included in all because otherwise the realms of malice and the realms of violence would not be mentioned separately because they are included in that.

original: yang khams drug ste sdug bsngal gyi khams dang bde ba'i khams dang yid mi bde ba'i khams dang yid bde ba'i khams dang btang snyoms kyi khams dang ma rig pa'i khams te 'di dag kyang chos kyi khams kyis bsdus so //
analyzed: yang khams drug ste sdug bsngal gyi khams dang bde ba'i khams dang yid mi bde ba'i khams dang yid bde ba'i khams dang btang snyoms kyi khams dang ma rig pa'i khams te 'di dag kyang chos kyi khams kyis bsdus so //
translated: There are also six elements: the element of suffering, the element of pleasure, the element of mental dissatisfaction, the element of satisfaction, the element of equanimity, and the element of ignorance. These are included in the element of mental objects.

original: yang khams bzhi ste tshor ba'i khams dang / 'du shes kyi khams dang / 'du byed kyi khams dang / rnam par shes pa'i khams te gsum ni chos kyi khams kyis bsdus la /
analyzed: yang khams bzhi ste tshor ba'i khams dang / 'du shes kyi khams dang / 'du byed kyi khams dang / rnam par shes pa'i khams te gsum ni chos kyi khams kyis bsdus la /
translated: There are also four elements: the element of sensation, the element of perception, the element of formative mental functions, and the element of consciousness. Three of these are included in the element of mental objects.

original: rnam par shes pa'i khams ni rnam par shes pa'i khams drug gis so //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i khams ni rnam par shes pa'i khams drug gis so //
translated: The element of consciousness is included in the six elements of consciousness.

original: yang khams gsum ste 'dod pa'i khams dang / gzugs kyi khams dang / gzugs med pa'i khams te de la 'dod pa'i khams ni khams bco brgyad kyis bsdus so //
analyzed: yang khams gsum ste 'dod pa'i khams dang / gzugs kyi khams dang / gzugs med pa'i khams te de la 'dod pa'i khams ni khams bco brgyad kyis bsdus so //
translated: There are also three elements: the element of sense-desire, the element of form, and the element of formlessness. The element of sense-desire is included in the eighteen elements.

original: gzugs kyi khams ni khams bcu bzhis bsdus so //
analyzed: gzugs kyi khams ni khams bcu bzhis bsdus so //
translated: The element of form is included in the fourteen elements.

original: gzugs med pa'i khams ni yid dang rnam par shes pa'i khams kyis bsdus so //
analyzed: gzugs med pa'i khams ni yid dang rnam par shes pa'i khams kyis bsdus so //
translated: The formless realm is included in the mind and the factors of conscious construction.

original: yang khams gsum ste gzugs kyi khams dang gzugs med pa'i khams dang / 'gog pa'i khams te gnyis kyis bsdus pa ni bshad zin to //
analyzed: yang khams gsum ste gzugs kyi khams dang gzugs med pa'i khams dang / 'gog pa'i khams te gnyis kyis bsdus pa ni bshad zin to //
translated: There are three other realms: the realm of form, the formless realm, and the realm of cessation. Two of these have already been explained.

original: 'gog pa'i khams ni chos kyi khams su 'du'o //
analyzed: 'gog pa'i khams ni chos kyi khams su 'du'o //
translated: The realm of cessation is included in the element of mental objects.

original: yang khams gsum ste 'das pa'i khams dang ma 'ongs pa'i khams dang / da ltar byung ba'i khams te 'di dag so sor bco brgyad kyis bsdus so //
analyzed: yang khams gsum ste 'das pa'i khams dang ma 'ongs pa'i khams dang / da ltar byung ba'i khams te 'di dag so sor bco brgyad kyis bsdus so //
translated: There are three other realms: the past realm, the future realm, and the present realm. Each of these is included in the eighteen elements.

original: yang khams gsum ste dman pa'i khams dang / gya nom pa'i khams dang / bar ma'i khams te /
analyzed: yang khams gsum ste dman pa'i khams dang / gya nom pa'i khams dang / bar ma'i khams te /
translated: There are three other realms: the inferior realm, the superior realm, and the middling realm.

original: gsum po 'di dag kyang ci rigs par khams bco brgyad dag tu 'du'o //
analyzed: gsum po 'di dag kyang ci rigs par khams bco brgyad dag tu 'du'o //
translated: These three are included in the eighteen elements, as appropriate.

original: yang khams gzhan gsum ste dge ba'i khams dang mi dge ba'i khams dang lung du ma bstan pa'i khams te /
analyzed: yang khams gzhan gsum ste dge ba'i khams dang mi dge ba'i khams dang lung du ma bstan pa'i khams te /
translated: There are three other realms: the wholesome realm, the unwholesome realm, and the undefined realm.

original: 'di dag gi dang po gnyis te /
analyzed: 'di dag gi dang po gnyis te /
translated: The first two of these are included in the eighteen elements.

original: gzugs kyi khams dang / sgra'i khams dang / yid kyi khams dang / rnam par shes pa'i khams drug dang / chos kyi khams su yang 'du'o //
analyzed: gzugs kyi khams dang / sgra'i khams dang / yid kyi khams dang / rnam par shes pa'i khams drug dang / chos kyi khams su yang 'du'o //
translated: The element of form, the element of sound, the element of the mental faculty, the six elements of consciousness, and the element of mental objects.

original: gsum po ni bco brgyad po thams cad du'o //
analyzed: gsum po ni bco brgyad po thams cad du'o //
translated: The last three are included in all eighteen elements.

original: yang khams gsum ste slob pa'i khams dang / mi slob pa'i khams dang / slob pa yang ma yin mi slob pa yang ma yin pa'i khams te de la slob pa dang mi slob pa dang @84b mi slob pa'i khams ni /
analyzed: yang khams gsum ste slob pa'i khams dang / mi slob pa'i khams dang / slob pa yang ma yin mi slob pa yang ma yin pa'i khams te de la slob pa dang mi slob pa dang @84b mi slob pa'i khams ni /
translated: There are three other elements: the element of the trainee, the element of the non-trainee, and the element that is neither the trainee nor the non-trainee.

original: yid dang yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i khams dang chos kyi khams dag tu 'du'o //
analyzed: yid dang yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i khams dang chos kyi khams dag tu 'du'o //
translated: The element of the trainee and the element of the non-trainee are included in the element of the mental faculty, the element of mental consciousness, and the element of mental objects.

original: gsum po ni khams bco brgyad po thams cad du'o //
analyzed: gsum po ni khams bco brgyad po thams cad du'o //
translated: The last three are included in all eighteen elements.

original: yang khams gnyis bshad de /
analyzed: yang khams gnyis bshad de /
translated: There are two other elements:

original: zag pa dang bcas pa'i khams dang zag pa med pa'i khams te /
analyzed: zag pa dang bcas pa'i khams dang zag pa med pa'i khams te /
translated: the element with impurity and the element without impurity.

original: dang po ni khams bco brgyad du 'du'o //
analyzed: dang po ni khams bco brgyad du 'du'o //
translated: The first is included in the eighteen elements.

original: gnyis pa ni yid dang yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i khams dang chos kyi khams dag tu'o //
analyzed: gnyis pa ni yid dang yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i khams dang chos kyi khams dag tu'o //
translated: The second is included in the element of the mental faculty, the element of mental consciousness, and the element of mental objects.

original: yang gnyis te 'dus byas kyi khams dang 'dus ma byas kyi khams so //
analyzed: yang gnyis te 'dus byas kyi khams dang 'dus ma byas kyi khams so //
translated: There are two other realms: the conditioned realm and the unconditioned realm.

original: dang po ni khams bco brgyad du 'du'o //
analyzed: dang po ni khams bco brgyad du 'du'o //
translated: The first is included in the eighteen realms.

original: gnyis pa ni chos kyi khams su 'du ste /
analyzed: gnyis pa ni chos kyi khams su 'du ste /
translated: The second is included in the entity realm.

original: de ltar de dag ni khams bzhi bcu rtsa bzhi rnams de ltar bco brgyad kyis bsdus par 'gyur zhing drug cu rtsa gnyis su yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar de dag ni khams bzhi bcu rtsa bzhi rnams de ltar bco brgyad kyis bsdus par 'gyur zhing drug cu rtsa gnyis su yang 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, these four realms are included in the eighteen realms, and they are also included in the sixty-two realms.

original: gnyis kyi mtshan nyid ma bshad na zhes bya ni nam mkha' dang rnam par shes pa gnyis kyi'o //
analyzed: gnyis kyi mtshan nyid ma bshad na zhes bya ni nam mkha' dang rnam par shes pa gnyis kyi'o //
translated: If the characteristics of the two realms have not been explained, the characteristics of the space realm and the consciousness realm have not been explained.

original: sa'i khams la sogs pa rnams kyi ni /🔽sra gsher dro nyid g-yo ba rnams //
analyzed: sa'i khams la sogs pa rnams kyi ni / sra gsher dro nyid g-yo ba rnams //
translated: The characteristics of the earth element, etc.🔽have been explained as solidity, fluidity,

original: zhes bya bar bshad zin to //
analyzed: zhes bya bar bshad zin to //
translated: heat, and motion.

original: gal te rnam shes so so rnam rig pa zhes bya bar rnam par shes pa'i khams kyi mtshan nyid kyang bshad pa ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: gal te rnam shes so so rnam rig pa zhes bya bar rnam par shes pa'i khams kyi mtshan nyid kyang bshad pa ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: If the characteristics of the consciousness realm have not been explained, since the consciousness realm is explained as the individual awareness of each object, has not the characteristic of the consciousness realm been explained?

original: so sor rnam par rig pa'i mtshan nyid kyi khyad par zhes bya ba mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa rnams phan tshun las khams nyid kyi khyad par zhes shes par bya ba ma yin no //
analyzed: so sor rnam par rig pa'i mtshan nyid kyi khyad par zhes bya ba mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa rnams phan tshun las khams nyid kyi khyad par zhes shes par bya ba ma yin no //
translated: The specific characteristic of the individual is not to be understood as the specific characteristic of the element of visual consciousness, etc.,

original: ci 'dir rnam par shes pa thams cad kyang rnam par shes pa'i khams su 'dod pa des khyad par du byas pa zhes bya ba de lta bu ma yin mod /
analyzed: ci 'dir rnam par shes pa thams cad kyang rnam par shes pa'i khams su 'dod pa des khyad par du byas pa zhes bya ba de lta bu ma yin mod /
translated: since it is not the case that all consciousnesses are considered to be the element of consciousness.

original: sa la sogs pa rnams la sra ba la sogs pa khyad par med pa la yang sa la sogs pa'i khams tha dad pas so //
analyzed: sa la sogs pa rnams la sra ba la sogs pa khyad par med pa la yang sa la sogs pa'i khams tha dad pas so //
translated: Earth, water, fire, and wind are not differentiated by solidity, etc., but by the elements of earth, etc.

original: nam mkha'i mtshan nyid bshad pa nam mkha'i khams ma yin pa de'i phyir rnam par shes par mi bya'o //🔽ci nam mkha'i khams gzhan du na zhes bya ba la de nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: nam mkha'i mtshan nyid bshad pa nam mkha'i khams ma yin pa de'i phyir rnam par shes par mi bya'o // ci nam mkha'i khams gzhan du na zhes bya ba la de nyid kyi phyir /
translated: The characteristic of space is not the element of space, and therefore it is not a consciousness.🔽Since it is not the element of space, is space something other than the element of space?

original: ci nam mkha' nyid nam mkha'i khams yin la zhes rgya cher gsungs so //
analyzed: ci nam mkha' nyid nam mkha'i khams yin la zhes rgya cher gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, is space itself the element of space?

original: bu ga zhes bya ba ci zhig yin ;
analyzed: bu ga zhes bya ba ci zhig yin ;
translated: What is a cavity?

original: rig par bya zhes bya ba la nam mkha' bzhin du bu ga'i don yang ma rtogs pa'i phyir ram /
analyzed: rig par bya zhes bya ba la nam mkha' bzhin du bu ga'i don yang ma rtogs pa'i phyir ram /
translated: The question is asked because, like space, the meaning of cavity is not understood.

original: bu ga ni nam mkha' nyid yin no snyam du log par rtogs pa'i phyir 'dri ba'o //
analyzed: bu ga ni nam mkha' nyid yin no snyam du log par rtogs pa'i phyir 'dri ba'o //
translated: Or, it is asked because of the misconception that a cavity is space itself.

original: snang dang mun pa dag yin lo //
analyzed: snang dang mun pa dag yin lo //
translated: Light and darkness.

original: zhes bya ba ni gal te bu gnam mkha'i khams yin la /🔽nam mkha'i @85a * //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni gal te bu gnam mkha'i khams yin la / nam mkha'i @85a * //
translated: If a cavity is the space element,

original: khams kyang bu ga yin na ni /
analyzed: khams kyang bu ga yin na ni /
translated: and the space element is a cavity,

original: der yang de ltar 'gyur bas thug pa med par 'gyur ba zhig go //
analyzed: der yang de ltar 'gyur bas thug pa med par 'gyur ba zhig go //
translated: then this would be an infinite regress, because it would be the same in regard to that.

original: lo'i sgra ni rdul phra rab rnams la phan tshun reg pa med pa'i phyir bsags pa la gdon mi za bar bu ga yod par 'gyur bas ma rangs pa'i don to //
analyzed: lo'i sgra ni rdul phra rab rnams la phan tshun reg pa med pa'i phyir bsags pa la gdon mi za bar bu ga yod par 'gyur bas ma rangs pa'i don to //
translated: The word “also” means that because there is no mutual contact among the subtle particles, it is certain that there is a cavity in the aggregate.

original: de nyid thogs pa'i nye 'khor gyi gzugs zhes bshad pa la de nyid ni nam mkha'i khams so //
analyzed: de nyid thogs pa'i nye 'khor gyi gzugs zhes bshad pa la de nyid ni nam mkha'i khams so //
translated: That very thing is called form that obstructs space.

original: gzhan dag na re thogs pa bden par bshad pa bu ga'i khyad par 'ga' zhig la yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba bye brag tu smra ba'i tshig tu bstan pa'i phyir zhes zer ro //
analyzed: gzhan dag na re thogs pa bden par bshad pa bu ga'i khyad par 'ga' zhig la yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba bye brag tu smra ba'i tshig tu bstan pa'i phyir zhes zer ro //
translated: Others say: It is not that the obstruction that is explained as real does not exist in some special holes.

original: mun pa ni mtshan mo'i rang bzhin dang snang ba ni nyin mo'i rang bzhin no ;
analyzed: mun pa ni mtshan mo'i rang bzhin dang snang ba ni nyin mo'i rang bzhin no ;
translated: Darkness is the nature of night and light is the nature of day.

original: / thogs pa zhes bya bsags pa'i gzugs //
analyzed: / thogs pa zhes bya bsags pa'i gzugs //
translated: Obstruction is aggregated form.

original: shin tu gnod pa byar rung ba //🔽zhes bya ba rkang pa gnyis po 'di dag gi rkang pa dang po aa gham ki li tsi ta sthi zhes pa'i aa yig bzung nas /
analyzed: shin tu gnod pa byar rung ba // zhes bya ba rkang pa gnyis po 'di dag gi rkang pa dang po aa gham ki li tsi ta sthi zhes pa'i aa yig bzung nas /
translated: It is very suitable to be harmed.🔽In these two lines, the first line is taken as the syllable a of aghaṃ kilikitsitaṃ,

original: rkang pa gnyis pa r'u pa mi tyartha gha ta zhes pa'i gha yig dag dang nges pa'i tshig gi tshogs sbyar te /
analyzed: rkang pa gnyis pa r'u pa mi tyartha gha ta zhes pa'i gha yig dag dang nges pa'i tshig gi tshogs sbyar te /
translated: and the second line is taken as the syllable gha of rūpam ity artha ghaṭa.

original: aa gha zhes pa ni thogs pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: aa gha zhes pa ni thogs pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Agha is called obstruction.

original: bsags pa ni tshogs pa'o //
analyzed: bsags pa ni tshogs pa'o //
translated: Aggregated means accumulated.

original: bsags par gnas pa ni bsags pa la gnas shing 'dus pa la gnas pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: bsags par gnas pa ni bsags pa la gnas shing 'dus pa la gnas pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Abiding in the aggregated means abiding in the accumulated, abiding in the assembled, which is the meaning of the term.

original: shin tu gnod par byar rung ba //
analyzed: shin tu gnod par byar rung ba //
translated: It is suitable to be harmed.

original: zhes bya ba ni gnod par byed pa dang gnod par byed par byar rung ba zhes dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni gnod par byed pa dang gnod par byed par byar rung ba zhes dgongs pa'o //
translated: The meaning is: it is suitable to be a harm-doer and a harm-receiver.

original: nam mkha'i khams ni gnod par byed pa nyid dang gnod par byar rung ba de la sgrib pa med pa de'i nye 'khor te kun nas khor yug tu 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: nam mkha'i khams ni gnod par byed pa nyid dang gnod par byar rung ba de la sgrib pa med pa de'i nye 'khor te kun nas khor yug tu 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The space element is the surrounding of that harm-doing and harm-receiving, because it is unobstructed. The meaning is: it is all around.

original: de nyid ni ma yin no zhes bya ba de'i rigs so //
analyzed: de nyid ni ma yin no zhes bya ba de'i rigs so //
translated: It is not that itself. The meaning is: it is of that type.

original: nye 'khor gyi gzugs zhes bya ba gzugs kyi khams dang skye mched dang phung po'i rang bzhin zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: nye 'khor gyi gzugs zhes bya ba gzugs kyi khams dang skye mched dang phung po'i rang bzhin zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning is: it is the nature of the form element, form sense-sphere, and form aggregate.

original: snang dang mun pa zhes bya ba ni kha dog gi khyad par ro //
analyzed: snang dang mun pa zhes bya ba ni kha dog gi khyad par ro //
translated: Light and darkness are the distinctions of color.

original: mdo sde pa rnams na re /
analyzed: mdo sde pa rnams na re /
translated: The Sautrantikas say:

original: bstan bcos las ni nam mkha'i khams kyi mtshan nyid nam mkha' las tha dad pa yod pa ma yin zhing /
analyzed: bstan bcos las ni nam mkha'i khams kyi mtshan nyid nam mkha' las tha dad pa yod pa ma yin zhing /
translated: In the treatise, the defining characteristics of the space element are not different from space.

original: nam mkha'i khams dang nam mkha' yang rdzas ma yin pa'i phyir nam mkha'i khams rdzas su med ces zer ro //
analyzed: nam mkha'i khams dang nam mkha' yang rdzas ma yin pa'i phyir nam mkha'i khams rdzas su med ces zer ro //
translated: and space is not a substance, therefore the element of space is not a substance.

original: slob dpon 'dus bzang na re /
analyzed: slob dpon 'dus bzang na re /
translated: Master Saṅghabhadra says:

original: nam mkha'i khams ni nam mkha' las tha dad par yod de /
analyzed: nam mkha'i khams ni nam mkha' las tha dad par yod de /
translated: The element of space exists separately from space.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis 'di skad du nam mkha' ni gzugs med pa bstan du med pa thogs pa med pa ste /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis 'di skad du nam mkha' ni gzugs med pa bstan du med pa thogs pa med pa ste /
translated: The Bhagavān said, “Space is formless, invisible, and unobstructing.

original: de ni ci la yang brten par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ni ci la yang brten par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: It does not depend on anything.

original: @85b 'on kyang 'jig rten na nam mkha' gdags pa yod do zhes gsungs pa'i phyir yod pa nyid dang tha dad pa gnyis ka shin tu gsal bar gsungs so zhes zer ro //
analyzed: @85b 'on kyang 'jig rten na nam mkha' gdags pa yod do zhes gsungs pa'i phyir yod pa nyid dang tha dad pa gnyis ka shin tu gsal bar gsungs so zhes zer ro //
translated: However, in the world, space is designated as existing.” Therefore, both its existence and its separateness are clearly stated.

original: gzugs kyi 'dod chags dang bral ba la nam mkha'i khams spangs par bstan pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: gzugs kyi 'dod chags dang bral ba la nam mkha'i khams spangs par bstan pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because it is taught that those free from attachment to form abandon the element of space.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis gang gi phyir sems de'i khams lnga las 'dod chags dang bral ba rnam par grol bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis gang gi phyir sems de'i khams lnga las 'dod chags dang bral ba rnam par grol bar 'gyur la /
translated: The Bhagavān said, “When the mind is free from attachment to the five elements, it is liberated.

original: de nas de'i rnam par shes pa nyid lhag mar lus par 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de nas de'i rnam par shes pa nyid lhag mar lus par 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Then consciousness alone remains.

original: nam mkha' ni spangs par bsnyad par rigs pa yang ma yin te zag pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nam mkha' ni spangs par bsnyad par rigs pa yang ma yin te zag pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Nor is it correct to say that space is abandoned, because it is uncontaminated.

original: nang dang phyi gsungs pa'i phyir te nang gi nam mkha'i khams ni mig gi bu ga gang yin pa dang zhes rgya cher gsungs so //
analyzed: nang dang phyi gsungs pa'i phyir te nang gi nam mkha'i khams ni mig gi bu ga gang yin pa dang zhes rgya cher gsungs so //
translated: Because it is said to be internal and external: The internal space element is the cavities of the eyes and so on.

original: phyi'i nam mkha' gang yin pa nam mkhar gyur pa'o //
analyzed: phyi'i nam mkha' gang yin pa nam mkhar gyur pa'o //
translated: External space is space that is not a door.

original: 'dus ma byas la ni nang dang phyi zhes rung ba ma yin no //
analyzed: 'dus ma byas la ni nang dang phyi zhes rung ba ma yin no //
translated: It is not tenable to say that the unconditioned is internal or external.

original: dpe ston sde ba na re snang ba dang nam mkha' ni gzhan ma yin pa nyid de /
analyzed: dpe ston sde ba na re snang ba dang nam mkha' ni gzhan ma yin pa nyid de /
translated: The Vatsiputrīyas say: Light and space are not different.

original: snang ba nyid kyang nam mkha'i khams nyid du rtogs par bya'o zhes zer ro //
analyzed: snang ba nyid kyang nam mkha'i khams nyid du rtogs par bya'o zhes zer ro //
translated: Light itself should be understood as the space element.

original: mdo dang 'gal ba'i gnas med de nam mkha' nyid rdzas su sgrub pa la phyi ma 'dir rnam par dpyad pa ma yin no //
analyzed: mdo dang 'gal ba'i gnas med de nam mkha' nyid rdzas su sgrub pa la phyi ma 'dir rnam par dpyad pa ma yin no //
translated: This is not a basis for contradicting the sūtras, because this later analysis does not establish space as a substance.

original: spangs pa'i tshig kyang nyon mongs pa la 'jug par khas blangs pa'i phyir 'gal ba med do ;
analyzed: spangs pa'i tshig kyang nyon mongs pa la 'jug par khas blangs pa'i phyir 'gal ba med do ;
translated: But there is no contradiction, because the word “abandon” is used in the sense of “to enter into the afflictions.”

original: / gzhan du na 'byung ba spangs pa tsam kho na brjod dgos so //
analyzed: / gzhan du na 'byung ba spangs pa tsam kho na brjod dgos so //
translated: Otherwise, one would have to say that the mere abandonment of the primary elements is the abandonment of the element of space.

original: de spangs pa kho na lhag ma rgyur byas pa'i gzugs spangs pa bzhin nam mkha'i khams kyang spangs par grub bo //
analyzed: de spangs pa kho na lhag ma rgyur byas pa'i gzugs spangs pa bzhin nam mkha'i khams kyang spangs par grub bo //
translated: The abandonment of the primary elements is the abandonment of the derivative form that is based on them, just as the abandonment of the seed is the abandonment of the sprout.

original: nang dang phyi yang brten pa'i dbye bas 'gal ba med do //
analyzed: nang dang phyi yang brten pa'i dbye bas 'gal ba med do //
translated: The internal and external are not contradictory, because they are distinguished as the basis.

original: gang gsungs pa la sogs pa ltar skyes bur gdags pa'i nye bar len pa'i phyir dang de la brten nas mngal du 'jug par gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang gsungs pa la sogs pa ltar skyes bur gdags pa'i nye bar len pa'i phyir dang de la brten nas mngal du 'jug par gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: As it is said, “The internal is the basis for the designation of a person, and the external is the basis for the designation of a person.”

original: 'dus byas dang zag bcas dang nam mkha'i khams zhes bya ba rgyu gnyis kyis 'di 'gal te /
analyzed: 'dus byas dang zag bcas dang nam mkha'i khams zhes bya ba rgyu gnyis kyis 'di 'gal te /
translated: The element of space is contradictory to the two causes, because it is said to be conditioned and contaminated.

original: 'dus byas ji lta ba nyid kyis zag pa dang bcas pa nyid la khyab ste /
analyzed: 'dus byas ji lta ba nyid kyis zag pa dang bcas pa nyid la khyab ste /
translated: It is pervaded by being conditioned and contaminated, just as it is by being a primary element.

original: de bzhin du gzugs kyi skye mched nyid kyis kyang zhes bya ste zhar la byung bas cho ga go //
analyzed: de bzhin du gzugs kyi skye mched nyid kyis kyang zhes bya ste zhar la byung bas cho ga go //
translated: Likewise, the form element is also the same.

original: rnam par shes pa'i khams ni rnam par shes pa zag pa dang bcas pa ste /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i khams ni rnam par shes pa zag pa dang bcas pa ste /
translated: The consciousness element is contaminated consciousness.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /🔽'di ltar khams drug po 'di dag ni zhes rgyu rgyas par smras te /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na / 'di ltar khams drug po 'di dag ni zhes rgyu rgyas par smras te /
translated: Why is that?

original: skyes bu 'di ni khams drug pa yin no zhes mdo @86a * //
analyzed: skyes bu 'di ni khams drug pa yin no zhes mdo @86a * //
translated: Because these six elements are called the six elements of a human being in the sutras.

original: las gsungs pa'i phyir khams drug la brten nas mngal du 'jug par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: las gsungs pa'i phyir khams drug la brten nas mngal du 'jug par 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, entry into the womb occurs in dependence on the six elements.

original: sa'i khams la sogs pa ltar skye ba'i rten nyid du 'dod pa'i phyir rnam par shes pa'i khams kyang zag pa dang bcas pa nyid do //
analyzed: sa'i khams la sogs pa ltar skye ba'i rten nyid du 'dod pa'i phyir rnam par shes pa'i khams kyang zag pa dang bcas pa nyid do //
translated: The consciousness element is contaminated because it is asserted to be the basis of birth, like the earth element and so on.

original: skye ba ni nang gi skye mched rnams te de ni rten no //
analyzed: skye ba ni nang gi skye mched rnams te de ni rten no //
translated: Birth is the internal sense bases and that is the basis.

original: de dag med na skye ba med pa'am 'jug pa med par so sor rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de dag med na skye ba med pa'am 'jug pa med par so sor rig par bya'o //
translated: If they do not exist, birth or entry does not occur. This should be understood.

original: de nyid kyi phyir de dag ni skye ba nying mtshams sbyor ba'i sems las zhes rgya cher gsungs so //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir de dag ni skye ba nying mtshams sbyor ba'i sems las zhes rgya cher gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, it is said, “They arise from the mind of rebirth-linking.🔽”

original: zag pa med pa'i chos rnams ni de lta ma yin no zhes bya ba ni skye ba rgyun gcod pa dang / gnod par byed pa dang yongs su gcod pa la sogs par 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zag pa med pa'i chos rnams ni de lta ma yin no zhes bya ba ni skye ba rgyun gcod pa dang / gnod par byed pa dang yongs su gcod pa la sogs par 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The uncontaminated dharmas are not like that, because they are engaged in severing the continuum of birth, harming, and completely cutting off.

original: gzhan dag na re skyed par byed pa dang gsos 'debs pa dang spel bar byed pa'i gzhir gyur pa zhes zer te /
analyzed: gzhan dag na re skyed par byed pa dang gsos 'debs pa dang spel bar byed pa'i gzhir gyur pa zhes zer te /
translated: Others say: They are the basis for generation, nourishment, and increase.

original: 'di la skyed par byed pa ni rnam par shes pa'i khams te /
analyzed: 'di la skyed par byed pa ni rnam par shes pa'i khams te /
translated: Generation is the consciousness element,

original: nying mtshams sbyor ba'i sa bon yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nying mtshams sbyor ba'i sa bon yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the seed of rebirth-linking.

original: gso bar byed pa ni 'byung ba rnams te rten du gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gso bar byed pa ni 'byung ba rnams te rten du gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Nourishment is the four primary elements, because they are the support.

original: spel bar byed pa ni nam mkha'i khams te go 'byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: spel bar byed pa ni nam mkha'i khams te go 'byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Increase is the space element, because it provides space.

original: chos de dag thams cad kyi bya ba ni phung po dang khams dang skye mched kyis ji ltar rigs par bsdus so //
analyzed: chos de dag thams cad kyi bya ba ni phung po dang khams dang skye mched kyis ji ltar rigs par bsdus so //
translated: The activity of all those things is included in the aggregates, elements, and sense bases, as appropriate.

original: da ni chos rab tu rnam par dbye ba la phan pa de dag gi don gyi rnam pa bsam par bya ste de la khams rnams su gzugs dang sems rnam par phye ste bstan pas zag pa dang bcas pa'i rnam pa la sogs pa rnams bden pa bde🔽blag tu khongs su chud pas khams rnams kho na las brtsams te bsam par bya'i //
analyzed: da ni chos rab tu rnam par dbye ba la phan pa de dag gi don gyi rnam pa bsam par bya ste de la khams rnams su gzugs dang sems rnam par phye ste bstan pas zag pa dang bcas pa'i rnam pa la sogs pa rnams bden pa bde blag tu khongs su chud pas khams rnams kho na las brtsams te bsam par bya'i //
translated: Now, the benefit of the thorough differentiation of things should be contemplated in terms of their meaning. Therein, since form and mind are distinguished and taught in the elements, the aspects of the contaminated, etc. are easily included in the truths.

original: phung po dang skye mched dag las brtsams te ma yin no ;
analyzed: phung po dang skye mched dag las brtsams te ma yin no ;
translated: Therefore, the elements alone should be contemplated, not beginning with the aggregates and sense bases.

original: / de nyid kyi phyir gang dag khams bco brgyad bstan pa zhes bya ba rgya cher gsungs so //
analyzed: / de nyid kyi phyir gang dag khams bco brgyad bstan pa zhes bya ba rgya cher gsungs so //
translated: For that very reason, it is said in detail, Those who teach the eighteen elements...

original: bstan yod 'dir ni zhes bya ba la khams zhes skabs dang sbyor ba yang gang zhig yin pa mi shes pas de'i phyir de gang zhe na zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: bstan yod 'dir ni zhes bya ba la khams zhes skabs dang sbyor ba yang gang zhig yin pa mi shes pas de'i phyir de gang zhe na zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: Here, it is not known what is meant by elements, so it is said, What are they?

original: gzugs zhes bya ba la gzugs ni bstan pa nyid de gzugs zhes bya ba 'jug pa'i rgyu nyid kyis sngar nyid du bshad pa ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: gzugs zhes bya ba la gzugs ni bstan pa nyid de gzugs zhes bya ba 'jug pa'i rgyu nyid kyis sngar nyid du bshad pa ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: Is it not already explained as the cause of the engagement of the term “form” since it is taught as form?

original: 'chad par 'gyur ba la bltos nas gtso bor bstan par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'chad par 'gyur ba la bltos nas gtso bor bstan par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is taught as the primary object of teaching in relation to what is to be explained.

original: der bshad pa'i gzugs can rnams kho na la der khyad par gyi don rigs kyi /
analyzed: der bshad pa'i gzugs can rnams kho na la der khyad par gyi don rigs kyi /
translated: The form that is explained there is only that which is distinguished there.

original: gzugs can ma yin pa rnams la ma @86b yin pa dang lhan cig tu bstan pas 'di la nyes pa med do //🔽bstan pa zhes bya ba 'di yang gang zhig ce na 'di ni 'di na'o //
analyzed: gzugs can ma yin pa rnams la ma @86b yin pa dang lhan cig tu bstan pas 'di la nyes pa med do // bstan pa zhes bya ba 'di yang gang zhig ce na 'di ni 'di na'o //
translated: There is no fault in teaching it together with that which is not form, since it is appropriate to explain the distinction in the form that is explained there.

original: 'di ni che ge mo zhig na'o zhes bstan pa'i stobs las byung ba'i mig gi rnam par shes pa la ste /
analyzed: 'di ni che ge mo zhig na'o zhes bstan pa'i stobs las byung ba'i mig gi rnam par shes pa la ste /
translated: What is this so-called teaching? It is the eye consciousness that arises from the power of teaching, such as “This is here,” “This is over there.”

original: de'i yul can yin pa'i phyir gzugs la de dang lhan cig gis zhes bsnyad do //
analyzed: de'i yul can yin pa'i phyir gzugs la de dang lhan cig gis zhes bsnyad do //
translated: It is called “together with that” because it is the object of that.

original: de bzhin du khyad par gang gis bstan par nus pa'i khyad par des 'di bstan par bya bas na bstan pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du khyad par gang gis bstan par nus pa'i khyad par des 'di bstan par bya bas na bstan pa zhes bya ste /
translated: Similarly, it is called demonstrable because it can be demonstrated by a particular, and that particular is demonstrated by it.

original: de yang mig gi dbang po'i yul nyid do zhes kha cig zer ro //
analyzed: de yang mig gi dbang po'i yul nyid do zhes kha cig zer ro //
translated: Some say: It is the object of the eye faculty.

original: gzhan dag na re /
analyzed: gzhan dag na re /
translated: Others say:

original: 'di ni 'di na'o che ge mo zhig na'o zhes bsnyad pa 'di nyid bstan pa yin la /
analyzed: 'di ni 'di na'o che ge mo zhig na'o zhes bsnyad pa 'di nyid bstan pa yin la /
translated: It is demonstrable because it is indicated as here or there.

original: gang zhig la de yod pas na bstan du yod pa ste /
analyzed: gang zhig la de yod pas na bstan du yod pa ste /
translated: That which possesses it is demonstrable.

original: dmigs pa dang bcas pa bzhin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: dmigs pa dang bcas pa bzhin no zhes zer ro //
translated: It is as if it were the object of observation.

original: slob dpon 'dus bzang na re /
analyzed: slob dpon 'dus bzang na re /
translated: Master Saṅghabhadra says:

original: gnyis bstan par lhan cig mthong bas nges pa'i phyir mig dang gzugs dag cig car skye'o zhes zer ro //
analyzed: gnyis bstan par lhan cig mthong bas nges pa'i phyir mig dang gzugs dag cig car skye'o zhes zer ro //
translated: Since it is ascertained that both are seen simultaneously, the eye and form arise simultaneously.

original: gzhan dag na re bstan du yod pa zhes bya ba ni me long la sogs pa rnams la gzugs brnyan snang ba ji lta ba de ltar 'di bstan du yod pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan dag na re bstan du yod pa zhes bya ba ni me long la sogs pa rnams la gzugs brnyan snang ba ji lta ba de ltar 'di bstan du yod pa'o //
translated: Others say: That which is called demonstrable is like the appearance of a reflection in a mirror and so on. It is demonstrable in that way.

original: brag ca la sogs pa la ni thal bar mi 'gyur te cig car mi skya ba'i phyir ro zhes zer ro //
analyzed: brag ca la sogs pa la ni thal bar mi 'gyur te cig car mi skya ba'i phyir ro zhes zer ro //
translated: But this is not the case with echoes, etc., because they do not arise simultaneously.

original: bstan du yod pa'i mtshan nyid ji skad bshad pa bzlog pa'i sgo nas lhag ma rnams ni bstan du med pa'o zhes bshad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bstan du yod pa'i mtshan nyid ji skad bshad pa bzlog pa'i sgo nas lhag ma rnams ni bstan du med pa'o zhes bshad par 'gyur ro //
