translated: The remaining sense-spheres should be understood as being non-resistant in the opposite sense to the way in which the sense-sphere of visible form has been described as resistant.

original: thogs dang bcas pa gzugs can bcu //
analyzed: thogs dang bcas pa gzugs can bcu //
translated: Ten are resistant.

original: zhes bya ba la gzugs can smos pa ni gzugs can ma yin pa rnam par gcad par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la gzugs can smos pa ni gzugs can ma yin pa rnam par gcad par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The word ‘material’ is mentioned in order to exclude the immaterial ones.

original: chos kyi skye mched la rnam par rig byed ma yin pa'i gzugs yod pa'i phyir gzugs can du tha snyad gdags su yod pas bcu zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: chos kyi skye mched la rnam par rig byed ma yin pa'i gzugs yod pa'i phyir gzugs can du tha snyad gdags su yod pas bcu zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: The sense-sphere of the dharmas is conventionally designated as material because non-informative form is included in it.🔽Hence, the words ‘ten’ are mentioned.

original: de nyid kyi phyir bshad pa las kyang bcu gang dag ces bya ba rgya cher gsungs so //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir bshad pa las kyang bcu gang dag ces bya ba rgya cher gsungs so //
translated: And because of this, the commentary states: “which ten?”

original: de dag la gzugs su rung ba'i gzugs yod pas gzugs su rung ba dang / rten dang brten pa'i gzugs sam ji ltar srid pa 'di dag la yod pas gzugs su rung ba'o //
analyzed: de dag la gzugs su rung ba'i gzugs yod pas gzugs su rung ba dang / rten dang brten pa'i gzugs sam ji ltar srid pa 'di dag la yod pas gzugs su rung ba'o //
translated: Or, they are suitable as form because they exist as form that is the support and the supported, as is possible.

original: mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa rnams la thal bar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa rnams la thal bar mi 'gyur te /
translated: The consequence does not apply to eye consciousness, etc.,

original: mig la sogs pa kun tu 'dzin pa'i don gyis de dag gi rten ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mig la sogs pa kun tu 'dzin pa'i don gyis de dag gi rten ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are not the support of those, since they do not have the meaning of grasping the eye, etc.

original: thogs pa zhes bya ba ni rdugs pa ste /
analyzed: thogs pa zhes bya ba ni rdugs pa ste /
translated: Obstruction means impediment.

original: de 'di la yod pas thogs pa dang bcas @87a &amp ;🔽88a * // pa'o ;
analyzed: de 'di la yod pas thogs pa dang bcas @87a &amp ; 88a * // pa'o ;
translated: It exists here, therefore it is obstructed.

original: / de yang rnam pa dang ldan pa'am rnam pa thams cad du ma yin par thogs pa dang bcas par 'dod ce na /
analyzed: / de yang rnam pa dang ldan pa'am rnam pa thams cad du ma yin par thogs pa dang bcas par 'dod ce na /
translated: Is it asserted that it is obstructed in some way or in every way?

original: de yang rnam pa gsum ste zhes bya ba rgya cher gsungs te /
analyzed: de yang rnam pa gsum ste zhes bya ba rgya cher gsungs te /
translated: It is also threefold.

original: dper na lag pa la lag pa thogs pa ni rang gi yul du de skye ba la gegs su gyur pa'i phyir te der dmigs pa la de ltar brjod do //
analyzed: dper na lag pa la lag pa thogs pa ni rang gi yul du de skye ba la gegs su gyur pa'i phyir te der dmigs pa la de ltar brjod do //
translated: For example, the hand is obstructed by the hand, because it is an impediment to the arising of that in its own place. It is said to be so with regard to the observation of that.

original: rdo ba la lag pa thogs pa yang de bzhin te de'i yul du mi skye ba yin gyi 'joms pa ma yin no //🔽rdo ba yang de gnyis la zhes bya ba lag pa'i yul du rdo ba dag de'i yul du mi skye ba la thogs pa brjod do //
analyzed: rdo ba la lag pa thogs pa yang de bzhin te de'i yul du mi skye ba yin gyi 'joms pa ma yin no // rdo ba yang de gnyis la zhes bya ba lag pa'i yul du rdo ba dag de'i yul du mi skye ba la thogs pa brjod do //
translated: The stone is not an obstacle to the hand, for the hand is born in the place occupied by the stone.

original: yul la thogs pa ni yul can rnams yul la thogs pa'o //
analyzed: yul la thogs pa ni yul can rnams yul la thogs pa'o //
translated: The object-field of the consciousness is the obstacle to the consciousness.🔽There is an object-field of the eye sense-faculty which is not an obstacle to the eye sense-faculty: the eye sense-faculty is not destroyed.🔽There is an object-field of the eye sense-faculty which is an obstacle to the eye sense-faculty: the eye sense-faculty is destroyed.

original: mig chu'i yul gyi gzugs rnams la mi thogs las thad la ma yin pa yang yod do //🔽chu la yang nye ba la sogs pa rnams thogs pas de'i phyir mi phal che'i lta bu'o zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: mig chu'i yul gyi gzugs rnams la mi thogs las thad la ma yin pa yang yod do // chu la yang nye ba la sogs pa rnams thogs pas de'i phyir mi phal che'i lta bu'o zhes gsungs so //
translated: There is an object-field of the eye sense-faculty which is not an obstacle to the eye sense-faculty: the eye sense-faculty is not destroyed.🔽There is an object-field of the eye sense-faculty which is an obstacle to the eye sense-faculty: the eye sense-faculty is destroyed.🔽There is an object-field of the eye sense-faculty which is not an obstacle to the eye sense-faculty: the eye sense-faculty is not destroyed.🔽There is an object-field of the eye sense-faculty which is an obstacle to the eye sense-faculty: the eye sense-faculty is destroyed.🔽There is an object-field of the eye sense-faculty which is not an obstacle to the eye sense-faculty: the eye sense-faculty is not destroyed.🔽There is an object-field of the eye sense-faculty which is an obstacle to the eye sense-faculty: the eye sense-faculty is destroyed.🔽There is an object-field of the eye sense-faculty which is not an obstacle to the eye sense-faculty: the eye sense-faculty is not destroyed.🔽There is an object-field of the eye sense-faculty which is an obstacle to the eye sense-faculty: the eye sense-faculty is destroyed.🔽There is an object-field of the eye sense-faculty which is not an obstacle to the eye sense-faculty: the eye sense-faculty is not destroyed.🔽There is an object-field of the eye sense-faculty which is an obstacle to the eye sense-faculty: the eye sense-faculty is destroyed.🔽There is an object-field of the eye sense-faculty which is not an obstacle to the eye sense-faculty: the eye sense-faculty is not destroyed.

original: gnyis kar ma yin pa yod de zhes rgyas par 'byung ba la /
analyzed: gnyis kar ma yin pa yod de zhes rgyas par 'byung ba la /
translated: There is an object-field of the eye sense

original: mngal du nges par 'chi ba dang / dmigs pa gzhan la sems g-yeng ba dang / 'gog pa dang 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa la snyoms par zhugs pa dang 'du shes med pa mngon du gyur pa dang / 'jig rten gyi bar dag tu skyes pa rnams kyi mig ni gnyi gar yang mi thogs so //
analyzed: mngal du nges par 'chi ba dang / dmigs pa gzhan la sems g-yeng ba dang / 'gog pa dang 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa la snyoms par zhugs pa dang 'du shes med pa mngon du gyur pa dang / 'jig rten gyi bar dag tu skyes pa rnams kyi mig ni gnyi gar yang mi thogs so //
translated: The eye sense faculty of those who die in the womb, those whose minds are distracted to other objects, those who are absorbed in the meditative attainment of nonperception or the meditative attainment of cessation, those who are born in the intermediate state of the mindless celestials, and those born in the formless realm is not obstructed by either.

original: pha bong zhes bya ba ni lpags bye'u'o //
analyzed: pha bong zhes bya ba ni lpags bye'u'o //
translated: A stone is a kind of bird.

original: mi phal che'i lta bu zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: mi phal che'i lta bu zhes bya ba la /
translated: Like most humans means

original: phal che ba smos pa ni kha cig gi mtshan mor yang 'jug ste las dang sman la bltos pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phal che ba smos pa ni kha cig gi mtshan mor yang 'jug ste las dang sman la bltos pa'i phyir ro //
translated: most humans enter the womb at night because they rely on karma and medicine.

original: gnyi gar ma yin pa zhes bya ba ni mngal du nges par 'chi ba nas 'jig rten gyi bar dag tu skyes pa'i bar ro //
analyzed: gnyi gar ma yin pa zhes bya ba ni mngal du nges par 'chi ba nas 'jig rten gyi bar dag tu skyes pa'i bar ro //
translated: Those who are not obstructed by either are those who die in the womb and those born in the intermediate state of the mindless celestials.

original: dmigs pa la thogs pa ni sems dang sems las byung ba rnams kyi rang gi dmigs pa 'dzin pa ste /
analyzed: dmigs pa la thogs pa ni sems dang sems las byung ba rnams kyi rang gi dmigs pa 'dzin pa ste /
translated: Obstruction of the object field means the apprehension of the object field of minds and mental factors.

original: de'i phyir 'di ni sems dang sems las byung ba rnams kho na'i rang gi dmigs pa dag la rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di ni sems dang sems las byung ba rnams kho na'i rang gi dmigs pa dag la rnam par gzhag go //
translated: Therefore, this is established as the object-field of only the mind and mental activities.

original: yang byed pa zhes bya ba 'di ci zhig ce na nus pa ste /
analyzed: yang byed pa zhes bya ba 'di ci zhig ce na nus pa ste /
translated: Again, what is this so-called activity? It is capability.

original: 'di ltar gang zhig gang la nus par 'gyur ba de ni der de'i yul yin no zhes smra ba por 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar gang zhig gang la nus par 'gyur ba de ni der de'i yul yin no zhes smra ba por 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, one who has capability with regard to something is said to have an object-field in that .

original: gang zhig de'i snang ba skyes pa las sems dang sems las byung ba rnams kyis 'dzin cing dmigs pa de ni dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: gang zhig de'i snang ba skyes pa las sems dang sems las byung ba rnams kyis 'dzin cing dmigs pa de ni dmigs pa'o //
translated: That which is grasped and objectified by the mind and mental activities on the basis of the arising of its appearance is the object-field.

original: thogs pa ni rdugs pa yin la /
analyzed: thogs pa ni rdugs pa yin la /
translated: Obstruction is resistance.

original: 'jug pa ma rdugs pa ni ma rdugs pa yin no @87b &amp ;
analyzed: 'jug pa ma rdugs pa ni ma rdugs pa yin no @87b &amp ;
translated: That which is not obstructed in its engagement is nonresistant.

original: 88b zhes 'jig rten na grags pa de'i phyir /
analyzed: 88b zhes 'jig rten na grags pa de'i phyir /
translated: This is well known in the world.

original: yang ji ltar na rang gi yul lam zhes dri ba rgya cher 'byung ngo //
analyzed: yang ji ltar na rang gi yul lam zhes dri ba rgya cher 'byung ngo //
translated: Why is it called the object-field of the eye?

original: de las gzhan du mi 'jug pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la /🔽rnam par shes pa'am dbang po yang rung ste /
analyzed: de las gzhan du mi 'jug pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la /🔽rnam par shes pa'am dbang po yang rung ste /
translated: Because it is not engaged elsewhere.🔽The eye is not engaged in sound, etc.

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i cha shas gang zhig tu zhugs pa de las gzhan mi 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i cha shas gang zhig tu zhugs pa de las gzhan mi 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it does not grasp the form, etc., that is not included in the part that is occupied.

original: gang zhig gang gis bsgribs pa de ni de las gzhan du mi 'jug pa yin pa de bzhin du 'dir yang rung ba'i yul las gzhan du 'jug pa thogs pa yin no //
analyzed: gang zhig gang gis bsgribs pa de ni de las gzhan du mi 'jug pa yin pa de bzhin du 'dir yang rung ba'i yul las gzhan du 'jug pa thogs pa yin no //
translated: Just as, when something is obstructed by something else, it does not enter into that which is obstructed, in the same way, here, when the object is obstructed, it does not enter into the object that is obstructed.

original: dmigs pa la thogs pas dogs pa dang bcas bar rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: dmigs pa la thogs pas dogs pa dang bcas bar rnam par gzhag go //
translated: Obstruction as object is established as the obstruction of the object.

original: rang gi yul la 'jug pa yang ci zhe na /
analyzed: rang gi yul la 'jug pa yang ci zhe na /
translated: What is the obstruction of the object?

original: de'i yul dang dbang po der dmigs pa las rnam par shes pa skye ba ste /
analyzed: de'i yul dang dbang po der dmigs pa las rnam par shes pa skye ba ste /
translated: Consciousness arises from the object, the faculty, and the attention directed to that object.

original: de la gzhan dag na re /
analyzed: de la gzhan dag na re /
translated: In this regard, others say:

original: yul gang yin pa de mig gis dmigs pa nyid dang / rnam par shes pa yul can gyi ngo bo dang / mig gi rnam par shes pa ni 'dzin pa po'i ngo bo ste /
analyzed: yul gang yin pa de mig gis dmigs pa nyid dang / rnam par shes pa yul can gyi ngo bo dang / mig gi rnam par shes pa ni 'dzin pa po'i ngo bo ste /
translated: The object is the object of the eye, the nature of consciousness is the subject of the object, and eye consciousness is the nature of the grasper.

original: gal te de ltar mi 'jug na de ni de la thogs pa zhes brjod par bya'o zhes zer ro //
analyzed: gal te de ltar mi 'jug na de ni de la thogs pa zhes brjod par bya'o zhes zer ro //
translated: If it does not engage in this way, it is said to be obstructed in regard to that.

original: dmigs pa la thogs pa ni rang gi yul du gzhan skye ba la gegs byed pa ste /
analyzed: dmigs pa la thogs pa ni rang gi yul du gzhan skye ba la gegs byed pa ste /
translated: Obstruction to the object field is the prevention of the arising of another in one’s own object field.

original: de yang sems la ni gzugs nyid do //
analyzed: de yang sems la ni gzugs nyid do //
translated: And that is form itself for the mind.

original: khams bcu thogs pa dang bcas pa dang / thogs pa yang rnam pa gsum mo zhes bya ba bshad pa de la /
analyzed: khams bcu thogs pa dang bcas pa dang / thogs pa yang rnam pa gsum mo zhes bya ba bshad pa de la /
translated: The ten elements are obstructed and obstruction is of three kinds.

original: thogs pa gang gis thogs pa dang bcas pa mi shes pa de'i phyir de lta bas na 'dir bcu po 'di dag ni sgrib pa la thogs pas zhes rgya cher 'byung ngo //
analyzed: thogs pa gang gis thogs pa dang bcas pa mi shes pa de'i phyir de lta bas na 'dir bcu po 'di dag ni sgrib pa la thogs pas zhes rgya cher 'byung ngo //
translated: Since it is not known by what obstruction they are obstructed, it is said here: Therefore, these ten are obstructed by the obstruction of obscuration.

original: phan tshun sgrib pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba 'di ni rdul phra rab bsags pa yin pa'i phyir phan tshun sgrib par byed do zhes sgrib pa la thogs pas thogs pa dang bcas pa nyid kyi rgyu yin no //
analyzed: phan tshun sgrib pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba 'di ni rdul phra rab bsags pa yin pa'i phyir phan tshun sgrib par byed do zhes sgrib pa la thogs pas thogs pa dang bcas pa nyid kyi rgyu yin no //
translated: Because they mutually obscure, this is the cause of being obstructed by the obstruction of obscuration, since they mutually obscure because they are accumulations of subtle particles.

original: de lta yin dang sgrib pa la thogs pa ni gzugs la sogs pa rnams dang mig la sogs pa rnams so //
analyzed: de lta yin dang sgrib pa la thogs pa ni gzugs la sogs pa rnams dang mig la sogs pa rnams so //
translated: If that is so, then the obstruction of obscuration is form, etc., and eye, etc.

original: yul la thogs pa ni mig la sogs pa rnams dang sems dang sems las byung ba rnams so //
analyzed: yul la thogs pa ni mig la sogs pa rnams dang sems dang sems las byung ba rnams so //
translated: The sense bases that are impeded to access are the eye, etc., and the mind and mental factors.

original: dmigs pa la thogs pa ni sems dang sems las byung ba rnams kho na'o //
analyzed: dmigs pa la thogs pa ni sems dang sems las byung ba rnams kho na'o //
translated: The sense bases that are impeded to objective support are only the mind and mental factors.

original: de'i phyir mu bzhi dang tshig phyi ma sbyor bar yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir mu bzhi dang tshig phyi ma sbyor bar yang 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, the four possibilities and the subsequent statements are also established.

original: sems kyi khams bdun dang chos kyi khams kyi phyogs zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: sems kyi khams bdun dang chos kyi khams kyi phyogs zhes bya ba la /
translated: The seven mental elements and part of the element of mental objects.

original: gang zhig sems dang sems las byung ba rnams kyi dmigs pa gang yin pa @89a &amp ;
analyzed: gang zhig sems dang sems las byung ba rnams kyi dmigs pa gang yin pa @89a &amp ;
translated: That which is the objective support of the mind and mental factors

original: 90a * // ni rnam par smin pa las skyes par sgrub par nus pa kho na'o //
analyzed: 90a * // ni rnam par smin pa las skyes par sgrub par nus pa kho na'o //
translated: can be established as being only the result of karmic maturation.🔽The body consciousness is also the transformation of time.

original: lus kyi rnam par shes pa ni dus yongs su 'gyur ba yang ngo zhes pa ma te shv'a pa kastatstshe nee ba sred pa'i tshogs drug rnam par gzhag ste /
analyzed: lus kyi rnam par shes pa ni dus yongs su 'gyur ba yang ngo zhes pa ma te shv'a pa kastatstshe nee ba sred pa'i tshogs drug rnam par gzhag ste /
translated: The Vaibhāṣikas posit six collections of craving:

original: mig gi 'dus te rig pa las skyes pa'i sred pa nas yid kyi 'dus te reg pa las skyes pa'i sred pa'i bar te /
analyzed: mig gi 'dus te rig pa las skyes pa'i sred pa nas yid kyi 'dus te reg pa las skyes pa'i sred pa'i bar te /
translated: craving born from contact with the eye up to craving born from contact with the mind.

original: mig gi 'dus te reg pa las skyes pa ma yin pa'i tshor ba la sogs pa mngon par brjod pa bzhin du /
analyzed: mig gi 'dus te reg pa las skyes pa ma yin pa'i tshor ba la sogs pa mngon par brjod pa bzhin du /
translated: Feeling, etc. that are not born from eye contact are like verbal expressions.

original: mig gi 'dus te reg pa las skyes ba'i mtshungs pa de ma thag par khas blang bar bya'o //
analyzed: mig gi 'dus te reg pa las skyes ba'i mtshungs pa de ma thag par khas blang bar bya'o //
translated: You should accept that the immediately preceding condition of eye contact is the same as eye contact.

original: 'di ltar mig gi 'dus te reg pa las skyes pa'i tshor ba la sogs pa rnams 'dus te reg pa'i de ma thag tu skye bar 'dod do //
analyzed: 'di ltar mig gi 'dus te reg pa las skyes pa'i tshor ba la sogs pa rnams 'dus te reg pa'i de ma thag tu skye bar 'dod do //
translated: Thus, feeling, etc. that are born from eye contact are held to arise immediately after contact.

original: rnam pa gnyis kyang srog chags rnams kyi nyon mongs pa chung ngu dang nyon mongs pa chen po dag go //
analyzed: rnam pa gnyis kyang srog chags rnams kyi nyon mongs pa chung ngu dang nyon mongs pa chen po dag go //
translated: There are two kinds of contact: contact with a small affliction and contact with a great affliction.

original: de la nyon mongs pa chung ngu ni phyin ci log gi rtog pa sngon du 'gro ba can no //
analyzed: de la nyon mongs pa chung ngu ni phyin ci log gi rtog pa sngon du 'gro ba can no //
translated: Contact with a small affliction is preceded by a misconception.

original: nyon mongs ba sngon du gyur pa ni nyon mongs pa chen po ste yul dang mtshungs par ldan pa nyid do //
analyzed: nyon mongs ba sngon du gyur pa ni nyon mongs pa chen po ste yul dang mtshungs par ldan pa nyid do //
translated: Contact with a great affliction is contact that is associated with the object.

original: de'i phyir 'ga' zhig la nyon mongs pa can gyi yid sngon du 'gro ba las rnam par shes pa ba skye'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'ga' zhig la nyon mongs pa can gyi yid sngon du 'gro ba las rnam par shes pa ba skye'o //
translated: Therefore, in some cases, consciousness arises from a prior afflicted mind.

original: 'ga' zhig la nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa sngon du 'gro bas zhes bya ba ma chags pa la sogs pa'i rang bzhin no ;
analyzed: 'ga' zhig la nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa sngon du 'gro bas zhes bya ba ma chags pa la sogs pa'i rang bzhin no ;
translated: Some say: They are preceded by non-afflicted states, which are by nature nonattachment and so on.

original: / ma chags pa dang zhe sdang med pa dang gti mug med pa dang ngo tsha shes pa dang / khrel yod pa dang chos lnga po de dag ni rang gi ngo bos dge ba yin gyi gzhan dang mtshungs par ldan pas ni ma yin no //
analyzed: / ma chags pa dang zhe sdang med pa dang gti mug med pa dang ngo tsha shes pa dang / khrel yod pa dang chos lnga po de dag ni rang gi ngo bos dge ba yin gyi gzhan dang mtshungs par ldan pas ni ma yin no //
translated: The five such as nonattachment, nonaversion, nondelusion, conscience and shame are virtuous by nature, but not by concomitance.

original: tshor ba la sogs pa sems las byung ba gzhan dag ma chags pa la sogs ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa de dag ni mtshungs par ldan pa kho nas dge ba yin gyi rang gi ngo bos ni ma yin no //
analyzed: tshor ba la sogs pa sems las byung ba gzhan dag ma chags pa la sogs ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa de dag ni mtshungs par ldan pa kho nas dge ba yin gyi rang gi ngo bos ni ma yin no //
translated: Other mental factors such as feeling that are concomitant with nonattachment and so on are virtuous by concomitance, but not by nature.🔽Arising and so on that are motivated by nonattachment and so on are virtuous by concomitance and by motivation, but not by nature.

original: ma chags la sogs pas kun nas bslang bas skye ba la sogs pa dang ldan pa ma yin pa dang rnam par rig byed ma yin pa'i gzugs kyang ste /
analyzed: ma chags la sogs pas kun nas bslang bas skye ba la sogs pa dang ldan pa ma yin pa dang rnam par rig byed ma yin pa'i gzugs kyang ste /
translated: Nonindicative form is virtuous by concomitance and by motivation, but not by nature.

original: 'di dag gi dge ba nyid ni kun nas slong ba'i dbang gis yin gyi mtshungs par ldan pa dang rang gi ngo bos ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di dag gi dge ba nyid ni kun nas slong ba'i dbang gis yin gyi mtshungs par ldan pa dang rang gi ngo bos ni ma yin no //
translated: Their virtue is due to the motivating force, not to their intrinsic nature.

original: so sor brtags pas 'gog pa ni zhes bya ba ni don dam pas dge ba yin no //
analyzed: so sor brtags pas 'gog pa ni zhes bya ba ni don dam pas dge ba yin no //
translated: Cessation due to deliberation is virtuous by ultimate nature.

original: chags pa la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid dang zhes bya ba la /🔽chags pa dang sdang ba dang rmongs pa dang / ngo tsha @89b &amp ;
analyzed: chags pa la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid dang zhes bya ba la / chags pa dang sdang ba dang rmongs pa dang / ngo tsha @89b &amp ;
translated: Those that are by nature attachment, etc.

original: 90b med pa dang khrel med pa ni rang gi ngo bos mi dge ba'o //
analyzed: 90b med pa dang khrel med pa ni rang gi ngo bos mi dge ba'o //
translated: Attachment, hostility, conceit, ignorance, shamelessness, and nonembarrassment are nonvirtuous by intrinsic nature.

original: chags pa la sogs pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa tshor ba la sogs pa ni mtshungs par ldan pa'i sgo nas so //
analyzed: chags pa la sogs pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa tshor ba la sogs pa ni mtshungs par ldan pa'i sgo nas so //
translated: Those that are concomitant with attachment, etc., such as feeling, etc., are nonvirtuous by concomitance.

original: skye ba la sogs pa dang rnam par rig byed ma yin pa'i gzugs ni kun nas slong ba'i sgo nas so //
analyzed: skye ba la sogs pa dang rnam par rig byed ma yin pa'i gzugs ni kun nas slong ba'i sgo nas so //
translated: Birth, etc., and nonindicative form are nonvirtuous by motivating force.

original: gzhan ni lung du ma bstan pa yin no zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gzhan ni lung du ma bstan pa yin no zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The others are indeterminate.

original: gang zhig rang gi ngo bos dge ba dang mi dge ba ma yin pa dang / de dang mtshungs par ldan pa ma yin pa dang / de dag gis kun nas bslang ba ma yin pa ste dper na nam mkha' dang so sor brtags pa ma yin pas 'gog pa dang lung du ma bstan pa'i sems dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i tshor ba la sogs pa dang /
analyzed: gang zhig rang gi ngo bos dge ba dang mi dge ba ma yin pa dang / de dang mtshungs par ldan pa ma yin pa dang / de dag gis kun nas bslang ba ma yin pa ste dper na nam mkha' dang so sor brtags pa ma yin pas 'gog pa dang lung du ma bstan pa'i sems dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i tshor ba la sogs pa dang /
translated: That which is not virtuous or nonvirtuous by its very nature, that which is not concomitant with them, and that which is not motivated by them, for example, space, nonanalytical cessation, and feeling and so on concomitant with neutral minds.

original: ji ltar bshad pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba'i kun nas slong ba ldan pa ma yin pa dag go //
analyzed: ji ltar bshad pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba'i kun nas slong ba ldan pa ma yin pa dag go //
translated: And that which is not motivated by the mind and mental factors explained earlier.

original: lus dang ngag gi rnam par rig byed kyi kun slong gi dbang gis dge ba dang mi dge ba nyid do zhes bya ba de'i phyir /
analyzed: lus dang ngag gi rnam par rig byed kyi kun slong gi dbang gis dge ba dang mi dge ba nyid do zhes bya ba de'i phyir /
translated: They are virtuous or nonvirtuous due to the motivating factors of the indicative form of body and speech.

original: gzugs dang sgra'i khams ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: gzugs dang sgra'i khams ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: Therefore it says, The form and sound elements and so on.

original: de las gzhan dag ni lung du ma bstan pa yin no zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de las gzhan dag ni lung du ma bstan pa yin no zhes bya ba la /
translated: The others are neutral.

original: lung du ma bstan pa'i sems kyis kun nas bslang ba'i lus ngag gi rnam par rig byed dang / rnam par rig byed las tha dad pa'i gzugs dang sgra thams cad do //🔽dge ba la sogs pa'i dbye ba bshad zin to //🔽gtogs pa ni ma bral ba ste /🔽'dod pa'i khams kyi rang bzhin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: lung du ma bstan pa'i sems kyis kun nas bslang ba'i lus ngag gi rnam par rig byed dang / rnam par rig byed las tha dad pa'i gzugs dang sgra thams cad do // dge ba la sogs pa'i dbye ba bshad zin to // gtogs pa ni ma bral ba ste / 'dod pa'i khams kyi rang bzhin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The form of the realm of immateriality is the concentration of the cessation of ideation and sensation.🔽The form of the realm of immateriality is the concentration of the cessation of ideation and sensation.🔽The form of the realm of immateriality is the concentration of the cessation of ideation and sensation.

original: kham gyi zas ni gzugs kyi khams na yod bar mi 'gyur ba ci las she na /🔽'di ni dgos pa med pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: kham gyi zas ni gzugs kyi khams na yod bar mi 'gyur ba ci las she na / 'di ni dgos pa med pa'i phyir te /
translated: The form of the realm of immateriality is the concentration of the cessation of ideation and sensation.🔽The form of the realm of immateriality is the concentration of the cessation of ideation and sensation.

original: gzugs med pa'i khams na gzugs la sogs pa bzhin du dgos pa med pa nyid do //
analyzed: gzugs med pa'i khams na gzugs la sogs pa bzhin du dgos pa med pa nyid do //
translated: The form of the realm of immateriality is the concentration of the cessation of ideation and sensation.🔽The form of the realm of immateriality is the concentration of the cessation of ideation and sensation.🔽The form of the realm of immateriality is the concentration of the cessation of ideation and sensation.🔽The form of the realm of immateriality is the concentration of the cessation of ideation and sensation.🔽The form of the realm of immateriality is the concentration of the cessation of ideation and sensation.🔽The form of the realm of immateriality is the concentration of the cessation of ideation and sensation.🔽The form of the realm of immateriality is the concentration of the cessation of ideation and sensation.🔽The form of the realm of immateriality is the concentration of the cessation of ideation and sensation.🔽The form of the realm of immateriality is the concentration of the cessation of ideation and sensation.🔽The form of the realm of immateriality is the concentration of the cessation of ideation and sensation.🔽The form of the realm of immateriality is the concentration of the cessation of ideation and sensation.🔽The form of the realm of immateriality is the concentration of the cessation of ideation and sensation.🔽The form of the realm of immateriality is the concentration of the cessation of ideation and sensation.

original: yang kham gyi zas la 'dod chags dang bral pa rnams gzugs kyi khams su skye bar rtogs par bya ste gzugs kyi 'dod chags dang bral ba rnams gzugs med pa'i khams su skye ba bzhin no ;
analyzed: yang kham gyi zas la 'dod chags dang bral pa rnams gzugs kyi khams su skye bar rtogs par bya ste gzugs kyi 'dod chags dang bral ba rnams gzugs med pa'i khams su skye ba bzhin no ;
translated: The form of the realm of immateriality is the concentration of the cessation of ideation and sensation.

original: / gzugs la sogs pa rnams zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: / gzugs la sogs pa rnams zhes bya ba la /
translated: The form of the realm of immateriality is

original: dri dang ro dag med pa'i phyir sna dang lce'i rnam par shes pa dag kyang med do //
analyzed: dri dang ro dag med pa'i phyir sna dang lce'i rnam par shes pa dag kyang med do //
translated: Since there is no odor or taste, there is no nose or tongue consciousness.

original: dmigs pa med pa'i phyir yul 'ga' la yang rnam par shes pa mi skye ste /
analyzed: dmigs pa med pa'i phyir yul 'ga' la yang rnam par shes pa mi skye ste /
translated: Consciousness does not arise in the absence of an object.

original: dper na gzugs med pa'i khams su gzugs dang sgra la sogs pa'i rnam par @91a * //
analyzed: dper na gzugs med pa'i khams su gzugs dang sgra la sogs pa'i rnam par @91a * //
translated: For example, in the formless realm, there is no form, sound, etc.

original: de yin na zhes bya ba ni shugs kyis ma nges pa ste /
analyzed: de yin na zhes bya ba ni shugs kyis ma nges pa ste /
translated: If that is so, this is an uncertain reason.

original: bstan du yod pa rnams kho na mdzes kyi bstan du med pa rnams ni ma yin pas rten kho nas chog gi zhes rgya cher 'byung ngo //
analyzed: bstan du yod pa rnams kho na mdzes kyi bstan du med pa rnams ni ma yin pas rten kho nas chog gi zhes rgya cher 'byung ngo //
translated: Only those that are demonstrable are beautiful, not those that are not demonstrable. Therefore, the support is sufficient.

original: de'i phyir dbang po med pa'i rten ni 'khrul pa nyid do zhes bya ba de la /
analyzed: de'i phyir dbang po med pa'i rten ni 'khrul pa nyid do zhes bya ba de la /
translated: Therefore, the support of the sense faculty is mistaken.

original: mig la sogs pa'i rten ni chos mthun pa'i sgo nas yin la /
analyzed: mig la sogs pa'i rten ni chos mthun pa'i sgo nas yin la /
translated: The support of the eye, etc. is similar.

original: pho'i dbang po'i rten ni chos mi mthun pa'i sgo nas so //
analyzed: pho'i dbang po'i rten ni chos mi mthun pa'i sgo nas so //
translated: The support of the male faculty is dissimilar.

original: de la dgos pa la yang rten srid pa la sngar dbang po'i dgos pa bshad par gyur pa de'i phyir slar yang de mi srid par rigs pa ni ma nges pa ma yin pa nyid do //🔽pho'i dbang po'i rten gyis ni der mdzes pa la sogs pa'i dgos pa mi bsgrub pas dgos pa med pa'i phyir dri dang ro bzhin du mi srid pa rigs kyi sna dang lce'i rten ni mdzes pa dang mngon par brjod pa'i dgos pa dang ldan pa'i phyir dbang
analyzed: de la dgos pa la yang rten srid pa la sngar dbang po'i dgos pa bshad par gyur pa de'i phyir slar yang de mi srid par rigs pa ni ma nges pa ma yin pa nyid do // pho'i dbang po'i rten gyis ni der mdzes pa la sogs pa'i dgos pa mi bsgrub pas dgos pa med pa'i phyir dri dang ro bzhin du mi srid pa rigs kyi sna dang lce'i rten ni mdzes pa dang mngon par brjod pa'i dgos pa dang ldan pa'i phyir dbang
translated: The purpose of the faculties has already been explained above, so it is not reasonable to assert that the faculties are not necessary for the existence of the body.🔽The support of the male faculty does not accomplish the purpose of beauty, etc., so it is reasonable that it does not exist, like smell and taste, because it has no purpose.

original: po med par srid par rigs so //
analyzed: po med par srid par rigs so //
translated: However, it is reasonable that the support of the nose and tongue exist without faculties because they have the purpose of beauty and expression.

original: dgos pa la bltos nas skye bar brjod pa med kyi /
analyzed: dgos pa la bltos nas skye bar brjod pa med kyi /
translated: It is not said that the faculties arise in dependence on their purpose,

original: dbang po la bltos nas rten skye'o zhes pa rigs par khas blang bar bya'o //
analyzed: dbang po la bltos nas rten skye'o zhes pa rigs par khas blang bar bya'o //
translated: but it is reasonable to accept that the support arises in dependence on the faculties.

original: dgos pa dang bcas pa 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi dgos pa med par yang dbang po mngon par 'grub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dgos pa dang bcas pa 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi dgos pa med par yang dbang po mngon par 'grub par 'gyur ro //
translated: Not only do the faculties arise with a purpose, they also arise without a purpose.

original: ji ltar de de dang skal ba mnyam pa rnams nyid kyang khyad par nye bar bzung nas sna dang lce'i dbang po gang yin pa de la sa n'a lam rgyu la 'khrul pa'i phyir ro snyam du sems so //
analyzed: ji ltar de de dang skal ba mnyam pa rnams nyid kyang khyad par nye bar bzung nas sna dang lce'i dbang po gang yin pa de la sa n'a lam rgyu la 'khrul pa'i phyir ro snyam du sems so //
translated: Just as those of the same status as the gods of the first absorption, having taken on a specific status, are confused about the nose and tongue sense faculties, since they are not active there.

original: don 'di ni dpe med par bstan par mi nus pas /
analyzed: don 'di ni dpe med par bstan par mi nus pas /
translated: Since this meaning cannot be taught without an example,🔽an example is stated:

original: dper na mngal du nges par 'chi ba rnams kyi lta bu'o zhes dpe gsungs te /
analyzed: dper na mngal du nges par 'chi ba rnams kyi lta bu'o zhes dpe gsungs te /
translated: For example, it is like those who definitely die in the womb.🔽The term definite is stated because those who are not definitely going to die have a purpose in one part, since it is possible that one born there sees form and so on.

original: nges pa smos pa ni 'chi bar ma nges pa rnams la phyogs gcig dgos pa dang bcas pa'i phyir te skyes pas gzugs la sogs pa mthong ba srid par 'gyur zhes dgos pa med kyang mngal du nges par 'chi ba'i ltar gzugs kyi khams su yang dbang po
analyzed: nges pa smos pa ni 'chi bar ma nges pa rnams la phyogs gcig dgos pa dang bcas pa'i phyir te skyes pas gzugs la sogs pa mthong ba srid par 'gyur zhes dgos pa med kyang mngal du nges par 'chi ba'i ltar gzugs kyi khams su yang dbang po
translated: Even though there is no purpose, like those who definitely die in the womb, in the form realm, the nose and tongue sense faculties are not active.

original: dag skye'o // mngal du nges par 'chi ba la rgyu med pa ma yin pa bzhin gzugs kyi khams su sna dang lce'i dbang po dag mngon par 'grub pa'i rgyu yod pa ma yin pas de na de dag med de /
analyzed: dag skye'o // mngal du nges par 'chi ba la rgyu med pa ma yin pa bzhin gzugs kyi khams su sna dang lce'i dbang po dag mngon par 'grub pa'i rgyu yod pa ma yin pas de na de dag med de /
translated: The nose and tongue faculties are not formed in the form realm because there is no cause for their formation there.

original: mig la sogs pa ni chos mthun pa'i sgo nas so //
analyzed: mig la sogs pa ni chos mthun pa'i sgo nas so //
translated: The eyes, etc., are similar to the nose and tongue faculties in that they are not formed in the form realm because there is no cause for their formation there.

original: pho'i dbang po ni chos mi mthun pa'i sgo nas so //
analyzed: pho'i dbang po ni chos mi mthun pa'i sgo nas so //
translated: The male faculty is not formed in the form realm because it is not in conformity with that realm.

original: sna dang lce'i dbang po dag de na rgyu med pa mi srid do snyam ste /
analyzed: sna dang lce'i dbang po dag de na rgyu med pa mi srid do snyam ste /
translated: The nose and tongue faculties are not formed in the form realm because it is impossible that they have no cause for their formation there.

original: dbang po @91b skye ba'i rgyu gang zhe na zhes bya ba'o //🔽dbang po la sred pa dang bcas pa'i las kyi khyad par ro zhes bya ba la skye mched drug la bdag tu chags pa dang ldan pa'i yul mngon par zhen pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: dbang po @91b skye ba'i rgyu gang zhe na zhes bya ba'o // dbang po la sred pa dang bcas pa'i las kyi khyad par ro zhes bya ba la skye mched drug la bdag tu chags pa dang ldan pa'i yul mngon par zhen pa'i phyir te /
translated: What is the cause of the formation of the faculties?🔽The special karma associated with craving for the faculties.🔽The special karma associated with craving for the faculties is the cause of the formation of the faculties.

original: de nye bar longs spyod pa'i dbang po la sred ba dang bcas pa'i las kyi khyad par ro //
analyzed: de nye bar longs spyod pa'i dbang po la sred ba dang bcas pa'i las kyi khyad par ro //
translated: The special karma associated with craving for the faculties is the cause of the formation of the faculties.

original: gang yang yul la sred pa dang bral ba de dbang po las kyang sred pa dang bral ba yin pas zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gang yang yul la sred pa dang bral ba de dbang po las kyang sred pa dang bral ba yin pas zhes bya ba la /
translated: Those who are free from craving for objects are also free from craving for faculties.

original: yul so sor myong ba byas pa'i phyir dbang po 'dod de dper na gang zhig 'khrig pa'i reg pa la 'dod chags dang bral ba de ni pho'i dbang po las kyang 'dod chags dang bral ba bzhin no //
analyzed: yul so sor myong ba byas pa'i phyir dbang po 'dod de dper na gang zhig 'khrig pa'i reg pa la 'dod chags dang bral ba de ni pho'i dbang po las kyang 'dod chags dang bral ba bzhin no //
translated: One craves for a faculty because it experiences an object. For example, one who is free from attachment to the contact of sexual intercourse is also free from attachment to the male faculty.

original: de'i phyir sna dang lce'i dbang po la 'dod chags dang bral ba'i phyir de na de dag gi rgyu las kyi khyad par yod pa ma yin te pho'i dbang po'i rgyu bzhin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir sna dang lce'i dbang po la 'dod chags dang bral ba'i phyir de na de dag gi rgyu las kyi khyad par yod pa ma yin te pho'i dbang po'i rgyu bzhin no //
translated: Therefore, since one is free from attachment to the nose and tongue faculties, the specific karma that is their cause does not exist there, like the cause of the male faculty.

original: ci ste yul 'dod chags dang bral yang dbang po la 'dod chags dang bral bar mi 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: ci ste yul 'dod chags dang bral yang dbang po la 'dod chags dang bral bar mi 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: But if one is free from attachment to objects, one would not be free from attachment to faculties.

original: rgyu med pa'i sna dang lce dag der skye ba ma yin te /
analyzed: rgyu med pa'i sna dang lce dag der skye ba ma yin te /
translated: The nose and tongue faculties are not born there without a cause.

original: de'i phyir gal te rgyu med par skye na pho'i dbang po yang ci ste 'grub par 'gyur /
analyzed: de'i phyir gal te rgyu med par skye na pho'i dbang po yang ci ste 'grub par 'gyur /
translated: Therefore, if they are born without a cause, why would the male faculty not also be established?

original: gal te 'dod chags dang bral bar gyur pa'i phyir rgyu dang bcas pas skye ba mi mdzes pa'i phyir yin gyi 'dod chags dang bral ba'i phyir ni ma yin no zhe'o //
analyzed: gal te 'dod chags dang bral bar gyur pa'i phyir rgyu dang bcas pas skye ba mi mdzes pa'i phyir yin gyi 'dod chags dang bral ba'i phyir ni ma yin no zhe'o //
translated: If you say that it is because the cause of birth is not beautiful when it is free from attachment, not because it is free from attachment,

original: rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas dang 'khor los sgyur ba ltar 'doms kyi sba ba sbubs su nub pa rnams kyi ci'i phyir mi mdzes par 'gyur /
analyzed: rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas dang 'khor los sgyur ba ltar 'doms kyi sba ba sbubs su nub pa rnams kyi ci'i phyir mi mdzes par 'gyur /
translated: then why is it not beautiful in the case of perfect Buddhas and wheel-turning kings, whose male organs are retracted into a sheath?

original: 'doms kyi sba ba ni pho'i dbang po'o //
analyzed: 'doms kyi sba ba ni pho'i dbang po'o //
translated: The male organ is the male faculty.

original: 'doms ni gang gis pho'i dbang po de bsdums pa'o //
analyzed: 'doms ni gang gis pho'i dbang po de bsdums pa'o //
translated: The sheath is that which covers the male organ.

original: gang dag la 'doms kyi sba ba sdubs su nub pa yod pa de dag gi zhes tshig bsdu'o //
analyzed: gang dag la 'doms kyi sba ba sdubs su nub pa yod pa de dag gi zhes tshig bsdu'o //
translated: Those who have a sheath that covers the male organ are said to have a sheath.

original: pho'i dbang po la 'dod chags dang bral ba rnams der skye bas pho'i dbang po mngon par mi 'grub ste /
analyzed: pho'i dbang po la 'dod chags dang bral ba rnams der skye bas pho'i dbang po mngon par mi 'grub ste /
translated: Those who are free from attachment to the male organ are not born there, and so the male organ does not manifest there.

original: de la 'dod chags dang bral ba rnams la ni de'i rten mngon par mi 'grub par rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: de la 'dod chags dang bral ba rnams la ni de'i rten mngon par mi 'grub par rtogs par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood that the basis of that attachment does not manifest there.

original: slob dpon 'dus bzang na re gang zhig dbang po la 'dod chags dang bral pa de nges par de'i rten las kyang ngo zhes zer ro //
analyzed: slob dpon 'dus bzang na re gang zhig dbang po la 'dod chags dang bral pa de nges par de'i rten las kyang ngo zhes zer ro //
translated: Master Saṅghabhadra says: One who is free from attachment to the sense faculty is definitely also free from attachment to its object.

original: de nyid kyi phyir sna dang lce'i rten mngon par grub pas de dag sna dang lce la 'dod chags bral ba zhes bya ba ma yin par nges par bya'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir sna dang lce'i rten mngon par grub pas de dag sna dang lce la 'dod chags bral ba zhes bya ba ma yin par nges par bya'o //
translated: Therefore it should be ascertained that those who are free from attachment to the nose and tongue faculties are not necessarily free from attachment to the nose and tongue objects.

original: gang zhig rten la 'dod chags dang ma bral ba de ni nges par dbang po las kyang zhes so //🔽dbang po la sred pa dang bral yang de'i rten la sred pa med pa 'ga' @92a * //
analyzed: gang zhig rten la 'dod chags dang ma bral ba de ni nges par dbang po las kyang zhes so // dbang po la sred pa dang bral yang de'i rten la sred pa med pa 'ga' @92a * //
translated: But those who are not free from attachment to the object are definitely not free from attachment to the sense faculty.

original: zhig dgos pa'i dbang gis mi 'gal te rnam par shes pa'i rten bzhin no //
analyzed: zhig dgos pa'i dbang gis mi 'gal te rnam par shes pa'i rten bzhin no //
translated: Even though one is free from craving the sense faculty, it is not contradictory that one is not free from craving its object due to the power of necessity, like the basis of consciousness.

original: dper na mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa la sred pa dang bral yang dgos pa'i dbang gis de'i rten la sred pa dang bral ba ma yin pa ste bsam gtan gnyis pa sogs par skye'o ;
analyzed: dper na mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa la sred pa dang bral yang dgos pa'i dbang gis de'i rten la sred pa dang bral ba ma yin pa ste bsam gtan gnyis pa sogs par skye'o ;
translated: For example, even though one is free from craving eye consciousness and so on, one is not free from craving its basis due to the power of necessity, like being born in the second absorption and so on.

original: / de bzhin du yang yul la sred pa dang bral yang dgos pa'i dbang gis dbang po la sred pa yang ma bral ba'o zhes brjod pa'am bstan par nus te /
analyzed: / de bzhin du yang yul la sred pa dang bral yang dgos pa'i dbang gis dbang po la sred pa yang ma bral ba'o zhes brjod pa'am bstan par nus te /
translated: Likewise, although they are free from craving for objects, they are not free from craving for the faculties, because of the need.

original: ji skad bshad pa'i dgos pa'i khyad par las dbang po la gnod par mi 'gyur zhes so //
analyzed: ji skad bshad pa'i dgos pa'i khyad par las dbang po la gnod par mi 'gyur zhes so //
translated: This can be stated or demonstrated.

original: sna dang lce'i dbang po dag gzugs kyi khams su skye ba de lta bu 'di mi rigs pa de ltar khas ma blangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sna dang lce'i dbang po dag gzugs kyi khams su skye ba de lta bu 'di mi rigs pa de ltar khas ma blangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is not reasonable that the nose and tongue faculties would be born in the form realm, and we do not accept that.

original: de na 'di dper brjod pa rab tu sgrub pa'i phyir bstan pa gang yin pa de rnams kyang ma 'brel ba nyid de /
analyzed: de na 'di dper brjod pa rab tu sgrub pa'i phyir bstan pa gang yin pa de rnams kyang ma 'brel ba nyid de /
translated: Those examples that are taught to prove this are also irrelevant.

original: gzhung mngas pa'i 'jigs pas de dag la rnam par dpyad do //🔽dgos pa'i dbang gis 'byung ba yang ma yin no ;
analyzed: gzhung mngas pa'i 'jigs pas de dag la rnam par dpyad do // dgos pa'i dbang gis 'byung ba yang ma yin no ;
translated: We have analyzed them, fearing excessive length.

original: / dgos pa'i dbang ma yin no //
analyzed: / dgos pa'i dbang ma yin no //
translated: They are not born from the power of need.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What then?

original: rgyu'i dbang gis zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: rgyu'i dbang gis zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: They are born from the power of cause, etc.

original: gal te skyes bu chen po'i mtshan rnams la ni de ltar mi brjod kyi /
analyzed: gal te skyes bu chen po'i mtshan rnams la ni de ltar mi brjod kyi /
translated: If the marks of a great man are not so described,

original: rgyu yod na mi mdzes par byed pa bzhin du yang 'byung bar 'gyur ba nyid do //🔽'o na ni mdo las dbang po rnams zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'dis ni khas blangs pa la gnod pa gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: rgyu yod na mi mdzes par byed pa bzhin du yang 'byung bar 'gyur ba nyid do // 'o na ni mdo las dbang po rnams zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'dis ni khas blangs pa la gnod pa gsungs pa'o //
translated: then they would arise even if there were no cause, just as if there were an ugly person.🔽But the sutra states that the faculties are the cause of the marks, so this contradicts the sutra.

original: da ni dbang po gang dag zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'gal ba spong ba'o //
analyzed: da ni dbang po gang dag zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'gal ba spong ba'o //
translated: Now, in order to eliminate this contradiction, the root text says, “What are the faculties?”

original: de lta ma yin na zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: de lta ma yin na zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: If that were not so,

original: gal te 'dod pa'i khams su gang yin pa de'i dbang du byas nas mdo las bshad pa yang khas blangs te /
analyzed: gal te 'dod pa'i khams su gang yin pa de'i dbang du byas nas mdo las bshad pa yang khas blangs te /
translated: then the sutra would be accepted as it is explained in the sutra, taking the desire realm as the basis.

original: de bzhin du de na pho'i dbang po yang yod par thal te sna dang lce'i dbang po bzhin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du de na pho'i dbang po yang yod par thal te sna dang lce'i dbang po bzhin no //
translated: Then it would follow that the male faculty would also exist there, like the nose and tongue faculties.

original: de ltar bcu bzhi bshad pa ni rnal 'byor spyod pa rnams so //🔽lus kyi sgo nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: de ltar bcu bzhi bshad pa ni rnal 'byor spyod pa rnams so //🔽lus kyi sgo nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: Thus, the Yogacarins explain fourteen faculties.🔽The root text says, “The faculties are of two kinds: those that are material and those that are not material.”

original: 'di la bdag tu nga rgyal bzhag bas na skye mched drug lus yin te nga'am nga'o snyam du bsam pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di la bdag tu nga rgyal bzhag bas na skye mched drug lus yin te nga'am nga'o snyam du bsam pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Since the pride of self is placed in this, the six sense spheres are the body, because of the thought “I” or “mine.”

original: de'i phyir khyad par med par skye mched drug la sred pa 'jug go //
analyzed: de'i phyir khyad par med par skye mched drug la sred pa 'jug go //
translated: Therefore, craving engages the six sense spheres without distinction.

original: yul gyi sgo nas ni ma yin pas zhes bya ba ni yul gyi dmigs pa'i sgo nas ma yin pa ste /
analyzed: yul gyi sgo nas ni ma yin pas zhes bya ba ni yul gyi dmigs pa'i sgo nas ma yin pa ste /
translated: But not by way of object means not by way of the object as objective support.

original: de'i phyir yul la 'dod chags dang bral bas de'i 'dzin par byed pa dbang po la 'dod chags dang bral bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir yul la 'dod chags dang bral bas de'i 'dzin par byed pa dbang po la 'dod chags dang bral bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, one is not freed from craving the sense faculty that grasps the object, by being freed from attachment to the object.

original: @92b 'khrig pa'i reg pa'i 'dod chags dang bral ba rnams ni pho'i dbang po las 'dod chags par bral bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: @92b 'khrig pa'i reg pa'i 'dod chags dang bral ba rnams ni pho'i dbang po las 'dod chags par bral bar 'gyur te /
translated: Those freed from attachment to sexual union are freed from attachment to the male faculty.

original: 'khrig pa'i reg pa'i sgo nas de la sred pa 'jug pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: 'khrig pa'i reg pa'i sgo nas de la sred pa 'jug pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because craving engages that by way of sexual union.

original: 'khrig pa'i reg pa dmigs pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: 'khrig pa'i reg pa dmigs pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Because sexual union is the objective support, is what is meant.

original: de'i phyir pho'i dbang po yang lus kyi dbang po'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir skye mched drug gis bsdus pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: de'i phyir pho'i dbang po yang lus kyi dbang po'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir skye mched drug gis bsdus pa ma yin nam /
translated: Therefore, since the male faculty is also of the nature of the body faculty, is it not included in the six sense bases?

original: de'i phyir de la lus kyi sgo nas sred pa 'jug par thal bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: de'i phyir de la lus kyi sgo nas sred pa 'jug par thal bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: Therefore, it follows that craving would engage through the body.

original: 'dir pho'i dbang po yang dag par 'grub pa'i las ni 'khrig pa'i reg pa la sred pa sngon du 'gro ba can yin te /
analyzed: 'dir pho'i dbang po yang dag par 'grub pa'i las ni 'khrig pa'i reg pa la sred pa sngon du 'gro ba can yin te /
translated: Here, the action that fully produces the male faculty is preceded by craving for sexual intercourse.

original: de'i phyir 'di la yul gyi sgo nas sred ba kun tu spyod kyi lus kyi sgo nas ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di la yul gyi sgo nas sred ba kun tu spyod kyi lus kyi sgo nas ni ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, craving engages its object in this case, but not through the body.

original: rten dang dmigs pa zhes bya ba ni mig la sogs pa rnams rten dang gzugs la sogs pa rnams dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: rten dang dmigs pa zhes bya ba ni mig la sogs pa rnams rten dang gzugs la sogs pa rnams dmigs pa'o //
translated: The term “basis” refers to the eye, etc., and the term “object” refers to form, etc.

original: 'di ltar rten dang dmigs pa med pa'i rnam par shes pa yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar rten dang dmigs pa med pa'i rnam par shes pa yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Thus, consciousness does not exist without a basis and an object.

original: de'i phyir de ni mig la sogs pa rnams dang gzugs la sogs pa rnams med pa'i phyir mig la sogs pa rnam par shes pa'i khams rnams yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir de ni mig la sogs pa rnams dang gzugs la sogs pa rnams med pa'i phyir mig la sogs pa rnam par shes pa'i khams rnams yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, since the eye, etc. and form, etc. do not exist, the eye consciousness element, etc. do not exist.

original: gang dag lam gyi bden pa dang 'dus ma byas kyis bsdus pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gang dag lam gyi bden pa dang 'dus ma byas kyis bsdus pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: Those who include the unconditioned in the truth of the path

original: 'dir slob dpon la rgol bar byed pa ni nam mkha' dang so sor brtags pa'i 'gog pa yod pa ma yin yang zag pa'i gnyen po yin pa'i phyir zag pa med pa'i phyir zag pa med pa nyid du yongs su brtag par bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir slob dpon la rgol bar byed pa ni nam mkha' dang so sor brtags pa'i 'gog pa yod pa ma yin yang zag pa'i gnyen po yin pa'i phyir zag pa med pa'i phyir zag pa med pa nyid du yongs su brtag par bya'o //
translated: Here, the master criticizes: Although space and analytical cessation do not exist, they should be considered uncontaminated because they are antidotes to defilements.

original: bye brag tu smra ba rnams kyis zag pa'i gnyen po nyid kyis zag pa med pa nyid du brjod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: bye brag tu smra ba rnams kyis zag pa'i gnyen po nyid kyis zag pa med pa nyid du brjod pa ma yin no //
translated: The Vaibhāṣikas say: We do not say they are uncontaminated because they are antidotes to defilements.

original: 'jig rten pa'i lam ni zag pa med pa nyid du ma gyur pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i lam ni zag pa med pa nyid du ma gyur pa'o //
translated: The mundane path is not uncontaminated.

original: so sor brtags pa'i 'gog pa ni rnam par grol ba dang khyad par gyi lam yang zag pa dang bcas pa nyid do zhes rgol ba dang dgos pa rnam par mi shes so //
analyzed: so sor brtags pa'i 'gog pa ni rnam par grol ba dang khyad par gyi lam yang zag pa dang bcas pa nyid do zhes rgol ba dang dgos pa rnam par mi shes so //
translated: The opponent does not understand the purpose of this response.🔽The fifteen are solely contaminated.

original: bco lnga po de dag ni gcig tu zag pa dang bcas pa yin no zhes bya ba de la yang rgol bar byed pa ni nyon mongs pa'i thob pa med pa'i phyir dang mtshungs par ldan pa med pa'i phyir rgyas par mi 'gyur ba rnams zag pa med
analyzed: bco lnga po de dag ni gcig tu zag pa dang bcas pa yin no zhes bya ba de la yang rgol bar byed pa ni nyon mongs pa'i thob pa med pa'i phyir dang mtshungs par ldan pa med pa'i phyir rgyas par mi 'gyur ba rnams zag pa med
translated: The opponent objects: Since the obtainment of affliction does not exist and since there is no concomitant state, they do not increase and they are uncontaminated.

original: pa rnam par shes pa'i tshogs la sogs pa rnams lam gyi dbang gis yongs su shes par dmigs pa rnams zag pa med pa nyid du 'gyur ro //🔽so sor brtags @93a * //
analyzed: pa rnam par shes pa'i tshogs la sogs pa rnams lam gyi dbang gis yongs su shes par dmigs pa rnams zag pa med pa nyid du 'gyur ro //🔽so sor brtags @93a * //
translated: The aggregates of consciousness and so on that are objects of knowledge of the path are uncontaminated.🔽The analytical cessations and the liberated and special paths are uncontaminated.

original: pa'i 'gog pa thob pa bzhin zhes bya ba gzugs la sogs pa rnams kyang nyon mongs pa'i thob pa med pa'i phyir dang nyon mongs pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa med pa'i phyir rgyas par mi 'gyur te de ltar de yang zag pa med par 'gyur ro //🔽gzugs la sogs pa la ni thal bar mi 'gyur te yongs su shes pa la dmigs pa'i phyir ro //🔽yang ci 'dir yongs su shes pa la dmigs pa nyid zag pa med pa'i rgyu yin zhe na /🔽ji ltar rgyas par mi 'gyur ba nyid yongs su shes pa la der dmigs pa ste sdug bsngal la chos shes pa la sogs pa rnams la 'khrug par byed pas rgyu ma yin no //
analyzed: pa'i 'gog pa thob pa bzhin zhes bya ba gzugs la sogs pa rnams kyang nyon mongs pa'i thob pa med pa'i phyir dang nyon mongs pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa med pa'i phyir rgyas par mi 'gyur te de ltar de yang zag pa med par 'gyur ro // gzugs la sogs pa la ni thal bar mi 'gyur te yongs su shes pa la dmigs pa'i phyir ro // yang ci 'dir yongs su shes pa la dmigs pa nyid zag pa med pa'i rgyu yin zhe na / ji ltar rgyas par mi 'gyur ba nyid yongs su shes pa la der dmigs pa ste sdug bsngal la chos shes pa la sogs pa rnams la 'khrug par byed pas rgyu ma yin no //
translated: Form, etc., also do not increase because they do not have the obtainment of defilement and they are not associated with defilement, just like the attainment of cessation. Thus, they are also uncontaminated.🔽But it is not the case that form, etc., are uncontaminated, because they are the object of complete knowledge.🔽But is the object of complete knowledge itself the cause of the uncontaminated?🔽How is it that they do not increase? Complete knowledge is the object of that, i.e., the knowledge of the dharma of suffering, etc., because it is not the cause of agitation.🔽

original: rgyas par mi 'gyur ba nyid kyang gzugs la sogs pa rnams la zhes bshad pa de bzhin no //
analyzed: rgyas par mi 'gyur ba nyid kyang gzugs la sogs pa rnams la zhes bshad pa de bzhin no //
