original: nyon mongs pa'i thob ba las sam mtshungs bar ldan pa las zag pa dang bcas par 'dod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i thob ba las sam mtshungs bar ldan pa las zag pa dang bcas par 'dod pa ma yin te /
translated: They are not asserted to be contaminated due to the obtainment of affliction or due to being concomitant with affliction.

original: zag pa med pa rnams dge ba zag pa dang bcas pa'i zag ba bcas pa zag pa med par thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zag pa med pa rnams dge ba zag pa dang bcas pa'i zag ba bcas pa zag pa med par thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If they were, it would follow that uncontaminated states would be contaminated states and that contaminated virtue would be uncontaminated.

original: 'o na ci phra rgyas rnams zag pa med pa rnams rgyas par 'gyur ba dang rgyud gzhan gyi nyon mongs pa rnams yongs su shes pa'i khams dmigs pa la rnam par shes pa'i tshogs drug la sogs pa rnams la ste /
analyzed: 'o na ci phra rgyas rnams zag pa med pa rnams rgyas par 'gyur ba dang rgyud gzhan gyi nyon mongs pa rnams yongs su shes pa'i khams dmigs pa la rnam par shes pa'i tshogs drug la sogs pa rnams la ste /
translated: Rather, they are contaminated due to the contaminated states of negative tendencies increasing in the sixfold collection of consciousness and so on, such as the contaminated states of negative tendencies increasing in the sixfold collection of consciousness and the knowledge of the complete knowledge of affliction in other continua focusing on the element of complete knowledge.

original: de bas na zag pa dang bcas pa 'di dag gzugs la sogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: de bas na zag pa dang bcas pa 'di dag gzugs la sogs pa bzhin no //
translated: Therefore they are contaminated like form and so on.

original: gzhan yang de lta bu ni mdo dang 'gal bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: gzhan yang de lta bu ni mdo dang 'gal bar 'gyur te /
translated: Moreover, this would contradict a sutra, which states:

original: zag pa dang bcas pa'i chos rnams gang zhe na /
analyzed: zag pa dang bcas pa'i chos rnams gang zhe na /
translated: What are contaminated phenomena?

original: ji srid mig nas gzugs la sogs pa dang / mig gi rnam par shes pa dang / mig gi 'dus te reg pa dang / gang yang mig gi 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis nang du tshor ba skye ba bde ba'am sdug bsngal ba'am /
analyzed: ji srid mig nas gzugs la sogs pa dang / mig gi rnam par shes pa dang / mig gi 'dus te reg pa dang / gang yang mig gi 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis nang du tshor ba skye ba bde ba'am sdug bsngal ba'am /
translated: As long as there is form in the eye, eye consciousness, eye contact, and whatever feeling arises internally due to the condition of eye contact, whether pleasant, painful, or neither,

original: sdug bsngal yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin pa'am zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: sdug bsngal yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin pa'am zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: and so on.

original: de la lam gyi bden pas bsdus pa'i chos kyi khams ni zag pa med pa'i sdom pa sems las byung ba rnams so //
analyzed: de la lam gyi bden pas bsdus pa'i chos kyi khams ni zag pa med pa'i sdom pa sems las byung ba rnams so //
translated: In this context, the phenomena element included in the truth of the path is the uncontaminated vows and mental factors.

original: mi ldan pa dang zag pa med pa yid kyi khams kyi rnam par shes pa'i khams kyang lam gyis bsdus so //
analyzed: mi ldan pa dang zag pa med pa yid kyi khams kyi rnam par shes pa'i khams kyang lam gyis bsdus so //
translated: The non-associated and uncontaminated mental element and consciousness element are also included in the path.

original: zag pa med pa'i rnam par shes pa dang 'dus ma byas ni chos kyi khams bsdus pa nyid do //
analyzed: zag pa med pa'i rnam par shes pa dang 'dus ma byas ni chos kyi khams bsdus pa nyid do //
translated: Uncontaminated consciousness and unconditioned phenomena are included in the phenomena element alone.

original: rtog dang dpyod dang bcas pa ni //
analyzed: rtog dang dpyod dang bcas pa ni //
translated: That which possesses investigation and analysis

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: is the first dhyāna.

original: ni'i sgra ni rtog pa dang dpyod pa dang bcas pa kho @93b na'o zhes nges par gzung ba'i don te /
analyzed: ni'i sgra ni rtog pa dang dpyod pa dang bcas pa kho @93b na'o zhes nges par gzung ba'i don te /
translated: The word “only” means that they are only associated with investigation and analysis.

original: de'i phyir 'di dag ni rtag tu zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di dag ni rtag tu zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: Therefore, it is said, “They always have investigation and analysis.”

original: yang ci'i phyir 'di rtag tu rtog pa dang dpyod pa dag dang mtshungs par ldan zhe na /
analyzed: yang ci'i phyir 'di rtag tu rtog pa dang dpyod pa dag dang mtshungs par ldan zhe na /
translated: Why are they always associated with investigation and analysis?

original: 'di ltar de dag kha phyi rol du bltas pa'i rtsing ba yin no zhes bya ba ni bstan bcos kyi yi ge'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar de dag kha phyi rol du bltas pa'i rtsing ba yin no zhes bya ba ni bstan bcos kyi yi ge'o //
translated: The treatise text says, “Because they are coarse, looking outward.”

original: de ltar yin dang kha nang du phyogs pa'i rgyu med pa rnams rtag tu sbyor ba mthong ba'i phyir ro zhes slob dpon 'dus bzang zer ro //
analyzed: de ltar yin dang kha nang du phyogs pa'i rgyu med pa rnams rtag tu sbyor ba mthong ba'i phyir ro zhes slob dpon 'dus bzang zer ro //
translated: The master Saṅghabhadra says, “Because it is seen that those that look inward without a cause are always applied.”

original: de la s'adhya sya bya bhi ts'a ro na he to na tsa s'a dhya bya bhi ts'a ranna he tu pra yatn'ar++ya ka tv'a de tatki la pa dang mi ti k'a ra n'anta ra m'a ha /
analyzed: de la s'adhya sya bya bhi ts'a ro na he to na tsa s'a dhya bya bhi ts'a ranna he tu pra yatn'ar++ya ka tv'a de tatki la pa dang mi ti k'a ra n'anta ra m'a ha /
translated: In that regard, the word “only” is used because they are not associated with investigation and analysis.

original: rtog pa dang dpyod pa dang bcas pa'i sa ni de yod pa'i phyir zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rtog pa dang dpyod pa dang bcas pa'i sa ni de yod pa'i phyir zhes bya'o //
translated: The stage that possesses investigation and analysis is so called because those two exist there.

original: tha ma gsum zhes bya ba la gnyi ga nges par gzung ba la yang skyon med do //
analyzed: tha ma gsum zhes bya ba la gnyi ga nges par gzung ba la yang skyon med do //
translated: The last three are so called because they are definitely ascertained as both.

original: mthar 'don pas ni tha ma'o //
analyzed: mthar 'don pas ni tha ma'o //
translated: The last is so called because it is the final stage.

original: ldan pa ma yin pa la rtog pa dang dpyod pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa med pas rtog pa dang bcas pa mi srid pas de'i phyir mtshungs par ldan pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //🔽chos kyi khams mtshungs par ldan pa smos pas rtog pa dang dpyod pa gnyis la thal bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: ldan pa ma yin pa la rtog pa dang dpyod pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa med pas rtog pa dang bcas pa mi srid pas de'i phyir mtshungs par ldan pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so // chos kyi khams mtshungs par ldan pa smos pas rtog pa dang dpyod pa gnyis la thal bar 'gyur la /
translated: Since investigation and analysis do not exist in the dissociated formative factors, it is impossible for them to possess investigation. Therefore Asanga's Compendium of Ascertainments says:🔽Since the investigation and analysis mentioned in the statement, “The element of mental objects possesses investigation and analysis,” are concomitant states, it follows that they exist in the element of mental objects.

original: de dag la rtog pa dang dpyod pa gnyis pa med pas rtog pa dang dpyod pa dang bcas pa mi srid do //
analyzed: de dag la rtog pa dang dpyod pa gnyis pa med pas rtog pa dang dpyod pa dang bcas pa mi srid do //
translated: But since investigation and analysis do not exist in those two, it is impossible for them to possess investigation and analysis.

original: de'i phyir rtog pa dang dpyod pa dag las gzhan pa zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir rtog pa dang dpyod pa dag las gzhan pa zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: Therefore Asanga's Compendium of Ascertainments says, “They are other than investigation and analysis.”

original: bsam gtan dang po'i gong na rtog pa med pa'i phyir dang / bsam gtan khyad par can gyi gong na dpyod pa med pa'i phyir dang / khams tha ma gsum yin pa'i phyir 'dod pa'i khams dang bsam gtan dang po na zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: bsam gtan dang po'i gong na rtog pa med pa'i phyir dang / bsam gtan khyad par can gyi gong na dpyod pa med pa'i phyir dang / khams tha ma gsum yin pa'i phyir 'dod pa'i khams dang bsam gtan dang po na zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: Because there is no investigation above the first absorption and there is no analysis above the special absorption, and because they are the last three realms, it is said, “in the desire realm and the first absorption.”

original: 'dod pa'i khams dang bsam gtan dang po dag na ni gang zhig rtog pa dang dpyod pa dang mtshungs par mi ldan par 'gyur ba /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams dang bsam gtan dang po dag na ni gang zhig rtog pa dang dpyod pa dang mtshungs par mi ldan par 'gyur ba /
translated: In the desire realm and the first absorption, there is no mental factor that is not concomitant with investigation and analysis.

original: rtog pa dang dpyod pa spangs pa'i sems las byung ba'i rnam pa 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rtog pa dang dpyod pa spangs pa'i sems las byung ba'i rnam pa 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin no //
translated: There is no type of mental factor that abandons investigation and analysis.

original: bsam gtan khyad par can rnam par rtog pa med la dpyod pa tsam gyis rnam par dpyod pa nyid de /
analyzed: bsam gtan khyad par can rnam par rtog pa med la dpyod pa tsam gyis rnam par dpyod pa nyid de /
translated: In the special absorption, there is no investigation but there is analysis alone.

original: mtshungs par ldan pa'i rtog pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: mtshungs par ldan pa'i rtog pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of the term concomitant investigation is that.

original: rtog pa med cing dpyod pa med pa zhes bya ba ni bsam gtan khyad par can gyi gong na rtog pa dang dpyod pa med pa'i phyir chos kyi khams mtshungs par ldan pa ma yin pa thams cad kyang gnyi ga ma yin pa ste /🔽thams cad smos pa ni 'dus byas dang 'dus ma @94a * //
analyzed: rtog pa med cing dpyod pa med pa zhes bya ba ni bsam gtan khyad par can gyi gong na rtog pa dang dpyod pa med pa'i phyir chos kyi khams mtshungs par ldan pa ma yin pa thams cad kyang gnyi ga ma yin pa ste / thams cad smos pa ni 'dus byas dang 'dus ma @94a * //
translated: That which is called neither investigation nor analysis is all the unassociated formative forces of the element of mental objects, because there is no investigation or analysis above the special meditative absorption.

original: byas bsdu bar bya ba'i phyir dang / sa thams cad bsdu bar bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: byas bsdu bar bya ba'i phyir dang / sa thams cad bsdu bar bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The term all is mentioned in order to include the conditioned and the unconditioned, and in order to include all the levels.

original: bsam gtan khyad par can gyi dpyod pa ni rtog pa med pa'i phyir dang / dpyod pa gnyis pa med pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: bsam gtan khyad par can gyi dpyod pa ni rtog pa med pa'i phyir dang / dpyod pa gnyis pa med pa'i phyir te /
translated: The analysis of the special meditative absorption is neither investigation nor analysis because there is no investigation and because there is no second analysis.

original: rtog pa yang med la dpyod pa yang med pa yin no zhes bya bar bsnyegs so //
analyzed: rtog pa yang med la dpyod pa yang med pa yin no zhes bya bar bsnyegs so //
translated: It is neither investigation nor analysis.🔽Analysis is always only analysis and conceptualization, but not conceptualization.

original: dpyod pa ni rtag tu dpyod pa med cing rnam par rtog pa tsam ste rnam par rtog pa yang zhes bya ba rnam pa gsum mo //
analyzed: dpyod pa ni rtag tu dpyod pa med cing rnam par rtog pa tsam ste rnam par rtog pa yang zhes bya ba rnam pa gsum mo //
translated: There are three types of conceptualization.

original: rtog pa ni rtag tu rnam par rtog pa med cing rtag tu dpyod pa tsam ste dpyod pa ma yin zhes so //
analyzed: rtog pa ni rtag tu rnam par rtog pa med cing rtag tu dpyod pa tsam ste dpyod pa ma yin zhes so //
translated: Conceptualization is always non-discursive and always merely discursive, not discursive investigation.

original: 'dod pa'i khams dang bsam gtan dang po'i zhes rgya cher 'byung ba la /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams dang bsam gtan dang po'i zhes rgya cher 'byung ba la /
translated: In the desire realm and the first absorption, there is conceptualization that is both discursive and investigative, and conceptualization that is only discursive.

original: rtog pa dang bcas pa dang dpyod pa dang bcas pa 'di dag gi nang du mi 'du na zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rtog pa dang bcas pa dang dpyod pa dang bcas pa 'di dag gi nang du mi 'du na zhes bya'o //
translated: If these are not included in those two, then what are they?

original: slob dpon 'dus bzang na re /
analyzed: slob dpon 'dus bzang na re /
translated: Master Saṃghabhadra says:

original: dpyod pa med pa'i phyir cig shos kyi rnam pa dag gi nang du 'du bar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: dpyod pa med pa'i phyir cig shos kyi rnam pa dag gi nang du 'du bar mi 'gyur te /
translated: They are not included in the other types because they lack investigation.

original: rnam par rtog pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i phyir ro zhes zer ro //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i phyir ro zhes zer ro //
translated: Because they are concomitant with conceptualization.

original: gal te rnam par rtog pa gnyis pa med pa'i phyir brjod par mi bya bar gyur na ci zhig mtshungs par ldan par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: gal te rnam par rtog pa gnyis pa med pa'i phyir brjod par mi bya bar gyur na ci zhig mtshungs par ldan par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: If they are inexpressible because there is no second conceptualization, then what is concomitant?

original: de la tshor ba gnyis pa yod de de dang mtshungs par ldan pa ma yin pa zhes bya ba nus pa med pa'i rgyu'i rang bzhin dang mtshungs par ldan par thal ba'am /
analyzed: de la tshor ba gnyis pa yod de de dang mtshungs par ldan pa ma yin pa zhes bya ba nus pa med pa'i rgyu'i rang bzhin dang mtshungs par ldan par thal ba'am /
translated: It is the nature of a cause that is not a condition, and it is not concomitant with that.

original: khyad par med kyang mtshungs par ldan pa khas blangs pas de'i phyir rang bzhin dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i phyir zhes brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: khyad par med kyang mtshungs par ldan pa khas blangs pas de'i phyir rang bzhin dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i phyir zhes brjod par bya'o //
translated: Or else, although there is no difference, since you accept that it is concomitant, therefore it is said that it is concomitant with the nature of that.

original: rnam par rtog pa gnyis pa med pa'i phyir ni ma yin zhes so //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa gnyis pa med pa'i phyir ni ma yin zhes so //
translated: It is not because there is no second conception.

original: gzhan la gzhan dang mtshungs par ldan pa zhes rab tu grub pa ni de'i tshogs la rnam par dpyod pa bzhin ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan la gzhan dang mtshungs par ldan pa zhes rab tu grub pa ni de'i tshogs la rnam par dpyod pa bzhin ma yin no //
translated: It is well established that one thing is concomitant with another, but not like the analysis of the collection of that.

original: rnam par rtog pa gnyis pa yod ces pa de'i phyir rnam par rtog pa gnyis pa med ces gsungs te /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa gnyis pa yod ces pa de'i phyir rnam par rtog pa gnyis pa med ces gsungs te /
translated: There is a second conception, and therefore it is said that there is no second conception.

original: gang bshad pa'i tshor ba gnyis pa yod do //
analyzed: gang bshad pa'i tshor ba gnyis pa yod do //
translated: There is a second feeling, as has been explained.

original: de dang mtshungs par ldan pa ma yin pa yod ces bya ba 'di la yang rim pa bzhin du rgol par byed de /
analyzed: de dang mtshungs par ldan pa ma yin pa yod ces bya ba 'di la yang rim pa bzhin du rgol par byed de /
translated: And so too, it is not concomitant with that.

original: gal te yang de'i tshogs la tshor ba gnyis pa yod pa ma yin par gyur na /
analyzed: gal te yang de'i tshogs la tshor ba gnyis pa yod pa ma yin par gyur na /
translated: If there is no second feeling in its collection,

original: ci zhig gis de nyid de dang mtshungs par ldan par dpyod par byed de 'du shes la sogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: ci zhig gis de nyid de dang mtshungs par ldan par dpyod par byed de 'du shes la sogs pa bzhin no //
translated: what analyzes it as concomitant with that? It is like discernment and so on.

original: de nyid kyi phyir zhes pa la gang gi phyir de na dpyod pa rnam pa gsum po dag tu mi 'du bar gyur pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir zhes pa la gang gi phyir de na dpyod pa rnam pa gsum po dag tu mi 'du bar gyur pa'o //
translated: Therefore means because it is not included in the three types of analysis.

original: rtog pa dang bcas dpyod pa bcas pa dag na zhes bya ba @94b la ;
analyzed: rtog pa dang bcas dpyod pa bcas pa dag na zhes bya ba @94b la ;
translated: In the realms of investigation and analysis means

original: 'dod pa'i khams dang bsam gtan dang po na'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams dang bsam gtan dang po na'o //
translated: in the desire realm and the first absorption.

original: rnam pa dang po ni rtog pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam pa dang po ni rtog pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The first type is concomitant with investigation.

original: rnam pa gnyis pa ni dpyod pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i phyir dang / rtog pa gnyis pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam pa gnyis pa ni dpyod pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i phyir dang / rtog pa gnyis pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The second type is concomitant with analysis and because there is no second investigation.

original: gsum pa ni ldan pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gsum pa ni ldan pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The third type is not concomitant.

original: bzhi pa ni /
analyzed: bzhi pa ni /
translated: The fourth is

original: rtog pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i phyir dang / dpyod pa gnyis pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtog pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i phyir dang / dpyod pa gnyis pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is associated with discursive thought and because there is no second investigation.

original: lhag ma rnams ni gnyis ka spangs //
analyzed: lhag ma rnams ni gnyis ka spangs //
translated: The others are devoid of both.

original: zhes bya ba la de dag dang mtshungs par mi ldan pa'i phyir rtog pa dang dpyod pa spangs pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la de dag dang mtshungs par mi ldan pa'i phyir rtog pa dang dpyod pa spangs pa'o //
translated: They are devoid of discursive thought and investigation because they are not associated with them.

original: gal te rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga zhes rgya cher 'byung ba la /
analyzed: gal te rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga zhes rgya cher 'byung ba la /
translated: The five collections of consciousness, etc.

original: rtog pa ni rnam par rtog pa yin na de dang mtshungs par ldan pa rnams ji ltar rnam par rtog pa med pa dag ces bya /
analyzed: rtog pa ni rnam par rtog pa yin na de dang mtshungs par ldan pa rnams ji ltar rnam par rtog pa med pa dag ces bya /
translated: If discursive thought is discursiveness, how can those associated with it be said to be without discursiveness?

original: yang rnam par rtog pa med pa dag ces gang du bshad ce na /
analyzed: yang rnam par rtog pa med pa dag ces gang du bshad ce na /
translated: And where is it explained that they are without discursiveness?

original: yid kyi rnam par shes pa kho na de dang de las rnam par rtog pa can nyid du bstan pas don gyis na rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga ni rtog pa med par bshad do //
analyzed: yid kyi rnam par shes pa kho na de dang de las rnam par rtog pa can nyid du bstan pas don gyis na rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga ni rtog pa med par bshad do //
translated: It is explained that the five collections of consciousness are without discursiveness because they are taught to be discursive only in the sense that they are associated with the discursiveness of mental consciousness.

original: nges par rtog dang rjes dran pa'i //
analyzed: nges par rtog dang rjes dran pa'i //
translated: Discursive thought and memory

original: rnam par rtog pas rnam mi rtog / ces bya ba la /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pas rnam mi rtog / ces bya ba la /
translated: It is nonconceptual, because it is free of conceptualization.

original: ngo bo nyid kyi rnam par rtog pas ni ma yin no //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid kyi rnam par rtog pas ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not nonconceptual because of the essential nature of nonconceptualization.🔽It is nonconceptual, because it is free of conceptualization.🔽It is nonconceptual, because it is free of conceptualization.🔽It is nonconceptual, because it is free of conceptualization.🔽It is nonconceptual, because it is free of conceptualization.

original: rnam par rtog pa rnam pa brgyad thugs par bzhag nas gzhan du grag go'i sgra rab tu sbyar te /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa rnam pa brgyad thugs par bzhag nas gzhan du grag go'i sgra rab tu sbyar te /
translated: It is nonconceptual, because it is free of conceptualization.

original: rnam par rtog pa ni rnam pa gsum mo zhes grag go zhes so //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa ni rnam pa gsum mo zhes grag go zhes so //
translated: It is nonconceptual, because it is free of conceptualization.🔽It is nonconceptual, because it is free of conceptualization.🔽It is nonconceptual, because it is free of conceptualization.🔽It is nonconceptual, because it is free of conceptualization.🔽It is nonconceptual, because it is free of conceptualization.

original: dper na rta rkang pa gcig pa la rkang pa'i bya ba mi nus pa'i phyir rkang med ces bya ba de bzhin du dmigs pa nges par rtog pa dang mngon par brjod pa med pa'i phyir rnam par rtog pa gcig pa dag la yang rnam par rtog pa
analyzed: dper na rta rkang pa gcig pa la rkang pa'i bya ba mi nus pa'i phyir rkang med ces bya ba de bzhin du dmigs pa nges par rtog pa dang mngon par brjod pa med pa'i phyir rnam par rtog pa gcig pa dag la yang rnam par rtog pa
translated: It is nonconceptual, because it is free of conceptualization.🔽It is nonconceptual, because it is free of conceptualization.🔽It is nonconceptual, because it is free of conceptualization.🔽It is nonconceptual, because it is free of conceptualization.🔽It is nonconceptual, because it is free of conceptualization.🔽It is nonconceptual, because it is free of conceptualization.🔽It is nonconceptual, because it is free of conceptualization.🔽It is nonconceptual, because it is free of conceptualization.🔽It is nonconceptual, because it is free of conceptualization.🔽It is nonconceptual, because it is free of conceptualization.🔽It is nonconceptual, because it is free of conceptualization.🔽It is nonconceptual, because it is free of conceptualization.🔽It is nonconceptual, because it is free of conceptualization.🔽It is nonconceptual, because it is free of conceptualization.🔽It is nonconceptual, because it is free of conceptualization.🔽It is nonconceptual, because it is free of conceptualization.🔽It is nonconceptual, because it is free of conceptualization.🔽It is nonconceptual, because it is free of conceptualization.🔽It is nonconceptual, because it is free of conceptualization.🔽It is nonconceptual, because it is free of conceptualization.🔽It is nonconceptual, because it is free of conceptualization.🔽It is nonconceptual, because it is free of conceptualization.🔽It is nonconceptual, because it is free of conceptualization.🔽It is nonconceptual, because it is free of conceptualization.

original: med pa zhes bya'o //🔽gal te yid kyi rnam par shes pa yang rnam par rtog pa gcig pa yod pa ma yin nam zhe na /🔽yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i rigs la bsams nas de skad bshad do //
analyzed: med pa zhes bya'o //🔽gal te yid kyi rnam par shes pa yang rnam par rtog pa gcig pa yod pa ma yin nam zhe na /🔽yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i rigs la bsams nas de skad bshad do //
translated: It is nonconceptual, because

original: sems rtsing bas rtog pa'i phyir ngo bo nyid kyi rnam par rtog par rnam par rtog ste rtog par byed pa'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir ro zhes slob dpon 'dus bzang zer ro //
analyzed: sems rtsing bas rtog pa'i phyir ngo bo nyid kyi rnam par rtog par rnam par rtog ste rtog par byed pa'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir ro zhes slob dpon 'dus bzang zer ro //
translated: The master Samghabhadra says that it is conceptual because it is coarse, i.e., it is conceptual by nature because it is the nature of conceptualization.

original: de dang 'dra bar 'jug pa'i shes rab dang dran pa dag la yang rnam par rtog par bshad de /
analyzed: de dang 'dra bar 'jug pa'i shes rab dang dran pa dag la yang rnam par rtog par bshad de /
translated: Wisdom and mindfulness that engage their objects in a similar way are also said to be conceptual.

original: 'di ltar rnam pa med par dmigs pa thams cad la gsal ba'i phyir 'jug bar byed pa gsal ba'i khyad par la 'jug la 'du shes kyi ma @95a * //
analyzed: 'di ltar rnam pa med par dmigs pa thams cad la gsal ba'i phyir 'jug bar byed pa gsal ba'i khyad par la 'jug la 'du shes kyi ma @95a * //
translated: Thus, they engage their objects through the clarity of the aspect, because all objects are clearly apprehended without aspects.

original: yin no // mi gsal ba nges par ma gzung ba'i phyir mos pa ma yin pa'i gzhi dang dmigs pa dang rnam pa dang dus mnyam pa nyid kyis 'jug pa'i sems las byung ba rnams la 'jug pa'i dus kyi dbye ba las rnam par rtog pa'i rang bzhin kho na rnam
analyzed: yin no // mi gsal ba nges par ma gzung ba'i phyir mos pa ma yin pa'i gzhi dang dmigs pa dang rnam pa dang dus mnyam pa nyid kyis 'jug pa'i sems las byung ba rnams la 'jug pa'i dus kyi dbye ba las rnam par rtog pa'i rang bzhin kho na rnam
translated: They do not engage their objects through the mode of apprehension of discernment, because they do not apprehend unclear objects. They do not engage their objects through the mode of apprehension of resolve, because they engage their objects simultaneously with the basis, focal object, aspect and time of the mind.

original: par rtog par mos pa dka'o //
analyzed: par rtog par mos pa dka'o //
translated: It is difficult to resolve that conceptualization is conceptual only through the classification of the time of engagement.

original: 'dir sems las byung ba'i rang bzhin ston pa skabs su ma bab po zhe na /
analyzed: 'dir sems las byung ba'i rang bzhin ston pa skabs su ma bab po zhe na /
translated: But it is not the right occasion to teach the nature of mental factors here.

original: de'i phyir de ni 'og nas sems las byung ba dag gi zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir de ni 'og nas sems las byung ba dag gi zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: Therefore, later on, it says, “the mental factors” and so on.

original: nges par rtog pa dang rjes su dran pa'i rnam par rtog pa dag ni gnas skabs kyi bzhag pa de nyid kyi mtshan nyid ni 'dir nges par brjod par bya dgos te gzhan du skabs med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nges par rtog pa dang rjes su dran pa'i rnam par rtog pa dag ni gnas skabs kyi bzhag pa de nyid kyi mtshan nyid ni 'dir nges par brjod par bya dgos te gzhan du skabs med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The defining characteristics of the two types of conceptualization—determinative and retrospective—must be stated here, because it is not the right occasion to do so later on.

original: de'i phyir gzhan dag gis rang bzhin ci zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de'i phyir gzhan dag gis rang bzhin ci zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Therefore, others ask, “What is their nature?” and so on.

original: shes rab ni mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa dang lhan cig skye ba dang yid las byung ba yang yod la /
analyzed: shes rab ni mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa dang lhan cig skye ba dang yid las byung ba yang yod la /
translated: Wisdom is sometimes found to arise together with the eye consciousness and so on, and sometimes it arises from the mental faculty.

original: yid las byung ba la rnam par gzhag pa dang mnyam par ma bzhag pa yang yod pas de'i phyir /
analyzed: yid las byung ba la rnam par gzhag pa dang mnyam par ma bzhag pa yang yod pas de'i phyir /
translated: Since it is sometimes found to be in equipoise and sometimes not,

original: yid kyi zhes bya ba dang g-yeng ba zhes khyad par gnyis nye bar gzung ngo //
analyzed: yid kyi zhes bya ba dang g-yeng ba zhes khyad par gnyis nye bar gzung ngo //
translated: it is specified as “of the mental faculty” and “distracted.”

original: snyoms par 'jug pa'i shes rab ni nges par rtog pa mi skye ba'o //
analyzed: snyoms par 'jug pa'i shes rab ni nges par rtog pa mi skye ba'o //
translated: The wisdom of meditative equipoise is not conceptual.

original: g-yeng ba ni nges par rtog pa'i rnam par rtog pa la brjod de /
analyzed: g-yeng ba ni nges par rtog pa'i rnam par rtog pa la brjod de /
translated: Distraction is said to be conceptual thought.

original: mnyam par gzhag pa ma yin pa shes pa ni nges ming la bltos te yul la 'jug pa skye bar byed do //
analyzed: mnyam par gzhag pa ma yin pa shes pa ni nges ming la bltos te yul la 'jug pa skye bar byed do //
translated: Non-equipoise is the arising of cognition that engages objects in dependence on names.

original: mnyam par gzhag pa ni ming la mi ltos pa kho nar don la 'jug ste /
analyzed: mnyam par gzhag pa ni ming la mi ltos pa kho nar don la 'jug ste /
translated: Meditative equipoise engages objects without depending on names.

original: de'i phyir mnyam par gzhag pa ma yin pa'i shes rab ni g-yeng ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir mnyam par gzhag pa ma yin pa'i shes rab ni g-yeng ba zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, non-equipoise is called distraction.

original: de nyid kyi phyir mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i shes rab ni nges par rtog pa'i rnam par rtog pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i shes rab ni nges par rtog pa'i rnam par rtog pa ma yin no //
translated: For this very reason, the wisdom associated with eye consciousness and so on is not conceptual thought.

original: yid kyi dran pa thams cad nyid //
analyzed: yid kyi dran pa thams cad nyid //
translated: All mental mindfulness

original: ces bya ba la thams cad smos pa ni mnyam par gzhag pa nye bar gzung ba'i don to //
analyzed: ces bya ba la thams cad smos pa ni mnyam par gzhag pa nye bar gzung ba'i don to //
translated: The term “all” refers to meditative equipoise.

original: yid smos pa ni mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i dran pa gsal bar bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yid smos pa ni mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i dran pa gsal bar bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The word “mind” is mentioned in order to clarify that mindfulness is associated with eye consciousness, etc.

original: dmigs pa mngon bar brjod pa yin pa'i phyir dang snyoms par 'jug pa'i ming la bltos pa'i phyir mnyam par gzhag pa dang mnyam par ma bzhag pa thams cad yid las byung ba'i @95b dran pa ste dran par byed pa'i rnam par rtog pa'o //
analyzed: dmigs pa mngon bar brjod pa yin pa'i phyir dang snyoms par 'jug pa'i ming la bltos pa'i phyir mnyam par gzhag pa dang mnyam par ma bzhag pa thams cad yid las byung ba'i @95b dran pa ste dran par byed pa'i rnam par rtog pa'o //
translated: It is conceptual thought that is mindfulness, which is mental, because it is the expression of the object and because it is named after meditative concentration.

original: mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa ni mi g-yeng ba'i phyir dang khyad par du rnam par rtog pa'i mtshan nyid med pa'i phyir rnam par rtog pa zhes mi bya ba de la 'dod pa'i khams dang bsam gtan dang po na
analyzed: mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa ni mi g-yeng ba'i phyir dang khyad par du rnam par rtog pa'i mtshan nyid med pa'i phyir rnam par rtog pa zhes mi bya ba de la 'dod pa'i khams dang bsam gtan dang po na
translated: It is not called conceptual thought because it is associated with eye consciousness, etc., because it is not distracted, and because it does not have the characteristic of special conceptualization.🔽In the desire realm and the first meditative stage, it is called mindfulness. In the other stages, it is called introspection.

original: mnyam par ma bzhag pa'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa gang yin pa de ni rnam par rtog pa gsum gyis rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa yin no //
analyzed: mnyam par ma bzhag pa'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa gang yin pa de ni rnam par rtog pa gsum gyis rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa yin no //
translated: The mental consciousness that is not in equipoise is associated with the three types of discursive thought.

original: bsam gtan dang po ni mnyam par gzhag pa'o //
analyzed: bsam gtan dang po ni mnyam par gzhag pa'o //
translated: The first concentration is in equipoise.

original: gnyis pa la sogs pa rnams su yang mnyam par ma bzhag pa'o //
analyzed: gnyis pa la sogs pa rnams su yang mnyam par ma bzhag pa'o //
translated: The second and so on are not in equipoise.

original: gnyis dag gis mnyam par gzhag pa nyid kyis so //
analyzed: gnyis dag gis mnyam par gzhag pa nyid kyis so //
translated: They are in equipoise by means of the two.

original: dmigs pa zhes sems kyi khams bdun no zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: dmigs pa zhes sems kyi khams bdun no zhes bya ba la /
translated: The seven mental constituents are the objective domain.

original: bdun ni dmigs pa dang bcas pa nyid do zhes nges par gzung bar bya'o //
analyzed: bdun ni dmigs pa dang bcas pa nyid do zhes nges par gzung bar bya'o //
translated: It should be ascertained that the seven are only with an objective domain.

original: 'di gang las she na chos kyi phyed kyang zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di gang las she na chos kyi phyed kyang zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Why is that? Because it says, “and half of the phenomena.”

original: 'di la dmigs pa yod pas na dmigs pa dang bcas pa'o //🔽yul dang spyod yul dang dmigs pa zhes bya ba ni rnam grangs so //
analyzed: 'di la dmigs pa yod pas na dmigs pa dang bcas pa'o // yul dang spyod yul dang dmigs pa zhes bya ba ni rnam grangs so //
translated: Because there is an objective domain in this, it is with an objective domain.🔽Objective domain, domain, and sphere are synonyms.

original: chos kyi phyed kyang zhes bya ba la dang gi sgra ni bsdu ba'i don to //
analyzed: chos kyi phyed kyang zhes bya ba la dang gi sgra ni bsdu ba'i don to //
translated: And half of the phenomena. The word and has the meaning of collecting.

original: gzhan dag na re ngas par gzung ba'i don te zhes zer ro //
analyzed: gzhan dag na re ngas par gzung ba'i don te zhes zer ro //
translated: Others say: The object of the eye sense faculty is the object of the eye consciousness.

original: de ltar na sems dang sems las byung ba rnams las gzhan pa rnams ni dmigs pa med pa'o zhes bya bar grub bo //
analyzed: de ltar na sems dang sems las byung ba rnams las gzhan pa rnams ni dmigs pa med pa'o zhes bya bar grub bo //
translated: Thus it is established that those other than minds and mental factors do not have objects.

original: 'dod pa gzhan ston pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni kha cig rdul phra rab re re ba yul gyi dngos por 'thad kyi mtha' dag yul gyi dngos por mi 'thad do zhes zer ro //
analyzed: 'dod pa gzhan ston pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni kha cig rdul phra rab re re ba yul gyi dngos por 'thad kyi mtha' dag yul gyi dngos por mi 'thad do zhes zer ro //
translated: Because they teach other assertions, some say: It is tenable that individual subtle particles are objects, but it is not tenable that a collection of them is an object.

original: slob dpon dpal len na re yul rnams rdzas med pa ste /🔽rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga po bsags pa'i yul can yin pa'i phyir zhes zer ro //
analyzed: slob dpon dpal len na re yul rnams rdzas med pa ste / rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga po bsags pa'i yul can yin pa'i phyir zhes zer ro //
translated: Master Śrīlāta says: Objects are not substantial.🔽Because the five collections of consciousness are the subjects of a collection of objects.

original: bye brag tu smra ba rnams na re rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga po'i yul rdzas su yod pa kho na ste /
analyzed: bye brag tu smra ba rnams na re rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga po'i yul rdzas su yod pa kho na ste /
translated: Vaibhasikas say: The objects of the five collections of consciousness are substantially existent.

original: rdul phra rab tshogs pa yul yin pa'i phyir rdul phra rab de rnams nyid de ltar 'dus pa las mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa'i skye ba la rgyur 'gyur ro //🔽'dus pa ma yin pa med par gyur pa'am de dag 'dus pa'i rdzas yul yin pa'i phyir re re dmigs par 'gyur ba ma yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: rdul phra rab tshogs pa yul yin pa'i phyir rdul phra rab de rnams nyid de ltar 'dus pa las mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa'i skye ba la rgyur 'gyur ro // 'dus pa ma yin pa med par gyur pa'am de dag 'dus pa'i rdzas yul yin pa'i phyir re re dmigs par 'gyur ba ma yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: Because the collection of subtle particles is the object, the subtle particles themselves, when they are assembled in that way, become the cause of the arising of visual consciousness, etc.🔽Since the non-assembled does not exist, or since the substance of their assembly is the object, each is not apprehended.

original: 'dus pa ma yin pa'i yul la rnam par mi rtog pa'i phyir dang 'dus pa zhes bya ba 'ga' zhig dngos @96a * //
analyzed: 'dus pa ma yin pa'i yul la rnam par mi rtog pa'i phyir dang 'dus pa zhes bya ba 'ga' zhig dngos @96a * //
translated: Because the object that is not assembled is not conceptualized, and because something called “assembled” does not exist as a thing, there is no conceptualization.

original: por yod pas gang la rnam par rtog pa med par mthong ba nas reg pa'i bar du skye bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: por yod pas gang la rnam par rtog pa med par mthong ba nas reg pa'i bar du skye bar 'gyur te /
translated: From seeing up to touching, it arises without conceptualization.

original: 'dus pa'i yul nyid ma yin na sngon po dang ser po'o snyam du zhen par mi 'gyur zhing mig gi rnam par shes pas kha dog sngon po ma bzung bar yid kyi rnam par shes pa la sngon po'o snyam du rnam par rtog pa'i nus pa yod pa
analyzed: 'dus pa'i yul nyid ma yin na sngon po dang ser po'o snyam du zhen par mi 'gyur zhing mig gi rnam par shes pas kha dog sngon po ma bzung bar yid kyi rnam par shes pa la sngon po'o snyam du rnam par rtog pa'i nus pa yod pa
translated: If it were not the object of the collection, the thought “blue and yellow” would not occur. And since the mental consciousness does not have the power to think “blue” without the eye consciousness having grasped the color blue,

original: ma yin pas tshogs pa med na sngon po dang ser po la sogs pa rnams rdzas ma yin par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma yin pas tshogs pa med na sngon po dang ser po la sogs pa rnams rdzas ma yin par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: if the collection does not exist, it follows that blue, yellow, etc. are not substances.

original: bcom ldan 'das mig dang gzugs la brten nas mig gi rnam par shes pa skye'o zhes bya ba nas yid dang chos la brten nas yid kyi rnam par shes pa skye'o zhes bya ba'i bar du gsungs so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das mig dang gzugs la brten nas mig gi rnam par shes pa skye'o zhes bya ba nas yid dang chos la brten nas yid kyi rnam par shes pa skye'o zhes bya ba'i bar du gsungs so //
translated: The Bhagavat has said, “The eye consciousness arises in dependence on the eye and forms,” and so on, up to “The mental consciousness arises in dependence on the mental faculty and mental objects.”

original: tshogs pa ma yin pa gzugs la sogs pa'i rang bzhin zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: tshogs pa ma yin pa gzugs la sogs pa'i rang bzhin zhes bya ba la /
translated: The collection is not the nature of form, etc.

original: de mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa'i gzung ba ma yin no //
analyzed: de mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa'i gzung ba ma yin no //
translated: It is not the object of the eye consciousness, etc.

original: gal te don dam pa'i yul can rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga ci las she na /
analyzed: gal te don dam pa'i yul can rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga ci las she na /
translated: If it is asked what is the fivefold collection of consciousness that has the ultimate as its object,

original: de rnams 'dod chags dang bral ba'i rang gi mtshan nyid kyi yul ma yin pa'i phyir dang kha phyi rol tu bltas pa'i phyir dang / mnyam par ma bzhag pa'i phyir dang rnam par mi rtog pa'i phyir dang / lan cig tshogs pa'i phyir dang nyung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de rnams 'dod chags dang bral ba'i rang gi mtshan nyid kyi yul ma yin pa'i phyir dang kha phyi rol tu bltas pa'i phyir dang / mnyam par ma bzhag pa'i phyir dang rnam par mi rtog pa'i phyir dang / lan cig tshogs pa'i phyir dang nyung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: it is because those five are not the objects of the intrinsic characteristics of freedom from attachment, because they face outward, because they are not equipoise, because they are not nonconceptual, because they are a single collection, and because they are few.

original: de'i phyir dmigs pa dang bcas pa'i chos kyi khams nyid kyang zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir dmigs pa dang bcas pa'i chos kyi khams nyid kyang zhes bya ste /
translated: Therefore, it is said that the ultimate is also the phenomena element that has an object.

original: rig pa de dag las lnga ni don dam pa la dmigs pa dang lhag ma yul zhes bya ba ni kun rdzob la dmigs pa yang ma yin no zhes bya ste zhar las byung bas chog go //
analyzed: rig pa de dag las lnga ni don dam pa la dmigs pa dang lhag ma yul zhes bya ba ni kun rdzob la dmigs pa yang ma yin no zhes bya ste zhar las byung bas chog go //
translated: From among those five, the five that are consciousnesses have the ultimate as their object. The remaining ones are said to be objects that do not have the conventional as their object. This is sufficient for the digression.

original: dkyus ma nyid brtsam par bya ste /
analyzed: dkyus ma nyid brtsam par bya ste /
translated: Now the main point will be addressed.

original: ma zin dgu zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: ma zin dgu zhes bya ba la /
translated: The nine that are not conjoined

original: 'dir ngang gi sgra dang po ni bsdu ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'dir ngang gi sgra dang po ni bsdu ba'i don to //
translated: Here the first instance of the word “also” has the meaning of inclusion.

original: gnyis pa ni sgra'i rnam grangs gsal bar byed pa'i don to //
analyzed: gnyis pa ni sgra'i rnam grangs gsal bar byed pa'i don to //
translated: The second is the meaning that clarifies the synonyms of sound.

original: kha cig na re sgra yang dbang po dang tha mi dad pa yod do zhes zer ro //
analyzed: kha cig na re sgra yang dbang po dang tha mi dad pa yod do zhes zer ro //
translated: Some say: Sound also exists without being different from the sense faculty.

original: dgu po gzhan ni rnam pa gnyis //🔽zhes gsungs pa'i phyir /
analyzed: dgu po gzhan ni rnam pa gnyis // zhes gsungs pa'i phyir /
translated: The other nine are of two types.

original: dgu ni ma zin pa kho na'o zhes shes par bya'o //
analyzed: dgu ni ma zin pa kho na'o zhes shes par bya'o //
translated: Therefore it should be understood that the other nine are not held.

original: chos kyi khams kyi phyed kyi dmigs pa dang bcas par bshad kyi thams cad ni ma yin pa ma zin pa ni thams cad 'dod pa nyid de /
analyzed: chos kyi khams kyi phyed kyi dmigs pa dang bcas par bshad kyi thams cad ni ma yin pa ma zin pa ni thams cad 'dod pa nyid de /
translated: It is explained that half of the phenomena element has objects, but not all of it. It is asserted that the unapprehendable is all of it.

original: de'i phyir brgyad pa'i phyed dang bcas te zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de'i phyir brgyad pa'i phyed dang bcas te zhes gsungs so //
translated: Therefore it is said that it is half of the eighth.

original: dgu po gzhan ni rnam pa gnyis //
analyzed: dgu po gzhan ni rnam pa gnyis //
translated: The other nine are of two types.

original: zhes gsungs pa'i phyir dgu ni ma yin pa kho na'o zhes shes par bya'o //
analyzed: zhes gsungs pa'i phyir dgu ni ma yin pa kho na'o zhes shes par bya'o //
translated: Therefore it should be understood that the other nine are not of two types.

original: chos @96b kyi khams kyi phyed dmigs pa dang bcas par bshad kyi thams cad ni ma yin la /
analyzed: chos @96b kyi khams kyi phyed dmigs pa dang bcas par bshad kyi thams cad ni ma yin la /
translated: It is explained that half of the phenomena element has objects, but not all of it.

original: mi zin par ni thams cad 'dod pa nyid de /
analyzed: mi zin par ni thams cad 'dod pa nyid de /
translated: It is asserted that the unapprehendable is all of it.

original: de'i phyir brgyad pa'i phyed dang bcas te zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de'i phyir brgyad pa'i phyed dang bcas te zhes gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, the root text says, “the last half of the eighth.”

original: dgu po gzhan ni rnam pa gnyis //
analyzed: dgu po gzhan ni rnam pa gnyis //
translated: The other nine are of two types.

original: zhes bya ba la brtsams par ma gyur na ni zin pa kho na'o zhes bya bar shes par 'gyur ba zhig go //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la brtsams par ma gyur na ni zin pa kho na'o zhes bya bar shes par 'gyur ba zhig go //
translated: If they were not already engaged, one would understand that they are only engaged.

original: da ltar byung ba rnams ni zin pa yin te de dag la phan btags pa dang gnod pa byas na sems dang sems las byung ba rnams la phan btags pa dang gnod pa byas par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: da ltar byung ba rnams ni zin pa yin te de dag la phan btags pa dang gnod pa byas na sems dang sems las byung ba rnams la phan btags pa dang gnod pa byas par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Those that are present are engaged, because when one benefits or harms them, one benefits or harms the mind and mental factors.

original: 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa rnams ni ma zin pa yin te /
analyzed: 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa rnams ni ma zin pa yin te /
translated: Those that are past and future are not engaged,

original: de dag la phan btags pa dang gnod pa mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag la phan btags pa dang gnod pa mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is impossible to benefit or harm them.

original: gzugs la sogs pa dbang po dang tha mi dad pa rnams dang dbang po ni grub pa dang bde ba lhan cig pa'i phyir dbang po bzhin tha mi dad do //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa dbang po dang tha mi dad pa rnams dang dbang po ni grub pa dang bde ba lhan cig pa'i phyir dbang po bzhin tha mi dad do //
translated: Form, etc., that is not distinct from the sense faculties is not distinct from the sense faculties, because it is established and exists simultaneously with them.

original: gzhan dag ni da ltar ba yin yang ma zin pa rnams te /
analyzed: gzhan dag ni da ltar ba yin yang ma zin pa rnams te /
translated: Others, even though they are present, are not engaged.

original: gang dag lus 'di la dbang po dang tha dad par gnas pa rnams so //🔽'di lta ste rtsa ba ma gtogs pa'i zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gang dag lus 'di la dbang po dang tha dad par gnas pa rnams so // 'di lta ste rtsa ba ma gtogs pa'i zhes bya ba la /
translated: Those that are located in this body separately from the faculties.🔽For example, the hair of the head, body hair, nails, and teeth,

original: skra dang ba spu dang sen mo dang so dag gi rtsa ba ni lus kyi dbang po dang tha mi dad pas spangs pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: skra dang ba spu dang sen mo dang so dag gi rtsa ba ni lus kyi dbang po dang tha mi dad pas spangs pa'i phyir te /
translated: except for their roots, because their roots are not separate from the body faculty.

original: 'di ltar skra la sogs pa rtsa ba nas bton na tshor ba 'byung gi bcad na ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar skra la sogs pa rtsa ba nas bton na tshor ba 'byung gi bcad na ni ma yin no //
translated: For example, when the hair, etc., is pulled out by the roots, there is a feeling, but not when it is cut.

original: de ltar re zhig nang dag la yod pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar re zhig nang dag la yod pa'o //
translated: So it exists in the internal.

original: phyi rol dag la yod pa bshad pa ni sa dang chu la sogs pa rnams la yod pa zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: phyi rol dag la yod pa bshad pa ni sa dang chu la sogs pa rnams la yod pa zhes bya ba ste /
translated: As for the external, it exists in earth, water, etc.

original: sogs pa smos pa ni me dang rlung dang shing dang so phag la sogs pa dag sdud do //
analyzed: sogs pa smos pa ni me dang rlung dang shing dang so phag la sogs pa dag sdud do //
translated: The phrase “etc.” includes fire, wind, wood, brick, etc.

original: 'du byed rnams bdag med pa yin dang 'dzin pa po med pas mig la sogs pa rnams la zin pa nyid mi srid do snyam ste 'dri ba ni zin pa zhes bya ba'i don ci zhe na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'du byed rnams bdag med pa yin dang 'dzin pa po med pas mig la sogs pa rnams la zin pa nyid mi srid do snyam ste 'dri ba ni zin pa zhes bya ba'i don ci zhe na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: “What is the meaning of appropriated?”

original: bstan bcos las ni bdag gis lus su gtogs pa'i zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: bstan bcos las ni bdag gis lus su gtogs pa'i zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: “That which is appropriated by the self that is associated with the body.”

original: de yang ci zhig ce na sems dang sems las byung ba rnams kyi bdag gir byas pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: de yang ci zhig ce na sems dang sems las byung ba rnams kyi bdag gir byas pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: What is that? It is that which is owned by the mind and mental factors.

original: bdag gir byas pa zhes bya ba ni gang zhig sems dang sems las byung ba rnams kyis rten gyi dngos por nye bar bzung ba'o //🔽sems dang sems las byung ba gzugs can ma yin pa yul na mi gnas pa rnams kyis rten gyi dngos po nye bar bzung ba ni mos @97a * //
analyzed: bdag gir byas pa zhes bya ba ni gang zhig sems dang sems las byung ba rnams kyis rten gyi dngos por nye bar bzung ba'o // sems dang sems las byung ba gzugs can ma yin pa yul na mi gnas pa rnams kyis rten gyi dngos po nye bar bzung ba ni mos @97a * //
translated: That which is owned is that which is taken up as a basis by the mind and mental factors.

original: par dka'o zhe na /
analyzed: par dka'o zhe na /
translated: It is difficult to understand how the mind and mental factors that are not form and do not abide in a place can take up a basis.

original: de'i phyir phan pa dang gnod pa dag gis phan tshun mthun par byed pa'i phyir nye bar bzung ba yin gyi de la gnas pa'i phyir ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir phan pa dang gnod pa dag gis phan tshun mthun par byed pa'i phyir nye bar bzung ba yin gyi de la gnas pa'i phyir ni ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, they are appropriated because they mutually assist each other through benefit and harm, but not because they endure.

original: 'di ltar mig la sogs pa rnams la mig sman la sogs pas phan btags na rnam par shes pa gsal zhing ma 'khrugs pa skye la rlung la sogs pas gnod pa byas na mi gsal ba dang 'khrug pa skye ba yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar mig la sogs pa rnams la mig sman la sogs pas phan btags na rnam par shes pa gsal zhing ma 'khrugs pa skye la rlung la sogs pas gnod pa byas na mi gsal ba dang 'khrug pa skye ba yin no //
translated: Thus, when the eyes, etc. are benefited by collyrium, etc., consciousness arises clearly and without disturbance, but when they are harmed by wind, etc., it arises unclearly and with disturbance.

original: de bzhin du rnam par shes pa tshor ba bde ba dang sdug bsngal dang mtshungs par ldan pa rnams skyes na mig la sogs pa rnams 'phel ba dang 'grib par 'gyur te de ltar phan tshun mthun bar byed pa yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du rnam par shes pa tshor ba bde ba dang sdug bsngal dang mtshungs par ldan pa rnams skyes na mig la sogs pa rnams 'phel ba dang 'grib par 'gyur te de ltar phan tshun mthun bar byed pa yin no //
translated: Similarly, when consciousness arises in association with pleasant and painful feelings, the eyes, etc. increase and decrease, and thus they mutually assist each other.

original: sems dang sems las byung ba rnams mig la sogs pa rnams kyi zin pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba spang ba'i phyir /
analyzed: sems dang sems las byung ba rnams mig la sogs pa rnams kyi zin pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba spang ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to avoid the consequence that mind and mental factors would be appropriated by the eyes, etc.,

original: 'jig rten na sems pa dang bcas pa'o zhes brjod pa gang yin pa'o zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: 'jig rten na sems pa dang bcas pa'o zhes brjod pa gang yin pa'o zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: That is what is called “endowed with mind” in the world.

original: gang zhig la 'jig rten na sems pa dang bcas pa'o zhes brjod ce na /
analyzed: gang zhig la 'jig rten na sems pa dang bcas pa'o zhes brjod ce na /
translated: What is it that is called “endowed with mind” in the world?

original: rten gang la gnod pa byas pa sdug bsngal 'byung ba dang / gang zhig 'dis rtsva ku sha dang tsha rgod dang me dang tsher ma dang gnam lcags la sogs pa dag las bsrung pa dang / gang zhig 'dod pa dang khro ba dang mya ngan dang 'jigs pa dang dga' ba la sogs pa dag gi rnam par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: rten gang la gnod pa byas pa sdug bsngal 'byung ba dang / gang zhig 'dis rtsva ku sha dang tsha rgod dang me dang tsher ma dang gnam lcags la sogs pa dag las bsrung pa dang / gang zhig 'dod pa dang khro ba dang mya ngan dang 'jigs pa dang dga' ba la sogs pa dag gi rnam par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: It is the basis in which pain arises when it is harmed and in which pleasure arises when it is soothed. It is that which is protected from such things as sharp kuśa grass, hot ashes, fire, thorns, and lightning. It is that which has the transformations of desire, anger, sorrow, fear, joy, and so on.

original: sems dang sems las byung ba rnams ni 'dzin pa yin pa'i phyir zin pa'o zhes mi brjod do //
analyzed: sems dang sems las byung ba rnams ni 'dzin pa yin pa'i phyir zin pa'o zhes mi brjod do //
translated: Mind and mental factors are not called “endowed” because they are the apprehender.

original: bye brag tu smra ba rnams ni gzugs gang zhig la gzir ba'am bcad pa na sdug bsngal 'byung zhing bzlog pas bde ba 'byung ba de ni zin pa'o zhes zer ro //
analyzed: bye brag tu smra ba rnams ni gzugs gang zhig la gzir ba'am bcad pa na sdug bsngal 'byung zhing bzlog pas bde ba 'byung ba de ni zin pa'o zhes zer ro //
translated: Vaibhasikas say: Form is endowed when pain arises when it is struck or cut and pleasure arises when it is soothed.

original: gzhan dag na re lus su gtogs pa 'di la nga dang da'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal gyis yongs su zin pa ni zin pa'o zhes zer ro //
analyzed: gzhan dag na re lus su gtogs pa 'di la nga dang da'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal gyis yongs su zin pa ni zin pa'o zhes zer ro //
translated: Others say: That which is appropriated is appropriated by the pride that thinks “I am” and “mine” in regard to this body.

original: de lta ni ma yin te sems dang sems las byung ba rnams zin pa yin par 'gyur du 'ong ngo //
analyzed: de lta ni ma yin te sems dang sems las byung ba rnams zin pa yin par 'gyur du 'ong ngo //
translated: That is not so, because it would follow that mind and mental factors would be appropriated.

original: nga rgyal nyid kyis ni dus su mi 'dung pa'i phyir dang gzugs nyid kyi phyir te /
analyzed: nga rgyal nyid kyis ni dus su mi 'dung pa'i phyir dang gzugs nyid kyi phyir te /
translated: Because pride does not endure for a long time and because it is form.

original: nye bar len par byed pa dang / nye bar len pa'i byed pa po'i gzugs kyi phyir zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: nye bar len par byed pa dang / nye bar len pa'i byed pa po'i gzugs kyi phyir zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is the form of the appropriator and that appropriated.

original: gzhan dag na re lus kyi dbang po dang tha mi dad pa gang yin pa de zin pa'o zhes zer ro //
analyzed: gzhan dag na re lus kyi dbang po dang tha mi dad pa gang yin pa de zin pa'o zhes zer ro //
translated: Others say: That which is not different from the body sense faculty is appropriated.

original: lus kyi dbang po'i zin pa de lta bu la ni dpyad @97b par bya ste /
analyzed: lus kyi dbang po'i zin pa de lta bu la ni dpyad @97b par bya ste /
translated: That which is appropriated by the body sense faculty should be investigated.

original: de ltar na gzugs la sogs pa dang sems dang sems las byung ba rnams dbang po ma yin pa'i phyir dang rten ma yin pas ma zin par thal bar 'gyur ba ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: de ltar na gzugs la sogs pa dang sems dang sems las byung ba rnams dbang po ma yin pa'i phyir dang rten ma yin pas ma zin par thal bar 'gyur ba ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: Thus, it is not the case that form and so on and minds and mental factors are not conjoined because they are not faculties or their supports.

original: dbang po dang tha mi dad pa'i gzugs la sogs pa dang sems dang sems las byung ba rnams rten yin pas 'di la nyes pa med de /
analyzed: dbang po dang tha mi dad pa'i gzugs la sogs pa dang sems dang sems las byung ba rnams rten yin pas 'di la nyes pa med de /
translated: There is no error here because form and so on and minds and mental factors that are not distinct from the faculties are their supports.

original: reg bya rnam pa gnyis yin te zhes nges par gzung ste /
analyzed: reg bya rnam pa gnyis yin te zhes nges par gzung ste /
translated: The Abhidharmakośa declares, “Tangible objects are of two types.”

original: lhag ma gzugs can dgu po ni /🔽'byung 'gyur chos khams phyogs gcig kyang zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lhag ma gzugs can dgu po ni / 'byung 'gyur chos khams phyogs gcig kyang zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The remaining nine physical constituents🔽are also derived from the elements.

original: 'byung ba rnams la yod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni bskyed pa la sogs pa'i ngo bos 'byung ba rnams de'i rgyur gyur pa'i phyir 'byung ba rnams la yod pa zhes brjod do //
analyzed: 'byung ba rnams la yod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni bskyed pa la sogs pa'i ngo bos 'byung ba rnams de'i rgyur gyur pa'i phyir 'byung ba rnams la yod pa zhes brjod do //
translated: The term “exist” in the statement “They exist in the elements” means that the elements are their cause in the sense that they generate and so on.

original: lhag ma zhes smos pas gzugs can ma yin pa la yang thal bar 'gyur bas gzugs can zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: lhag ma zhes smos pas gzugs can ma yin pa la yang thal bar 'gyur bas gzugs can zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: The term “the rest” would imply that the formless constituents are also form. Thus, the term “form” is stated.

original: chos kyi khams la yang rnam par rig byed ma yin pa'i gzugs yod pas gzugs can nyid yin pa de'i dgu po zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: chos kyi khams la yang rnam par rig byed ma yin pa'i gzugs yod pas gzugs can nyid yin pa de'i dgu po zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: Since the form constituent also exists as noninformative form, the term “the nine” is stated.

original: rnam par rig byed ma yin pa'i gzugs kyang 'byung ba las gyur pa yin pas de bsdu bar bya ba'i phyir chos khams phyogs gcig kyang zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: rnam par rig byed ma yin pa'i gzugs kyang 'byung ba las gyur pa yin pas de bsdu bar bya ba'i phyir chos khams phyogs gcig kyang zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: Since noninformative form is also derived form, the term “a part of the form constituent” is stated in order to include it.

original: kyang gi sgra ni bsdu ba'i don to //
analyzed: kyang gi sgra ni bsdu ba'i don to //
translated: The term “also” has the sense of “and.”

original: gzhan dag na re kyang gi sgra ni khams 'byung ba'i bdag nyid kho na yod pa ma yin pa nyid du bstan pa'i don to zhes zer ro //
analyzed: gzhan dag na re kyang gi sgra ni khams 'byung ba'i bdag nyid kho na yod pa ma yin pa nyid du bstan pa'i don to zhes zer ro //
translated: Others say that the term “also” is stated in order to show that the form constituent is not only of the nature of the primary elements.

original: lhag ma rnams ni ma brtsams pa kho nas gnyi ga ma yin pa zhes bya bar grub po //
analyzed: lhag ma rnams ni ma brtsams pa kho nas gnyi ga ma yin pa zhes bya bar grub po //
translated: The remaining constituents are established as neither form nor consciousness by the mere fact that they are not mentioned.

original: skye mched bcu po dag ni 'byung ba tsam mo zhes zer te zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: skye mched bcu po dag ni 'byung ba tsam mo zhes zer te zhes bya ba la /
translated: The ten bases are merely the elements.

original: tsam gyi sgra ni 'byung ba las gyur ba yin pa rnam par bcad pa'i don to //
analyzed: tsam gyi sgra ni 'byung ba las gyur ba yin pa rnam par bcad pa'i don to //
translated: The word “mere” excludes that which is derived from the elements.

original: de lta yin dang dri ba dang lan mi 'thad do zhe'o //
analyzed: de lta yin dang dri ba dang lan mi 'thad do zhe'o //
translated: If that were not so, then the question and answer would be untenable.

original: skye mched bcu po dag ni 'byung ba tsam mo zhes bya ba de ni de lta ma yin no //
analyzed: skye mched bcu po dag ni 'byung ba tsam mo zhes bya ba de ni de lta ma yin no //
translated: The ten bases are mere elements.

original: tshig tsam gyis dad par mi 'gyur bas rgyu smras pa /
analyzed: tshig tsam gyis dad par mi 'gyur bas rgyu smras pa /
translated: Since one does not come to have faith in something through mere words, the reason is stated:

original: 'byung ba rnams ni bzhi nyid dang sra ba la sogs pa mtshan nyid du nges par gzung ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: 'byung ba rnams ni bzhi nyid dang sra ba la sogs pa mtshan nyid du nges par gzung ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Because the four primary elements are ascertained as four and their characteristics as solidity and so on.

original: mdo las bzhi nyid du nges par gzung ba'i phyir dang / sra ba la sogs pa mtshan nyid du nges par gzung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mdo las bzhi nyid du nges par gzung ba'i phyir dang / sra ba la sogs pa mtshan nyid du nges par gzung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the four primary elements are ascertained as four in the sūtras and their characteristics as solidity and so on are ascertained.🔽The sūtras state:🔽These are the four primary elements.

original: de la 'di dag ni 'byung ba chen po bzhi ste zhes bzhir nges par gzung ba dang / sa'i khams gang zhen sra ba nyid do zhes rgya cher 'byung ste sra ba la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid nges par gzung @98a * //
analyzed: de la 'di dag ni 'byung ba chen po bzhi ste zhes bzhir nges par gzung ba dang / sa'i khams gang zhen sra ba nyid do zhes rgya cher 'byung ste sra ba la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid nges par gzung @98a * //
translated: What is the earth element? It is solidity.

original: pa dang bzhi'i nges par bzung bas ni 'byung ba chen po bcu dag med do zhes ston to //
analyzed: pa dang bzhi'i nges par bzung bas ni 'byung ba chen po bcu dag med do zhes ston to //
translated: The specification of four indicates that there are not ten great elements.

original: gal te 'byung ba las tha dad pa'i 'byung ba las gyur pa med na /
analyzed: gal te 'byung ba las tha dad pa'i 'byung ba las gyur pa med na /
translated: If the derivative is not distinct from the elements,

original: de lta yin dang skye mched bzhi'am gcig go zhes brjod dgos kyi bcu zhes ma yin no //
analyzed: de lta yin dang skye mched bzhi'am gcig go zhes brjod dgos kyi bcu zhes ma yin no //
translated: then it should be said that there are four or one sense base, not ten.

original: sra ba la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid du nges par bzung bas ni mig la sogs pa rnams dang gzugs la sogs pa rnams 'byung ba dag gi nang du ma 'dus par ston te /
analyzed: sra ba la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid du nges par bzung bas ni mig la sogs pa rnams dang gzugs la sogs pa rnams 'byung ba dag gi nang du ma 'dus par ston te /
translated: The specification of the characteristics of solidity, etc., indicates that the eye, etc., and form, etc., are not included among the elements,

original: sra ba la sogs pa'i rang gi ngo bo dang mtshan nyid mi mthun pa'i phyir te tshor ba la sogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: sra ba la sogs pa'i rang gi ngo bo dang mtshan nyid mi mthun pa'i phyir te tshor ba la sogs pa bzhin no //
translated: because they do not have the same intrinsic nature and characteristics as solidity, etc., like feeling, etc.

original: yang ji ltar de rnams 'byung ba dag dang mtshan nyid mi mthun par khong du chud ce na /
analyzed: yang ji ltar de rnams 'byung ba dag dang mtshan nyid mi mthun par khong du chud ce na /
translated: How do you understand that they are not the same as the elements?

original: 'byung ba de dag reg bya yin pa'i phyir dang reg pa'i yul yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'byung ba de dag reg bya yin pa'i phyir dang reg pa'i yul yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the elements are tangible objects and objects of touch.

original: mig la sogs pa rnams kyi ni gzugs la sogs pa rnams yin gyi reg bya ni ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mig la sogs pa rnams kyi ni gzugs la sogs pa rnams yin gyi reg bya ni ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because form, etc. are the objects of the eye, etc., but not of tactility.

original: gzugs la sogs pa rnams pa lta bar bya ba dang bsnam par bya ba myang bar bya ba dang mig la sogs pa rnams kyang lta bar byed pa dang snom par byed pa dang myong bar byed pa yin gyi reg par mi byed pa'i phyir reg bya ni
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa rnams pa lta bar bya ba dang bsnam par bya ba myang bar bya ba dang mig la sogs pa rnams kyang lta bar byed pa dang snom par byed pa dang myong bar byed pa yin gyi reg par mi byed pa'i phyir reg bya ni
translated: Form, etc. are seen, smelled, tasted, but not touched, and the eye, etc. are the instruments of seeing, smelling, tasting, but not of touching.

original: ma yin no //
analyzed: ma yin no //
translated: Tactility is not the object of the eye, etc.

original: 'byung ba'i bdag nyid can khyad par med pa'i phyir gzugs la sogs pa thams cad dbang po thams cad kyi gzung bar bya bar 'gyur na /
analyzed: 'byung ba'i bdag nyid can khyad par med pa'i phyir gzugs la sogs pa thams cad dbang po thams cad kyi gzung bar bya bar 'gyur na /
translated: If all form, etc. were the objects of all the faculties, such as the eye, etc., because they are not distinguished as having the nature of the elements,

original: de ni yod pa yang ma yin te /🔽mig la sogs pas kyang ste mig dang rna ba dang sna dang lce rnams kyis ni sra ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: de ni yod pa yang ma yin te / mig la sogs pas kyang ste mig dang rna ba dang sna dang lce rnams kyis ni sra ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: that would not be so.🔽The eye, etc. do not grasp solidity, etc.

original: sra ba dang gsher ba dang dro ba dang yang zhing g-yo ba nyid dang mi 'dzin te /
analyzed: sra ba dang gsher ba dang dro ba dang yang zhing g-yo ba nyid dang mi 'dzin te /
translated: The eye, ear, nose, and tongue do not grasp solidity, fluidity, heat, and oscillation, which are the characteristics of the elements.

original: de'i phyir sa la sogs pa dag gzugs la sogs pa'i bdag nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir sa la sogs pa dag gzugs la sogs pa'i bdag nyid ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, earth, etc. are not of the nature of form, etc.

original: lus kyi dbang pos kyang kha dog la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: lus kyi dbang pos kyang kha dog la sogs pa ste /
translated: The body faculty also does not grasp color, etc.

original: kha dog dang sgra dang dri dang ro dag 'dzin pa ma yin te /
analyzed: kha dog dang sgra dang dri dang ro dag 'dzin pa ma yin te /
translated: It does not grasp color, sound, smell, or taste.

original: de'i phyir gzugs la sogs pa rnams 'byung pa'i rang bzhin ma yin pa zhes bya bar grub pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir gzugs la sogs pa rnams 'byung pa'i rang bzhin ma yin pa zhes bya bar grub pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is established that form, etc. are not of the nature of the elements.

original: mig la sogs pa rnams ni yul can yin pa'i phyir dang / yul nges pa'i phyir yul dag dang phan tshun rang bzhin tha dad par khong du chud par bya'o //
analyzed: mig la sogs pa rnams ni yul can yin pa'i phyir dang / yul nges pa'i phyir yul dag dang phan tshun rang bzhin tha dad par khong du chud par bya'o //
translated: The eye faculty, etc. should be understood as having a different nature from their objects because they are subjects and because they are determined to have specific objects.

original: mdo las 'byung ba rnam bzhi nyid du nges par bzung ba dang sra ba la sogs pa'i rang bzhin nges par bzung ba'i phyir kha dog la sogs pa rnams lus kyi dbang po'i gzung bar bya ba las bzlog pa yin pas skye mched bcu po rnams ni 'byung🔽ba @98b tsam ma yin par grub po //
analyzed: mdo las 'byung ba rnam bzhi nyid du nges par bzung ba dang sra ba la sogs pa'i rang bzhin nges par bzung ba'i phyir kha dog la sogs pa rnams lus kyi dbang po'i gzung bar bya ba las bzlog pa yin pas skye mched bcu po rnams ni 'byung🔽ba @98b tsam ma yin par grub po //
translated: Since the sutras definitely enumerate the elements as four and definitely enumerate their natures as solidity, etc., color, etc. are the opposite of being objects of the body faculty. Therefore the ten bases are established as not being mere elements.

original: gzugs su rung bas na gzugs te gnod pa byar rung ba zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: gzugs su rung bas na gzugs te gnod pa byar rung ba zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Form is that which is suitable as form, that is, as that which can be broken.

original: de 'di la yod pas na mig la sogs pa'i skye mched gzugs can zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de 'di la yod pas na mig la sogs pa'i skye mched gzugs can zhes bya'o //
translated: The physical bases such as the eyes are so called because they possess form.

original: reg bya'i skye mched kho na 'byung ba chen po bzhi dag go zhes bya bar gsungs kyi mig la sogs pa'i skye mched rnams ni ma yin te /
analyzed: reg bya'i skye mched kho na 'byung ba chen po bzhi dag go zhes bya bar gsungs kyi mig la sogs pa'i skye mched rnams ni ma yin te /
translated: The four great elements are only the tactile base.

original: 'byung ba las tha dad pa'i 'jam pa nyid la sogs pa reg bya'i skye mched du gsungs pas 'byung ba chen po bzhi dag rgyur byas pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'byung ba las tha dad pa'i 'jam pa nyid la sogs pa reg bya'i skye mched du gsungs pas 'byung ba chen po bzhi dag rgyur byas pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The four great elements are called the cause of the tactile base because smoothness and so on, which are distinct from the elements, are said to be the tactile base.

original: reg bya'i skye mched kyi phyogs gcig kho nas 'byung ba rnams bsdus pa'i phyir lhag ma mig la sogs pa dang 'jam pa nyid la sogs pa ni 'byung ba ngag ma yin no zhes bya ba gsal bar kun tu bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: reg bya'i skye mched kyi phyogs gcig kho nas 'byung ba rnams bsdus pa'i phyir lhag ma mig la sogs pa dang 'jam pa nyid la sogs pa ni 'byung ba ngag ma yin no zhes bya ba gsal bar kun tu bstan pa yin no //
translated: The elements are not the remaining bases such as the eyes, because the elements are subsumed by the tactile base alone.

original: thams cad 'byung ba'i bdag nyid yin te reg bya'i skye mched kho na rnam pa gnyis su bstan gyi mig la sogs pa'i skye mched rnams ma yin pa dang mig la sogs pa'i skye mched rnams kho na rnam pa gcig tu bstan gyi rig bya'i skye mched ma
analyzed: thams cad 'byung ba'i bdag nyid yin te reg bya'i skye mched kho na rnam pa gnyis su bstan gyi mig la sogs pa'i skye mched rnams ma yin pa dang mig la sogs pa'i skye mched rnams kho na rnam pa gcig tu bstan gyi rig bya'i skye mched ma
translated: The source of all is the source of both primary elements and derivative form, but the source of form alone is the source of only derivative form.🔽The source of all is the source of both original: yin pa zhes bya ba 'di la 'byung ba dang 'byung ba las gyur pa gnyis rang gi ngo bo tha dad pas rgyu gzhan pa ma yin te /🔽de'i phyir mdo dang 'gal bas skye mched bcu po rnams 'byung ba tsam ma yin no //
analyzed: yin pa zhes bya ba 'di la 'byung ba dang 'byung ba las gyur pa gnyis rang gi ngo bo tha dad pas rgyu gzhan pa ma yin te / de'i phyir mdo dang 'gal bas skye mched bcu po rnams 'byung ba tsam ma yin no //
translated: The source of all is the source of both primary elements and derivative form, but the source of form alone is the source of only derivative form.

original: 'o na mdo las zhes rgya cher 'byung ba la /🔽gal te mig 'byung ba'i rang bzhin ma yin na /🔽ci'i phyir 'di skad du /🔽mig gi sha'i gong bu la sra ba dang mkhrang bar gyur pa gang yin pa zhes bya ba zhes gsungs she na /
analyzed: 'o na mdo las zhes rgya cher 'byung ba la /🔽gal te mig 'byung ba'i rang bzhin ma yin na /🔽ci'i phyir 'di skad du /🔽mig gi sha'i gong bu la sra ba dang mkhrang bar gyur pa gang yin pa zhes bya ba zhes gsungs she na /
translated: The source

original: mig la sogs pa'i 'byung ba tshogs pa'i bdag nyid gang yin pa de la ni 'dir dbang po rnams 'byung ba'i rang bzhin du bstan pa 'thad cing gong bu smos pa yang don dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: mig la sogs pa'i 'byung ba tshogs pa'i bdag nyid gang yin pa de la ni 'dir dbang po rnams 'byung ba'i rang bzhin du bstan pa 'thad cing gong bu smos pa yang don dang bcas pa'o //
translated: The sense faculties are said to be of the nature of the collection of the elements such as earth, and so on, and it is tenable that they are taught to be of the nature of the elements.

original: gang yang 'byung ba dang mtshan nyid mi mthun pa de la ni dbang po rnams 'byung ba'i rang bzhin du bstan pa mi 'thad de /
analyzed: gang yang 'byung ba dang mtshan nyid mi mthun pa de la ni dbang po rnams 'byung ba'i rang bzhin du bstan pa mi 'thad de /
translated: But it is not tenable that those that are dissimilar to the elements are taught to be of the nature of the elements.
